Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֛ה בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינַ֖י בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד בְּאֶחָד֩ לַחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֜י בַּשָּׁנָ֣ה הַשֵּׁנִ֗ית לְצֵאתָ֛ם מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: On the first day of the second month, in the second year following the exodus from the land of Egypt, יהוה spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh vemidevar siynay veohel mvoed veechad lachodesh hasheniy vashanah hasheniyt letsetam meerets mitserayiim lemor

Hebrew: שְׂא֗וּ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֙ כׇּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמ֔וֹת כׇּל־זָכָ֖ר לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Take a census of the whole Israelite company [of fighters] by the clans of its ancestral houses, listing the names, every male, head by head.
Transliteration: sheu et-rosh khׇl-adat veney-yisherael lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemvot khׇl-zakhar legulegelotam

Hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כׇּל־יֹצֵ֥א צָבָ֖א בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל תִּפְקְד֥וּ אֹתָ֛ם לְצִבְאֹתָ֖ם אַתָּ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated: You and Aaron shall record them by their groups, from the age of twenty years up, all those in Israel who are able to bear arms.
Transliteration: miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khׇl-yotse tsava veyisherael tifekedu otam letsiveotam atah veaharon

Hebrew: וְאִתְּכֶ֣ם יִהְי֔וּ אִ֥ישׁ אִ֖ישׁ לַמַּטֶּ֑ה אִ֛ישׁ רֹ֥אשׁ לְבֵית־אֲבֹתָ֖יו הֽוּא׃
Translated: Associated with you shall be a participant from each tribe, each one the head of his ancestral house.
Transliteration: veitekhem yiheyu iysh iysh lamateh iysh rosh leveyt-avotayv hu

Hebrew: וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ שְׁמ֣וֹת הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַֽעַמְד֖וּ אִתְּכֶ֑ם לִרְאוּבֵ֕ן אֱלִיצ֖וּר בֶּן־שְׁדֵיאֽוּר׃
Translated: These are the names of the participants who shall assist you: From Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur.
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot haanashiym asher yaamedu itekhem lireuven eliytsur ven-shedeyur

Hebrew: לְשִׁמְע֕וֹן שְׁלֻמִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּרִֽישַׁדָּֽי׃
Translated: From Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
Transliteration: leshimevon shelumiyel ven-tsuriyshaday

Hebrew: לִֽיהוּדָ֕ה נַחְשׁ֖וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָֽב׃
Translated: From Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab.
Transliteration: liyhudah nacheshvon ven-amiynadav

Hebrew: לְיִ֨שָּׂשכָ֔ר נְתַנְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּעָֽר׃
Translated: From Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar.
Transliteration: leyishashkhar netaneel ven-tsuar

Hebrew: לִזְבוּלֻ֕ן אֱלִיאָ֖ב בֶּן־חֵלֹֽן׃
Translated: From Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.
Transliteration: lizevulun eliyav ven-chelon

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף לְאֶפְרַ֕יִם אֱלִישָׁמָ֖ע בֶּן־עַמִּיה֑וּד לִמְנַשֶּׁ֕ה גַּמְלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָהצֽוּר׃
Translated: From the sons of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud; from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
Transliteration: liveney yvosef leeferayiim eliyshama ven-amiyhud limenasheh gameliyel ven-fedahtsur

Hebrew: לְבִ֨נְיָמִ֔ן אֲבִידָ֖ן בֶּן־גִּדְעֹנִֽי׃
Translated: From Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.
Transliteration: levineyamin aviydan ven-gideoniy

Hebrew: לְדָ֕ן אֲחִיעֶ֖זֶר בֶּן־עַמִּֽישַׁדָּֽי׃
Translated: From Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
Transliteration: ledan achiyezer ven-amiyshaday

Hebrew: לְאָשֵׁ֕ר פַּגְעִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עׇכְרָֽן׃
Translated: From Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran.
Transliteration: leasher fageiyel ven-ׇkheran

Hebrew: לְגָ֕ד אֶלְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־דְּעוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: From Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.
Transliteration: legad eleyasaf ven-deuel

Hebrew: לְנַ֨פְתָּלִ֔י אֲחִירַ֖ע בֶּן־עֵינָֽן׃
Translated: From Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.
Transliteration: lenafetaliy achiyra ven-eynan

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה (קריאי) [קְרוּאֵ֣י] הָעֵדָ֔ה נְשִׂיאֵ֖י מַטּ֣וֹת אֲבוֹתָ֑ם רָאשֵׁ֛י אַלְפֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵֽם׃
Translated: Those are the elected of the assembly, the chieftains of their ancestral tribes: they are the heads of the contingents of Israel.
Transliteration: eleh (kryy) [keruey] haedah neshiyey matvot avvotam rashey alefey yisherael hem

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹ֑ן אֵ֚ת הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִקְּב֖וּ בְּשֵׁמֹֽת׃
Translated: So Moses and Aaron took those participants, who were designated by name,
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh veaharon et haanashiym haeleh asher nikevu veshemot

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־הָעֵדָ֜ה הִקְהִ֗ילוּ בְּאֶחָד֙ לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וַיִּתְיַֽלְד֥וּ עַל־מִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמ֗וֹת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֛ה וָמַ֖עְלָה לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and on the first day of the second month they convoked the whole company [of fighters], who were registered by the clans of their ancestral houses—the names of those aged twenty years and over being listed head by head.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-haedah hikehiylu veechad lachodesh hasheniy vayiteyaledu al-mishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemvot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah legulegelotam

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַֽיִּפְקְדֵ֖ם בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃ {ס}
Translated: As יהוה had commanded Moses, so he recorded them in the wilderness of Sinai.
Transliteration: khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh vayifekedem vemidevar siynay {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֤וּ בְנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵן֙ בְּכֹ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֤ר שֵׁמוֹת֙ לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָ֔ם כׇּל־זָכָ֗ר מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: They totaled as follows: The descendants of Reuben, Israel’s first-born, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, head by head, all males aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-reuven vekhor yisherael tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemvot legulegelotam khׇl-zakhar miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה רְאוּבֵ֑ן שִׁשָּׁ֧ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Reuben: 46,500.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh reuven shishah vearevaiym elef vachamesh mevot {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֔וֹן תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם פְּקֻדָ֗יו בְּמִסְפַּ֤ר שֵׁמוֹת֙ לְגֻלְגְּלֹתָ֔ם כׇּל־זָכָ֗ר מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Simeon, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, their enrollment as listed by name, head by head, all males aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney shimevon tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam fekudayv vemisefar shemvot legulegelotam khׇl-zakhar miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה שִׁמְע֑וֹן תִּשְׁעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Simeon: 59,300.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh shimevon tisheah vachamishiym elef ushelosh mevot {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י גָ֔ד תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמ֗וֹת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Gad, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney gad tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemvot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה גָ֑ד חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Gad: 45,650.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh gad chamishah vearevaiym elef veshesh mevot vachamishiym {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Judah, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney yehudah tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה יְהוּדָ֑ה אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וְשִׁבְעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Judah: 74,600.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh yehudah arevaah veshiveiym elef veshesh mevot {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Issachar, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney yishashkhar tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה יִשָּׂשכָ֑ר אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Issachar: 54,400.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh yishashkhar arevaah vachamishiym elef veareva mevot {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻ֔ן תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Zebulun, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney zevulun tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה זְבוּלֻ֑ן שִׁבְעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Zebulun: 57,400.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh zevulun shiveah vachamishiym elef veareva mevot {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֤י יוֹסֵף֙ לִבְנֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Joseph: Of the descendants of Ephraim, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney yvosef liveney eferayiim tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה אֶפְרָ֑יִם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Ephraim: 40,500.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh eferayiim arevaiym elef vachamesh mevot {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמ֗וֹת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Manasseh, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney menasheh tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemvot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה שְׁנַ֧יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּמָאתָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Manasseh: 32,200.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh menasheh shenayiim usheloshiym elef umatayiim {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Benjamin, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney vineyamin tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה בִנְיָמִ֑ן חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Benjamin: 35,400.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh vineyamin chamishah usheloshiym elef veareva mevot {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י דָ֔ן תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Dan, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney dan tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה דָ֑ן שְׁנַ֧יִם וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Dan: 62,700.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh dan shenayiim veshishiym elef usheva mevot {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֔ר תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Asher, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house, as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: liveney asher tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה אָשֵׁ֑ר אֶחָ֧ד וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Asher: 41,500.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh asher echad vearevaiym elef vachamesh mevot {f}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י נַפְתָּלִ֔י תּוֹלְדֹתָ֥ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר שֵׁמֹ֗ת מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כֹּ֖ל יֹצֵ֥א צָבָֽא׃
Translated: [Of] the descendants of Naphtali, the registration of the clans of their ancestral house as listed by name, aged twenty years and over, all who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: veney nafetaliy tvoledotam lemishefechotam leveyt avotam vemisefar shemot miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khol yotse tsava

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה נַפְתָּלִ֑י שְׁלֹשָׁ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: those enrolled from the tribe of Naphtali: 53,400.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem lemateh nafetaliy sheloshah vachamishiym elef veareva mevot {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַפְּקֻדִ֡ים אֲשֶׁר֩ פָּקַ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאַהֲרֹן֙ וּנְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר אִ֑ישׁ אִישׁ־אֶחָ֥ד לְבֵית־אֲבֹתָ֖יו הָיֽוּ׃
Translated: Those are the enrollments recorded by Moses and Aaron and by the chieftains of Israel, who were twelve in number, one participant from each ancestral house.
Transliteration: eleh hafekudiym asher fakad mosheh veaharon uneshiyey yisherael sheneym ashar iysh iysh-echad leveyt-avotayv hayu

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֛וּ כׇּל־פְּקוּדֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה כׇּל־יֹצֵ֥א צָבָ֖א בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: All the Israelite males, aged twenty years and over, enrolled by ancestral houses, all those in Israel who were able to bear arms—
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-fekudey veney-yisherael leveyt avotam miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khׇl-yotse tsava veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ כׇּל־הַפְּקֻדִ֔ים שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֑ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: all who were enrolled came to 603,550.
Transliteration: vayiheyu khׇl-hafekudiym shesh-mevot elef usheloshet alafiym vachamesh mevot vachamishiym

Hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֖ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה אֲבֹתָ֑ם לֹ֥א הׇתְפָּקְד֖וּ בְּתוֹכָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: The Levites, however, were not recorded among them by their ancestral tribe.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim lemateh avotam lo hׇtefakedu vetvokham {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: For יהוה had spoken to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ אֶת־מַטֵּ֤ה לֵוִי֙ לֹ֣א תִפְקֹ֔ד וְאֶת־רֹאשָׁ֖ם לֹ֣א תִשָּׂ֑א בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Do not on any account enroll the tribe of Levi or take a census of them with the Israelites.
Transliteration: akhe et-mateh leviy lo tifekod veet-rosham lo tisha vetvokhe veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֡ה הַפְקֵ֣ד אֶת־הַלְוִיִּם֩ עַל־מִשְׁכַּ֨ן הָעֵדֻ֜ת וְעַ֣ל כׇּל־כֵּלָיו֮ וְעַ֣ל כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לוֹ֒ הֵ֜מָּה יִשְׂא֤וּ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְהֵ֖ם יְשָׁרְתֻ֑הוּ וְסָבִ֥יב לַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יַחֲנֽוּ׃
Translated: You shall put the Levites in charge of the Tabernacle of the Pact, all its furnishings, and everything that pertains to it: they shall carry the Tabernacle and all its furnishings, and they shall tend it; and they shall camp around the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: veatah hafeked et-haleviyim al-mishekhan haedut veal khׇl-khelayv veal khׇl-asher-lvo hemah yisheu et-hamishekhan veet-khׇl-khelayv vehem yesharetuhu vesaviyv lamishekhan yachanu

Hebrew: וּבִנְסֹ֣עַ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֗ן יוֹרִ֤ידוּ אֹתוֹ֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם וּבַחֲנֹת֙ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן יָקִ֥ימוּ אֹת֖וֹ הַלְוִיִּ֑ם וְהַזָּ֥ר הַקָּרֵ֖ב יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: When the Tabernacle is to set out, the Levites shall take it down, and when the Tabernacle is to be pitched, the Levites shall set it up; any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.
Transliteration: uvinesoa hamishekhan yvoriydu otvo haleviyim uvachanot hamishekhan yakiymu otvo haleviyim vehazar hakarev yumat

Hebrew: וְחָנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִ֧ישׁ עַֽל־מַחֲנֵ֛הוּ וְאִ֥ישׁ עַל־דִּגְל֖וֹ לְצִבְאֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The Israelites shall encamp troop by troop, each man with his division and each under his standard.
Transliteration: vechanu veney yisherael iysh al-machanehu veiysh al-digelvo letsiveotam

Hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּ֞ם יַחֲנ֤וּ סָבִיב֙ לְמִשְׁכַּ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֔ת וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֣ה קֶ֔צֶף עַל־עֲדַ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְשָׁמְרוּ֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת מִשְׁכַּ֥ן הָעֵדֽוּת׃
Translated: The Levites, however, shall camp around the Tabernacle of the Pact, that wrath may not strike the Israelite community; the Levites shall stand guard around the Tabernacle of the Pact.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim yachanu saviyv lemishekhan haedut velo-yiheyeh ketsef al-adat veney yisherael veshameru haleviyim et-mishemeret mishekhan haedut

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה כֵּ֥ן עָשֽׂוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: The Israelites did accordingly; just as יהוה had commanded Moses, so they did.
Transliteration: vayaashu veney yisherael khekhol asher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh khen ashu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ עַל־דִּגְל֤וֹ בְאֹתֹת֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֔ם יַחֲנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִנֶּ֕גֶד סָבִ֥יב לְאֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד יַחֲנֽוּ׃
Translated: The Israelites shall camp each man with his standard, under the banners of their ancestral house; they shall camp around the Tent of Meeting at a distance.
Transliteration: iysh al-digelvo veotot leveyt avotam yachanu veney yisherael mineged saviyv leohel-mvoed yachanu

Hebrew: וְהַחֹנִים֙ קֵ֣דְמָה מִזְרָ֔חָה דֶּ֛גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה יְהוּדָ֖ה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה נַחְשׁ֖וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָֽב׃
Translated: Camped on the front, or east side: the standard of the division of Judah, troop by troop. Chieftain of the Judites: Nahshon son of Amminadab.
Transliteration: vehachoniym kedemah mizerachah degel machaneh yehudah letsiveotam venashiy liveney yehudah nacheshvon ven-amiynadav

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וְשִׁבְעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 74,600.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem arevaah veshiveiym elef veshesh mevot

Hebrew: וְהַחֹנִ֥ים עָלָ֖יו מַטֵּ֣ה יִשָּׂשכָ֑ר וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר נְתַנְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּעָֽר׃
Translated: Camping next to it: The tribe of Issachar. Chieftain of the Issacharites: Nethanel son of Zuar.
Transliteration: vehachoniym alayv mateh yishashkhar venashiy liveney yishashkhar netaneel ven-tsuar

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדָ֑יו אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 54,400.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudayv arevaah vachamishiym elef veareva mevot

Hebrew: מַטֵּ֖ה זְבוּלֻ֑ן וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻ֔ן אֱלִיאָ֖ב בֶּן־חֵלֹֽן׃
Translated: The tribe of Zebulun. Chieftain of the Zebulunites: Eliab son of Helon.
Transliteration: mateh zevulun venashiy liveney zevulun eliyav ven-chelon

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדָ֑יו שִׁבְעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 57,400.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudayv shiveah vachamishiym elef veareva mevot

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־הַפְּקֻדִ֞ים לְמַחֲנֵ֣ה יְהוּדָ֗ה מְאַ֨ת אֶ֜לֶף וּשְׁמֹנִ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף וְשֵֽׁשֶׁת־אֲלָפִ֥ים וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֖וֹת לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם רִאשֹׁנָ֖ה יִסָּֽעוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The total enrolled in the division of Judah: 186,400, for all troops. These shall march first.
Transliteration: khׇl-hafekudiym lemachaneh yehudah meat elef ushemoniym elef vesheshet-alafiym veareva-mevot letsiveotam rishonah yisau {s}

Hebrew: דֶּ֣גֶל מַחֲנֵ֧ה רְאוּבֵ֛ן תֵּימָ֖נָה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֔ן אֱלִיצ֖וּר בֶּן־שְׁדֵיאֽוּר׃
Translated: On the south: the standard of the division of Reuben, troop by troop. Chieftain of the Reubenites: Elizur son of Shedeur.
Transliteration: degel machaneh reuven teymanah letsiveotam venashiy liveney reuven eliytsur ven-shedeyur

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדָ֑יו שִׁשָּׁ֧ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 46,500.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudayv shishah vearevaiym elef vachamesh mevot

Hebrew: וְהַחוֹנִ֥ם עָלָ֖יו מַטֵּ֣ה שִׁמְע֑וֹן וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֔וֹן שְׁלֻמִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּרִֽישַׁדָּֽי׃
Translated: Camping next to it: The tribe of Simeon. Chieftain of the Simeonites: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
Transliteration: vehachvonim alayv mateh shimevon venashiy liveney shimevon shelumiyel ven-tsuriyshaday

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם תִּשְׁעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 59,300.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem tisheah vachamishiym elef ushelosh mevot

Hebrew: וּמַטֵּ֖ה גָּ֑ד וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י גָ֔ד אֶלְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־רְעוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: And the tribe of Gad. Chieftain of the Gadites: Eliasaph son of Reuel.
Transliteration: umateh gad venashiy liveney gad eleyasaf ven-reuel

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם חֲמִשָּׁ֤ה וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 45,650.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem chamishah vearevaiym elef veshesh mevot vachamishiym

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־הַפְּקֻדִ֞ים לְמַחֲנֵ֣ה רְאוּבֵ֗ן מְאַ֨ת אֶ֜לֶף וְאֶחָ֨ד וַחֲמִשִּׁ֥ים אֶ֛לֶף וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֥וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וּשְׁנִיִּ֖ם יִסָּֽעוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The total enrolled in the division of Reuben: 151,450, for all troops. These shall march second.
Transliteration: khׇl-hafekudiym lemachaneh reuven meat elef veechad vachamishiym elef veareva-mevot vachamishiym letsiveotam usheniyim yisau {s}

Hebrew: וְנָסַ֧ע אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֛ד מַחֲנֵ֥ה הַלְוִיִּ֖ם בְּת֣וֹךְ הַֽמַּחֲנֹ֑ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר יַחֲנוּ֙ כֵּ֣ן יִסָּ֔עוּ אִ֥ישׁ עַל־יָד֖וֹ לְדִגְלֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Then, midway between the divisions, the Tent of Meeting, the division of the Levites, shall move. As they camp, so they shall march, each in position, by their standards.
Transliteration: venasa ohel-mvoed machaneh haleviyim vetvokhe hamachanot khaasher yachanu khen yisau iysh al-yadvo ledigeleyhem {s}

Hebrew: דֶּ֣גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה אֶפְרַ֛יִם לְצִבְאֹתָ֖ם יָ֑מָּה וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם אֱלִישָׁמָ֖ע בֶּן־עַמִּיהֽוּד׃
Translated: On the west: the standard of the division of Ephraim, troop by troop. Chieftain of the Ephraimites: Elishama son of Ammihud.
Transliteration: degel machaneh eferayiim letsiveotam yamah venashiy liveney eferayiim eliyshama ven-amiyhud

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 40,500.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem arevaiym elef vachamesh mevot

Hebrew: וְעָלָ֖יו מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה גַּמְלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָהצֽוּר׃
Translated: Next to it: The tribe of Manasseh. Chieftain of the Manassites: Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
Transliteration: vealayv mateh menasheh venashiy liveney menasheh gameliyel ven-fedahtsur

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁנַ֧יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 32,200.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem shenayiim usheloshiym elef umatayiim

Hebrew: וּמַטֵּ֖ה בִּנְיָמִ֑ן וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֔ן אֲבִידָ֖ן בֶּן־גִּדְעֹנִֽי׃
Translated: And the tribe of Benjamin. Chieftain of the Benjaminites: Abidan son of Gideoni.
Transliteration: umateh vineyamin venashiy liveney vineyamin aviydan ven-gideoniy

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 35,400.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem chamishah usheloshiym elef veareva mevot

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־הַפְּקֻדִ֞ים לְמַחֲנֵ֣ה אֶפְרַ֗יִם מְאַ֥ת אֶ֛לֶף וּשְׁמֹֽנַת־אֲלָפִ֥ים וּמֵאָ֖ה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וּשְׁלִשִׁ֖ים יִסָּֽעוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The total enrolled in the division of Ephraim: 108,100 for all troops. These shall march third.
Transliteration: khׇl-hafekudiym lemachaneh eferayiim meat elef ushemonat-alafiym umeah letsiveotam ushelishiym yisau {s}

Hebrew: דֶּ֣גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה דָ֛ן צָפֹ֖נָה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י דָ֔ן אֲחִיעֶ֖זֶר בֶּן־עַמִּֽישַׁדָּֽי׃
Translated: On the north: the standard of the division of Dan, troop by troop. Chieftain of the Danites: Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
Transliteration: degel machaneh dan tsafonah letsiveotam venashiy liveney dan achiyezer ven-amiyshaday

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁנַ֧יִם וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 62,700.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem shenayiim veshishiym elef usheva mevot

Hebrew: וְהַחֹנִ֥ים עָלָ֖יו מַטֵּ֣ה אָשֵׁ֑ר וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֔ר פַּגְעִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עׇכְרָֽן׃
Translated: Camping next to it: The tribe of Asher. Chieftain of the Asherites: Pagiel son of Ochran.
Transliteration: vehachoniym alayv mateh asher venashiy liveney asher fageiyel ven-ׇkheran

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אֶחָ֧ד וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 41,500.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem echad vearevaiym elef vachamesh mevot

Hebrew: וּמַטֵּ֖ה נַפְתָּלִ֑י וְנָשִׂיא֙ לִבְנֵ֣י נַפְתָּלִ֔י אֲחִירַ֖ע בֶּן־עֵינָֽן׃
Translated: And the tribe of Naphtali. Chieftain of the Naphtalites: Ahira son of Enan.
Transliteration: umateh nafetaliy venashiy liveney nafetaliy achiyra ven-eynan

Hebrew: וּצְבָא֖וֹ וּפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: His troop, as enrolled: 53,400.
Transliteration: utsevavo ufekudeyhem sheloshah vachamishiym elef veareva mevot

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַפְּקֻדִים֙ לְמַ֣חֲנֵה דָ֔ן מְאַ֣ת אֶ֗לֶף וְשִׁבְעָ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת לָאַחֲרֹנָ֥ה יִסְע֖וּ לְדִגְלֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: The total enrolled in the division of Dan: 157,600. These shall march last, by their standards.
Transliteration: khׇl-hafekudiym lemachaneh dan meat elef veshiveah vachamishiym elef veshesh mevot laacharonah yiseu ledigeleyhem {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה פְּקוּדֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם כׇּל־פְּקוּדֵ֤י הַֽמַּחֲנֹת֙ לְצִבְאֹתָ֔ם שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֔ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: Those are the enrollments of the Israelites by ancestral houses. The total enrolled in the divisions, for all troops: 603,550.
Transliteration: eleh fekudey veney-yisherael leveyt avotam khׇl-fekudey hamachanot letsiveotam shesh-mevot elef usheloshet alafiym vachamesh mevot vachamishiym

Hebrew: וְהַ֨לְוִיִּ֔ם לֹ֣א הׇתְפָּקְד֔וּ בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: The Levites, however, were not recorded among the Israelites, as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim lo hׇtefakedu vetvokhe veney yisherael khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֗ה כֵּֽן־חָנ֤וּ לְדִגְלֵיהֶם֙ וְכֵ֣ן נָסָ֔עוּ אִ֥ישׁ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖יו עַל־בֵּ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: The Israelites did accordingly; just as יהוה had commanded Moses, so they camped by their standards, and so they marched, each man with his clan according to his ancestral house.
Transliteration: vayaashu veney yisherael khekhol asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh khen-chanu ledigeleyhem vekhen nasau iysh lemishefechotayv al-veyt avotayv {f}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה תּוֹלְדֹ֥ת אַהֲרֹ֖ן וּמֹשֶׁ֑ה בְּי֗וֹם דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּהַ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translated: This is the line of Aaron and Moses at the time that יהוה spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
Transliteration: veeleh tvoledot aharon umosheh veyvom diver yehovah et-mosheh vehar siynay

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה שְׁמ֥וֹת בְּֽנֵי־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַבְּכֹ֣ר <small>׀</small> נָדָ֑ב וַאֲבִיה֕וּא אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאִיתָמָֽר׃
Translated: These were the names of Aaron’s sons: Nadab, the first-born, and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar;
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot veney-aharon havekhor <small></small> nadav vaaviyhu eleazar veiytamar

Hebrew: אֵ֗לֶּה שְׁמוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים הַמְּשֻׁחִ֑ים אֲשֶׁר־מִלֵּ֥א יָדָ֖ם לְכַהֵֽן׃
Translated: those were the names of Aaron’s sons, the anointed priests who were ordained for priesthood.
Transliteration: eleh shemvot veney aharon hakhohaniym hameshuchiym asher-mile yadam lekhahen

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣מׇת נָדָ֣ב וַאֲבִיה֣וּא לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֡ה בְּֽהַקְרִבָם֩ אֵ֨שׁ זָרָ֜ה לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר סִינַ֔י וּבָנִ֖ים לֹא־הָי֣וּ לָהֶ֑ם וַיְכַהֵ֤ן אֶלְעָזָר֙ וְאִ֣יתָמָ֔ר עַל־פְּנֵ֖י אַהֲרֹ֥ן אֲבִיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: But Nadab and Abihu died by the will of יהוה, when they offered alien fire before יהוה in the wilderness of Sinai; and they left no sons. So it was Eleazar and Ithamar who served as priests in the lifetime of their father Aaron.
Transliteration: vayamׇt nadav vaaviyhu lifeney yehovah vehakerivam esh zarah lifeney yehovah vemidevar siynay uvaniym lo-hayu lahem vayekhahen eleazar veiytamar al-feney aharon aviyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: הַקְרֵב֙ אֶת־מַטֵּ֣ה לֵוִ֔י וְהַעֲמַדְתָּ֣ אֹת֔וֹ לִפְנֵ֖י אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְשֵׁרְת֖וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Advance the tribe of Levi and place its [men] in attendance upon Aaron the priest to serve him.
Transliteration: hakerev et-mateh leviy vehaamadeta otvo lifeney aharon hakhohen vesheretu otvo

Hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֣וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמַרְתּ֗וֹ וְאֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֙רֶת֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: They shall perform duties for him and for the whole community before the Tent of Meeting, doing the work of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: veshameru et-mishemaretvo veet-mishemeret khׇl-haedah lifeney ohel mvoed laavod et-avodat hamishekhan

Hebrew: וְשָׁמְר֗וּ אֶֽת־כׇּל־כְּלֵי֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְאֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֥ת הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: They shall take charge of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting—a duty on behalf of the Israelites—doing the work of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: veshameru et-khׇl-kheley ohel mvoed veet-mishemeret veney yisherael laavod et-avodat hamishekhan

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּה֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו נְתוּנִ֨ם נְתוּנִ֥ם הֵ֙מָּה֙ ל֔וֹ מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: You shall assign the Levites to Aaron and to his sons: they are formally assigned to him from among the Israelites.
Transliteration: venatatah et-haleviyim leaharon ulevanayv netunim netunim hemah lvo meet veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אַהֲרֹ֤ן וְאֶת־בָּנָיו֙ תִּפְקֹ֔ד וְשָׁמְר֖וּ אֶת־כְּהֻנָּתָ֑ם וְהַזָּ֥ר הַקָּרֵ֖ב יוּמָֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall make Aaron and his sons responsible for observing their priestly duties; and any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.
Transliteration: veet-aharon veet-vanayv tifekod veshameru et-khehunatam vehazar hakarev yumat {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֞י הִנֵּ֧ה לָקַ֣חְתִּי אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֗ם מִתּוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל תַּ֧חַת כׇּל־בְּכ֛וֹר פֶּ֥טֶר רֶ֖חֶם מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָ֥יוּ לִ֖י הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: I hereby take the Levites from among the Israelites in place of all the male first-born, the first issue of the womb among the Israelites: the Levites shall be Mine.
Transliteration: vaaniy hineh lakachetiy et-haleviyim mitvokhe veney yisherael tachat khׇl-vekhvor feter rechem miveney yisherael vehayu liy haleviyim

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לִי֮ כׇּל־בְּכוֹר֒ בְּיוֹם֩ הַכֹּתִ֨י כׇל־בְּכ֜וֹר בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֗יִם הִקְדַּ֨שְׁתִּי לִ֤י כׇל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵאָדָ֖ם עַד־בְּהֵמָ֑ה לִ֥י יִהְי֖וּ אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: For every male first-born is Mine: at the time that I smote every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt, I consecrated every male first-born in Israel, human and beast, to Myself, to be Mine, יהוה’s.
Transliteration: khiy liy khׇl-vekhvor veyvom hakhotiy khׇl-vekhvor veerets mitserayiim hikedashetiy liy khׇl-vekhvor veyisherael meadam ad-vehemah liy yiheyu aniy yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינַ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh vemidevar siynay lemor

Hebrew: פְּקֹד֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י לֵוִ֔י לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם כׇּל־זָכָ֛ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֥דֶשׁ וָמַ֖עְלָה תִּפְקְדֵֽם׃
Translated: Record the descendants of Levi by ancestral house and by clan; record every male among them from the age of one month up.
Transliteration: fekod et-veney leviy leveyt avotam lemishefechotam khׇl-zakhar miven-chodesh vamaelah tifekedem

Hebrew: וַיִּפְקֹ֥ד אֹתָ֛ם מֹשֶׁ֖ה עַל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צֻוָּֽה׃
Translated: So Moses recorded them at the command of יהוה, as he was bidden.
Transliteration: vayifekod otam mosheh al-fiy yehovah khaasher tsuvah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ־אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵֽי־לֵוִ֖י בִּשְׁמֹתָ֑ם גֵּרְשׁ֕וֹן וּקְהָ֖ת וּמְרָרִֽי׃
Translated: These were the sons of Levi by name: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
Transliteration: vayiheyu-eleh veney-leviy vishemotam gereshvon ukehat umerariy

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה שְׁמ֥וֹת בְּֽנֵי־גֵרְשׁ֖וֹן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם לִבְנִ֖י וְשִׁמְעִֽי׃
Translated: These were the names of the sons of Gershon by clan: Libni and Shimei.
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot veney-gereshvon lemishefechotam liveniy veshimeiy

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י קְהָ֖ת לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם עַמְרָ֣ם וְיִצְהָ֔ר חֶבְר֖וֹן וְעֻזִּיאֵֽל׃
Translated: The sons of Kohath by clan: Amram and Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
Transliteration: uveney kehat lemishefechotam ameram veyitsehar chevervon veuziyel

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֧י מְרָרִ֛י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם מַחְלִ֣י וּמוּשִׁ֑י אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֛ם מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַלֵּוִ֖י לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The sons of Merari by clan: Mahli and Mushi. These were the clans of the Levites within their ancestral houses:
Transliteration: uveney merariy lemishefechotam macheliy umushiy eleh hem mishefechot haleviy leveyt avotam

Hebrew: לְגֵ֣רְשׁ֔וֹן מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַלִּבְנִ֔י וּמִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשִּׁמְעִ֑י אֵ֣לֶּה הֵ֔ם מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּֽי׃
Translated: To Gershon belonged the clan of the Libnites and the clan of the Shimeites; those were the clans of the Gershonites.
Transliteration: legereshvon mishefachat haliveniy umishefachat hashimeiy eleh hem mishefechot hagereshuniy

Hebrew: פְּקֻדֵיהֶם֙ בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר כׇּל־זָכָ֔ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה פְּקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם שִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: The recorded entries of all their males from the age of one month up, as recorded, came to 7,500.
Transliteration: fekudeyhem vemisefar khׇl-zakhar miven-chodesh vamaelah fekudeyhem shiveat alafiym vachamesh mevot

Hebrew: מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֑י אַחֲרֵ֧י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן יַחֲנ֖וּ יָֽמָּה׃
Translated: The clans of the Gershonites were to camp behind the Tabernacle, to the west.
Transliteration: mishefechot hagereshuniy acharey hamishekhan yachanu yamah

Hebrew: וּנְשִׂ֥יא בֵֽית־אָ֖ב לַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֑י אֶלְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־לָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The chieftain of the ancestral house of the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.
Transliteration: uneshiy veyt-av lagereshuniy eleyasaf ven-lael

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁמֶ֤רֶת בְּנֵֽי־גֵרְשׁוֹן֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן וְהָאֹ֑הֶל מִכְסֵ֕הוּ וּמָסַ֕ךְ פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: The duties of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting comprised: the tabernacle, the tent, its covering, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;
Transliteration: umishemeret veney-gereshvon veohel mvoed hamishekhan vehaohel mikhesehu umasakhe fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְקַלְעֵ֣י הֶֽחָצֵ֗ר וְאֶת־מָסַךְ֙ פֶּ֣תַח הֶֽחָצֵ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֧ר עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן וְעַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִ֑יב וְאֵת֙ מֵֽיתָרָ֔יו לְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: the hangings of the enclosure, the screen for the entrance of the enclosure which surrounds the Tabernacle, the cords thereof, and the altar—all the service connected with these.
Transliteration: vekaleey hechatser veet-masakhe fetach hechatser asher al-hamishekhan veal-hamizevecha saviyv veet meytarayv lekhol avodatvo {s}

Hebrew: וְלִקְהָ֗ת מִשְׁפַּ֤חַת הַֽעַמְרָמִי֙ וּמִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַיִּצְהָרִ֔י וּמִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַֽחֶבְרֹנִ֔י וּמִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָעׇזִּֽיאֵלִ֑י אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֖ם מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַקְּהָתִֽי׃
Translated: To Kohath belonged the clan of the Amramites, the clan of the Izharites, the clan of the Hebronites, and the clan of the Uzzielites; those were the clans of the Kohathites.
Transliteration: velikehat mishefachat haameramiy umishefachat hayitsehariy umishefachat hacheveroniy umishefachat haׇziyeliy eleh hem mishefechot hakehatiy

Hebrew: בְּמִסְפַּר֙ כׇּל־זָכָ֔ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה שְׁמֹנַ֤ת אֲלָפִים֙ וְשֵׁ֣שׁ מֵא֔וֹת שֹׁמְרֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: All the listed males from the age of one month up came to 8,600, attending to the duties of the sanctuary.
Transliteration: vemisefar khׇl-zakhar miven-chodesh vamaelah shemonat alafiym veshesh mevot shomerey mishemeret hakodesh

Hebrew: מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת בְּנֵי־קְהָ֖ת יַחֲנ֑וּ עַ֛ל יֶ֥רֶךְ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן תֵּימָֽנָה׃
Translated: The clans of the Kohathites were to camp along the south side of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: mishefechot veney-kehat yachanu al yerekhe hamishekhan teymanah

Hebrew: וּנְשִׂ֥יא בֵֽית־אָ֖ב לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַקְּהָתִ֑י אֱלִיצָפָ֖ן בֶּן־עֻזִּיאֵֽל׃
Translated: The chieftain of the ancestral house of the Kohathite clans was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.
Transliteration: uneshiy veyt-av lemishefechot hakehatiy eliytsafan ven-uziyel

Hebrew: וּמִשְׁמַרְתָּ֗ם הָאָרֹ֤ן וְהַשֻּׁלְחָן֙ וְהַמְּנֹרָ֣ה וְהַֽמִּזְבְּחֹ֔ת וּכְלֵ֣י הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשָׁרְת֖וּ בָּהֶ֑ם וְהַ֨מָּסָ֔ךְ וְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Their duties comprised: the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, and the sacred utensils that were used with them, and the screen —all the service connected with these.
Transliteration: umishemaretam haaron vehashulechan vehamenorah vehamizevechot ukheley hakodesh asher yesharetu vahem vehamasakhe vekhol avodatvo

Hebrew: וּנְשִׂיא֙ נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הַלֵּוִ֔י אֶלְעָזָ֖ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֑ן פְּקֻדַּ֕ת שֹׁמְרֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: The head chieftain of the Levites was Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, in charge of those attending to the duties of the sanctuary.
Transliteration: uneshiy neshiyey haleviy eleazar ven-aharon hakhohen fekudat shomerey mishemeret hakodesh

Hebrew: לִמְרָרִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַמַּחְלִ֔י וּמִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַמּוּשִׁ֑י אֵ֥לֶּה הֵ֖ם מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת מְרָרִֽי׃
Translated: To Merari belonged the clan of the Mahlites and the clan of the Mushites; those were the clans of Merari.
Transliteration: limerariy mishefachat hamacheliy umishefachat hamushiy eleh hem mishefechot merariy

Hebrew: וּפְקֻדֵיהֶם֙ בְּמִסְפַּ֣ר כׇּל־זָכָ֔ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה שֵׁ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
Translated: The recorded entries of all their males from the age of one month up came to 6,200.
Transliteration: ufekudeyhem vemisefar khׇl-zakhar miven-chodesh vamaelah sheshet alafiym umatayiim

Hebrew: וּנְשִׂ֤יא בֵֽית־אָב֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת מְרָרִ֔י צוּרִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־אֲבִיחָ֑יִל עַ֣ל יֶ֧רֶךְ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן יַחֲנ֖וּ צָפֹֽנָה׃
Translated: The chieftain of the ancestral house of the clans of Merari was Zuriel son of Abihail. They were to camp along the north side of the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: uneshiy veyt-av lemishefechot merariy tsuriyel ven-aviychayiil al yerekhe hamishekhan yachanu tsafonah

Hebrew: וּפְקֻדַּ֣ת מִשְׁמֶ֘רֶת֮ בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִי֒ קַרְשֵׁי֙ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וּבְרִיחָ֖יו וְעַמֻּדָ֣יו וַאֲדָנָ֑יו וְכׇ֨ל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The assigned duties of the Merarites comprised: the planks of the Tabernacle, its bars, posts, and sockets, and all its furnishings—all the service connected with these;
Transliteration: ufekudat mishemeret veney merariy kareshey hamishekhan uveriychayv veamudayv vaadanayv vekhׇl-khelayv vekhol avodatvo

Hebrew: וְעַמֻּדֵ֧י הֶחָצֵ֛ר סָבִ֖יב וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֑ם וִיתֵדֹתָ֖ם וּמֵֽיתְרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: also the posts around the enclosure and their sockets, pegs, and cords.
Transliteration: veamudey hechatser saviyv veadeneyhem viytedotam umeytereyhem

Hebrew: וְהַחֹנִ֣ים לִפְנֵ֣י הַמִּשְׁכָּ֡ן קֵ֣דְמָה לִפְנֵי֩ אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֨ד ׀ מִזְרָ֜חָה מֹשֶׁ֣ה ׀ וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן וּבָנָ֗יו שֹֽׁמְרִים֙ מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַמִּקְדָּ֔שׁ לְמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהַזָּ֥ר הַקָּרֵ֖ב יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: Those who were to camp before the Tabernacle, in front—before the Tent of Meeting, on the east—were Moses and Aaron and his sons, attending to the duties of the sanctuary, as a duty on behalf of the Israelites; and any outsider who encroached was to be put to death.
Transliteration: vehachoniym lifeney hamishekhan kedemah lifeney ohel-mvoed mizerachah mosheh veaharon uvanayv shomeriym mishemeret hamikedash lemishemeret veney yisherael vehazar hakarev yumat

Hebrew: כׇּל־פְּקוּדֵ֨י הַלְוִיִּ֜ם אֲשֶׁר֩ פָּקַ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְׄאַׄהֲׄרֹ֛ׄןׄ עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם כׇּל־זָכָר֙ מִבֶּן־חֹ֣דֶשׁ וָמַ֔עְלָה שְׁנַ֥יִם וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃ {ס}
Translated: All the Levites who were recorded, whom at יהוה’s command Moses and Aaron recorded by their clans, all the males from the age of one month up, came to 22,000.
Transliteration: khׇl-fekudey haleviyim asher fakad mosheh veaharon al-fiy yehovah lemishefechotam khׇl-zakhar miven-chodesh vamaelah shenayiim veesheriym alef {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה פְּקֹ֨ד כׇּל־בְּכֹ֤ר זָכָר֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִבֶּן־חֹ֖דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה וְשָׂ֕א אֵ֖ת מִסְפַּ֥ר שְׁמֹתָֽם׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses: Record every first-born male of the Israelite people from the age of one month up, and make a list of their names;
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh fekod khׇl-vekhor zakhar liveney yisherael miven-chodesh vamaelah vesha et misefar shemotam

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֨ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֥ם לִי֙ אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה תַּ֥חַת כׇּל־בְּכֹ֖ר בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאֵת֙ בֶּהֱמַ֣ת הַלְוִיִּ֔ם תַּ֣חַת כׇּל־בְּכ֔וֹר בְּבֶהֱמַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and take the Levites for Me, יהוה, in place of every male first-born among the Israelite people, and the cattle of the Levites in place of every male first-born among the cattle of the Israelites.
Transliteration: velakacheta et-haleviyim liy aniy yehovah tachat khׇl-vekhor viveney yisherael veet vehemat haleviyim tachat khׇl-vekhvor vevehemat veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּפְקֹ֣ד מֹשֶׁ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ אֶֽת־כׇּל־בְּכ֖וֹר בִּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: So Moses recorded all the male first-born among the Israelites, as יהוה had commanded him.
Transliteration: vayifekod mosheh khaasher tsivah yehovah otvo et-khׇl-vekhvor viveney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כׇל־בְּכ֨וֹר זָכָ֜ר בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר שֵׁמֹ֛ת מִבֶּן־חֹ֥דֶשׁ וָמַ֖עְלָה לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁנַ֤יִם וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated: All the first-born males as listed by name, recorded from the age of one month up, came to 22,273.
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-vekhvor zakhar vemisefar shemot miven-chodesh vamaelah lifekudeyhem shenayiim veesheriym elef sheloshah veshiveiym umatayiim {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: קַ֣ח אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֗ם תַּ֤חַת כׇּל־בְּכוֹר֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־בֶּהֱמַ֥ת הַלְוִיִּ֖ם תַּ֣חַת בְּהֶמְתָּ֑ם וְהָיוּ־לִ֥י הַלְוִיִּ֖ם אֲנִ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Take the Levites in place of all the male first-born among the Israelite people, and the cattle of the Levites in place of their cattle; and the Levites shall be Mine, יהוה’s.
Transliteration: kach et-haleviyim tachat khׇl-vekhvor viveney yisherael veet-vehemat haleviyim tachat vehemetam vehayu-liy haleviyim aniy yehovah

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ פְּדוּיֵ֣י הַשְּׁלֹשָׁ֔ה וְהַשִּׁבְעִ֖ים וְהַמָּאתָ֑יִם הָעֹֽדְפִים֙ עַל־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִבְּכ֖וֹר בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And as the redemption price of the 273 Israelite male first-born over and above the number of the Levites,
Transliteration: veet fedueiy hasheloshah vehashiveiym vehamatayiim haodefiym al-haleviyim mivekhvor veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְלָקַחְתָּ֗ חֲמֵ֧שֶׁת חֲמֵ֛שֶׁת שְׁקָלִ֖ים לַגֻּלְגֹּ֑לֶת בְּשֶׁ֤קֶל הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ תִּקָּ֔ח עֶשְׂרִ֥ים גֵּרָ֖ה הַשָּֽׁקֶל׃
Translated: take five shekels per head—take this by the sanctuary weight, twenty gerahs to the shekel—
Transliteration: velakacheta chameshet chameshet shekaliym lagulegolet veshekel hakodesh tikach esheriym gerah hashakel

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֣ה הַכֶּ֔סֶף לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו פְּדוּיֵ֕י הָעֹדְפִ֖ים בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: and give the money to Aaron and his sons as the redemption price for those who are in excess.
Transliteration: venatatah hakhesef leaharon ulevanayv fedueiy haodefiym vahem

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵ֖ת כֶּ֣סֶף הַפִּדְי֑וֹם מֵאֵת֙ הָעֹ֣דְפִ֔ים עַ֖ל פְּדוּיֵ֥י הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: So Moses took the redemption money from those over and above the ones redeemed by the Levites;
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh et khesef hafideyvom meet haodefiym al fedueiy haleviyim

Hebrew: מֵאֵ֗ת בְּכ֛וֹר בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לָקַ֣ח אֶת־הַכָּ֑סֶף חֲמִשָּׁ֨ה וְשִׁשִּׁ֜ים וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵא֛וֹת וָאֶ֖לֶף בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: he took the money from the male first-born of the Israelites, 1,365 sanctuary shekels.
Transliteration: meet vekhvor veney yisherael lakach et-hakhasef chamishah veshishiym ushelosh mevot vaelef veshekel hakodesh

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֨ן מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־כֶּ֧סֶף הַפְּדֻיִ֛ם לְאַהֲרֹ֥ן וּלְבָנָ֖יו עַל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: And Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons at יהוה’s bidding, as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayiten mosheh et-khesef hafeduyim leaharon ulevanayv al-fiy yehovah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: נָשֹׂ֗א אֶת־רֹאשׁ֙ בְּנֵ֣י קְהָ֔ת מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י לֵוִ֑י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Take a [separate] census of the Kohathites among the Levites, by the clans of their ancestral house,
Transliteration: nasho et-rosh veney kehat mitvokhe veney leviy lemishefechotam leveyt avotam

Hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כׇּל־בָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת מְלָאכָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service, to perform tasks for the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: miven sheloshiym shanah vamaelah vead ven-chamishiym shanah khׇl-va latsava laashvot melakhah veohel mvoed

Hebrew: זֹ֛את עֲבֹדַ֥ת בְּנֵי־קְהָ֖ת בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד קֹ֖דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: This is the responsibility of the Kohathites in the Tent of Meeting: the most sacred objects.
Transliteration: zot avodat veney-kehat veohel mvoed kodesh hakodashiym

Hebrew: וּבָ֨א אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ בִּנְסֹ֣עַ הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְהוֹרִ֕דוּ אֵ֖ת פָּרֹ֣כֶת הַמָּסָ֑ךְ וְכִ֨סּוּ־בָ֔הּ אֵ֖ת אֲרֹ֥ן הָעֵדֻֽת׃
Translated: At the breaking of camp, Aaron and his sons shall go in and take down the screening curtain and cover the Ark of the Pact with it.
Transliteration: uva aharon uvanayv vinesoa hamachaneh vehvoridu et farokhet hamasakhe vekhisu-vah et aron haedut

Hebrew: וְנָתְנ֣וּ עָלָ֗יו כְּסוּי֙ ע֣וֹר תַּ֔חַשׁ וּפָרְשׂ֧וּ בֶֽגֶד־כְּלִ֛יל תְּכֵ֖לֶת מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְשָׂמ֖וּ בַּדָּֽיו׃
Translated: They shall lay a covering of dolphin skin over it and spread a cloth of pure blue on top; and they shall put its poles in place.
Transliteration: venatenu alayv khesuy vor tachash ufareshu veged-kheliyl tekhelet milemaelah veshamu vadayv

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ שֻׁלְחַ֣ן הַפָּנִ֗ים יִפְרְשׂוּ֮ בֶּ֣גֶד תְּכֵ֒לֶת֒ וְנָתְנ֣וּ עָ֠לָ֠יו אֶת־הַקְּעָרֹ֤ת וְאֶת־הַכַּפֹּת֙ וְאֶת־הַמְּנַקִּיֹּ֔ת וְאֵ֖ת קְשׂ֣וֹת הַנָּ֑סֶךְ וְלֶ֥חֶם הַתָּמִ֖יד עָלָ֥יו יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Over the table of display they shall spread a blue cloth; they shall place upon it the bowls, the ladles, the jars, and the libation jugs; and the regular bread shall rest upon it.
Transliteration: veal shulechan hafaniym yifereshu veged tekhelet venatenu alayv et-hakearot veet-hakhafot veet-hamenakiyot veet keshvot hanasekhe velechem hatamiyd alayv yiheyeh

Hebrew: וּפָרְשׂ֣וּ עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם בֶּ֚גֶד תּוֹלַ֣עַת שָׁנִ֔י וְכִסּ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ בְּמִכְסֵ֖ה ע֣וֹר תָּ֑חַשׁ וְשָׂמ֖וּ אֶת־בַּדָּֽיו׃
Translated: They shall spread over these a crimson cloth which they shall cover with a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put the poles in place.
Transliteration: ufareshu aleyhem veged tvolaat shaniy vekhisu otvo vemikheseh vor tachash veshamu et-vadayv

Hebrew: וְלָקְח֣וּ ׀ בֶּ֣גֶד תְּכֵ֗לֶת וְכִסּ֞וּ אֶת־מְנֹרַ֤ת הַמָּאוֹר֙ וְאֶת־נֵ֣רֹתֶ֔יהָ וְאֶת־מַלְקָחֶ֖יהָ וְאֶת־מַחְתֹּתֶ֑יהָ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־כְּלֵ֣י שַׁמְנָ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְשָׁרְתוּ־לָ֖הּ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: Then they shall take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand for lighting, with its lamps, its tongs, and its fire pans, as well as all the oil vessels that are used in its service.
Transliteration: velakechu veged tekhelet vekhisu et-menorat hamavor veet-neroteyha veet-malekacheyha veet-machetoteyha veet khׇl-kheley shamenah asher yesharetu-lah vahem

Hebrew: וְנָתְנ֤וּ אֹתָהּ֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלֶ֔יהָ אֶל־מִכְסֵ֖ה ע֣וֹר תָּ֑חַשׁ וְנָתְנ֖וּ עַל־הַמּֽוֹט׃
Translated: They shall put it and all its furnishings into a covering of dolphin skin, which they shall then place on a carrying frame.
Transliteration: venatenu otah veet-khׇl-kheleyha el-mikheseh vor tachash venatenu al-hamvot

Hebrew: וְעַ֣ל ׀ מִזְבַּ֣ח הַזָּהָ֗ב יִפְרְשׂוּ֙ בֶּ֣גֶד תְּכֵ֔לֶת וְכִסּ֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ בְּמִכְסֵ֖ה ע֣וֹר תָּ֑חַשׁ וְשָׂמ֖וּ אֶת־בַּדָּֽיו׃
Translated: Next they shall spread a blue cloth over the altar of gold and cover it with a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put its poles in place.
Transliteration: veal mizevach hazahav yifereshu veged tekhelet vekhisu otvo vemikheseh vor tachash veshamu et-vadayv

Hebrew: וְלָקְחוּ֩ אֶת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֨י הַשָּׁרֵ֜ת אֲשֶׁ֧ר יְשָֽׁרְתוּ־בָ֣ם בַּקֹּ֗דֶשׁ וְנָֽתְנוּ֙ אֶל־בֶּ֣גֶד תְּכֵ֔לֶת וְכִסּ֣וּ אוֹתָ֔ם בְּמִכְסֵ֖ה ע֣וֹר תָּ֑חַשׁ וְנָתְנ֖וּ עַל־הַמּֽוֹט׃
Translated: They shall take all the service vessels with which the service in the sanctuary is performed, put them into a blue cloth and cover them with a covering of dolphin skin, which they shall then place on a carrying frame.
Transliteration: velakechu et-khׇl-kheley hasharet asher yesharetu-vam vakodesh venatenu el-veged tekhelet vekhisu votam vemikheseh vor tachash venatenu al-hamvot

Hebrew: וְדִשְּׁנ֖וּ אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וּפָרְשׂ֣וּ עָלָ֔יו בֶּ֖גֶד אַרְגָּמָֽן׃
Translated: They shall remove the ashes from the [copper] altar and spread a purple cloth over it.
Transliteration: vedishenu et-hamizevecha ufareshu alayv veged aregaman

Hebrew: וְנָתְנ֣וּ עָ֠לָ֠יו אֶֽת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֞יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְֽשָׁרְת֧וּ עָלָ֣יו בָּהֶ֗ם אֶת־הַמַּחְתֹּ֤ת אֶת־הַמִּזְלָגֹת֙ וְאֶת־הַיָּעִ֣ים וְאֶת־הַמִּזְרָקֹ֔ת כֹּ֖ל כְּלֵ֣י הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וּפָרְשׂ֣וּ עָלָ֗יו כְּס֛וּי ע֥וֹר תַּ֖חַשׁ וְשָׂמ֥וּ בַדָּֽיו׃
Translated: Upon it they shall place all the vessels that are used in its service: the fire pans, the flesh hooks, the scrapers, and the basins—all the vessels of the altar—and over it they shall spread a covering of dolphin skin; and they shall put its poles in place.
Transliteration: venatenu alayv et-khׇl-khelayv asher yesharetu alayv vahem et-hamachetot et-hamizelagot veet-hayaiym veet-hamizerakot khol kheley hamizevecha ufareshu alayv khesuy vor tachash veshamu vadayv

Hebrew: וְכִלָּ֣ה אַֽהֲרֹן־וּ֠בָנָ֠יו לְכַסֹּ֨ת אֶת־הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֣י הַקֹּ֘דֶשׁ֮ בִּנְסֹ֣עַ הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֒ וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן יָבֹ֤אוּ בְנֵי־קְהָת֙ לָשֵׂ֔את וְלֹֽא־יִגְּע֥וּ אֶל־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ וָמֵ֑תוּ אֵ֛לֶּה מַשָּׂ֥א בְנֵֽי־קְהָ֖ת בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the sacred objects and all the furnishings of the sacred objects at the breaking of camp, only then shall the Kohathites come and lift them, so that they do not come in contact with the sacred objects and die. These things in the Tent of Meeting shall be the porterage of the Kohathites.
Transliteration: vekhilah aharon-uvanayv lekhasot et-hakodesh veet-khׇl-kheley hakodesh vinesoa hamachaneh veacharey-khen yavou veney-kehat lashet velo-yigeu el-hakodesh vametu eleh masha veney-kehat veohel mvoed

Hebrew: וּפְקֻדַּ֞ת אֶלְעָזָ֣ר ׀ בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֗ן שֶׁ֤מֶן הַמָּאוֹר֙ וּקְטֹ֣רֶת הַסַּמִּ֔ים וּמִנְחַ֥ת הַתָּמִ֖יד וְשֶׁ֣מֶן הַמִּשְׁחָ֑ה פְּקֻדַּ֗ת כׇּל־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־בּ֔וֹ בְּקֹ֖דֶשׁ וּבְכֵלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: Responsibility shall rest with Eleazar son of Aaron the priest for the lighting oil, the aromatic incense, the regular meal offering, and the anointing oil—responsibility for the whole Tabernacle and for everything consecrated that is in it or in its vessels.
Transliteration: ufekudat eleazar ven-aharon hakhohen shemen hamavor uketoret hasamiym uminechat hatamiyd veshemen hamishechah fekudat khׇl-hamishekhan vekhׇl-asher-vvo vekodesh uvekhelayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: אַל־תַּכְרִ֕יתוּ אֶת־שֵׁ֖בֶט מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַקְּהָתִ֑י מִתּ֖וֹךְ הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: Do not let the group of Kohathite clans be cut off from the Levites.
Transliteration: al-takheriytu et-shevet mishefechot hakehatiy mitvokhe haleviyim

Hebrew: וְזֹ֣את ׀ עֲשׂ֣וּ לָהֶ֗ם וְחָיוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א יָמֻ֔תוּ בְּגִשְׁתָּ֖ם אֶת־קֹ֣דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֑ים אַהֲרֹ֤ן וּבָנָיו֙ יָבֹ֔אוּ וְשָׂמ֣וּ אוֹתָ֗ם אִ֥ישׁ אִ֛ישׁ עַל־עֲבֹדָת֖וֹ וְאֶל־מַשָּׂאֽוֹ׃
Translated: Do this with them, that they may live and not die when they approach the most sacred objects: let Aaron and his sons go in and assign each of them to his duties and to his porterage.
Transliteration: vezot ashu lahem vechayu velo yamutu vegishetam et-kodesh hakodashiym aharon uvanayv yavou veshamu votam iysh iysh al-avodatvo veel-mashavo

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָבֹ֧אוּ לִרְא֛וֹת כְּבַלַּ֥ע אֶת־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ וָמֵֽתוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: But let not [the Kohathites] go inside and witness the dismantling of the sanctuary, lest they die.
Transliteration: velo-yavou lirevot khevala et-hakodesh vametu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: נָשֹׂ֗א אֶת־רֹ֛אשׁ בְּנֵ֥י גֵרְשׁ֖וֹן גַּם־הֵ֑ם לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Take a census of the Gershonites also, by their ancestral house and by their clans.
Transliteration: nasho et-rosh veney gereshvon gam-hem leveyt avotam lemishefechotam

Hebrew: מִבֶּן֩ שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים שָׁנָ֜ה וָמַ֗עְלָה עַ֛ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תִּפְקֹ֣ד אוֹתָ֑ם כׇּל־הַבָּא֙ לִצְבֹ֣א צָבָ֔א לַעֲבֹ֥ד עֲבֹדָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: Record them from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service in the performance of tasks for the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: miven sheloshiym shanah vamaelah ad ven-chamishiym shanah tifekod votam khׇl-hava litsevo tsava laavod avodah veohel mvoed

Hebrew: זֹ֣את עֲבֹדַ֔ת מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֑י לַעֲבֹ֖ד וּלְמַשָּֽׂא׃
Translated: These are the duties of the Gershonite clans as to labor and porterage:
Transliteration: zot avodat mishefechot hagereshuniy laavod ulemasha

Hebrew: וְנָ֨שְׂא֜וּ אֶת־יְרִיעֹ֤ת הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ וְאֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד מִכְסֵ֕הוּ וּמִכְסֵ֛ה הַתַּ֥חַשׁ אֲשֶׁר־עָלָ֖יו מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְאֶ֨ת־מָסַ֔ךְ פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: they shall carry the cloths of the Tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting with its covering, the covering of dolphin skin that is on top of it, and the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;
Transliteration: venasheu et-yeriyot hamishekhan veet-ohel mvoed mikhesehu umikheseh hatachash asher-alayv milemaelah veet-masakhe fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ קַלְעֵ֨י הֶֽחָצֵ֜ר וְאֶת־מָסַ֣ךְ ׀ פֶּ֣תַח ׀ שַׁ֣עַר הֶחָצֵ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֤ן וְעַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ סָבִ֔יב וְאֵת֙ מֵֽיתְרֵיהֶ֔ם וְאֶֽת־כׇּל־כְּלֵ֖י עֲבֹדָתָ֑ם וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֧ר יֵעָשֶׂ֛ה לָהֶ֖ם וְעָבָֽדוּ׃
Translated: the hangings of the enclosure, the screen at the entrance of the gate of the enclosure that surrounds the Tabernacle, the cords thereof, and the altar, and all their service equipment and all their accessories; and they shall perform the service.
Transliteration: veet kaleey hechatser veet-masakhe fetach shaar hechatser asher al-hamishekhan veal-hamizevecha saviyv veet meytereyhem veet-khׇl-kheley avodatam veet khׇl-asher eiasheh lahem veavadu

Hebrew: עַל־פִּי֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן וּבָנָ֜יו תִּהְיֶ֗ה כׇּל־עֲבֹדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֔י לְכׇ֨ל־מַשָּׂאָ֔ם וּלְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתָ֑ם וּפְקַדְתֶּ֤ם עֲלֵהֶם֙ בְּמִשְׁמֶ֔רֶת אֵ֖ת כׇּל־מַשָּׂאָֽם׃
Translated: All the duties of the Gershonites, all their porterage and all their service, shall be performed on orders from Aaron and his sons; you shall make them responsible for attending to all their porterage.
Transliteration: al-fiy aharon uvanayv tiheyeh khׇl-avodat veney hagereshuniy lekhׇl-mashaam ulekhol avodatam ufekadetem alehem vemishemeret et khׇl-mashaam

Hebrew: זֹ֣את עֲבֹדַ֗ת מִשְׁפְּחֹ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֖י בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וּמִ֨שְׁמַרְתָּ֔ם בְּיַד֙ אִֽיתָמָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the duties of the Gershonite clans for the Tent of Meeting; they shall attend to them under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
Transliteration: zot avodat mishefechot veney hagereshuniy veohel mvoed umishemaretam veyad iytamar ven-aharon hakhohen {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֖י מְרָרִ֑י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֥ם לְבֵית־אֲבֹתָ֖ם תִּפְקֹ֥ד אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: As for the Merarites, you shall record them by the clans of their ancestral house;
Transliteration: veney merariy lemishefechotam leveyt-avotam tifekod otam

Hebrew: מִבֶּן֩ שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים שָׁנָ֜ה וָמַ֗עְלָה וְעַ֛ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה תִּפְקְדֵ֑ם כׇּל־הַבָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲבֹ֕ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: you shall record them from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who are subject to service in the performance of the duties for the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: miven sheloshiym shanah vamaelah vead ven-chamishiym shanah tifekedem khׇl-hava latsava laavod et-avodat ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְזֹאת֙ מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת מַשָּׂאָ֔ם לְכׇל־עֲבֹדָתָ֖ם בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד קַרְשֵׁי֙ הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן וּבְרִיחָ֖יו וְעַמּוּדָ֥יו וַאֲדָנָֽיו׃
Translated: These are their porterage tasks in connection with their various duties for the Tent of Meeting: the planks, the bars, the posts, and the sockets of the Tabernacle;
Transliteration: vezot mishemeret mashaam lekhׇl-avodatam veohel mvoed kareshey hamishekhan uveriychayv veamudayv vaadanayv

Hebrew: וְעַמּוּדֵי֩ הֶחָצֵ֨ר סָבִ֜יב וְאַדְנֵיהֶ֗ם וִיתֵֽדֹתָם֙ וּמֵ֣יתְרֵיהֶ֔ם לְכׇ֨ל־כְּלֵיהֶ֔ם וּלְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדָתָ֑ם וּבְשֵׁמֹ֣ת תִּפְקְד֔וּ אֶת־כְּלֵ֖י מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת מַשָּׂאָֽם׃
Translated: the posts around the enclosure and their sockets, pegs, and cords—all these furnishings and their service: you shall list by name the objects that are their porterage tasks.
Transliteration: veamudey hechatser saviyv veadeneyhem viytedotam umeytereyhem lekhׇl-kheleyhem ulekhol avodatam uveshemot tifekedu et-kheley mishemeret mashaam

Hebrew: זֹ֣את עֲבֹדַ֗ת מִשְׁפְּחֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֔י לְכׇל־עֲבֹדָתָ֖ם בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד בְּיַד֙ אִֽיתָמָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: Those are the duties of the Merarite clans, pertaining to their various duties in the Tent of Meeting under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
Transliteration: zot avodat mishefechot veney merariy lekhׇl-avodatam veohel mvoed veyad iytamar ven-aharon hakhohen

Hebrew: וַיִּפְקֹ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְאַהֲרֹ֛ן וּנְשִׂיאֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י הַקְּהָתִ֑י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם וּלְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
Translated: So Moses, Aaron, and the chieftains of the community recorded the Kohathites by the clans of their ancestral house,
Transliteration: vayifekod mosheh veaharon uneshiyey haedah et-veney hakehatiy lemishefechotam uleveyt avotam

Hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כׇּל־הַבָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲבֹדָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: miven sheloshiym shanah vamaelah vead ven-chamishiym shanah khׇl-hava latsava laavodah veohel mvoed

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ פְקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם אַלְפַּ֕יִם שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וַחֲמִשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: Those recorded by their clans came to 2,750.
Transliteration: vayiheyu fekudeyhem lemishefechotam alefayiim sheva mevot vachamishiym

Hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה פְקוּדֵי֙ מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַקְּהָתִ֔י כׇּל־הָעֹבֵ֖ד בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּקַ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: That was the enrollment of the Kohathite clans, all those who performed duties relating to the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of יהוה through Moses.
Transliteration: eleh fekudey mishefechot hakehatiy khׇl-haoved veohel mvoed asher fakad mosheh veaharon al-fiy yehovah veyad-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וּפְקוּדֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י גֵרְשׁ֑וֹן לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָ֖ם וּלְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The Gershonites who were recorded by the clans of their ancestral house,
Transliteration: ufekudey veney gereshvon lemishefechvotam uleveyt avotam

Hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כׇּל־הַבָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲבֹדָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting—
Transliteration: miven sheloshiym shanah vamaelah vead ven-chamishiym shanah khׇl-hava latsava laavodah veohel mvoed

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְיוּ֙ פְּקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם אַלְפַּ֕יִם וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃
Translated: those recorded by the clans of their ancestral house came to 2,630.
Transliteration: vayiheyu fekudeyhem lemishefechotam leveyt avotam alefayiim veshesh mevot usheloshiym

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה פְקוּדֵ֗י מִשְׁפְּחֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י גֵרְשׁ֔וֹן כׇּל־הָעֹבֵ֖ד בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּקַ֥ד מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: That was the enrollment of the Gershonite clans, all those performing duties relating to the Tent of Meeting whom Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of יהוה.
Transliteration: eleh fekudey mishefechot veney gereshvon khׇl-haoved veohel mvoed asher fakad mosheh veaharon al-fiy yehovah

Hebrew: וּפְקוּדֵ֕י מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֑י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם לְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The enrollment of the Merarite clans by the clans of their ancestral house,
Transliteration: ufekudey mishefechot veney merariy lemishefechotam leveyt avotam

Hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כׇּל־הַבָּא֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לַעֲבֹדָ֖ה בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to service for work relating to the Tent of Meeting—
Transliteration: miven sheloshiym shanah vamaelah vead ven-chamishiym shanah khׇl-hava latsava laavodah veohel mvoed

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ פְקֻדֵיהֶ֖ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם שְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים וּמָאתָֽיִם׃
Translated: those recorded by their clans came to 3,200.
Transliteration: vayiheyu fekudeyhem lemishefechotam sheloshet alafiym umatayiim

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה פְקוּדֵ֔י מִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֑י אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּקַ֤ד מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: That was the enrollment of the Merarite clans which Moses and Aaron recorded at the command of יהוה through Moses.
Transliteration: eleh fekudey mishefechot veney merariy asher fakad mosheh veaharon al-fiy yehovah veyad-mosheh

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־הַפְּקֻדִ֡ים אֲשֶׁר֩ פָּקַ֨ד מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְאַהֲרֹ֛ן וּנְשִׂיאֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֖ם וּלְבֵ֥ית אֲבֹתָֽם׃
Translated: All the Levites whom Moses, Aaron, and the chieftains of Israel recorded by the clans of their ancestral houses,
Transliteration: khׇl-hafekudiym asher fakad mosheh veaharon uneshiyey yisherael et-haleviyim lemishefechotam uleveyt avotam

Hebrew: מִבֶּ֨ן שְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה וְעַ֖ד בֶּן־חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֑ה כׇּל־הַבָּ֗א לַעֲבֹ֨ד עֲבֹדַ֧ת עֲבֹדָ֛ה וַעֲבֹדַ֥ת מַשָּׂ֖א בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: from the age of thirty years up to the age of fifty, all who were subject to duties of service and porterage relating to the Tent of Meeting—
Transliteration: miven sheloshiym shanah vamaelah vead ven-chamishiym shanah khׇl-hava laavod avodat avodah vaavodat masha veohel mvoed

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֖וּ פְּקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁמֹנַ֣ת אֲלָפִ֔ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁמֹנִֽים׃
Translated: those recorded came to 8,580.
Transliteration: vayiheyu fekudeyhem shemonat alafiym vachamesh mevot ushemoniym

Hebrew: עַל־פִּ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה פָּקַ֤ד אוֹתָם֙ בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אִ֥ישׁ אִ֛ישׁ עַל־עֲבֹדָת֖וֹ וְעַל־מַשָּׂא֑וֹ וּפְקֻדָ֕יו אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: Each one was given responsibility for his service and porterage at the command of יהוה through Moses, and each was recorded as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: al-fiy yehovah fakad votam veyad-mosheh iysh iysh al-avodatvo veal-mashavo ufekudayv asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: צַ֚ו אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וִֽישַׁלְּחוּ֙ מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה כׇּל־צָר֖וּעַ וְכׇל־זָ֑ב וְכֹ֖ל טָמֵ֥א לָנָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated: Instruct the Israelites to remove from camp anyone with an eruption or a discharge and anyone defiled by a corpse.
Transliteration: tsav et-veney yisherael viyshalechu min-hamachaneh khׇl-tsarua vekhׇl-zav vekhol tame lanafesh

Hebrew: מִזָּכָ֤ר עַד־נְקֵבָה֙ תְּשַׁלֵּ֔חוּ אֶל־מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה תְּשַׁלְּח֑וּם וְלֹ֤א יְטַמְּאוּ֙ אֶת־מַ֣חֲנֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י שֹׁכֵ֥ן בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: Remove male and female alike; put them outside the camp so that they do not defile the camp of those in whose midst I dwell.
Transliteration: mizakhar ad-nekevah teshalechu el-michuts lamachaneh teshalechum velo yetameu et-machaneyhem asher aniy shokhen vetvokham

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂוּ־כֵן֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְשַׁלְּח֣וּ אוֹתָ֔ם אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֵּ֥ן עָשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The Israelites did so, putting them outside the camp; as יהוה had spoken to Moses, so the Israelites did.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen veney yisherael vayeshalechu votam el-michuts lamachaneh khaasher diver yehovah el-mosheh khen ashu veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֮ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ אִ֣ישׁ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֗ה כִּ֤י יַעֲשׂוּ֙ מִכׇּל־חַטֹּ֣את הָֽאָדָ֔ם לִמְעֹ֥ל מַ֖עַל בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וְאָֽשְׁמָ֖ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִֽוא׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelites: When men or women individually commit any wrong toward a fellow human being, thus breaking faith with יהוה, and they realize their guilt,
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael iysh vo-ishah khiy yaashu mikhׇl-chatot haadam limeol maal vayhovah veashemah hanefesh hahiv

Hebrew: וְהִתְוַדּ֗וּ אֶֽת־חַטָּאתָם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשׂוּ֒ וְהֵשִׁ֤יב אֶת־אֲשָׁמוֹ֙ בְּרֹאשׁ֔וֹ וַחֲמִישִׁת֖וֹ יֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֑יו וְנָתַ֕ן לַאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָשַׁ֥ם לֽוֹ׃
Translated: they shall confess the wrong that they have done. They shall make restitution in the principal amount and add one-fifth to it, giving it to the one who was wronged.
Transliteration: vehitevadu et-chatatam asher ashu veheshiyv et-ashamvo veroshvo vachamiyshitvo yosef alayv venatan laasher asham lvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֵ֨ין לָאִ֜ישׁ גֹּאֵ֗ל לְהָשִׁ֤יב הָאָשָׁם֙ אֵלָ֔יו הָאָשָׁ֛ם הַמּוּשָׁ֥ב לַיהֹוָ֖ה לַכֹּהֵ֑ן מִלְּבַ֗ד אֵ֚יל הַכִּפֻּרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יְכַפֶּר־בּ֖וֹ עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: If that party [is deceased and] has no kin to whom restitution can be made, the amount repaid shall go to יהוה for the priest—in addition to the ram of expiation with which expiation is made on their behalf.
Transliteration: veim-eyn laiysh goel lehashiyv haasham elayv haasham hamushav layhovah lakhohen milevad eyl hakhifuriym asher yekhafer-vvo alayv

Hebrew: וְכׇל־תְּרוּמָ֞ה לְכׇל־קׇדְשֵׁ֧י בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֥יבוּ לַכֹּהֵ֖ן ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: So, too, any gift among the sacred donations that the Israelites offer shall be the priest’s.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-terumah lekhׇl-kׇdeshey veney-yisherael asher-yakeriyvu lakhohen lvo yiheyeh

Hebrew: וְאִ֥ישׁ אֶת־קֳדָשָׁ֖יו ל֣וֹ יִהְי֑וּ אִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִתֵּ֥ן לַכֹּהֵ֖ן ל֥וֹ יִהְיֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And each shall retain his sacred donations: each priest shall keep what is given to him.
Transliteration: veiysh et-kodashayv lvo yiheyu iysh asher-yiten lakhohen lvo yiheyeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֥ישׁ אִישׁ֙ כִּֽי־תִשְׂטֶ֣ה אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וּמָעֲלָ֥ה ב֖וֹ מָֽעַל׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: Any party whose wife has gone astray and broken faith with him,
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem iysh iysh khiy-tisheteh ishetvo umaalah vvo maal

Hebrew: וְשָׁכַ֨ב אִ֣ישׁ אֹתָהּ֮ שִׁכְבַת־זֶ֒רַע֒ וְנֶעְלַם֙ מֵעֵינֵ֣י אִישָׁ֔הּ וְנִסְתְּרָ֖ה וְהִ֣יא נִטְמָ֑אָה וְעֵד֙ אֵ֣ין בָּ֔הּ וְהִ֖וא לֹ֥א נִתְפָּֽשָׂה׃
Translated: in that another man has had carnal relations with her unbeknown to her husband, and she keeps secret the fact that she has defiled herself without being forced, and there is no witness against her,
Transliteration: veshakhav iysh otah shikhevat-zera veneelam meeyney iyshah veniseterah vehiy nitemaah veed eyn vah vehiv lo nitefashah

Hebrew: וְעָבַ֨ר עָלָ֧יו רֽוּחַ־קִנְאָ֛ה וְקִנֵּ֥א אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֖וֹ וְהִ֣וא נִטְמָ֑אָה אוֹ־עָבַ֨ר עָלָ֤יו רֽוּחַ־קִנְאָה֙ וְקִנֵּ֣א אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֔וֹ וְהִ֖יא לֹ֥א נִטְמָֽאָה׃
Translated: but a fit of jealousy comes over him and he is wrought up about the wife who has defiled herself—or if a fit of jealousy comes over him and he is wrought up about his wife although she has not defiled herself—
Transliteration: veavar alayv rucha-kineah vekine et-ishetvo vehiv nitemaah vo-avar alayv rucha-kineah vekine et-ishetvo vehiy lo nitemaah

Hebrew: וְהֵבִ֨יא הָאִ֣ישׁ אֶת־אִשְׁתּוֹ֮ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵן֒ וְהֵבִ֤יא אֶת־קׇרְבָּנָהּ֙ עָלֶ֔יהָ עֲשִׂירִ֥ת הָאֵיפָ֖ה קֶ֣מַח שְׂעֹרִ֑ים לֹֽא־יִצֹ֨ק עָלָ֜יו שֶׁ֗מֶן וְלֹֽא־יִתֵּ֤ן עָלָיו֙ לְבֹנָ֔ה כִּֽי־מִנְחַ֤ת קְנָאֹת֙ ה֔וּא מִנְחַ֥ת זִכָּר֖וֹן מַזְכֶּ֥רֶת עָוֺֽן׃
Translated: that party shall bring his wife to the priest. And he shall bring as an offering for her one-tenth of an ephah of barley flour. No oil shall be poured upon it and no frankincense shall be laid on it, for it is a meal offering of jealousy, a meal offering of remembrance which recalls wrongdoing.
Transliteration: veheviy haiysh et-ishetvo el-hakhohen veheviy et-kׇrevanah aleyha ashiyrit haeyfah kemach sheoriym lo-yitsok alayv shemen velo-yiten alayv levonah khiy-minechat kenaot hu minechat zikharvon mazekheret avon

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֥יב אֹתָ֖הּ הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְהֶֽעֱמִדָ֖הּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The priest shall bring her forward and have her stand before יהוה.
Transliteration: vehikeriyv otah hakhohen veheemidah lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֧ח הַכֹּהֵ֛ן מַ֥יִם קְדֹשִׁ֖ים בִּכְלִי־חָ֑רֶשׂ וּמִן־הֶֽעָפָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִהְיֶה֙ בְּקַרְקַ֣ע הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן יִקַּ֥ח הַכֹּהֵ֖ן וְנָתַ֥ן אֶל־הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: The priest shall take sacral water in an earthen vessel and, taking some of the earth that is on the floor of the Tabernacle, the priest shall put it into the water.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen mayiim kedoshiym vikheliy-charesh umin-heafar asher yiheyeh vekareka hamishekhan yikach hakhohen venatan el-hamayiim

Hebrew: וְהֶעֱמִ֨יד הַכֹּהֵ֥ן אֶֽת־הָאִשָּׁה֮ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָה֒ וּפָרַע֙ אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וְנָתַ֣ן עַל־כַּפֶּ֗יהָ אֵ֚ת מִנְחַ֣ת הַזִּכָּר֔וֹן מִנְחַ֥ת קְנָאֹ֖ת הִ֑וא וּבְיַ֤ד הַכֹּהֵן֙ יִהְי֔וּ מֵ֥י הַמָּרִ֖ים הַמְאָֽרְרִֽים׃
Translated: After he has made the woman stand before יהוה, the priest shall bare the woman’s head and place upon her hands the meal offering of remembrance, which is a meal offering of jealousy. And in the priest’s hands shall be the water of bitterness that induces the spell.
Transliteration: veheemiyd hakhohen et-haishah lifeney yehovah ufara et-rosh haishah venatan al-khafeyha et minechat hazikharvon minechat kenaot hiv uveyad hakhohen yiheyu mey hamariym hameareriym

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבִּ֨יעַ אֹתָ֜הּ הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְאָמַ֤ר אֶל־הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ אִם־לֹ֨א שָׁכַ֥ב אִישׁ֙ אֹתָ֔ךְ וְאִם־לֹ֥א שָׂטִ֛ית טֻמְאָ֖ה תַּ֣חַת אִישֵׁ֑ךְ הִנָּקִ֕י מִמֵּ֛י הַמָּרִ֥ים הַֽמְאָרְרִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: The priest shall adjure the woman, saying to her, “If no other party has lain with you, if you have not gone astray in defilement while living in your husband’s household, be immune to harm from this water of bitterness that induces the spell.
Transliteration: vehisheviya otah hakhohen veamar el-haishah im-lo shakhav iysh otakhe veim-lo shatiyt tumeah tachat iyshekhe hinakiy mimey hamariym hameareriym haeleh

Hebrew: וְאַ֗תְּ כִּ֥י שָׂטִ֛ית תַּ֥חַת אִישֵׁ֖ךְ וְכִ֣י נִטְמֵ֑את וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אִ֥ישׁ בָּךְ֙ אֶת־שְׁכׇבְתּ֔וֹ מִֽבַּלְעֲדֵ֖י אִישֵֽׁךְ׃
Translated: But if you have gone astray while living in your husband’s household and have defiled yourself, if any party other than your husband has had carnal relations with you”—
Transliteration: veate khiy shatiyt tachat iyshekhe vekhiy nitemet vayiten iysh vakhe et-shekhׇvetvo mivaleadey iyshekhe

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁבִּ֨יעַ הַכֹּהֵ֥ן אֶֽת־הָאִשָּׁה֮ בִּשְׁבֻעַ֣ת הָאָלָה֒ וְאָמַ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ לָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה יִתֵּ֨ן יְהֹוָ֥ה אוֹתָ֛ךְ לְאָלָ֥ה וְלִשְׁבֻעָ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ עַמֵּ֑ךְ בְּתֵ֨ת יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־יְרֵכֵךְ֙ נֹפֶ֔לֶת וְאֶת־בִּטְנֵ֖ךְ צָבָֽה׃
Translated: here the priest shall administer the curse of adjuration to the woman, as the priest goes on to say to the woman—“may יהוה make you a curse and an imprecation among your people, as יהוה causes your thigh to sag and your belly to distend;
Transliteration: vehisheviya hakhohen et-haishah vishevuat haalah veamar hakhohen laishah yiten yehovah votakhe lealah velishevuah vetvokhe amekhe vetet yehovah et-yerekhekhe nofelet veet-vitenekhe tsavah

Hebrew: וּ֠בָ֠אוּ הַמַּ֨יִם הַמְאָרְרִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ בְּֽמֵעַ֔יִךְ לַצְבּ֥וֹת בֶּ֖טֶן וְלַנְפִּ֣ל יָרֵ֑ךְ וְאָמְרָ֥ה הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אָמֵ֥ן <small>׀</small> אָמֵֽן׃
Translated: may this water that induces the spell enter your body, causing the belly to distend and the thigh to sag.” And the woman shall say, “Amen, amen!”
Transliteration: uvau hamayiim hameareriym haeleh vemeayiikhe latsevvot veten velanefil yarekhe veamerah haishah amen <small></small> amen

Hebrew: וְ֠כָתַ֠ב אֶת־הָאָלֹ֥ת הָאֵ֛לֶּה הַכֹּהֵ֖ן בַּסֵּ֑פֶר וּמָחָ֖ה אֶל־מֵ֥י הַמָּרִֽים׃
Translated: The priest shall put these curses down in writing and rub it off into the water of bitterness.
Transliteration: vekhatav et-haalot haeleh hakhohen vasefer umachah el-mey hamariym

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁקָה֙ אֶת־הָ֣אִשָּׁ֔ה אֶת־מֵ֥י הַמָּרִ֖ים הַמְאָֽרְרִ֑ים וּבָ֥אוּ בָ֛הּ הַמַּ֥יִם הַֽמְאָרְרִ֖ים לְמָרִֽים׃
Translated: He is to make the woman drink the water of bitterness that induces the spell, so that the spell-inducing water may enter into her to bring on bitterness.
Transliteration: vehishekah et-haishah et-mey hamariym hameareriym uvau vah hamayiim hameareriym lemariym

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֤ח הַכֹּהֵן֙ מִיַּ֣ד הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה אֵ֖ת מִנְחַ֣ת הַקְּנָאֹ֑ת וְהֵנִ֤יף אֶת־הַמִּנְחָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהִקְרִ֥יב אֹתָ֖הּ אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Then the priest shall take from the woman’s hand the meal offering of jealousy, elevate the meal offering before יהוה, and present it on the altar.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen miyad haishah et minechat hakenaot veheniyf et-haminechah lifeney yehovah vehikeriyv otah el-hamizevecha

Hebrew: וְקָמַ֨ץ הַכֹּהֵ֤ן מִן־הַמִּנְחָה֙ אֶת־אַזְכָּ֣רָתָ֔הּ וְהִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וְאַחַ֛ר יַשְׁקֶ֥ה אֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אֶת־הַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: The priest shall scoop out of the meal offering a token part of it and turn it into smoke on the altar. Last, he shall make the woman drink the water.
Transliteration: vekamats hakhohen min-haminechah et-azekharatah vehiketiyr hamizevechah veachar yashekeh et-haishah et-hamayiim

Hebrew: וְהִשְׁקָ֣הּ אֶת־הַמַּ֗יִם וְהָיְתָ֣ה אִֽם־נִטְמְאָה֮ וַתִּמְעֹ֣ל מַ֣עַל בְּאִישָׁהּ֒ וּבָ֨אוּ בָ֜הּ הַמַּ֤יִם הַמְאָֽרְרִים֙ לְמָרִ֔ים וְצָבְתָ֣ה בִטְנָ֔הּ וְנָפְלָ֖ה יְרֵכָ֑הּ וְהָיְתָ֧ה הָאִשָּׁ֛ה לְאָלָ֖ה בְּקֶ֥רֶב עַמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Once he has made her drink the water—if she has defiled herself by breaking faith with her husband, the spell-inducing water shall enter into her to bring on bitterness, so that her belly shall distend and her thigh shall sag; and the wife shall become a curse among her people.
Transliteration: vehishekah et-hamayiim vehayetah im-nitemeah vatimeol maal veiyshah uvau vah hamayiim hameareriym lemariym vetsavetah vitenah venafelah yerekhah vehayetah haishah lealah vekerev amah

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א נִטְמְאָה֙ הָֽאִשָּׁ֔ה וּטְהֹרָ֖ה הִ֑וא וְנִקְּתָ֖ה וְנִזְרְעָ֥ה זָֽרַע׃
Translated: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is pure, she shall be unharmed and able to retain seed.
Transliteration: veim-lo nitemeah haishah utehorah hiv veniketah venizereah zara

Hebrew: זֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַקְּנָאֹ֑ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּשְׂטֶ֥ה אִשָּׁ֛ה תַּ֥חַת אִישָׁ֖הּ וְנִטְמָֽאָה׃
Translated: This is the ritual in cases of jealousy, when a woman goes astray while living in her husband’s household, and defiles herself,
Transliteration: zot tvorat hakenaot asher tisheteh ishah tachat iyshah venitemaah

Hebrew: א֣וֹ אִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תַּעֲבֹ֥ר עָלָ֛יו ר֥וּחַ קִנְאָ֖ה וְקִנֵּ֣א אֶת־אִשְׁתּ֑וֹ וְהֶעֱמִ֤יד אֶת־הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְעָ֤שָׂה לָהּ֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַתּוֹרָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: or when a fit of jealousy comes over a husband and he is wrought up over his wife: the woman shall be made to stand before יהוה and the priest shall carry out all this ritual with her.
Transliteration: vo iysh asher taavor alayv rucha kineah vekine et-ishetvo veheemiyd et-haishah lifeney yehovah veashah lah hakhohen et khׇl-hatvorah hazot

Hebrew: וְנִקָּ֥ה הָאִ֖ישׁ מֵעָוֺ֑ן וְהָאִשָּׁ֣ה הַהִ֔וא תִּשָּׂ֖א אֶת־עֲוֺנָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: The man shall be clear of guilt; but that woman shall suffer for her guilt.
Transliteration: venikah haiysh meavon vehaishah hahiv tisha et-avonah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אִ֣ישׁ אֽוֹ־אִשָּׁ֗ה כִּ֤י יַפְלִא֙ לִנְדֹּר֙ נֶ֣דֶר נָזִ֔יר לְהַזִּ֖יר לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelites and say to them: If any men or women explicitly utter a nazirite’s vow, to set themselves apart for יהוה,
