Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem iysh vo-ishah khiy yafeli linedor neder naziyr lehaziyr layhovah

Hebrew: מִיַּ֤יִן וְשֵׁכָר֙ יַזִּ֔יר חֹ֥מֶץ יַ֛יִן וְחֹ֥מֶץ שֵׁכָ֖ר לֹ֣א יִשְׁתֶּ֑ה וְכׇל־מִשְׁרַ֤ת עֲנָבִים֙ לֹ֣א יִשְׁתֶּ֔ה וַעֲנָבִ֛ים לַחִ֥ים וִיבֵשִׁ֖ים לֹ֥א יֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated: they shall abstain from wine and any other intoxicant; they shall not drink vinegar of wine or of any other intoxicant, neither shall they drink anything in which grapes have been steeped, nor eat grapes fresh or dried.
Transliteration: miyayiin veshekhar yaziyr chomets yayiin vechomets shekhar lo yisheteh vekhׇl-misherat anaviym lo yisheteh vaanaviym lachiym viyveshiym lo yokhel

Hebrew: כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י נִזְר֑וֹ מִכֹּל֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵעָשֶׂ֜ה מִגֶּ֣פֶן הַיַּ֗יִן מֵחַרְצַנִּ֛ים וְעַד־זָ֖ג לֹ֥א יֹאכֵֽל׃
Translated: Throughout their term as nazirite, they may not eat anything that is obtained from the grapevine, even seeds or skin.
Transliteration: khol yemey nizervo mikhol asher eiasheh migefen hayayiin mecharetsaniym vead-zag lo yokhel

Hebrew: כׇּל־יְמֵי֙ נֶ֣דֶר נִזְר֔וֹ תַּ֖עַר לֹא־יַעֲבֹ֣ר עַל־רֹאשׁ֑וֹ עַד־מְלֹ֨את הַיָּמִ֜ם אֲשֶׁר־יַזִּ֤יר לַיהֹוָה֙ קָדֹ֣שׁ יִהְיֶ֔ה גַּדֵּ֥ל פֶּ֖רַע שְׂעַ֥ר רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: Throughout the term of their vow as nazirite, no razor shall touch their head; it shall remain consecrated until the completion of their term as nazirite of יהוה, the hair of their head being left to grow untrimmed.
Transliteration: khׇl-yemey neder nizervo taar lo-yaavor al-roshvo ad-melot hayamim asher-yaziyr layhovah kadosh yiheyeh gadel fera shear roshvo

Hebrew: כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י הַזִּיר֖וֹ לַיהֹוָ֑ה עַל־נֶ֥פֶשׁ מֵ֖ת לֹ֥א יָבֹֽא׃
Translated: Throughout the term that they have set apart for יהוה, they shall not go in where there is a dead person.
Transliteration: khׇl-yemey haziyrvo layhovah al-nefesh met lo yavo

Hebrew: לְאָבִ֣יו וּלְאִמּ֗וֹ לְאָחִיו֙ וּלְאַ֣חֹת֔וֹ לֹא־יִטַּמָּ֥א לָהֶ֖ם בְּמֹתָ֑ם כִּ֛י נֵ֥זֶר אֱלֹהָ֖יו עַל־רֹאשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated: Even if their father or mother, or their brother or sister should die, they must not become defiled for any of them, since hair set apart for their God is upon their head:
Transliteration: leaviyv uleimvo leachiyv uleachotvo lo-yitama lahem vemotam khiy nezer elohayv al-roshvo

Hebrew: כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י נִזְר֑וֹ קָדֹ֥שׁ ה֖וּא לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: throughout their term as nazirite they are consecrated to יהוה.
Transliteration: khol yemey nizervo kadosh hu layhovah

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָמ֨וּת מֵ֤ת עָלָיו֙ בְּפֶ֣תַע פִּתְאֹ֔ם וְטִמֵּ֖א רֹ֣אשׁ נִזְר֑וֹ וְגִלַּ֤ח רֹאשׁוֹ֙ בְּי֣וֹם טׇהֳרָת֔וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י יְגַלְּחֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: If someone dies suddenly nearby, defiling the consecrated hair, the [nazirite] shall shave the head at the time of becoming pure, shaving it on the seventh day.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yamut met alayv vefeta fiteom vetime rosh nizervo vegilach roshvo veyvom tׇhoratvo vayyvom hasheviyiy yegalechenu

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁמִינִ֗י יָבִא֙ שְׁתֵּ֣י תֹרִ֔ים א֥וֹ שְׁנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יוֹנָ֑ה אֶ֨ל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: On the eighth day that person shall bring two turtledoves or two pigeons to the priest, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hashemiyniy yavi shetey toriym vo sheney veney yvonah el-hakhohen el-fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְעָשָׂ֣ה הַכֹּהֵ֗ן אֶחָ֤ד לְחַטָּאת֙ וְאֶחָ֣ד לְעֹלָ֔ה וְכִפֶּ֣ר עָלָ֔יו מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָ֖א עַל־הַנָּ֑פֶשׁ וְקִדַּ֥שׁ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: The priest shall offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, and make expiation on the person’s behalf for the guilt incurred through the corpse. That same day the head shall be reconsecrated;
Transliteration: veashah hakhohen echad lechatat veechad leolah vekhifer alayv measher chata al-hanafesh vekidash et-roshvo vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וְהִזִּ֤יר לַֽיהֹוָה֙ אֶת־יְמֵ֣י נִזְר֔וֹ וְהֵבִ֛יא כֶּ֥בֶשׂ בֶּן־שְׁנָת֖וֹ לְאָשָׁ֑ם וְהַיָּמִ֤ים הָרִאשֹׁנִים֙ יִפְּל֔וּ כִּ֥י טָמֵ֖א נִזְרֽוֹ׃
Translated: and that person shall rededicate to יהוה the term as nazirite, bringing a lamb in its first year as a penalty offering. The previous period shall be void, since the consecrated hair was defiled.
Transliteration: vehiziyr layhovah et-yemey nizervo veheviy khevesh ven-shenatvo leasham vehayamiym harishoniym yifelu khiy tame nizervo

Hebrew: וְזֹ֥את תּוֹרַ֖ת הַנָּזִ֑יר בְּי֗וֹם מְלֹאת֙ יְמֵ֣י נִזְר֔וֹ יָבִ֣יא אֹת֔וֹ אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: This is the ritual for the nazirite: On the day that the term as nazirite is completed, the person shall be brought to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: vezot tvorat hanaziyr veyvom melot yemey nizervo yaviy otvo el-fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֣יב אֶת־קׇרְבָּנ֣וֹ לַיהֹוָ֡ה כֶּ֩בֶשׂ֩ בֶּן־שְׁנָת֨וֹ תָמִ֤ים אֶחָד֙ לְעֹלָ֔ה וְכַבְשָׂ֨ה אַחַ֧ת בַּת־שְׁנָתָ֛הּ תְּמִימָ֖ה לְחַטָּ֑את וְאַֽיִל־אֶחָ֥ד תָּמִ֖ים לִשְׁלָמִֽים׃
Translated: As an offering to יהוה that person shall present: one male lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering; one ewe lamb in its first year, without blemish, for a sin offering; one ram without blemish for an offering of well-being;
Transliteration: vehikeriyv et-kׇrevanvo layhovah khevesh ven-shenatvo tamiym echad leolah vekhaveshah achat vat-shenatah temiymah lechatat veayiil-echad tamiym lishelamiym

Hebrew: וְסַ֣ל מַצּ֗וֹת סֹ֤לֶת חַלֹּת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֣ים בַּשָּׁ֑מֶן וּמִנְחָתָ֖ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated: a basket of unleavened cakes of choice flour with oil mixed in, and unleavened wafers spread with oil; and the proper meal offerings and libations.
Transliteration: vesal matsvot solet chalot velulot vashemen urekiykey matsvot meshuchiym vashamen uminechatam venisekheyhem

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֥יב הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעָשָׂ֥ה אֶת־חַטָּאת֖וֹ וְאֶת־עֹלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: The priest shall present them before יהוה and offer the sin offering and the burnt offering.
Transliteration: vehikeriyv hakhohen lifeney yehovah veashah et-chatatvo veet-olatvo

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָאַ֜יִל יַעֲשֶׂ֨ה זֶ֤בַח שְׁלָמִים֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה עַ֖ל סַ֣ל הַמַּצּ֑וֹת וְעָשָׂה֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן אֶת־מִנְחָת֖וֹ וְאֶת־נִסְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He shall offer the ram as a sacrifice of well-being to יהוה, together with the basket of unleavened cakes; the priest shall also offer the meal offerings and the libations.
Transliteration: veet-haayiil yaasheh zevach shelamiym layhovah al sal hamatsvot veashah hakhohen et-minechatvo veet-nisekhvo

Hebrew: וְגִלַּ֣ח הַנָּזִ֗יר פֶּ֛תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ נִזְר֑וֹ וְלָקַ֗ח אֶת־שְׂעַר֙ רֹ֣אשׁ נִזְר֔וֹ וְנָתַן֙ עַל־הָאֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁר־תַּ֖חַת זֶ֥בַח הַשְּׁלָמִֽים׃
Translated: The nazirite shall then shave the consecrated hair, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and take those locks of consecrated hair and put them on the fire that is under the sacrifice of well-being.
Transliteration: vegilach hanaziyr fetach ohel mvoed et-rosh nizervo velakach et-shear rosh nizervo venatan al-haesh asher-tachat zevach hashelamiym

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־הַזְּרֹ֣עַ בְּשֵׁלָה֮ מִן־הָאַ֒יִל֒ וְֽחַלַּ֨ת מַצָּ֤ה אַחַת֙ מִן־הַסַּ֔ל וּרְקִ֥יק מַצָּ֖ה אֶחָ֑ד וְנָתַן֙ עַל־כַּפֵּ֣י הַנָּזִ֔יר אַחַ֖ר הִֽתְגַּלְּח֥וֹ אֶת־נִזְרֽוֹ׃
Translated: The priest shall take the shoulder of the ram when it has been boiled, one unleavened cake from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and place them on the hands of the nazirite after the consecrated hair has been shaved.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen et-hazeroa veshelah min-haayiil vechalat matsah achat min-hasal urekiyk matsah echad venatan al-khafey hanaziyr achar hitegalechvo et-nizervo

Hebrew: וְהֵנִיף֩ אוֹתָ֨ם הַכֹּהֵ֥ן <small>׀</small> תְּנוּפָה֮ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָה֒ קֹ֤דֶשׁ הוּא֙ לַכֹּהֵ֔ן עַ֚ל חֲזֵ֣ה הַתְּנוּפָ֔ה וְעַ֖ל שׁ֣וֹק הַתְּרוּמָ֑ה וְאַחַ֛ר יִשְׁתֶּ֥ה הַנָּזִ֖יר יָֽיִן׃
Translated: The priest shall elevate them as an elevation offering before יהוה; and this shall be a sacred donation for the priest, in addition to the breast of the elevation offering and the thigh of gift offering. After that the nazirite may drink wine.
Transliteration: veheniyf votam hakhohen <small></small> tenufah lifeney yehovah kodesh hu lakhohen al chazeh hatenufah veal shvok haterumah veachar yisheteh hanaziyr yayiin

Hebrew: זֹ֣את תּוֹרַ֣ת הַנָּזִיר֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִדֹּר֒ קׇרְבָּנ֤וֹ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ עַל־נִזְר֔וֹ מִלְּבַ֖ד אֲשֶׁר־תַּשִּׂ֣יג יָד֑וֹ כְּפִ֤י נִדְרוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִדֹּ֔ר כֵּ֣ן יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה עַ֖ל תּוֹרַ֥ת נִזְרֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Such is the obligation of a nazirite; except that those who vow an offering to יהוה of what they can afford, beyond their nazirite requirements, must do exactly according to the vow that they have made beyond their obligation as nazirites.
Transliteration: zot tvorat hanaziyr asher yidor kׇrevanvo layhovah al-nizervo milevad asher-tashiyg yadvo khefiy nidervo asher yidor khen yaasheh al tvorat nizervo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֤ר אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶל־בָּנָ֣יו לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֥ה תְבָרְכ֖וּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אָמ֖וֹר לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Speak to Aaron and his sons: Thus shall you bless the people of Israel. Say to them:
Transliteration: daver el-aharon veel-vanayv lemor khoh tevarekhu et-veney yisherael amvor lahem {s}

Hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה וְיִשְׁמְרֶֽךָ׃ {ס}
Translated: יהוה bless you and protect you!
Transliteration: yevarekhekha yehovah veyishemerekha {s}

Hebrew: יָאֵ֨ר יְהֹוָ֧ה ׀ פָּנָ֛יו אֵלֶ֖יךָ וִֽיחֻנֶּֽךָּ׃ {ס}
Translated: יהוה deal kindly and graciously with you!
Transliteration: yaer yehovah fanayv eleykha viychunekha {s}

Hebrew: יִשָּׂ֨א יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ פָּנָיו֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ וְיָשֵׂ֥ם לְךָ֖ שָׁלֽוֹם׃ {ס}
Translated: יהוה bestow [divine] favor upon you and grant you peace!
Transliteration: yisha yehovah fanayv eleykha veyashem lekha shalvom {s}

Hebrew: וְשָׂמ֥וּ אֶת־שְׁמִ֖י עַל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַאֲנִ֖י אֲבָרְכֵֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus they shall link My name with the people of Israel, and I will bless them.
Transliteration: veshamu et-shemiy al-veney yisherael vaaniy avarekhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֡י בְּיוֹם֩ כַּלּ֨וֹת מֹשֶׁ֜ה לְהָקִ֣ים אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֗ן וַיִּמְשַׁ֨ח אֹת֜וֹ וַיְקַדֵּ֤שׁ אֹתוֹ֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֔יו וְאֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ וְאֶת־כׇּל־כֵּלָ֑יו וַיִּמְשָׁחֵ֖ם וַיְקַדֵּ֥שׁ אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: On the day that Moses finished setting up the Tabernacle, he anointed and consecrated it and all its furnishings, as well as the altar and its utensils. When he had anointed and consecrated them,
Transliteration: vayehiy veyvom khalvot mosheh lehakiym et-hamishekhan vayimeshach otvo vayekadesh otvo veet-khׇl-khelayv veet-hamizevecha veet-khׇl-khelayv vayimeshachem vayekadesh otam

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרִ֙יבוּ֙ נְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל רָאשֵׁ֖י בֵּ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם הֵ֚ם נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הַמַּטֹּ֔ת הֵ֥ם הָעֹמְדִ֖ים עַל־הַפְּקֻדִֽים׃
Translated: the chieftains of Israel, the heads of ancestral houses, namely, the chieftains of the tribes, those who were in charge of enrollment, drew near
Transliteration: vayakeriyvu neshiyey yisherael rashey veyt avotam hem neshiyey hamatot hem haomediym al-hafekudiym

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֨יאוּ אֶת־קׇרְבָּנָ֜ם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה שֵׁשׁ־עֶגְלֹ֥ת צָב֙ וּשְׁנֵ֣י עָשָׂ֣ר בָּקָ֔ר עֲגָלָ֛ה עַל־שְׁנֵ֥י הַנְּשִׂאִ֖ים וְשׁ֣וֹר לְאֶחָ֑ד וַיַּקְרִ֥יבוּ אוֹתָ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: and brought their offering before יהוה: six draught carts and twelve oxen, a cart for every two chieftains and an ox for each one. When they had brought them before the Tabernacle,
Transliteration: vayaviyu et-kׇrevanam lifeney yehovah shesh-egelot tsav usheney ashar vakar agalah al-sheney haneshiiym veshvor leechad vayakeriyvu votam lifeney hamishekhan

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses:
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: קַ֚ח מֵֽאִתָּ֔ם וְהָי֕וּ לַעֲבֹ֕ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אוֹתָם֙ אֶל־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ כְּפִ֥י עֲבֹדָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Accept these from them for use in the service of the Tent of Meeting, and give them to the Levites according to their respective services.
Transliteration: kach meitam vehayu laavod et-avodat ohel mvoed venatatah votam el-haleviyim iysh khefiy avodatvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־הָעֲגָלֹ֖ת וְאֶת־הַבָּקָ֑ר וַיִּתֵּ֥ן אוֹתָ֖ם אֶל־הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: Moses took the carts and the oxen and gave them to the Levites.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-haagalot veet-havakar vayiten votam el-haleviyim

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁתֵּ֣י הָעֲגָל֗וֹת וְאֵת֙ אַרְבַּ֣עַת הַבָּקָ֔ר נָתַ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י גֵרְשׁ֑וֹן כְּפִ֖י עֲבֹדָתָֽם׃
Translated: Two carts and four oxen he gave to the Gershonites, as required for their service,
Transliteration: et shetey haagalvot veet arevaat havakar natan liveney gereshvon khefiy avodatam

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ אַרְבַּ֣ע הָעֲגָלֹ֗ת וְאֵת֙ שְׁמֹנַ֣ת הַבָּקָ֔ר נָתַ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֑י כְּפִי֙ עֲבֹ֣דָתָ֔ם בְּיַד֙ אִֽיתָמָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: and four carts and eight oxen he gave to the Merarites, as required for their service—under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
Transliteration: veet areva haagalot veet shemonat havakar natan liveney merariy khefiy avodatam veyad iytamar ven-aharon hakhohen

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֥י קְהָ֖ת לֹ֣א נָתָ֑ן כִּֽי־עֲבֹדַ֤ת הַקֹּ֙דֶשׁ֙ עֲלֵהֶ֔ם בַּכָּתֵ֖ף יִשָּֽׂאוּ׃
Translated: But to the Kohathites he did not give any; since theirs was the service of the [most] sacred objects, their porterage was by shoulder.
Transliteration: veliveney kehat lo natan khiy-avodat hakodesh alehem vakhatef yishau

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרִ֣יבוּ הַנְּשִׂאִ֗ים אֵ֚ת חֲנֻכַּ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ בְּי֖וֹם הִמָּשַׁ֣ח אֹת֑וֹ וַיַּקְרִ֧יבוּ הַנְּשִׂיאִ֛ם אֶת־קׇרְבָּנָ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: The chieftains also brought the dedication offering for the altar upon its being anointed. As the chieftains were presenting their offerings before the altar,
Transliteration: vayakeriyvu haneshiiym et chanukhat hamizevecha veyvom himashach otvo vayakeriyvu haneshiyim et-kׇrevanam lifeney hamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה נָשִׂ֨יא אֶחָ֜ד לַיּ֗וֹם נָשִׂ֤יא אֶחָד֙ לַיּ֔וֹם יַקְרִ֙יבוּ֙ אֶת־קׇרְבָּנָ֔ם לַחֲנֻכַּ֖ת הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃ {ס}
Translated: יהוה said to Moses: Let them present their offerings for the dedication of the altar, one chieftain each day.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh nashiy echad layyvom nashiy echad layyvom yakeriyvu et-kׇrevanam lachanukhat hamizevecha {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י הַמַּקְרִ֛יב בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן אֶת־קׇרְבָּנ֑וֹ נַחְשׁ֥וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָ֖ב לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The one who presented his offering on the first day was Nahshon son of Amminadab of the tribe of Judah.
Transliteration: vayehiy hamakeriyv vayyvom harishvon et-kׇrevanvo nacheshvon ven-amiynadav lemateh yehudah

Hebrew: וְקׇרְבָּנ֞וֹ קַֽעֲרַת־כֶּ֣סֶף אַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וּמֵאָה֮ מִשְׁקָלָהּ֒ מִזְרָ֤ק אֶחָד֙ כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁבְעִ֥ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם ׀ מְלֵאִ֗ים סֹ֛לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן לְמִנְחָֽה׃
Translated: His offering: one silver bowl weighing 130 shekels and one silver basin of 70 shekels by the sanctuary weight, both filled with choice flour with oil mixed in, for a meal offering;
Transliteration: vekׇrevanvo kaarat-khesef achat sheloshiym umeah mishekalah mizerak echad khesef shiveiym shekel veshekel hakodesh sheneyhem meleiym solet velulah vashemen leminechah

Hebrew: כַּ֥ף אַחַ֛ת עֲשָׂרָ֥ה זָהָ֖ב מְלֵאָ֥ה קְטֹֽרֶת׃
Translated: one gold ladle of 10 shekels, filled with incense;
Transliteration: khaf achat asharah zahav meleah ketoret

Hebrew: פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֞ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֗ר אַ֧יִל אֶחָ֛ד כֶּֽבֶשׂ־אֶחָ֥ד בֶּן־שְׁנָת֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: one bull of the herd, one ram, and one lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;
Transliteration: far echad ven-vakar ayiil echad khevesh-echad ven-shenatvo leolah

Hebrew: שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: one goat for a sin offering;
Transliteration: sheiyr-iziym echad lechatat

Hebrew: וּלְזֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֮ בָּקָ֣ר שְׁנַ֒יִם֒ אֵילִ֤ם חֲמִשָּׁה֙ עַתּוּדִ֣ים חֲמִשָּׁ֔ה כְּבָשִׂ֥ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֖ה חֲמִשָּׁ֑ה זֶ֛ה קׇרְבַּ֥ן נַחְשׁ֖וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָֽב׃ {פ}
Translated: and for his sacrifice of well-being: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five yearling lambs. That was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.
Transliteration: ulezevach hashelamiym vakar shenayiim eylim chamishah atudiym chamishah khevashiym veney-shanah chamishah zeh kׇrevan nacheshvon ven-amiynadav {f}

Hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י הִקְרִ֖יב נְתַנְאֵ֣ל בֶּן־צוּעָ֑ר נְשִׂ֖יא יִשָּׂשכָֽר׃
Translated: On the second day, Nethanel son of Zuar, chieftain of Issachar, made his offering.
Transliteration: vayyvom hasheniy hikeriyv netaneel ven-tsuar neshiy yishashkhar

Hebrew: הִקְרִ֨ב אֶת־קׇרְבָּנ֜וֹ קַֽעֲרַת־כֶּ֣סֶף אַחַ֗ת שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וּמֵאָה֮ מִשְׁקָלָהּ֒ מִזְרָ֤ק אֶחָד֙ כֶּ֔סֶף שִׁבְעִ֥ים שֶׁ֖קֶל בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ שְׁנֵיהֶ֣ם ׀ מְלֵאִ֗ים סֹ֛לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן לְמִנְחָֽה׃
Translated: He presented as his offering: one silver bowl weighing 130 shekels and one silver basin of 70 shekels by the sanctuary weight, both filled with choice flour with oil mixed in, for a meal offering;
Transliteration: hikeriv et-kׇrevanvo kaarat-khesef achat sheloshiym umeah mishekalah mizerak echad khesef shiveiym shekel veshekel hakodesh sheneyhem meleiym solet velulah vashemen leminechah

Hebrew: כַּ֥ף אַחַ֛ת עֲשָׂרָ֥ה זָהָ֖ב מְלֵאָ֥ה קְטֹֽרֶת׃
Translated: one gold ladle of 10 shekels, filled with incense;
Transliteration: khaf achat asharah zahav meleah ketoret

Translated: one bull of the herd, one ram, and one lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;
Transliteration: far echad ven-vakar ayiil echad khevesh-echad ven-shenatvo leolah

Translated: one goat for a sin offering;
Transliteration: sheiyr-iziym echad lechatat

Translated: and for his sacrifice of well-being: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five yearling lambs. That was the offering of Nethanel son of Zuar.
Transliteration: ulezevach hashelamiym vakar shenayiim eylim chamishah atudiym chamishah khevashiym veney-shanah chamishah zeh kׇrevan netaneel ven-tsuar {f}

Hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י נָשִׂ֖יא לִבְנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻ֑ן אֱלִיאָ֖ב בֶּן־חֵלֹֽן׃
Translated: On the third day, it was the chieftain of the Zebulunites, Eliab son of Helon.
Transliteration: vayyvom hasheliyshiy nashiy liveney zevulun eliyav ven-chelon

Translated: On the fourth day, it was the chieftain of the Reubenites, Elizur son of Shedeur.
Transliteration: vayyvom hareviyiy nashiy liveney reuven eliytsur ven-shedeyur

Translated: On the fifth day, it was the chieftain of the Simeonites, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
Transliteration: vayyvom hachamiyshiy nashiy liveney shimevon shelumiyel ven-tsuriyshaday

Translated: On the sixth day, it was the chieftain of the Gadites, Eliasaph son of Deuel.
Transliteration: vayyvom hashishiy nashiy liveney gad eleyasaf ven-deuel

Translated: one gold ladle of 10 shekels, filled with incense;
Transliteration: khaf achat asharah zahav meleah ketoret

Hebrew: פַּ֣ר אֶחָ֞ד בֶּן־בָּקָ֗ר אַ֧יִל אֶחָ֛ד כֶּֽבֶשׂ־אֶחָ֥ד בֶּן־שְׁנָת֖וֹ לְעֹלָֽה׃
Translated: one bull of the herd, one ram, and one lamb in its first year, for a burnt offering;
Transliteration: far echad ven-vakar ayiil echad khevesh-echad ven-shenatvo leolah

Hebrew: שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: one goat for a sin offering;
Transliteration: sheiyr-iziym echad lechatat

Hebrew: וּלְזֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִים֮ בָּקָ֣ר שְׁנַ֒יִם֒ אֵילִ֤ם חֲמִשָּׁה֙ עַתֻּדִ֣ים חֲמִשָּׁ֔ה כְּבָשִׂ֥ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֖ה חֲמִשָּׁ֑ה זֶ֛ה קׇרְבַּ֥ן אֲחִירַ֖ע בֶּן־עֵינָֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: and for his sacrifice of well-being: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five yearling lambs. That was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.
Transliteration: ulezevach hashelamiym vakar shenayiim eylim chamishah atudiym chamishah khevashiym veney-shanah chamishah zeh kׇrevan achiyra ven-eynan {f}

Hebrew: זֹ֣את ׀ חֲנֻכַּ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ בְּיוֹם֙ הִמָּשַׁ֣ח אֹת֔וֹ מֵאֵ֖ת נְשִׂיאֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל קַעֲרֹ֨ת כֶּ֜סֶף שְׁתֵּ֣ים עֶשְׂרֵ֗ה מִֽזְרְקֵי־כֶ֙סֶף֙ שְׁנֵ֣ים עָשָׂ֔ר כַּפּ֥וֹת זָהָ֖ב שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵֽה׃
Translated: This was the dedication offering for the altar from the chieftains of Israel upon its being anointed: silver bowls, 12; silver basins, 12; gold ladles, 12.
Transliteration: zot chanukhat hamizevecha veyvom himashach otvo meet neshiyey yisherael kaarot khesef sheteym eshereh mizerekey-khesef sheneym ashar khafvot zahav sheteym eshereh

Hebrew: שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים וּמֵאָ֗ה הַקְּעָרָ֤ה הָֽאַחַת֙ כֶּ֔סֶף וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים הַמִּזְרָ֣ק הָאֶחָ֑ד כֹּ֚ל כֶּ֣סֶף הַכֵּלִ֔ים אַלְפַּ֥יִם וְאַרְבַּע־מֵא֖וֹת בְּשֶׁ֥קֶל הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: Silver per bowl, 130; per basin, 70. Total silver of vessels, 2,400 sanctuary shekels.
Transliteration: sheloshiym umeah hakearah haachat khesef veshiveiym hamizerak haechad khol khesef hakheliym alefayiim veareva-mevot veshekel hakodesh

Hebrew: כַּפּ֨וֹת זָהָ֤ב שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵה֙ מְלֵאֹ֣ת קְטֹ֔רֶת עֲשָׂרָ֧ה עֲשָׂרָ֛ה הַכַּ֖ף בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ כׇּל־זְהַ֥ב הַכַּפּ֖וֹת עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּמֵאָֽה׃
Translated: The 12 gold ladles filled with incense—10 sanctuary shekels per ladle—total gold of the ladles, 120.
Transliteration: khafvot zahav sheteym-eshereh meleot ketoret asharah asharah hakhaf veshekel hakodesh khׇl-zehav hakhafvot esheriym umeah

Hebrew: כׇּל־הַבָּקָ֨ר לָעֹלָ֜ה שְׁנֵ֧ים עָשָׂ֣ר פָּרִ֗ים אֵילִ֤ם שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂר֙ כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר וּמִנְחָתָ֑ם וּשְׂעִירֵ֥י עִזִּ֛ים שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר לְחַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: Total of herd animals for burnt offerings, 12 bulls; of rams, 12; of yearling lambs, 12—with their proper meal offerings; of goats for sin offerings, 12.
Transliteration: khׇl-havakar laolah sheneym ashar fariym eylim sheneym-ashar khevashiym veney-shanah sheneym ashar uminechatam usheiyrey iziym sheneym ashar lechatat

Hebrew: וְכֹ֞ל בְּקַ֣ר ׀ זֶ֣בַח הַשְּׁלָמִ֗ים עֶשְׂרִ֣ים וְאַרְבָּעָה֮ פָּרִים֒ אֵילִ֤ם שִׁשִּׁים֙ עַתֻּדִ֣ים שִׁשִּׁ֔ים כְּבָשִׂ֥ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֖ה שִׁשִּׁ֑ים זֹ֚את חֲנֻכַּ֣ת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ אַחֲרֵ֖י הִמָּשַׁ֥ח אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Total of herd animals for sacrifices of well-being, 24 bulls; of rams, 60; of he-goats, 60; of yearling lambs, 60. That was the dedication offering for the altar after its anointing.
Transliteration: vekhol vekar zevach hashelamiym esheriym vearevaah fariym eylim shishiym atudiym shishiym khevashiym veney-shanah shishiym zot chanukhat hamizevecha acharey himashach otvo

Hebrew: וּבְבֹ֨א מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵד֮ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אִתּוֹ֒ וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע אֶת־הַקּ֜וֹל מִדַּבֵּ֣ר אֵלָ֗יו מֵעַ֤ל הַכַּפֹּ֙רֶת֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־אֲרֹ֣ן הָעֵדֻ֔ת מִבֵּ֖ין שְׁנֵ֣י הַכְּרֻבִ֑ים וַיְדַבֵּ֖ר אֵלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: When Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with [God], he would hear the Voice addressing him from above the cover that was on top of the Ark of the Pact between the two cherubim; thus [God] spoke to him.
Transliteration: uvevo mosheh el-ohel mvoed ledaver itvo vayishema et-hakvol midaver elayv meal hakhaforet asher al-aron haedut miveyn sheney hakheruviym vayedaver elayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֵלָ֑יו בְּהַעֲלֹֽתְךָ֙ אֶת־הַנֵּרֹ֔ת אֶל־מוּל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הַמְּנוֹרָ֔ה יָאִ֖ירוּ שִׁבְעַ֥ת הַנֵּרֽוֹת׃
Translated: Speak to Aaron and say to him, “When you mount the lamps, let the seven lamps give light at the front of the lampstand.”
Transliteration: daver el-aharon veamareta elayv vehaalotekha et-hanerot el-mul feney hamenvorah yaiyru shiveat hanervot

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ כֵּן֙ אַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶל־מוּל֙ פְּנֵ֣י הַמְּנוֹרָ֔ה הֶעֱלָ֖ה נֵרֹתֶ֑יהָ כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Aaron did so; he mounted the lamps at the front of the lampstand, as יהוה had commanded Moses.—
Transliteration: vayaash khen aharon el-mul feney hamenvorah heelah neroteyha khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וְזֶ֨ה מַעֲשֵׂ֤ה הַמְּנֹרָה֙ מִקְשָׁ֣ה זָהָ֔ב עַד־יְרֵכָ֥הּ עַד־פִּרְחָ֖הּ מִקְשָׁ֣ה הִ֑וא כַּמַּרְאֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶרְאָ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֵּ֥ן עָשָׂ֖ה אֶת־הַמְּנֹרָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Now this is how the lampstand was made: it was hammered work of gold, hammered from base to petal. According to the pattern that יהוה had shown Moses, so was the lampstand made.
Transliteration: vezeh maasheh hamenorah mikeshah zahav ad-yerekhah ad-firechah mikeshah hiv khamareeh asher hereah yehovah et-mosheh khen ashah et-hamenorah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: קַ֚ח אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְטִהַרְתָּ֖ אֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Take the Levites from among the Israelites and purify them.
Transliteration: kach et-haleviyim mitvokhe veney yisherael vetihareta otam

Hebrew: וְכֹֽה־תַעֲשֶׂ֤ה לָהֶם֙ לְטַֽהֲרָ֔ם הַזֵּ֥ה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֵ֣י חַטָּ֑את וְהֶעֱבִ֤ירוּ תַ֙עַר֙ עַל־כׇּל־בְּשָׂרָ֔ם וְכִבְּס֥וּ בִגְדֵיהֶ֖ם וְהִטֶּהָֽרוּ׃
Translated: This is what you shall do to them to purify them: sprinkle on them water of purification, and let them go over their whole body with a razor, and wash their clothes; thus they shall be purified.
Transliteration: vekhoh-taasheh lahem letaharam hazeh aleyhem mey chatat veheeviyru taar al-khׇl-vesharam vekhivesu vigedeyhem vehiteharu

Hebrew: וְלָֽקְחוּ֙ פַּ֣ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֔ר וּמִ֨נְחָת֔וֹ סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן וּפַר־שֵׁנִ֥י בֶן־בָּקָ֖ר תִּקַּ֥ח לְחַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: Let them take a bull of the herd, and with it a meal offering of choice flour with oil mixed in, and you take a second bull of the herd for a sin offering.
Transliteration: velakechu far ven-vakar uminechatvo solet velulah vashamen ufar-sheniy ven-vakar tikach lechatat

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהִ֨קְהַלְתָּ֔ אֶֽת־כׇּל־עֲדַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: You shall bring the Levites forward before the Tent of Meeting. Assemble the Israelite community leadership,
Transliteration: vehikeraveta et-haleviyim lifeney ohel mvoed vehikehaleta et-khׇl-adat veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתָּ֥ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֖ם לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְסָמְכ֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: and bring the Levites forward before יהוה. Let the Israelites lay their hands upon the Levites,
Transliteration: vehikeraveta et-haleviyim lifeney yehovah vesamekhu veney-yisherael et-yedeyhem al-haleviyim

Hebrew: וְהֵנִיף֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֤ם תְּנוּפָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָי֕וּ לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and let Aaron designate the Levites before יהוה as an elevation offering from the Israelites, that they may perform the service of יהוה.
Transliteration: veheniyf aharon et-haleviyim tenufah lifeney yehovah meet veney yisherael vehayu laavod et-avodat yehovah

Hebrew: וְהַלְוִיִּם֙ יִסְמְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְדֵיהֶ֔ם עַ֖ל רֹ֣אשׁ הַפָּרִ֑ים וַ֠עֲשֵׂ֠ה אֶת־הָאֶחָ֨ד חַטָּ֜את וְאֶת־הָאֶחָ֤ד עֹלָה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: The Levites shall now lay their hands upon the heads of the bulls; one shall be offered to יהוה as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, to make expiation for the Levites.
Transliteration: vehaleviyim yisemekhu et-yedeyhem al rosh hafariym vaasheh et-haechad chatat veet-haechad olah layhovah lekhafer al-haleviyim

Hebrew: וְהַֽעֲמַדְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לִפְנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְלִפְנֵ֣י בָנָ֑יו וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: You shall place the Levites in attendance upon Aaron and his sons, and designate them as an elevation offering to יהוה.
Transliteration: vehaamadeta et-haleviyim lifeney aharon velifeney vanayv vehenafeta otam tenufah layhovah

Hebrew: וְהִבְדַּלְתָּ֙ אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהָ֥יוּ לִ֖י הַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: Thus you shall set the Levites apart from the Israelites, and the Levites shall be Mine.
Transliteration: vehivedaleta et-haleviyim mitvokhe veney yisherael vehayu liy haleviyim

Hebrew: וְאַֽחֲרֵי־כֵן֙ יָבֹ֣אוּ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְטִֽהַרְתָּ֣ אֹתָ֔ם וְהֵנַפְתָּ֥ אֹתָ֖ם תְּנוּפָֽה׃
Translated: Thereafter the Levites shall be qualified for the service of the Tent of Meeting, once you have purified them and designated them as an elevation offering.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen yavou haleviyim laavod et-ohel mvoed vetihareta otam vehenafeta otam tenufah

Hebrew: כִּי֩ נְתֻנִ֨ים נְתֻנִ֥ים הֵ֙מָּה֙ לִ֔י מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל תַּ֩חַת֩ פִּטְרַ֨ת כׇּל־רֶ֜חֶם בְּכ֥וֹר כֹּל֙ מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָקַ֥חְתִּי אֹתָ֖ם לִֽי׃
Translated: For they are formally assigned to Me from among the Israelites: I have taken them for Myself in place of all the first issue of the womb, of all the male first-born of the Israelites.
Transliteration: khiy netuniym netuniym hemah liy mitvokhe veney yisherael tachat fiterat khׇl-rechem vekhvor khol miveney yisherael lakachetiy otam liy

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לִ֤י כׇל־בְּכוֹר֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה בְּי֗וֹם הַכֹּתִ֤י כׇל־בְּכוֹר֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם הִקְדַּ֥שְׁתִּי אֹתָ֖ם לִֽי׃
Translated: For every male first-born among the Israelites, human as well as beast, is Mine; I consecrated them to Myself at the time that I smote every [male] first-born in the land of Egypt.
Transliteration: khiy liy khׇl-vekhvor viveney yisherael vaadam uvavehemah veyvom hakhotiy khׇl-vekhvor veerets mitserayiim hikedashetiy otam liy

Hebrew: וָאֶקַּ֖ח אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֑ם תַּ֥חַת כׇּל־בְּכ֖וֹר בִּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Now I take the Levites instead of every male first-born of the Israelites;
Transliteration: vaekach et-haleviyim tachat khׇl-vekhvor viveney yisherael

Hebrew: וָאֶתְּנָ֨ה אֶת־הַלְוִיִּ֜ם נְתֻנִ֣ים ׀ לְאַהֲרֹ֣ן וּלְבָנָ֗יו מִתּוֹךְ֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ לַעֲבֹ֞ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וּלְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֨א יִהְיֶ֜ה בִּבְנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ נֶ֔גֶף בְּגֶ֥שֶׁת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: and from among the Israelites I formally assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons, to perform the service for the Israelites in the Tent of Meeting and to make expiation for the Israelites, so that no plague may afflict the Israelites for coming too near the sanctuary.
Transliteration: vaetenah et-haleviyim netuniym leaharon ulevanayv mitvokhe veney yisherael laavod et-avodat veney-yisherael veohel mvoed ulekhafer al-veney yisherael velo yiheyeh viveney yisherael negef vegeshet veney-yisherael el-hakodesh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְאַהֲרֹ֛ן וְכׇל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַלְוִיִּ֑ם כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁה֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם כֵּן־עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Moses, Aaron, and the Israelite community leadership did with the Levites accordingly; just as יהוה had commanded Moses in regard to the Levites, so the Israelites did with them.
Transliteration: vayaash mosheh veaharon vekhׇl-adat veney-yisherael laleviyim khekhol asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh laleviyim khen-ashu lahem veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְחַטְּא֣וּ הַלְוִיִּ֗ם וַֽיְכַבְּסוּ֙ בִּגְדֵיהֶ֔ם וַיָּ֨נֶף אַהֲרֹ֥ן אֹתָ֛ם תְּנוּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיְכַפֵּ֧ר עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם אַהֲרֹ֖ן לְטַהֲרָֽם׃
Translated: The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes; and Aaron designated them as an elevation offering before יהוה, and Aaron made expiation for them to purify them.
Transliteration: vayitechateu haleviyim vayekhavesu vigedeyhem vayanef aharon otam tenufah lifeney yehovah vayekhafer aleyhem aharon letaharam

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֞ן בָּ֣אוּ הַלְוִיִּ֗ם לַעֲבֹ֤ד אֶת־עֲבֹֽדָתָם֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד לִפְנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן וְלִפְנֵ֣י בָנָ֑יו כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ צִוָּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁה֙ עַל־הַלְוִיִּ֔ם כֵּ֖ן עָשׂ֥וּ לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Thereafter the Levites were qualified to perform their service in the Tent of Meeting, under Aaron and his sons. As יהוה had commanded Moses in regard to the Levites, so they did to them.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen vau haleviyim laavod et-avodatam veohel mvoed lifeney aharon velifeney vanayv khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh al-haleviyim khen ashu lahem {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: זֹ֖את אֲשֶׁ֣ר לַלְוִיִּ֑ם מִבֶּן֩ חָמֵ֨שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה יָבוֹא֙ לִצְבֹ֣א צָבָ֔א בַּעֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: This is the rule for the Levites. From twenty-five years of age up they shall participate in the work force in the service of the Tent of Meeting;
Transliteration: zot asher laleviyim miven chamesh veesheriym shanah vamaelah yavvo litsevo tsava vaavodat ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וּמִבֶּן֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה יָשׁ֖וּב מִצְּבָ֣א הָעֲבֹדָ֑ה וְלֹ֥א יַעֲבֹ֖ד עֽוֹד׃
Translated: but at the age of fifty they shall retire from the work force and shall serve no more.
Transliteration: umiven chamishiym shanah yashuv mitseva haavodah velo yaavod vod

Hebrew: וְשֵׁרֵ֨ת אֶת־אֶחָ֜יו בְּאֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ לִשְׁמֹ֣ר מִשְׁמֶ֔רֶת וַעֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א יַעֲבֹ֑ד כָּ֛כָה תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה לַלְוִיִּ֖ם בְּמִשְׁמְרֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: They may assist their brother Levites at the Tent of Meeting by standing guard, but they shall perform no labor. Thus you shall deal with the Levites in regard to their duties.
Transliteration: vesheret et-echayv veohel mvoed lishemor mishemeret vaavodah lo yaavod khakhah taasheh laleviyim vemishemerotam {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה בְמִדְבַּר־סִ֠ינַ֠י בַּשָּׁנָ֨ה הַשֵּׁנִ֜ית לְצֵאתָ֨ם מֵאֶ֧רֶץ מִצְרַ֛יִם בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, on the first new moon of the second year following the exodus from the land of Egypt, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh vemidevar-siynay vashanah hasheniyt letsetam meerets mitserayiim vachodesh harishvon lemor

Hebrew: וְיַעֲשׂ֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־הַפָּ֖סַח בְּמוֹעֲדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Let the Israelite people offer the passover sacrifice at its set time:
Transliteration: veyaashu veney-yisherael et-hafasach vemvoadvo

Hebrew: בְּאַרְבָּעָ֣ה עָשָֽׂר־י֠וֹם בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֜ה בֵּ֧ין הָֽעַרְבַּ֛יִם תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בְּמֹעֲד֑וֹ כְּכׇל־חֻקֹּתָ֥יו וּכְכׇל־מִשְׁפָּטָ֖יו תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: you shall offer it on the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, at its set time; you shall offer it in accordance with all its rules and rites.
Transliteration: vearevaah ashar-yvom vachodesh hazeh veyn haarevayiim taashu otvo vemoadvo khekhׇl-chukotayv ukhekhׇl-mishefatayv taashu otvo

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַעֲשֹׂ֥ת הַפָּֽסַח׃
Translated: Moses instructed the Israelites to offer the passover sacrifice;
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh el-veney yisherael laashot hafasach

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂ֣וּ אֶת־הַפֶּ֡סַח בָּרִאשׁ֡וֹן בְּאַרְבָּעָה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֥וֹם לַחֹ֛דֶשׁ בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר סִינָ֑י כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֵּ֥ן עָשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and they offered the passover sacrifice in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight, in the wilderness of Sinai. Just as יהוה had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did.
Transliteration: vayaashu et-hafesach varishvon vearevaah ashar yvom lachodesh veyn haarevayiim vemidevar siynay khekhol asher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh khen ashu veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י אֲנָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָי֤וּ טְמֵאִים֙ לְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֔ם וְלֹא־יָכְל֥וּ לַעֲשֹׂת־הַפֶּ֖סַח בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַֽיִּקְרְב֞וּ לִפְנֵ֥י מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְלִפְנֵ֥י אַהֲרֹ֖ן בַּיּ֥וֹם הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: But there were some householders who were impure by reason of a corpse and could not offer the passover sacrifice on that day. Appearing that same day before Moses and Aaron,
Transliteration: vayehiy anashiym asher hayu temeiym lenefesh adam velo-yakhelu laashot-hafesach vayyvom hahu vayikerevu lifeney mosheh velifeney aharon vayyvom hahu

Hebrew: וַ֠יֹּאמְר֠וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָהֵ֙מָּה֙ אֵלָ֔יו אֲנַ֥חְנוּ טְמֵאִ֖ים לְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֑ם לָ֣מָּה נִגָּרַ֗ע לְבִלְתִּ֨י הַקְרִ֜יב אֶת־קׇרְבַּ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ בְּמֹ֣עֲד֔וֹ בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: those householders said to them, “Impure though we are by reason of a corpse, why must we be debarred from presenting יהוה’s offering at its set time with the rest of the Israelites?”
Transliteration: vayomeru haanashiym hahemah elayv anachenu temeiym lenefesh adam lamah nigara leviletiy hakeriyv et-kׇrevan yehovah vemoadvo vetvokhe veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֖ם מֹשֶׁ֑ה עִמְד֣וּ וְאֶשְׁמְעָ֔ה מַה־יְצַוֶּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לָכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Moses said to them, “Stand by, and let me hear what instructions יהוה gives about you.”
Transliteration: vayomer alehem mosheh imedu veeshemeah mah-yetsaveh yehovah lakhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֣ישׁ אִ֣ישׁ כִּי־יִהְיֶֽה־טָמֵ֣א <small>׀</small> לָנֶ֡פֶשׁ אוֹ֩ בְדֶ֨רֶךְ רְחֹקָ֜הׄ לָכֶ֗ם א֚וֹ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעָ֥שָׂה פֶ֖סַח לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people, saying: When any party—whether you or your posterity—who is defiled by a corpse or is on a long journey would offer a passover sacrifice to יהוה,
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael lemor iysh iysh khiy-yiheyeh-tame <small></small> lanefesh vo vederekhe rechokah lakhem vo ledoroteykhem veashah fesach layhovah

Hebrew: בַּחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֜י בְּאַרְבָּעָ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר י֛וֹם בֵּ֥ין הָעַרְבַּ֖יִם יַעֲשׂ֣וּ אֹת֑וֹ עַל־מַצּ֥וֹת וּמְרֹרִ֖ים יֹאכְלֻֽהוּ׃
Translated: they shall offer it in the second month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at twilight. They shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs,
Transliteration: vachodesh hasheniy vearevaah ashar yvom veyn haarevayiim yaashu otvo al-matsvot umeroriym yokheluhu

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יַשְׁאִ֤ירוּ מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ עַד־בֹּ֔קֶר וְעֶ֖צֶם לֹ֣א יִשְׁבְּרוּ־ב֑וֹ כְּכׇל־חֻקַּ֥ת הַפֶּ֖סַח יַעֲשׂ֥וּ אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: and they shall not leave any of it over until morning. They shall not break a bone of it. They shall offer it in strict accord with the law of the passover sacrifice.
Transliteration: lo-yasheiyru mimenu ad-voker veetsem lo yisheveru-vvo khekhׇl-chukat hafesach yaashu otvo

Hebrew: וְהָאִישׁ֩ אֲשֶׁר־ה֨וּא טָה֜וֹר וּבְדֶ֣רֶךְ לֹא־הָיָ֗ה וְחָדַל֙ לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת הַפֶּ֔סַח וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מֵֽעַמֶּ֑יהָ כִּ֣י ׀ קׇרְבַּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹ֤א הִקְרִיב֙ בְּמֹ֣עֲד֔וֹ חֶטְא֥וֹ יִשָּׂ֖א הָאִ֥ישׁ הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: But if any party who is pure and not on a journey refrains from offering the passover sacrifice, that person shall be cut off from kin, for יהוה’s offering was not presented at its set time; that party shall bear the guilt.
Transliteration: vehaiysh asher-hu tahvor uvederekhe lo-hayah vechadal laashvot hafesach venikheretah hanefesh hahiv meameyha khiy kׇrevan yehovah lo hikeriyv vemoadvo chetevo yisha haiysh hahu

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָג֨וּר אִתְּכֶ֜ם גֵּ֗ר וְעָ֤שָֽׂה פֶ֙סַח֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה כְּחֻקַּ֥ת הַפֶּ֛סַח וּכְמִשְׁפָּט֖וֹ כֵּ֣ן יַעֲשֶׂ֑ה חֻקָּ֤ה אַחַת֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם וְלַגֵּ֖ר וּלְאֶזְרַ֥ח הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {ס}
Translated: And when a stranger who resides with you would offer a passover sacrifice to יהוה, it must be offered in accordance with the rules and rites of the passover sacrifice. There shall be one law for you, whether stranger or citizen of the country.
Transliteration: vekhiy-yagur itekhem ger veashah fesach layhovah khechukat hafesach ukhemishefatvo khen yaasheh chukah achat yiheyeh lakhem velager uleezerach haarets {s}

Hebrew: וּבְיוֹם֙ הָקִ֣ים אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן כִּסָּ֤ה הֶֽעָנָן֙ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֔ן לְאֹ֖הֶל הָעֵדֻ֑ת וּבָעֶ֜רֶב יִהְיֶ֧ה עַֽל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֛ן כְּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֖שׁ עַד־בֹּֽקֶר׃
Translated: On the day that the Tabernacle was set up, the cloud covered the Tabernacle, the Tent of the Pact; and in the evening it rested over the Tabernacle in the likeness of fire until morning.
Transliteration: uveyvom hakiym et-hamishekhan khisah heanan et-hamishekhan leohel haedut uvaerev yiheyeh al-hamishekhan khemareeh-esh ad-voker

Hebrew: כֵּ֚ן יִהְיֶ֣ה תָמִ֔יד הֶעָנָ֖ן יְכַסֶּ֑נּוּ וּמַרְאֵה־אֵ֖שׁ לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: It was always so: the cloud covered it, appearing as fire by night.
Transliteration: khen yiheyeh tamiyd heanan yekhasenu umareeh-esh layelah

Hebrew: וּלְפִ֞י הֵעָל֤וֹת הֶֽעָנָן֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָאֹ֔הֶל וְאַ֣חֲרֵי כֵ֔ן יִסְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּבִמְק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֤ר יִשְׁכׇּן־שָׁם֙ הֶֽעָנָ֔ן שָׁ֥ם יַחֲנ֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And whenever the cloud lifted from the Tent, the Israelites would set out accordingly; and at the spot where the cloud settled, there the Israelites would make camp.
Transliteration: ulefiy healvot heanan meal haohel veacharey khen yiseu veney yisherael uvimekvom asher yishekhׇn-sham heanan sham yachanu veney yisherael

Hebrew: עַל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה יִסְעוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה יַחֲנ֑וּ כׇּל־יְמֵ֗י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׁכֹּ֧ן הֶעָנָ֛ן עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יַחֲנֽוּ׃
Translated: At a command of יהוה the Israelites broke camp, and at a command of יהוה they made camp: they remained encamped as long as the cloud stayed over the Tabernacle.
Transliteration: al-fiy yehovah yiseu veney yisherael veal-fiy yehovah yachanu khׇl-yemey asher yishekhon heanan al-hamishekhan yachanu

Hebrew: וּבְהַאֲרִ֧יךְ הֶֽעָנָ֛ן עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וְשָׁמְר֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א יִסָּֽעוּ׃
Translated: When the cloud lingered over the Tabernacle many days, the Israelites observed יהוה’s mandate and did not journey on.
Transliteration: uvehaariykhe heanan al-hamishekhan yamiym raviym veshameru veney-yisherael et-mishemeret yehovah velo yisau

Hebrew: וְיֵ֞שׁ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִהְיֶ֧ה הֶֽעָנָ֛ן יָמִ֥ים מִסְפָּ֖ר עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן עַל־פִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ יַחֲנ֔וּ וְעַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה יִסָּֽעוּ׃
Translated: At such times as the cloud rested over the Tabernacle for but a few days, they remained encamped at a command of יהוה, and broke camp at a command of יהוה.
Transliteration: veeish asher yiheyeh heanan yamiym misefar al-hamishekhan al-fiy yehovah yachanu veal-fiy yehovah yisau

Hebrew: וְיֵ֞שׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִהְיֶ֤ה הֶֽעָנָן֙ מֵעֶ֣רֶב עַד־בֹּ֔קֶר וְנַעֲלָ֧ה הֶֽעָנָ֛ן בַּבֹּ֖קֶר וְנָסָ֑עוּ א֚וֹ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַ֔יְלָה וְנַעֲלָ֥ה הֶעָנָ֖ן וְנָסָֽעוּ׃
Translated: And at such times as the cloud stayed from evening until morning, they broke camp as soon as the cloud lifted in the morning. Day or night, whenever the cloud lifted, they would break camp.
Transliteration: veeish asher-yiheyeh heanan meerev ad-voker venaalah heanan vavoker venasau vo yvomam valayelah venaalah heanan venasau

Hebrew: אֽוֹ־יֹמַ֜יִם אוֹ־חֹ֣דֶשׁ אוֹ־יָמִ֗ים בְּהַאֲרִ֨יךְ הֶעָנָ֤ן עַל־הַמִּשְׁכָּן֙ לִשְׁכֹּ֣ן עָלָ֔יו יַחֲנ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְלֹ֣א יִסָּ֑עוּ וּבְהֵעָלֹת֖וֹ יִסָּֽעוּ׃
Translated: Whether it was two days or a month or a year—however long the cloud lingered over the Tabernacle—the Israelites remained encamped and did not set out; only when it lifted did they break camp.
Transliteration: vo-yomayiim vo-chodesh vo-yamiym vehaariykhe heanan al-hamishekhan lishekhon alayv yachanu veney-yisherael velo yisau uvehealotvo yisau

Hebrew: עַל־פִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ יַחֲנ֔וּ וְעַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה יִסָּ֑עוּ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֤רֶת יְהֹוָה֙ שָׁמָ֔רוּ עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: On a sign from יהוה they made camp and on a sign from יהוה they broke camp; they observed יהוה’s mandate at יהוה’s bidding through Moses.
Transliteration: al-fiy yehovah yachanu veal-fiy yehovah yisau et-mishemeret yehovah shamaru al-fiy yehovah veyad-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֣ה לְךָ֗ שְׁתֵּי֙ חֲצֽוֹצְרֹ֣ת כֶּ֔סֶף מִקְשָׁ֖ה תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה אֹתָ֑ם וְהָי֤וּ לְךָ֙ לְמִקְרָ֣א הָֽעֵדָ֔ה וּלְמַסַּ֖ע אֶת־הַֽמַּחֲנֽוֹת׃
Translated: Have two silver trumpets made; make them of hammered work. They shall serve you to summon [military bodies of] the community and to set the divisions in motion.
Transliteration: asheh lekha shetey chatsvotserot khesef mikeshah taasheh otam vehayu lekha lemikera haedah ulemasa et-hamachanvot

Hebrew: וְתָקְע֖וּ בָּהֵ֑ן וְנֽוֹעֲד֤וּ אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: When both are blown in long blasts, the whole company [of fighters] shall assemble before you at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting;
Transliteration: vetakeu vahen venvoadu eleykha khׇl-haedah el-fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְאִם־בְּאַחַ֖ת יִתְקָ֑עוּ וְנוֹעֲד֤וּ אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ הַנְּשִׂיאִ֔ים רָאשֵׁ֖י אַלְפֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and if only one is blown, the chieftains, heads of Israel’s contingents, shall assemble before you.
Transliteration: veim-veachat yitekau venvoadu eleykha haneshiyiym rashey alefey yisherael

Hebrew: וּתְקַעְתֶּ֖ם תְּרוּעָ֑ה וְנָֽסְעוּ֙ הַֽמַּחֲנ֔וֹת הַחֹנִ֖ים קֵֽדְמָה׃
Translated: But when you sound short blasts, the divisions encamped on the east shall move forward;
Transliteration: utekaetem teruah venaseu hamachanvot hachoniym kedemah

Hebrew: וּתְקַעְתֶּ֤ם תְּרוּעָה֙ שֵׁנִ֔ית וְנָֽסְעוּ֙ הַֽמַּחֲנ֔וֹת הַחֹנִ֖ים תֵּימָ֑נָה תְּרוּעָ֥ה יִתְקְע֖וּ לְמַסְעֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: and when you sound short blasts a second time, those encamped on the south shall move forward. Thus short blasts shall be blown for setting them in motion,
Transliteration: utekaetem teruah sheniyt venaseu hamachanvot hachoniym teymanah teruah yitekeu lemaseeyhem

Hebrew: וּבְהַקְהִ֖יל אֶת־הַקָּהָ֑ל תִּתְקְע֖וּ וְלֹ֥א תָרִֽיעוּ׃
Translated: while to convoke [military bodies of] the congregation you shall blow long blasts, not short ones.
Transliteration: uvehakehiyl et-hakahal titekeu velo tariyu

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים יִתְקְע֖וּ בַּחֲצֹֽצְר֑וֹת וְהָי֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם לְחֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָ֖ם לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: The trumpets shall be blown by Aaron’s sons, the priests; they shall be for you an institution for all time throughout the ages.
Transliteration: uveney aharon hakhohaniym yitekeu vachatsotservot vehayu lakhem lechukat volam ledoroteykhem

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־תָבֹ֨אוּ מִלְחָמָ֜ה בְּאַרְצְכֶ֗ם עַל־הַצַּר֙ הַצֹּרֵ֣ר אֶתְכֶ֔ם וַהֲרֵעֹתֶ֖ם בַּחֲצֹצְרֹ֑ת וְנִזְכַּרְתֶּ֗ם לִפְנֵי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם וְנוֹשַׁעְתֶּ֖ם מֵאֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: When you are at war in your land against an aggressor who attacks you, you shall sound short blasts on the trumpets, that you may be remembered before your God יהוה and be delivered from your enemies.
Transliteration: vekhiy-tavou milechamah vearetsekhem al-hatsar hatsorer etekhem vahareotem vachatsotserot venizekharetem lifeney yehovah eloheykhem venvoshaetem meoyeveykhem

Hebrew: וּבְי֨וֹם שִׂמְחַתְכֶ֥ם וּֽבְמוֹעֲדֵיכֶם֮ וּבְרָאשֵׁ֣י חׇדְשֵׁיכֶם֒ וּתְקַעְתֶּ֣ם בַּחֲצֹֽצְרֹ֗ת עַ֚ל עֹלֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעַ֖ל זִבְחֵ֣י שַׁלְמֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָי֨וּ לָכֶ֤ם לְזִכָּרוֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: And on your joyous occasions—your fixed festivals and new moon days—you shall sound the trumpets over your burnt offerings and your sacrifices of well-being. They shall be a reminder of you before your God: I, יהוה, am your God.
Transliteration: uveyvom shimechatekhem uvemvoadeykhem uverashey chׇdesheykhem utekaetem vachatsotserot al oloteykhem veal zivechey shalemeykhem vehayu lakhem lezikharvon lifeney eloheykhem aniy yehovah eloheykhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בַּשָּׁנָ֧ה הַשֵּׁנִ֛ית בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַשֵּׁנִ֖י בְּעֶשְׂרִ֣ים בַּחֹ֑דֶשׁ נַעֲלָה֙ הֶֽעָנָ֔ן מֵעַ֖ל מִשְׁכַּ֥ן הָעֵדֻֽת׃
Translated: In the second year, on the twentieth day of the second month, the cloud lifted from the Tabernacle of the Pact
Transliteration: vayehiy vashanah hasheniyt vachodesh hasheniy veesheriym vachodesh naalah heanan meal mishekhan haedut

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לְמַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם מִמִּדְבַּ֣ר סִינָ֑י וַיִּשְׁכֹּ֥ן הֶעָנָ֖ן בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָֽן׃
Translated: and the Israelites set out on their journeys from the wilderness of Sinai. The cloud came to rest in the wilderness of Paran.
Transliteration: vayiseu veney-yisherael lemaseeyhem mimidevar siynay vayishekhon heanan vemidevar faran

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ בָּרִאשֹׁנָ֑ה עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: When the march was to begin, at יהוה’s command through Moses,
Transliteration: vayiseu varishonah al-fiy yehovah veyad-mosheh

Hebrew: וַיִּסַּ֞ע דֶּ֣גֶל מַחֲנֵ֧ה בְנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֛ה בָּרִאשֹׁנָ֖ה לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְעַ֨ל־צְבָא֔וֹ נַחְשׁ֖וֹן בֶּן־עַמִּינָדָֽב׃
Translated: the first standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Judah. In command of its troops was Nahshon son of Amminadab;
Transliteration: vayisa degel machaneh veney-yehudah varishonah letsiveotam veal-tsevavo nacheshvon ven-amiynadav

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י יִשָּׂשכָ֑ר נְתַנְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּעָֽר׃
Translated: in command of the tribal troop of Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;
Transliteration: veal-tseva mateh veney yishashkhar netaneel ven-tsuar

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻ֑ן אֱלִיאָ֖ב בֶּן־חֵלֹֽן׃
Translated: and in command of the tribal troop of Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon.
Transliteration: veal-tseva mateh veney zevulun eliyav ven-chelon

Hebrew: וְהוּרַ֖ד הַמִּשְׁכָּ֑ן וְנָסְע֤וּ בְנֵֽי־גֵרְשׁוֹן֙ וּבְנֵ֣י מְרָרִ֔י נֹשְׂאֵ֖י הַמִּשְׁכָּֽן׃
Translated: Then the Tabernacle would be taken apart; and the Gershonites and the Merarites, who carried the Tabernacle, would set out.
Transliteration: vehurad hamishekhan venaseu veney-gereshvon uveney merariy nosheey hamishekhan

Hebrew: וְנָסַ֗ע דֶּ֛גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה רְאוּבֵ֖ן לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְעַ֨ל־צְבָא֔וֹ אֱלִיצ֖וּר בֶּן־שְׁדֵיאֽוּר׃
Translated: The next standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Reuben. In command of its troop was Elizur son of Shedeur;
Transliteration: venasa degel machaneh reuven letsiveotam veal-tsevavo eliytsur ven-shedeyur

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֑וֹן שְׁלֻֽמִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־צוּרִֽישַׁדָּֽי׃
Translated: in command of the tribal troop of Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
Transliteration: veal-tseva mateh veney shimevon shelumiyel ven-tsuriyshaday

Hebrew: וְעַל־צְבָ֖א מַטֵּ֣ה בְנֵי־גָ֑ד אֶלְיָסָ֖ף בֶּן־דְּעוּאֵֽל׃
Translated: and in command of the tribal troop of Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel.
Transliteration: veal-tseva mateh veney-gad eleyasaf ven-deuel

Hebrew: וְנָסְעוּ֙ הַקְּהָתִ֔ים נֹשְׂאֵ֖י הַמִּקְדָּ֑שׁ וְהֵקִ֥ימוּ אֶת־הַמִּשְׁכָּ֖ן עַד־בֹּאָֽם׃
Translated: Then the Kohathites, who carried the sacred objects, would set out; and by the time they arrived, the Tabernacle would be set up again.
Transliteration: venaseu hakehatiym nosheey hamikedash vehekiymu et-hamishekhan ad-voam

Hebrew: וְנָסַ֗ע דֶּ֛גֶל מַחֲנֵ֥ה בְנֵֽי־אֶפְרַ֖יִם לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְעַ֨ל־צְבָא֔וֹ אֱלִישָׁמָ֖ע בֶּן־עַמִּיהֽוּד׃
Translated: The next standard to set out, troop by troop, was the division of Ephraim. In command of its troop was Elishama son of Ammihud;
Transliteration: venasa degel machaneh veney-eferayiim letsiveotam veal-tsevavo eliyshama ven-amiyhud

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה גַּמְלִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־פְּדָהצֽוּר׃
Translated: in command of the tribal troop of Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;
Transliteration: veal-tseva mateh veney menasheh gameliyel ven-fedahtsur

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִ֑ן אֲבִידָ֖ן בֶּן־גִּדְעוֹנִֽי׃
Translated: and in command of the tribal troop of Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni.
Transliteration: veal-tseva mateh veney vineyamin aviydan ven-gidevoniy

Hebrew: וְנָסַ֗ע דֶּ֚גֶל מַחֲנֵ֣ה בְנֵי־דָ֔ן מְאַסֵּ֥ף לְכׇל־הַֽמַּחֲנֹ֖ת לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וְעַ֨ל־צְבָא֔וֹ אֲחִיעֶ֖זֶר בֶּן־עַמִּישַׁדָּֽי׃
Translated: Then, as the rear guard of all the divisions, the standard of the division of Dan would set out, troop by troop. In command of its troop was Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
Transliteration: venasa degel machaneh veney-dan measef lekhׇl-hamachanot letsiveotam veal-tsevavo achiyezer ven-amiyshaday

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י אָשֵׁ֑ר פַּגְעִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עׇכְרָֽן׃
Translated: in command of the tribal troop of Asher, Pagiel son of Ochran;
Transliteration: veal-tseva mateh veney asher fageiyel ven-ׇkheran

Hebrew: וְעַ֨ל־צְבָ֔א מַטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י נַפְתָּלִ֑י אֲחִירַ֖ע בֶּן־עֵינָֽן׃
Translated: and in command of the tribal troop of Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.
Transliteration: veal-tseva mateh veney nafetaliy achiyra ven-eynan

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מַסְעֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם וַיִּסָּֽעוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: Such was the order of march of the Israelites, as they marched troop by troop.
Transliteration: eleh maseey veney-yisherael letsiveotam vayisau {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֗ה לְ֠חֹבָ֠ב בֶּן־רְעוּאֵ֣ל הַמִּדְיָנִי֮ חֹתֵ֣ן מֹשֶׁה֒ נֹסְעִ֣ים ׀ אֲנַ֗חְנוּ אֶל־הַמָּקוֹם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֹת֖וֹ אֶתֵּ֣ן לָכֶ֑ם לְכָ֤ה אִתָּ֙נוּ֙ וְהֵטַ֣בְנוּ לָ֔ךְ כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֥ה דִּבֶּר־ט֖וֹב עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Moses said to Hobab son of Reuel the Midianite, Moses’ father-in-law, “We are setting out for the place of which יהוה has said, ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us and we will be generous with you; for יהוה has promised to be generous to Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh lechovav ven-reuel hamideyaniy choten mosheh noseiym anachenu el-hamakvom asher amar yehovah otvo eten lakhem lekhah itanu vehetavenu lakhe khiy-yehovah diver-tvov al-yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֵלָ֖יו לֹ֣א אֵלֵ֑ךְ כִּ֧י אִם־אֶל־אַרְצִ֛י וְאֶל־מוֹלַדְתִּ֖י אֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: “I will not go,” he replied to him, “but will return to my native land.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv lo elekhe khiy im-el-aretsiy veel-mvoladetiy elekhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֕אמֶר אַל־נָ֖א תַּעֲזֹ֣ב אֹתָ֑נוּ כִּ֣י ׀ עַל־כֵּ֣ן יָדַ֗עְתָּ חֲנֹתֵ֙נוּ֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר וְהָיִ֥יתָ לָּ֖נוּ לְעֵינָֽיִם׃
Translated: He said, “Please do not leave us, inasmuch as you know where we should camp in the wilderness and can be our guide.
Transliteration: vayomer al-na taazov otanu khiy al-khen yadaeta chanotenu vamidevar vehayiyta lanu leeynayiim

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֖ה כִּי־תֵלֵ֣ךְ עִמָּ֑נוּ וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ הַטּ֣וֹב הַה֗וּא אֲשֶׁ֨ר יֵיטִ֧יב יְהֹוָ֛ה עִמָּ֖נוּ וְהֵטַ֥בְנוּ לָֽךְ׃
Translated: So if you come with us, we will extend to you the same bounty that יהוה grants us.”
Transliteration: vehayah khiy-telekhe imanu vehayah hatvov hahu asher eiytiyv yehovah imanu vehetavenu lakhe

Hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵהַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה דֶּ֖רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וַאֲר֨וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֜ה נֹסֵ֣עַ לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם דֶּ֚רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים לָת֥וּר לָהֶ֖ם מְנוּחָֽה׃
Translated: They marched from the mountain of יהוה a distance of three days. The Ark of the Covenant of יהוה traveled in front of them on that three days’ journey to seek out a resting place for them;
Transliteration: vayiseu mehar yehovah derekhe sheloshet yamiym vaarvon veriyt-yehovah nosea lifeneyhem derekhe sheloshet yamiym latur lahem menuchah

Hebrew: וַעֲנַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם יוֹמָ֑ם בְּנׇסְעָ֖ם מִן־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: and יהוה’s cloud kept above them by day, as they moved on from camp.
Transliteration: vaanan yehovah aleyhem yvomam venׇseam min-hamachaneh {s}

Hebrew: ׆ וַיְהִ֛י בִּנְסֹ֥עַ הָאָרֹ֖ן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֑ה קוּמָ֣ה ׀ יְהֹוָ֗ה וְיָפֻ֙צוּ֙ אֹֽיְבֶ֔יךָ וְיָנֻ֥סוּ מְשַׂנְאֶ֖יךָ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
When the Ark was to set out, Moses would say:
Advance, O יהוה !
May Your enemies be scattered,
And may Your foes flee before You!
Transliteration: vayehiy vinesoa haaron vayomer mosheh kumah yehovah veyafutsu oyeveykha veyanusu meshaneeykha mifaneykha

Hebrew: וּבְנֻחֹ֖ה יֹאמַ֑ר שׁוּבָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה רִֽבְב֖וֹת אַלְפֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ ׆ {פ}
Translated:
And when it halted, he would say:
Return, O יהוה,
You who are Israel’s myriads of thousands!
Transliteration: uvenuchoh yomar shuvah yehovah rivevvot alefey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הָעָם֙ כְּמִתְאֹ֣נְנִ֔ים רַ֖ע בְּאׇזְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּשְׁמַ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ וַיִּ֣חַר אַפּ֔וֹ וַתִּבְעַר־בָּם֙ אֵ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתֹּ֖אכַל בִּקְצֵ֥ה הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: The people took to complaining bitterly before יהוה. יהוה heard and was incensed: a fire of יהוה broke out against them, ravaging the outskirts of the camp.
Transliteration: vayehiy haam khemiteoneniym ra veׇzeney yehovah vayishema yehovah vayichar afvo vativear-vam esh yehovah vatokhal viketseh hamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֥ק הָעָ֖ם אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֤ל מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתִּשְׁקַ֖ע הָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: The people cried out to Moses. Moses prayed to יהוה, and the fire died down.
Transliteration: vayitseak haam el-mosheh vayitefalel mosheh el-yehovah vatisheka haesh

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא תַּבְעֵרָ֑ה כִּֽי־בָעֲרָ֥ה בָ֖ם אֵ֥שׁ יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: That place was named Taberah, because a fire of יהוה had broken out against them.
Transliteration: vayikera shem-hamakvom hahu taveerah khiy-vaarah vam esh yehovah

Hebrew: וְהָֽאסַפְסֻף֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבּ֔וֹ הִתְאַוּ֖וּ תַּאֲוָ֑ה וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ וַיִּבְכּ֗וּ גַּ֚ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מִ֥י יַאֲכִלֵ֖נוּ בָּשָֽׂר׃
Translated: The riffraff in their midst felt a gluttonous craving; and then the Israelites wept and said, “If only we had meat to eat!
Transliteration: vehasafesuf asher vekirevvo hiteauu taavah vayashuvu vayivekhu gam veney yisherael vayomeru miy yaakhilenu vashar

Hebrew: זָכַ֙רְנוּ֙ אֶת־הַדָּגָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־נֹאכַ֥ל בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם חִנָּ֑ם אֵ֣ת הַקִּשֻּׁאִ֗ים וְאֵת֙ הָֽאֲבַטִּחִ֔ים וְאֶת־הֶחָצִ֥יר וְאֶת־הַבְּצָלִ֖ים וְאֶת־הַשּׁוּמִֽים׃
Translated: We remember the fish that we used to eat free in Egypt, the cucumbers, the melons, the leeks, the onions, and the garlic.
Transliteration: zakharenu et-hadagah asher-nokhal vemitserayiim chinam et hakishuiym veet haavatichiym veet-hechatsiyr veet-havetsaliym veet-hashumiym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֛ה נַפְשֵׁ֥נוּ יְבֵשָׁ֖ה אֵ֣ין כֹּ֑ל בִּלְתִּ֖י אֶל־הַמָּ֥ן עֵינֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Now our gullets are shriveled. There is nothing at all! Nothing but this manna to look to!”
Transliteration: veatah nafeshenu yeveshah eyn khol viletiy el-haman eyneynu

Hebrew: וְהַמָּ֕ן כִּזְרַע־גַּ֖ד ה֑וּא וְעֵינ֖וֹ כְּעֵ֥ין הַבְּדֹֽלַח׃
Translated: Now the manna was like coriander seed, and in color it was like bdellium.
Transliteration: vehaman khizera-gad hu veeynvo kheeyn havedolach

Hebrew: שָׁ֩טוּ֩ הָעָ֨ם וְלָֽקְט֜וּ וְטָחֲנ֣וּ בָרֵחַ֗יִם א֤וֹ דָכוּ֙ בַּמְּדֹכָ֔ה וּבִשְּׁלוּ֙ בַּפָּר֔וּר וְעָשׂ֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ עֻג֑וֹת וְהָיָ֣ה טַעְמ֔וֹ כְּטַ֖עַם לְשַׁ֥ד הַשָּֽׁמֶן׃
Translated: The people would go about and gather it, grind it between millstones or pound it in a mortar, boil it in a pot, and make it into cakes. It tasted like rich cream.
Transliteration: shatu haam velaketu vetachanu varechayiim vo dakhu vamedokhah uvishelu vafarur veashu otvo ugvot vehayah taemvo khetaam leshad hashamen

Hebrew: וּבְרֶ֧דֶת הַטַּ֛ל עַל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה לָ֑יְלָה יֵרֵ֥ד הַמָּ֖ן עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: When the dew fell on the camp at night, the manna would fall upon it.
Transliteration: uveredet hatal al-hamachaneh layelah eired haman alayv

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־הָעָ֗ם בֹּכֶה֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔יו אִ֖ישׁ לְפֶ֣תַח אׇהֳל֑וֹ וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ מְאֹ֔ד וּבְעֵינֵ֥י מֹשֶׁ֖ה רָֽע׃
Translated: Moses heard the people weeping, every clan apart, at the entrance of each tent. יהוה was very angry, and Moses was distressed.
Transliteration: vayishema mosheh et-haam vokheh lemishefechotayv iysh lefetach ׇholvo vayichar-af yehovah meod uveeyney mosheh ra

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה לָמָ֤ה הֲרֵעֹ֙תָ֙ לְעַבְדֶּ֔ךָ וְלָ֛מָּה לֹא־מָצָ֥תִי חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ לָשׂ֗וּם אֶת־מַשָּׂ֛א כׇּל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה עָלָֽי׃
Translated: And Moses said to יהוה, “Why have You dealt ill with Your servant, and why have I not enjoyed Your favor, that You have laid the burden of all this people upon me?
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-yehovah lamah hareota leavedekha velamah lo-matsatiy chen veeyneykha lashum et-masha khׇl-haam hazeh alay

Hebrew: הֶאָנֹכִ֣י הָרִ֗יתִי אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אִם־אָנֹכִ֖י יְלִדְתִּ֑יהוּ כִּֽי־תֹאמַ֨ר אֵלַ֜י שָׂאֵ֣הוּ בְחֵיקֶ֗ךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשָּׂ֤א הָאֹמֵן֙ אֶת־הַיֹּנֵ֔ק עַ֚ל הָֽאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתָּ לַאֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: Did I produce all these people, did I engender them, that You should say to me, ‘Carry them in your bosom as a caregiver carries an infant,’ to the land that You have promised on oath to their fathers?
Transliteration: heanokhiy hariytiy et khׇl-haam hazeh im-anokhiy yelidetiyhu khiy-tomar elay shaehu vecheykekha khaasher yisha haomen et-hayonek al haadamah asher nishevaeta laavotayv

Hebrew: מֵאַ֤יִן לִי֙ בָּשָׂ֔ר לָתֵ֖ת לְכׇל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּֽי־יִבְכּ֤וּ עָלַי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר תְּנָה־לָּ֥נוּ בָשָׂ֖ר וְנֹאכֵֽלָה׃
Translated: Where am I to get meat to give to all this people, when they whine before me and say, ‘Give us meat to eat!’
Transliteration: meayiin liy vashar latet lekhׇl-haam hazeh khiy-yivekhu alay lemor tenah-lanu vashar venokhelah

Hebrew: לֹֽא־אוּכַ֤ל אָנֹכִי֙ לְבַדִּ֔י לָשֵׂ֖את אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֥י כָבֵ֖ד מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated: I cannot carry all this people by myself, for it is too much for me.
Transliteration: lo-ukhal anokhiy levadiy lashet et-khׇl-haam hazeh khiy khaved mimeniy

Hebrew: וְאִם־כָּ֣כָה ׀ אַתְּ־עֹ֣שֶׂה לִּ֗י הׇרְגֵ֤נִי נָא֙ הָרֹ֔ג אִם־מָצָ֥אתִי חֵ֖ן בְּעֵינֶ֑יךָ וְאַל־אֶרְאֶ֖ה בְּרָעָתִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: If You would deal thus with me, kill me rather, I beg You, and let me see no more of my wretchedness!”
Transliteration: veim-khakhah ate-osheh liy hׇregeniy na harog im-matsatiy chen veeyneykha veal-ereeh veraatiy {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶסְפָה־לִּ֞י שִׁבְעִ֣ים אִישׁ֮ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָדַ֔עְתָּ כִּי־הֵ֛ם זִקְנֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם וְשֹׁטְרָ֑יו וְלָקַחְתָּ֤ אֹתָם֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְהִֽתְיַצְּב֥וּ שָׁ֖ם עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Gather for Me seventy of Israel’s elders of whom you have experience as elders and officers of the people, and bring them to the Tent of Meeting and let them take their place there with you.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh esefah-liy shiveiym iysh mizikeney yisherael asher yadaeta khiy-hem zikeney haam veshoterayv velakacheta otam el-ohel mvoed vehiteyatsevu sham imakhe

Hebrew: וְיָרַדְתִּ֗י וְדִבַּרְתִּ֣י עִמְּךָ֮ שָׁם֒ וְאָצַלְתִּ֗י מִן־הָר֛וּחַ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָלֶ֖יךָ וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְנָשְׂא֤וּ אִתְּךָ֙ בְּמַשָּׂ֣א הָעָ֔ם וְלֹא־תִשָּׂ֥א אַתָּ֖ה לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: I will come down and speak with you there, and I will draw upon the spirit that is on you and put it upon them; they shall share the burden of the people with you, and you shall not bear it alone.
Transliteration: veyaradetiy vedivaretiy imekha sham veatsaletiy min-harucha asher aleykha veshametiy aleyhem venasheu itekha vemasha haam velo-tisha atah levadekha

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הָעָ֨ם תֹּאמַ֜ר הִתְקַדְּשׁ֣וּ לְמָחָר֮ וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֣ם בָּשָׂר֒ כִּ֡י בְּכִיתֶם֩ בְּאׇזְנֵ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר מִ֤י יַאֲכִלֵ֙נוּ֙ בָּשָׂ֔ר כִּי־ט֥וֹב לָ֖נוּ בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וְנָתַ֨ן יְהֹוָ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם בָּשָׂ֖ר וַאֲכַלְתֶּֽם׃
Translated: And say to the people: Purify yourselves for tomorrow and you shall eat meat, for you have kept whining before יהוה and saying, ‘If only we had meat to eat! Indeed, we were better off in Egypt!’ יהוה will give you meat and you shall eat.
Transliteration: veel-haam tomar hitekadeshu lemachar vaakhaletem vashar khiy vekhiytem veׇzeney yehovah lemor miy yaakhilenu vashar khiy-tvov lanu vemitserayiim venatan yehovah lakhem vashar vaakhaletem

Hebrew: לֹ֣א י֥וֹם אֶחָ֛ד תֹּאכְל֖וּן וְלֹ֣א יוֹמָ֑יִם וְלֹ֣א ׀ חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה יָמִ֗ים וְלֹא֙ עֲשָׂרָ֣ה יָמִ֔ים וְלֹ֖א עֶשְׂרִ֥ים יֽוֹם׃
Translated: You shall eat not one day, not two, not even five days or ten or twenty,
Transliteration: lo yvom echad tokhelun velo yvomayiim velo chamishah yamiym velo asharah yamiym velo esheriym yvom

Hebrew: עַ֣ד ׀ חֹ֣דֶשׁ יָמִ֗ים עַ֤ד אֲשֶׁר־יֵצֵא֙ מֵֽאַפְּכֶ֔ם וְהָיָ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם לְזָרָ֑א יַ֗עַן כִּֽי־מְאַסְתֶּ֤ם אֶת־יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֔ם וַתִּבְכּ֤וּ לְפָנָיו֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֖ה יָצָ֥אנוּ מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: but a whole month, until it comes out of your nostrils and becomes loathsome to you. For you have rejected יהוה who is among you, by whining before [God] and saying, ‘Oh, why did we ever leave Egypt!’”
Transliteration: ad chodesh yamiym ad asher-eitse meafekhem vehayah lakhem lezara yaan khiy-measetem et-yehovah asher vekirevekhem vativekhu lefanayv lemor lamah zeh yatsanu mimitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ מֹשֶׁה֒ שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ רַגְלִ֔י הָעָ֕ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָנֹכִ֖י בְּקִרְבּ֑וֹ וְאַתָּ֣ה אָמַ֗רְתָּ בָּשָׂר֙ אֶתֵּ֣ן לָהֶ֔ם וְאָכְל֖וּ חֹ֥דֶשׁ יָמִֽים׃
Translated: But Moses said, “The people who are with me number six hundred thousand foot soldiers; yet You say, ‘I will give them enough meat to eat for a whole month.’
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh shesh-mevot elef rageliy haam asher anokhiy vekirevvo veatah amareta vashar eten lahem veakhelu chodesh yamiym

Hebrew: הֲצֹ֧אן וּבָקָ֛ר יִשָּׁחֵ֥ט לָהֶ֖ם וּמָצָ֣א לָהֶ֑ם אִ֣ם אֶֽת־כׇּל־דְּגֵ֥י הַיָּ֛ם יֵאָסֵ֥ף לָהֶ֖ם וּמָצָ֥א לָהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Could enough flocks and herds be slaughtered to suffice them? Or could all the fish of the sea be gathered for them to suffice them?”
Transliteration: hatson uvakar yishachet lahem umatsa lahem im et-khׇl-degey hayam eiasef lahem umatsa lahem {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הֲיַ֥ד יְהֹוָ֖ה תִּקְצָ֑ר עַתָּ֥ה תִרְאֶ֛ה הֲיִקְרְךָ֥ דְבָרִ֖י אִם־לֹֽא׃
Translated: And יהוה answered Moses, “Is there a limit to יהוה’s power? You shall soon see whether what I have said happens to you or not!”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh hayad yehovah tiketsar atah tireeh hayikerekha devariy im-lo

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֣א מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיְדַבֵּר֙ אֶל־הָעָ֔ם אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֶּאֱסֹ֞ף שִׁבְעִ֥ים אִישׁ֙ מִזִּקְנֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם וַֽיַּעֲמֵ֥ד אֹתָ֖ם סְבִיבֹ֥ת הָאֹֽהֶל׃
Translated: Moses went out and reported the words of יהוה to the people. He gathered seventy of the people’s elders and stationed them around the Tent.
Transliteration: vayetse mosheh vayedaver el-haam et diverey yehovah vayeesof shiveiym iysh mizikeney haam vayaamed otam seviyvot haohel

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨רֶד יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> בֶּעָנָן֮ וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלָיו֒ וַיָּ֗אצֶל מִן־הָר֙וּחַ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלָ֔יו וַיִּתֵּ֕ן עַל־שִׁבְעִ֥ים אִ֖ישׁ הַזְּקֵנִ֑ים וַיְהִ֗י כְּנ֤וֹחַ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ הָר֔וּחַ וַיִּֽתְנַבְּא֖וּ וְלֹ֥א יָסָֽפוּ׃
Translated: Then, after coming down in a cloud and speaking to him, יהוה drew upon the spirit that was on him and put it upon the seventy participating elders. And when the spirit rested upon them, they spoke in ecstasy, but did not continue.
Transliteration: vayered yehovah <small></small> veanan vayedaver elayv vayatsel min-harucha asher alayv vayiten al-shiveiym iysh hazekeniym vayehiy khenvocha aleyhem harucha vayitenaveu velo yasafu

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁאֲר֣וּ שְׁנֵֽי־אֲנָשִׁ֣ים <small>׀</small> בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֡ה שֵׁ֣ם הָאֶחָ֣ד <small>׀</small> אֶלְדָּ֡ד וְשֵׁם֩ הַשֵּׁנִ֨י מֵידָ֜ד וַתָּ֧נַח עֲלֵהֶ֣ם הָר֗וּחַ וְהֵ֙מָּה֙ בַּכְּתֻבִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יָצְא֖וּ הָאֹ֑הֱלָה וַיִּֽתְנַבְּא֖וּ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: Two of the participants, one named Eldad and the other Medad, had remained in camp; yet the spirit rested upon them—they were among those recorded, but they had not gone out to the Tent—and they spoke in ecstasy in the camp.
Transliteration: vayishaaru sheney-anashiym <small></small> vamachaneh shem haechad <small></small> eledad veshem hasheniy meydad vatanach alehem harucha vehemah vakhetuviym velo yatseu haohelah vayitenaveu vamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣רׇץ הַנַּ֔עַר וַיַּגֵּ֥ד לְמֹשֶׁ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֶלְדָּ֣ד וּמֵידָ֔ד מִֽתְנַבְּאִ֖ים בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: An assistant ran out and told Moses, saying, “Eldad and Medad are acting the prophet in the camp!”
Transliteration: vayarׇts hanaar vayaged lemosheh vayomar eledad umeydad mitenaveiym vamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֜עַן יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן מְשָׁרֵ֥ת מֹשֶׁ֛ה מִבְּחֻרָ֖יו וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֲדֹנִ֥י מֹשֶׁ֖ה כְּלָאֵֽם׃
Translated: And Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ attendant from his youth, spoke up and said, “My lord Moses, restrain them!”
Transliteration: vayaan yehvoshua vin-nun mesharet mosheh mivechurayv vayomar adoniy mosheh khelaem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה הַֽמְקַנֵּ֥א אַתָּ֖ה לִ֑י וּמִ֨י יִתֵּ֜ן כׇּל־עַ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ נְבִיאִ֔ים כִּי־יִתֵּ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶת־רוּח֖וֹ עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But Moses said to him, “Are you wrought up on my account? Would that all יהוה’s people were prophets, that יהוה put [the divine] spirit upon them!”
Transliteration: vayomer lvo mosheh hamekane atah liy umiy yiten khׇl-am yehovah neviyiym khiy-yiten yehovah et-ruchvo aleyhem

Hebrew: וַיֵּאָסֵ֥ף מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה ה֖וּא וְזִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Moses then reentered the camp together with the elders of Israel.
Transliteration: vayeasef mosheh el-hamachaneh hu vezikeney yisherael

Hebrew: וְר֜וּחַ נָסַ֣ע ׀ מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיָּ֣גׇז שַׂלְוִים֮ מִן־הַיָּם֒ וַיִּטֹּ֨שׁ עַל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֜ה כְּדֶ֧רֶךְ י֣וֹם כֹּ֗ה וּכְדֶ֤רֶךְ יוֹם֙ כֹּ֔ה סְבִיב֖וֹת הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וּכְאַמָּתַ֖יִם עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: A wind from יהוה started up, swept quail from the sea and strewed them over the camp, about a day’s journey on this side and about a day’s journey on that side, all around the camp, and some two cubits deep on the ground.
Transliteration: verucha nasa meet yehovah vayagׇz shaleviym min-hayam vayitosh al-hamachaneh khederekhe yvom khoh ukhederekhe yvom khoh seviyvvot hamachaneh ukheamatayiim al-feney haarets

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם הָעָ֡ם כׇּל־הַיּוֹם֩ הַה֨וּא וְכׇל־הַלַּ֜יְלָה וְכֹ֣ל ׀ י֣וֹם הַֽמׇּחֳרָ֗ת וַיַּֽאַסְפוּ֙ אֶת־הַשְּׂלָ֔ו הַמַּמְעִ֕יט אָסַ֖ף עֲשָׂרָ֣ה חֳמָרִ֑ים וַיִּשְׁטְח֤וּ לָהֶם֙ שָׁט֔וֹחַ סְבִיב֖וֹת הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: The people set to gathering quail all that day and night and all the next day—even the one who gathered least had ten ḥomers—and they spread them out all around the camp.
Transliteration: vayakׇm haam khׇl-hayyvom hahu vekhׇl-halayelah vekhol yvom hamׇchorat vayaasefu et-hashelav hamameiyt asaf asharah chomariym vayishetechu lahem shatvocha seviyvvot hamachaneh

Hebrew: הַבָּשָׂ֗ר עוֹדֶ֙נּוּ֙ בֵּ֣ין שִׁנֵּיהֶ֔ם טֶ֖רֶם יִכָּרֵ֑ת וְאַ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ חָרָ֣ה בָעָ֔ם וַיַּ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ בָּעָ֔ם מַכָּ֖ה רַבָּ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: The meat was still between their teeth, not yet chewed, when the anger of יהוה blazed forth against the people and יהוה struck the people with a very severe plague.
Transliteration: havashar vodenu veyn shineyhem terem yikharet veaf yehovah charah vaam vayakhe yehovah vaam makhah ravah meod

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֛א אֶת־שֵֽׁם־הַמָּק֥וֹם הַה֖וּא קִבְר֣וֹת הַֽתַּאֲוָ֑ה כִּי־שָׁם֙ קָֽבְר֔וּ אֶת־הָעָ֖ם הַמִּתְאַוִּֽים׃
Translated: That place was named Kibroth-hattaavah, because the people who had the craving were buried there.
Transliteration: vayikera et-shem-hamakvom hahu kivervot hataavah khiy-sham kaveru et-haam hamiteaviym

Hebrew: מִקִּבְר֧וֹת הַֽתַּאֲוָ֛ה נָסְע֥וּ הָעָ֖ם חֲצֵר֑וֹת וַיִּהְי֖וּ בַּחֲצֵרֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: Then the people set out from Kibroth-hattaavah for Hazeroth. When they were in Hazeroth,
Transliteration: mikivervot hataavah naseu haam chatservot vayiheyu vachatservot {f}

Hebrew: וַתְּדַבֵּ֨ר מִרְיָ֤ם וְאַהֲרֹן֙ בְּמֹשֶׁ֔ה עַל־אֹד֛וֹת הָאִשָּׁ֥ה הַכֻּשִׁ֖ית אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָקָ֑ח כִּֽי־אִשָּׁ֥ה כֻשִׁ֖ית לָקָֽח׃
Translated: Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman he had taken [into his household as his wife]: “He took a Cushite woman!”
Transliteration: vatedaver mireyam veaharon vemosheh al-odvot haishah hakhushiyt asher lakach khiy-ishah khushiyt lakach

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ הֲרַ֤ק אַךְ־בְּמֹשֶׁה֙ דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה הֲלֹ֖א גַּם־בָּ֣נוּ דִבֵּ֑ר וַיִּשְׁמַ֖ע יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They said, “Has יהוה spoken only through Moses? Has [God] not spoken through us as well?” יהוה heard it.
Transliteration: vayomeru harak akhe-vemosheh diver yehovah halo gam-vanu diver vayishema yehovah

Hebrew: וְהָאִ֥ישׁ מֹשֶׁ֖ה עָנָ֣ו מְאֹ֑ד מִכֹּל֙ הָֽאָדָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאֲדָמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Now Moses himself was very humble, more so than any other human being on earth.
Transliteration: vehaiysh mosheh anav meod mikhol haadam asher al-feney haadamah {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה פִּתְאֹ֗ם אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶל־מִרְיָ֔ם צְא֥וּ שְׁלׇשְׁתְּכֶ֖ם אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיֵּצְא֖וּ שְׁלׇשְׁתָּֽם׃
Translated: Suddenly יהוה called to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “Come out, you three, to the Tent of Meeting.” So the three of them went out.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah fiteom el-mosheh veel-aharon veel-mireyam tseu shelׇshetekhem el-ohel mvoed vayetseu shelׇshetam

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רֶד יְהֹוָה֙ בְּעַמּ֣וּד עָנָ֔ן וַֽיַּעֲמֹ֖ד פֶּ֣תַח הָאֹ֑הֶל וַיִּקְרָא֙ אַהֲרֹ֣ן וּמִרְיָ֔ם וַיֵּצְא֖וּ שְׁנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: יהוה came down in a pillar of cloud, stopped at the entrance of the Tent, and called out, “Aaron and Miriam!” The two of them came forward;
Transliteration: vayered yehovah veamud anan vayaamod fetach haohel vayikera aharon umireyam vayetseu sheneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֣א דְבָרָ֑י אִם־יִֽהְיֶה֙ נְבִ֣יאֲכֶ֔ם יְהֹוָ֗ה בַּמַּרְאָה֙ אֵלָ֣יו אֶתְוַדָּ֔ע בַּחֲל֖וֹם אֲדַבֶּר־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and [God] said, “Hear these My words: When prophets of יהוה arise among you, I make Myself known to them in a vision, I speak with them in a dream.
Transliteration: vayomer shimeu-na devaray im-yiheyeh neviyakhem yehovah vamareah elayv etevada vachalvom adaver-vvo

Hebrew: לֹא־כֵ֖ן עַבְדִּ֣י מֹשֶׁ֑ה בְּכׇל־בֵּיתִ֖י נֶאֱמָ֥ן הֽוּא׃
Translated: Not so with My servant Moses; he is trusted throughout My household.
Transliteration: lo-khen avediy mosheh vekhׇl-veytiy neeman hu

Hebrew: פֶּ֣ה אֶל־פֶּ֞ה אֲדַבֶּר־בּ֗וֹ וּמַרְאֶה֙ וְלֹ֣א בְחִידֹ֔ת וּתְמֻנַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה יַבִּ֑יט וּמַדּ֙וּעַ֙ לֹ֣א יְרֵאתֶ֔ם לְדַבֵּ֖ר בְּעַבְדִּ֥י בְמֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: With him I speak mouth to mouth, plainly and not in riddles, and he beholds the likeness of יהוה. How then did you not shrink from speaking against My servant Moses!”
Transliteration: feh el-feh adaver-vvo umareeh velo vechiydot utemunat yehovah yaviyt umadua lo yeretem ledaver veavediy vemosheh

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֧ף יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּ֖ם וַיֵּלַֽךְ׃
Translated: Still incensed with them, יהוה departed.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah vam vayelakhe

Hebrew: וְהֶעָנָ֗ן סָ֚ר מֵעַ֣ל הָאֹ֔הֶל וְהִנֵּ֥ה מִרְיָ֖ם מְצֹרַ֣עַת כַּשָּׁ֑לֶג וַיִּ֧פֶן אַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶל־מִרְיָ֖ם וְהִנֵּ֥ה מְצֹרָֽעַת׃
Translated: As the cloud withdrew from the Tent, there was Miriam stricken with snow-white scales! When Aaron turned toward Miriam, he saw that she was stricken with scales.
Transliteration: veheanan sar meal haohel vehineh mireyam metsoraat khashaleg vayifen aharon el-mireyam vehineh metsoraat

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אַהֲרֹ֖ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה בִּ֣י אֲדֹנִ֔י אַל־נָ֨א תָשֵׁ֤ת עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ חַטָּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֥ר נוֹאַ֖לְנוּ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר חָטָֽאנוּ׃
Translated: And Aaron said to Moses, “O my lord, account not to us the sin which we committed in our folly.
Transliteration: vayomer aharon el-mosheh viy adoniy al-na tashet aleynu chatat asher nvoalenu vaasher chatanu

Hebrew: אַל־נָ֥א תְהִ֖י כַּמֵּ֑ת אֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּצֵאתוֹ֙ מֵרֶ֣חֶם אִמּ֔וֹ וַיֵּאָכֵ֖ל חֲצִ֥י בְשָׂרֽוֹ׃
Translated: Let her not be like a stillbirth which emerges from its mother’s womb with half its flesh eaten away!”
Transliteration: al-na tehiy khamet asher vetsetvo merechem imvo vayeakhel chatsiy vesharvo

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעַ֣ק מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר אֵ֕ל נָ֛א רְפָ֥א נָ֖א לָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: So Moses cried out to יהוה, saying, “O God, pray heal her!”
Transliteration: vayitseak mosheh el-yehovah lemor el na refa na lah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה וְאָבִ֙יהָ֙ יָרֹ֤ק יָרַק֙ בְּפָנֶ֔יהָ הֲלֹ֥א תִכָּלֵ֖ם שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים תִּסָּגֵ֞ר שִׁבְעַ֤ת יָמִים֙ מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְאַחַ֖ר תֵּאָסֵֽף׃
Translated: But יהוה said to Moses, “If her father spat in her face, would she not bear her shame for seven days? Let her be shut out of camp for seven days, and then let her be readmitted.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh veaviyha yarok yarak vefaneyha halo tikhalem shiveat yamiym tisager shiveat yamiym michuts lamachaneh veachar teasef

Hebrew: וַתִּסָּגֵ֥ר מִרְיָ֛ם מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים וְהָעָם֙ לֹ֣א נָסַ֔ע עַד־הֵאָסֵ֖ף מִרְיָֽם׃
Translated: So Miriam was shut out of camp seven days; and the people did not march on until Miriam was readmitted.
Transliteration: vatisager mireyam michuts lamachaneh shiveat yamiym vehaam lo nasa ad-heasef mireyam

Hebrew: וְאַחַ֛ר נָסְע֥וּ הָעָ֖ם מֵחֲצֵר֑וֹת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: After that the people set out from Hazeroth and encamped in the wilderness of Paran.
Transliteration: veachar naseu haam mechatservot vayachanu vemidevar faran {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: שְׁלַח־לְךָ֣ אֲנָשִׁ֗ים וְיָתֻ֙רוּ֙ אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֲשֶׁר־אֲנִ֥י נֹתֵ֖ן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִ֣ישׁ אֶחָד֩ אִ֨ישׁ אֶחָ֜ד לְמַטֵּ֤ה אֲבֹתָיו֙ תִּשְׁלָ֔חוּ כֹּ֖ל נָשִׂ֥יא בָהֶֽם׃
Translated: “Send agents to scout the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelite people; send one participant from each of their ancestral tribes, each one a chieftain among them.”
Transliteration: shelach-lekha anashiym veyaturu et-erets khenaan asher-aniy noten liveney yisherael iysh echad iysh echad lemateh avotayv tishelachu khol nashiy vahem

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח אֹתָ֥ם מֹשֶׁ֛ה מִמִּדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָ֖ן עַל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כֻּלָּ֣ם אֲנָשִׁ֔ים רָאשֵׁ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: So Moses, by יהוה’s command, sent them out from the wilderness of Paran, all of them being men of consequence, leaders of the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayishelach otam mosheh mimidevar faran al-fiy yehovah khulam anashiym rashey veney-yisherael hemah

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה שְׁמוֹתָ֑ם לְמַטֵּ֣ה רְאוּבֵ֔ן שַׁמּ֖וּעַ בֶּן־זַכּֽוּר׃
Translated: And these were their names: From the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur.
Transliteration: veeleh shemvotam lemateh reuven shamua ven-zakhur

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה שִׁמְע֔וֹן שָׁפָ֖ט בֶּן־חוֹרִֽי׃
Translated: From the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori.
Transliteration: lemateh shimevon shafat ven-chvoriy

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה יְהוּדָ֔ה כָּלֵ֖ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּֽה׃
Translated: From the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh.
Transliteration: lemateh yehudah khalev ven-yefuneh

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר יִגְאָ֖ל בֶּן־יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated: From the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph.
Transliteration: lemateh yishashkhar yigeal ven-yvosef

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֥ה אֶפְרָ֖יִם הוֹשֵׁ֥עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃
Translated: From the tribe of Ephraim, Hosea son of Nun.
Transliteration: lemateh eferayiim hvoshea vin-nun

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה בִנְיָמִ֔ן פַּלְטִ֖י בֶּן־רָפֽוּא׃
Translated: From the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Rafu.
Transliteration: lemateh vineyamin faletiy ven-rafu

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה זְבוּלֻ֔ן גַּדִּיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־סוֹדִֽי׃
Translated: From the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi.
Transliteration: lemateh zevulun gadiyel ven-svodiy

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֥ה יוֹסֵ֖ף לְמַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה גַּדִּ֖י בֶּן־סוּסִֽי׃
Translated: From the tribe of Joseph, namely, the tribe of Manasseh, Gaddi son of Susi.
Transliteration: lemateh yvosef lemateh menasheh gadiy ven-susiy

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה דָ֔ן עַמִּיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־גְּמַלִּֽי׃
Translated: From the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli.
Transliteration: lemateh dan amiyel ven-gemaliy

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה אָשֵׁ֔ר סְת֖וּר בֶּן־מִיכָאֵֽל׃
Translated: From the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael.
Transliteration: lemateh asher setur ven-miykhael

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה נַפְתָּלִ֔י נַחְבִּ֖י בֶּן־וׇפְסִֽי׃
Translated: From the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi.
Transliteration: lemateh nafetaliy nacheviy ven-vׇfesiy

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה גָ֔ד גְּאוּאֵ֖ל בֶּן־מָכִֽי׃
Translated: From the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.
Transliteration: lemateh gad geuel ven-makhiy

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָת֣וּר אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיִּקְרָ֥א מֹשֶׁ֛ה לְהוֹשֵׁ֥עַ בִּן־נ֖וּן יְהוֹשֻֽׁעַ׃
Translated: Those were the names of the participants whom Moses sent to scout the land; but Moses changed the name of Hosea son of Nun to Joshua.
Transliteration: eleh shemvot haanashiym asher-shalach mosheh latur et-haarets vayikera mosheh lehvoshea vin-nun yehvoshua
