Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח אֹתָם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה לָת֖וּר אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם עֲל֥וּ זֶה֙ בַּנֶּ֔גֶב וַעֲלִיתֶ֖ם אֶת־הָהָֽר׃
Translated: When Moses sent them to scout the land of Canaan, he said to them, “Go up there into the Negeb and on into the hill country,
Transliteration: vayishelach otam mosheh latur et-erets khenaan vayomer alehem alu zeh vanegev vaaliytem et-hahar

Hebrew: וּרְאִיתֶ֥ם אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ מַה־הִ֑וא וְאֶת־הָעָם֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב עָלֶ֔יהָ הֶחָזָ֥ק הוּא֙ הֲרָפֶ֔ה הַמְעַ֥ט ה֖וּא אִם־רָֽב׃
Translated: and see what kind of country it is. Are the people who dwell in it strong or weak, few or many?
Transliteration: ureiytem et-haarets mah-hiv veet-haam hayoshev aleyha hechazak hu harafeh hameat hu im-rav

Hebrew: וּמָ֣ה הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־הוּא֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּ֔הּ הֲטוֹבָ֥ה הִ֖וא אִם־רָעָ֑ה וּמָ֣ה הֶֽעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁר־הוּא֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּהֵ֔נָּה הַבְּמַֽחֲנִ֖ים אִ֥ם בְּמִבְצָרִֽים׃
Translated: Is the country in which they dwell good or bad? Are the towns they live in open or fortified?
Transliteration: umah haarets asher-hu yoshev vah hatvovah hiv im-raah umah heariym asher-hu yvoshev vahenah havemachaniym im vemivetsariym

Hebrew: וּמָ֣ה הָ֠אָ֠רֶץ הַשְּׁמֵנָ֨ה הִ֜וא אִם־רָזָ֗ה הֲיֵֽשׁ־בָּ֥הּ עֵץ֙ אִם־אַ֔יִן וְהִ֨תְחַזַּקְתֶּ֔ם וּלְקַחְתֶּ֖ם מִפְּרִ֣י הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהַ֨יָּמִ֔ים יְמֵ֖י בִּכּוּרֵ֥י עֲנָבִֽים׃
Translated: Is the soil rich or poor? Is it wooded or not? And take pains to bring back some of the fruit of the land.”—Now it happened to be the season of the first ripe grapes.
Transliteration: umah haarets hashemenah hiv im-razah haeish-vah ets im-ayiin vehitechazaketem ulekachetem miferiy haarets vehayamiym yemey vikhurey anaviym

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ וַיָּתֻ֣רוּ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ מִמִּדְבַּר־צִ֥ן עַד־רְחֹ֖ב לְבֹ֥א חֲמָֽת׃
Translated: They went up and scouted the land, from the wilderness of Zin to Rehob, at Lebo-hamath.
Transliteration: vayaalu vayaturu et-haarets mimidevar-tsin ad-rechov levo chamat

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֣וּ בַנֶּ֘גֶב֮ וַיָּבֹ֣א עַד־חֶבְרוֹן֒ וְשָׁ֤ם אֲחִימַן֙ שֵׁשַׁ֣י וְתַלְמַ֔י יְלִידֵ֖י הָעֲנָ֑ק וְחֶבְר֗וֹן שֶׁ֤בַע שָׁנִים֙ נִבְנְתָ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י צֹ֥עַן מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: They went up into the Negeb and came to Hebron, where lived Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the Anakites.—Now Hebron was founded seven years before Zoan of Egypt.—
Transliteration: vayaalu vanegev vayavo ad-chevervon vesham achiyman sheshay vetalemay yeliydey haanak vechevervon sheva shaniym nivenetah lifeney tsoan mitserayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ עַד־נַ֣חַל אֶשְׁכֹּ֗ל וַיִּכְרְת֨וּ מִשָּׁ֤ם זְמוֹרָה֙ וְאֶשְׁכּ֤וֹל עֲנָבִים֙ אֶחָ֔ד וַיִּשָּׂאֻ֥הוּ בַמּ֖וֹט בִּשְׁנָ֑יִם וּמִן־הָרִמֹּנִ֖ים וּמִן־הַתְּאֵנִֽים׃
Translated: They reached the wadi Eshcol, and there they cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes—it had to be borne on a carrying frame by two of them—and some pomegranates and figs.
Transliteration: vayavou ad-nachal eshekhol vayikheretu misham zemvorah veeshekhvol anaviym echad vayishauhu vamvot vishenayiim umin-harimoniym umin-hateeniym

Hebrew: לַמָּק֣וֹם הַה֔וּא קָרָ֖א נַ֣חַל אֶשְׁכּ֑וֹל עַ֚ל אֹד֣וֹת הָֽאֶשְׁכּ֔וֹל אֲשֶׁר־כָּרְת֥וּ מִשָּׁ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: That place was named the wadi Eshcol because of the cluster that the Israelites cut down there.
Transliteration: lamakvom hahu kara nachal eshekhvol al odvot haeshekhvol asher-kharetu misham veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ מִתּ֣וּר הָאָ֑רֶץ מִקֵּ֖ץ אַרְבָּעִ֥ים יֽוֹם׃
Translated: At the end of forty days they returned from scouting the land.
Transliteration: vayashuvu mitur haarets mikets arevaiym yvom

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֡וּ וַיָּבֹ֩אוּ֩ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֨ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֜ן וְאֶל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֧ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶל־מִדְבַּ֥ר פָּארָ֖ן קָדֵ֑שָׁה וַיָּשִׁ֨יבוּ אֹתָ֤ם דָּבָר֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה וַיַּרְא֖וּם אֶת־פְּרִ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: They went straight to Moses and Aaron and the whole Israelite community at Kadesh in the wilderness of Paran, and they made their report to them and to the whole community, as they showed them the fruit of the land.
Transliteration: vayelekhu vayavou el-mosheh veel-aharon veel-khׇl-adat veney-yisherael el-midevar faran kadeshah vayashiyvu otam davar veet-khׇl-haedah vayareum et-feriy haarets

Hebrew: וַיְסַפְּרוּ־לוֹ֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ בָּ֕אנוּ אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שְׁלַחְתָּ֑נוּ וְ֠גַ֠ם זָבַ֨ת חָלָ֥ב וּדְבַ֛שׁ הִ֖וא וְזֶה־פִּרְיָֽהּ׃
Translated: This is what they told him: “We came to the land you sent us to; it does indeed flow with milk and honey, and this is its fruit.
Transliteration: vayesaferu-lvo vayomeru vanu el-haarets asher shelachetanu vegam zavat chalav udevash hiv vezeh-fireyah

Hebrew: אֶ֚פֶס כִּֽי־עַ֣ז הָעָ֔ם הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְהֶֽעָרִ֗ים בְּצֻר֤וֹת גְּדֹלֹת֙ מְאֹ֔ד וְגַם־יְלִדֵ֥י הָֽעֲנָ֖ק רָאִ֥ינוּ שָֽׁם׃
Translated: However, the people who inhabit the country are powerful, and the cities are fortified and very large; moreover, we saw the Anakites there.
Transliteration: efes khiy-az haam hayoshev vaarets veheariym vetsurvot gedolot meod vegam-yelidey haanak raiynu sham

Hebrew: עֲמָלֵ֥ק יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּאֶ֣רֶץ הַנֶּ֑גֶב וְ֠הַֽחִתִּ֠י וְהַיְבוּסִ֤י וְהָֽאֱמֹרִי֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּהָ֔ר וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ יוֹשֵׁ֣ב עַל־הַיָּ֔ם וְעַ֖ל יַ֥ד הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: Amalekites dwell in the Negeb region; Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites inhabit the hill country; and Canaanites dwell by the Sea and along the Jordan.”
Transliteration: amalek yvoshev veerets hanegev vehachitiy vehayevusiy vehaemoriy yvoshev vahar vehakhenaaniy yvoshev al-hayam veal yad hayareden

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧הַס כָּלֵ֛ב אֶת־הָעָ֖ם אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּ֗אמֶר עָלֹ֤ה נַעֲלֶה֙ וְיָרַ֣שְׁנוּ אֹתָ֔הּ כִּֽי־יָכ֥וֹל נוּכַ֖ל לָֽהּ׃
Translated: Caleb hushed the people before Moses and said, “Let us by all means go up, and we shall gain possession of it, for we shall surely overcome it.”
Transliteration: vayahas khalev et-haam el-mosheh vayomer aloh naaleh veyarashenu otah khiy-yakhvol nukhal lah

Hebrew: וְהָ֨אֲנָשִׁ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־עָל֤וּ עִמּוֹ֙ אָֽמְר֔וּ לֹ֥א נוּכַ֖ל לַעֲל֣וֹת אֶל־הָעָ֑ם כִּֽי־חָזָ֥ק ה֖וּא מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: But the other men who had gone up with him said, “We cannot attack that people, for it is stronger than we.”
Transliteration: vehaanashiym asher-alu imvo ameru lo nukhal laalvot el-haam khiy-chazak hu mimenu

Hebrew: וַיֹּצִ֜יאוּ דִּבַּ֤ת הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תָּר֣וּ אֹתָ֔הּ אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הָאָ֡רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֩ עָבַ֨רְנוּ בָ֜הּ לָת֣וּר אֹתָ֗הּ אֶ֣רֶץ אֹכֶ֤לֶת יוֹשְׁבֶ֙יהָ֙ הִ֔וא וְכׇל־הָעָ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־רָאִ֥ינוּ בְתוֹכָ֖הּ אַנְשֵׁ֥י מִדּֽוֹת׃
Translated: Thus they spread calumnies among the Israelites about the land they had scouted, saying, “The country that we traversed and scouted is one that devours its settlers. All the people that we saw in it are of great size;
Transliteration: vayotsiyu divat haarets asher taru otah el-veney yisherael lemor haarets asher avarenu vah latur otah erets okhelet yvosheveyha hiv vekhׇl-haam asher-raiynu vetvokhah aneshey midvot

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣ם רָאִ֗ינוּ אֶת־הַנְּפִילִ֛ים בְּנֵ֥י עֲנָ֖ק מִן־הַנְּפִלִ֑ים וַנְּהִ֤י בְעֵינֵ֙ינוּ֙ כַּֽחֲגָבִ֔ים וְכֵ֥ן הָיִ֖ינוּ בְּעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: we saw the Nephilim there—the Anakites are part of the Nephilim—and we looked like grasshoppers to ourselves, and so we must have looked to them.”
Transliteration: vesham raiynu et-hanefiyliym veney anak min-hanefiliym vanehiy veeyneynu khachagaviym vekhen hayiynu veeyneyhem

Hebrew: וַתִּשָּׂא֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה וַֽיִּתְּנ֖וּ אֶת־קוֹלָ֑ם וַיִּבְכּ֥וּ הָעָ֖ם בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הַהֽוּא׃
Translated: The whole community broke into loud cries, and the people wept that night.
Transliteration: vatisha khׇl-haedah vayitenu et-kvolam vayivekhu haam valayelah hahu

Hebrew: וַיִּלֹּ֙נוּ֙ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן כֹּ֖ל בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֲלֵהֶ֜ם כׇּל־הָעֵדָ֗ה לוּ־מַ֙תְנוּ֙ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם א֛וֹ בַּמִּדְבָּ֥ר הַזֶּ֖ה לוּ־מָֽתְנוּ׃
Translated: All the Israelites railed against Moses and Aaron. “If only we had died in the land of Egypt,” the whole community shouted at them, “or if only we might die in this wilderness!”
Transliteration: vayilonu al-mosheh veal-aharon khol veney yisherael vayomeru alehem khׇl-haedah lu-matenu veerets mitserayiim vo vamidevar hazeh lu-matenu

Hebrew: וְלָמָ֣ה יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה מֵבִ֨יא אֹתָ֜נוּ אֶל־הָאָ֤רֶץ הַזֹּאת֙ לִנְפֹּ֣ל בַּחֶ֔רֶב נָשֵׁ֥ינוּ וְטַפֵּ֖נוּ יִהְי֣וּ לָבַ֑ז הֲל֧וֹא ט֦וֹב לָ֖נוּ שׁ֥וּב מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
Translated: “Why is יהוה taking us to that land to fall by the sword?” “Our wives and children will be carried off!” “It would be better for us to go back to Egypt!”
Transliteration: velamah yehovah meviy otanu el-haarets hazot linefol vacherev nasheynu vetafenu yiheyu lavaz halvo tvov lanu shuv mitserayemah

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ אִ֣ישׁ אֶל־אָחִ֑יו נִתְּנָ֥ה רֹ֖אשׁ וְנָשׁ֥וּבָה מִצְרָֽיְמָה׃
Translated: And they said to one another, “Let us head back for Egypt.”
Transliteration: vayomeru iysh el-achiyv nitenah rosh venashuvah mitserayemah

Hebrew: וַיִּפֹּ֥ל מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם לִפְנֵ֕י כׇּל־קְהַ֥ל עֲדַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then Moses and Aaron fell on their faces before all the assembled congregation of Israelites.
Transliteration: vayifol mosheh veaharon al-feneyhem lifeney khׇl-kehal adat veney yisherael

Hebrew: וִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן וְכָלֵב֙ בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֔ה מִן־הַתָּרִ֖ים אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ קָרְע֖וּ בִּגְדֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, of those who had scouted the land, rent their clothes
Transliteration: viyhvoshua vin-nun vekhalev ven-yefuneh min-hatariym et-haarets kareu vigedeyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֶל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָבַ֤רְנוּ בָהּ֙ לָת֣וּר אֹתָ֔הּ טוֹבָ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ מְאֹ֥ד מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: and exhorted the whole Israelite community: “The land that we traversed and scouted is an exceedingly good land.
Transliteration: vayomeru el-khׇl-adat veney-yisherael lemor haarets asher avarenu vah latur otah tvovah haarets meod meod

Hebrew: אִם־חָפֵ֥ץ בָּ֙נוּ֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהֵבִ֤יא אֹתָ֙נוּ֙ אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֔את וּנְתָנָ֖הּ לָ֑נוּ אֶ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־הִ֛וא זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: If pleased with us, יהוה will bring us into that land, a land that flows with milk and honey, and give it to us;
Transliteration: im-chafets vanu yehovah veheviy otanu el-haarets hazot unetanah lanu erets asher-hiv zavat chalav udevash

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ בַּיהֹוָה֮ אַל־תִּמְרֹ֒דוּ֒ וְאַתֶּ֗ם אַל־תִּֽירְאוּ֙ אֶת־עַ֣ם הָאָ֔רֶץ כִּ֥י לַחְמֵ֖נוּ הֵ֑ם סָ֣ר צִלָּ֧ם מֵעֲלֵיהֶ֛ם וַֽיהֹוָ֥ה אִתָּ֖נוּ אַל־תִּירָאֻֽם׃
Translated: only you must not rebel against יהוה. Have no fear then of the people of the country, for they are our prey: their protection has departed from them, but יהוה is with us. Have no fear of them!”
Transliteration: akhe vayhovah al-timerodu veatem al-tiyreu et-am haarets khiy lachemenu hem sar tsilam mealeyhem vayhovah itanu al-tiyraum

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה לִרְגּ֥וֹם אֹתָ֖ם בָּאֲבָנִ֑ים וּכְב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֗ה נִרְאָה֙ בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד אֶֽל־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: As the whole community threatened to pelt them with stones, the Presence of יהוה appeared in the Tent of Meeting to all the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayomeru khׇl-haedah liregvom otam vaavaniym ukhevvod yehovah nireah veohel mvoed el-khׇl-veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַד־אָ֥נָה יְנַאֲצֻ֖נִי הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה וְעַד־אָ֙נָה֙ לֹא־יַאֲמִ֣ינוּ בִ֔י בְּכֹל֙ הָֽאֹת֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי בְּקִרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses, “How long will this people spurn Me, and how long will they have no faith in Me despite all the signs that I have performed in their midst?
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh ad-anah yenaatsuniy haam hazeh vead-anah lo-yaamiynu viy vekhol haotvot asher ashiytiy vekirevvo

Hebrew: אַכֶּ֥נּוּ בַדֶּ֖בֶר וְאוֹרִשֶׁ֑נּוּ וְאֶֽעֱשֶׂה֙ אֹֽתְךָ֔ לְגוֹי־גָּד֥וֹל וְעָצ֖וּם מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: I will strike them with pestilence and disown them, and I will make of you a nation far more numerous than they!”
Transliteration: akhenu vadever vevorishenu veeesheh otekha legvoy-gadvol veatsum mimenu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְשָׁמְע֣וּ מִצְרַ֔יִם כִּֽי־הֶעֱלִ֧יתָ בְכֹחֲךָ֛ אֶת־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה מִקִּרְבּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But Moses said to יהוה, “When the Egyptians, from whose midst You brought up this people in Your might, hear the news,
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-yehovah veshameu mitserayiim khiy-heeliyta vekhochakha et-haam hazeh mikirevvo

Hebrew: וְאָמְר֗וּ אֶל־יוֹשֵׁב֮ הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּאת֒ שָֽׁמְעוּ֙ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּקֶ֖רֶב הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־עַ֨יִן בְּעַ֜יִן נִרְאָ֣ה ׀ אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה וַעֲנָֽנְךָ֙ עֹמֵ֣ד עֲלֵהֶ֔ם וּבְעַמֻּ֣ד עָנָ֗ן אַתָּ֨ה הֹלֵ֤ךְ לִפְנֵיהֶם֙ יוֹמָ֔ם וּבְעַמּ֥וּד אֵ֖שׁ לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: they will tell it to the inhabitants of that land. Now they have heard that You, יהוה, are in the midst of this people; that You, יהוה, appear in plain sight when Your cloud rests over them and when You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and in a pillar of fire by night.
Transliteration: veameru el-yvoshev haarets hazot shameu khiy-atah yehovah vekerev haam hazeh asher-ayiin veayiin nireah atah yehovah vaananekha omed alehem uveamud anan atah holekhe lifeneyhem yvomam uveamud esh layelah

Hebrew: וְהֵמַתָּ֛ה אֶת־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה כְּאִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֑ד וְאָֽמְרוּ֙ הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמְע֥וּ אֶֽת־שִׁמְעֲךָ֖ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: If then You slay this people wholesale, the nations who have heard Your fame will say,
Transliteration: vehematah et-haam hazeh kheiysh echad veameru hagvoyim asher-shameu et-shimeakha lemor

Hebrew: מִבִּלְתִּ֞י יְכֹ֣לֶת יְהֹוָ֗ה לְהָבִיא֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֣ע לָהֶ֑ם וַיִּשְׁחָטֵ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: ‘It must be because יהוה was powerless to bring that people into the land promised them on oath that [that god] slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
Transliteration: miviletiy yekholet yehovah lehaviy et-haam hazeh el-haarets asher-nisheva lahem vayishechatem vamidevar

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה <big>יִ</big>גְדַּל־נָ֖א כֹּ֣חַ אֲדֹנָ֑י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתָּ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Therefore, I pray, let my Lord’s forbearance be great, as You have declared, saying,
Transliteration: veatah <big>yi</big>gedal-na khocha adonay khaasher divareta lemor

Hebrew: יְהֹוָ֗ה אֶ֤רֶךְ אַפַּ֙יִם֙ וְרַב־חֶ֔סֶד נֹשֵׂ֥א עָוֺ֖ן וָפָ֑שַׁע וְנַקֵּה֙ לֹ֣א יְנַקֶּ֔ה פֹּקֵ֞ד עֲוֺ֤ן אָבוֹת֙ עַל־בָּנִ֔ים עַל־שִׁלֵּשִׁ֖ים וְעַל־רִבֵּעִֽים׃
Translated: ‘יהוה ! slow to anger and abounding in kindness; forgiving iniquity and transgression; yet not remitting all punishment, but visiting the iniquity of parents upon children, upon the third and fourth generations.’
Transliteration: yehovah erekhe afayiim verav-chesed noshe avon vafasha venakeh lo yenakeh foked avon avvot al-vaniym al-shileshiym veal-riveiym

Hebrew: סְלַֽח־נָ֗א לַעֲוֺ֛ן הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֖ה כְּגֹ֣דֶל חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתָה֙ לָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם וְעַד־הֵֽנָּה׃
Translated: Pardon, I pray, the iniquity of this people according to Your great kindness, as You have forgiven this people ever since Egypt.”
Transliteration: selach-na laavon haam hazeh khegodel chasedekha vekhaasher nashatah laam hazeh mimitserayiim vead-henah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה סָלַ֖חְתִּי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
Translated: And יהוה said, “I pardon, as you have asked.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah salachetiy khidevarekha

Hebrew: וְאוּלָ֖ם חַי־אָ֑נִי וְיִמָּלֵ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Nevertheless, as I live and as יהוה’s Presence fills the whole world,
Transliteration: veulam chay-aniy veyimale khevvod-yehovah et-khׇl-haarets

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כׇל־הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים הָרֹאִ֤ים אֶת־כְּבֹדִי֙ וְאֶת־אֹ֣תֹתַ֔י אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֥יתִי בְמִצְרַ֖יִם וּבַמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיְנַסּ֣וּ אֹתִ֗י זֶ֚ה עֶ֣שֶׂר פְּעָמִ֔ים וְלֹ֥א שָׁמְע֖וּ בְּקוֹלִֽי׃
Translated: none of those involved—who have seen My Presence and the signs that I have performed in Egypt and in the wilderness, and who have tried Me these many times and have disobeyed Me—
Transliteration: khiy khׇl-haanashiym haroiym et-khevodiy veet-ototay asher-ashiytiy vemitserayiim uvamidevar vayenasu otiy zeh esher feamiym velo shameu vekvoliy

Hebrew: אִם־יִרְאוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖עְתִּי לַאֲבֹתָ֑ם וְכׇל־מְנַאֲצַ֖י לֹ֥א יִרְאֽוּהָ׃
Translated: shall see the land that I promised on oath to their fathers; none of those who spurn Me shall see it.
Transliteration: im-yireu et-haarets asher nishevaetiy laavotam vekhׇl-menaatsay lo yireuha

Hebrew: וְעַבְדִּ֣י כָלֵ֗ב עֵ֣קֶב הָֽיְתָ֞ה ר֤וּחַ אַחֶ֙רֶת֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וַיְמַלֵּ֖א אַחֲרָ֑י וַהֲבִֽיאֹתִ֗יו אֶל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣א שָׁ֔מָּה וְזַרְע֖וֹ יוֹרִשֶֽׁנָּה׃
Translated: But My servant Caleb, because he was imbued with a different spirit and remained loyal to Me—him will I bring into the land that he entered, and his offspring shall hold it as a possession.
Transliteration: veavediy khalev ekev hayetah rucha acheret imvo vayemale acharay vahaviyotiyv el-haarets asher-va shamah vezarevo yvorishenah

Hebrew: וְהָעֲמָלֵקִ֥י וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּעֵ֑מֶק מָחָ֗ר פְּנ֨וּ וּסְע֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר דֶּ֥רֶךְ יַם־סֽוּף׃ {פ}
Translated: Now the Amalekites and the Canaanites occupy the valleys. Start out, then, tomorrow and march into the wilderness by way of the Sea of Reeds.”
Transliteration: vehaamalekiy vehakhenaaniy yvoshev vaemek machar fenu useu lakhem hamidevar derekhe yam-suf {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke further to Moses and Aaron,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֗י לָעֵדָ֤ה הָֽרָעָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥מָּה מַלִּינִ֖ים עָלָ֑י אֶת־תְּלֻנּ֞וֹת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֵ֧מָּה מַלִּינִ֛ים עָלַ֖י שָׁמָֽעְתִּי׃
Translated: “How much longer shall that wicked community keep muttering against Me? Very well, I have heeded the incessant muttering of the Israelites against Me.
Transliteration: ad-matay laedah haraah hazot asher hemah maliyniym alay et-telunvot veney yisherael asher hemah maliyniym alay shamaetiy

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֣ר אֲלֵהֶ֗ם חַי־אָ֙נִי֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה אִם־לֹ֕א כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּרְתֶּ֖ם בְּאׇזְנָ֑י כֵּ֖ן אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Say to them: ‘As I live,’ says יהוה, ‘I will do to you just as you have urged Me.
Transliteration: emor alehem chay-aniy neum-yehovah im-lo khaasher divaretem veׇzenay khen eesheh lakhem

Hebrew: בַּמִּדְבָּ֣ר הַ֠זֶּ֠ה יִפְּל֨וּ פִגְרֵיכֶ֜ם וְכׇל־פְּקֻדֵיכֶם֙ לְכׇל־מִסְפַּרְכֶ֔ם מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֲלִֽינֹתֶ֖ם עָלָֽי׃
Translated: In this very wilderness shall your carcasses drop. Of all of you [men] who were recorded in your various lists from the age of twenty years up, you who have muttered against Me,
Transliteration: vamidevar hazeh yifelu figereykhem vekhׇl-fekudeykhem lekhׇl-misefarekhem miven esheriym shanah vamaelah asher haliynotem alay

Hebrew: אִם־אַתֶּם֙ תָּבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר נָשָׂ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־יָדִ֔י לְשַׁכֵּ֥ן אֶתְכֶ֖ם בָּ֑הּ כִּ֚י אִם־כָּלֵ֣ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֔ה וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃
Translated: not one shall enter the land in which I swore to settle you—save Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
Transliteration: im-atem tavou el-haarets asher nashatiy et-yadiy leshakhen etekhem vah khiy im-khalev ven-yefuneh viyhvoshua vin-nun

Hebrew: וְטַ֨פְּכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲמַרְתֶּ֖ם לָבַ֣ז יִהְיֶ֑ה וְהֵבֵיאתִ֣י אֹתָ֔ם וְיָֽדְעוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר מְאַסְתֶּ֖ם בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Your children who, you said, would be carried off—these will I allow to enter; they shall know the land that you have rejected.
Transliteration: vetafekhem asher amaretem lavaz yiheyeh veheveytiy otam veyadeu et-haarets asher measetem vah

Hebrew: וּפִגְרֵיכֶ֖ם אַתֶּ֑ם יִפְּל֖וּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: But your carcasses shall drop in this wilderness,
Transliteration: ufigereykhem atem yifelu vamidevar hazeh

Hebrew: וּ֠בְנֵיכֶ֠ם יִהְי֨וּ רֹעִ֤ים בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה וְנָשְׂא֖וּ אֶת־זְנוּתֵיכֶ֑ם עַד־תֹּ֥ם פִּגְרֵיכֶ֖ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: while your children roam the wilderness for forty years, suffering for your faithlessness, until the last of your carcasses is down in the wilderness.
Transliteration: uveneykhem yiheyu roiym vamidevar arevaiym shanah venasheu et-zenuteykhem ad-tom figereykhem vamidevar

Hebrew: בְּמִסְפַּ֨ר הַיָּמִ֜ים אֲשֶׁר־תַּרְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־הָאָ֘רֶץ֮ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים יוֹם֒ י֣וֹם לַשָּׁנָ֞ה י֣וֹם לַשָּׁנָ֗ה תִּשְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־עֲוֺנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה וִֽידַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־תְּנוּאָתִֽי׃
Translated: You shall bear your punishment for forty years, corresponding to the number of days—forty days—that you scouted the land: a year for each day. Thus you shall know what it means to thwart Me.
Transliteration: vemisefar hayamiym asher-taretem et-haarets arevaiym yvom yvom lashanah yvom lashanah tisheu et-avonoteykhem arevaiym shanah viydaetem et-tenuatiy

Hebrew: אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָה֮ דִּבַּ֒רְתִּי֒ אִם־לֹ֣א ׀ זֹ֣את אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֗ה לְכׇל־הָעֵדָ֤ה הָֽרָעָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את הַנּוֹעָדִ֖ים עָלָ֑י בַּמִּדְבָּ֥ר הַזֶּ֛ה יִתַּ֖מּוּ וְשָׁ֥ם יָמֻֽתוּ׃
Translated: I יהוה have spoken: Thus will I do to all that wicked band that has banded together against Me: in this very wilderness they shall die and so be finished off.’”
Transliteration: aniy yehovah divaretiy im-lo zot eesheh lekhׇl-haedah haraah hazot hanvoadiym alay vamidevar hazeh yitamu vesham yamutu

Hebrew: וְהָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֖ה לָת֣וּר אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַיָּשֻׁ֗בוּ (וילונו) [וַיַּלִּ֤ינוּ] עָלָיו֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה לְהוֹצִ֥יא דִבָּ֖ה עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: As for the agents whom Moses sent to scout the land, those who came back and caused the whole community to mutter against him by spreading calumnies about the land—
Transliteration: vehaanashiym asher-shalach mosheh latur et-haarets vayashuvu (vylvnv) [vayaliynu] alayv et-khׇl-haedah lehvotsiy divah al-haarets

Hebrew: וַיָּמֻ֙תוּ֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים מוֹצִאֵ֥י דִבַּת־הָאָ֖רֶץ רָעָ֑ה בַּמַּגֵּפָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: those who spread such calumnies about the land died of plague, by the will of יהוה.
Transliteration: vayamutu haanashiym mvotsiey divat-haarets raah vamagefah lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֔וּן וְכָלֵ֖ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֑ה חָיוּ֙ מִן־הָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים הָהֵ֔ם הַהֹלְכִ֖ים לָת֥וּר אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Of those involved in going to scout the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh survived.
Transliteration: viyhvoshua vin-nun vekhalev ven-yefuneh chayu min-haanashiym hahem haholekhiym latur et-haarets

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֶֽל־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּֽתְאַבְּל֥וּ הָעָ֖ם מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: When Moses repeated these words to all the Israelites, the people were overcome by grief.
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh et-hadevariym haeleh el-khׇl-veney yisherael vayiteavelu haam meod

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכִּ֣מוּ בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיַּֽעֲל֥וּ אֶל־רֹאשׁ־הָהָ֖ר לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֶּ֗נּוּ וְעָלִ֛ינוּ אֶל־הַמָּק֛וֹם אֲשֶׁר־אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה כִּ֥י חָטָֽאנוּ׃
Translated: Early next morning [their fighting force] set out toward the crest of the hill country, saying, “We are prepared to go up to the place that יהוה has spoken of, for we were wrong.”
Transliteration: vayashekhimu vavoker vayaalu el-rosh-hahar lemor hinenu vealiynu el-hamakvom asher-amar yehovah khiy chatanu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה לָ֥מָּה זֶּ֛ה אַתֶּ֥ם עֹבְרִ֖ים אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהִ֖וא לֹ֥א תִצְלָֽח׃
Translated: But Moses said, “Why do you transgress יהוה’s command? This will not succeed.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh lamah zeh atem overiym et-fiy yehovah vehiv lo titselach

Hebrew: אַֽל־תַּעֲל֔וּ כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וְלֹא֙ תִּנָּ֣גְפ֔וּ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹיְבֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Do not go up, lest you be routed by your enemies, for יהוה is not in your midst.
Transliteration: al-taalu khiy eyn yehovah vekirevekhem velo tinagefu lifeney oyeveykhem

Hebrew: כִּי֩ הָעֲמָלֵקִ֨י וְהַכְּנַעֲנִ֥י שָׁם֙ לִפְנֵיכֶ֔ם וּנְפַלְתֶּ֖ם בֶּחָ֑רֶב כִּֽי־עַל־כֵּ֤ן שַׁבְתֶּם֙ מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: For the Amalekites and the Canaanites will be there to face you, and you will fall by the sword, inasmuch as you have turned from following יהוה and יהוה will not be with you.”
Transliteration: khiy haamalekiy vehakhenaaniy sham lifeneykhem unefaletem vecharev khiy-al-khen shavetem meacharey yehovah velo-yiheyeh yehovah imakhem

Hebrew: וַיַּעְפִּ֕לוּ לַעֲל֖וֹת אֶל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר וַאֲר֤וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָה֙ וּמֹשֶׁ֔ה לֹא־מָ֖שׁוּ מִקֶּ֥רֶב הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: Yet defiantly they marched toward the crest of the hill country, though neither יהוה’s Ark of the Covenant nor Moses stirred from the camp.
Transliteration: vayaefilu laalvot el-rosh hahar vaarvon veriyt-yehovah umosheh lo-mashu mikerev hamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רֶד הָעֲמָלֵקִי֙ וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י הַיֹּשֵׁ֖ב בָּהָ֣ר הַה֑וּא וַיַּכּ֥וּם וַֽיַּכְּת֖וּם עַד־הַֽחׇרְמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And the Amalekites and the Canaanites who dwelt in that hill country came down and dealt them a shattering blow at Hormah.
Transliteration: vayered haamalekiy vehakhenaaniy hayoshev vahar hahu vayakhum vayakhetum ad-hachׇremah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כִּ֣י תָבֹ֗אוּ אֶל־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ מוֹשְׁבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land that I am giving you to settle in,
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem khiy tavou el-erets mvoshevoteykhem asher aniy noten lakhem

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֨ם אִשֶּׁ֤ה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ עֹלָ֣ה אוֹ־זֶ֔בַח לְפַלֵּא־נֶ֙דֶר֙ א֣וֹ בִנְדָבָ֔ה א֖וֹ בְּמֹעֲדֵיכֶ֑ם לַעֲשׂ֞וֹת רֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה מִן־הַבָּקָ֖ר א֥וֹ מִן־הַצֹּֽאן׃
Translated: and would present an offering by fire to יהוה from the herd or from the flock, be it burnt offering or sacrifice, in fulfillment of a vow explicitly uttered, or as a freewill offering, or at your fixed occasions, producing an odor pleasing to יהוה:
Transliteration: vaashiytem isheh layhovah olah vo-zevach lefale-neder vo vinedavah vo vemoadeykhem laashvot reycha niychocha layhovah min-havakar vo min-hatson

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֛יב הַמַּקְרִ֥יב קׇרְבָּנ֖וֹ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה מִנְחָה֙ סֹ֣לֶת עִשָּׂר֔וֹן בָּל֕וּל בִּרְבִעִ֥ית הַהִ֖ין שָֽׁמֶן׃
Translated: The person who presents the offering to יהוה shall bring as a meal offering: a tenth of a measure of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of oil mixed in.
Transliteration: vehikeriyv hamakeriyv kׇrevanvo layhovah minechah solet isharvon valul vireviiyt hahiyn shamen

Hebrew: וְיַ֤יִן לַנֶּ֙סֶךְ֙ רְבִיעִ֣ית הַהִ֔ין תַּעֲשֶׂ֥ה עַל־הָעֹלָ֖ה א֣וֹ לַזָּ֑בַח לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: You shall also offer, with the burnt offering or the sacrifice, a quarter of a hin of wine as a libation for each sheep.
Transliteration: veyayiin lanesekhe reviyiyt hahiyn taasheh al-haolah vo lazavach lakhevesh haechad

Hebrew: א֤וֹ לָאַ֙יִל֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה מִנְחָ֔ה סֹ֖לֶת שְׁנֵ֣י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֑ים בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן שְׁלִשִׁ֥ית הַהִֽין׃
Translated: In the case of a ram, you shall present as a meal offering: two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with a third of a hin of oil mixed in;
Transliteration: vo laayiil taasheh minechah solet sheney esheroniym velulah vashemen shelishiyt hahiyn

Hebrew: וְיַ֥יִן לַנֶּ֖סֶךְ שְׁלִשִׁ֣ית הַהִ֑ין תַּקְרִ֥יב רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and a third of a hin of wine as a libation—as an offering of pleasing odor to יהוה.
Transliteration: veyayiin lanesekhe shelishiyt hahiyn takeriyv reycha-niychocha layhovah

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־תַעֲשֶׂ֥ה בֶן־בָּקָ֖ר עֹלָ֣ה אוֹ־זָ֑בַח לְפַלֵּא־נֶ֥דֶר אֽוֹ־שְׁלָמִ֖ים לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And if it is an animal from the herd that you offer to יהוה as a burnt offering or as a sacrifice, in fulfillment of a vow explicitly uttered or as an offering of well-being,
Transliteration: vekhiy-taasheh ven-vakar olah vo-zavach lefale-neder vo-shelamiym layhovah

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִ֤יב עַל־בֶּן־הַבָּקָר֙ מִנְחָ֔ה סֹ֖לֶת שְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֑ים בָּל֥וּל בַּשֶּׁ֖מֶן חֲצִ֥י הַהִֽין׃
Translated: there shall be offered a meal offering along with the animal: three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with half a hin of oil mixed in;
Transliteration: vehikeriyv al-ven-havakar minechah solet sheloshah esheroniym valul vashemen chatsiy hahiyn

Hebrew: וְיַ֛יִן תַּקְרִ֥יב לַנֶּ֖סֶךְ חֲצִ֣י הַהִ֑ין אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and as libation you shall offer half a hin of wine—these being offerings by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה.
Transliteration: veyayiin takeriyv lanesekhe chatsiy hahiyn isheh reycha-niychocha layhovah

Hebrew: כָּ֣כָה יֵעָשֶׂ֗ה לַשּׁוֹר֙ הָֽאֶחָ֔ד א֖וֹ לָאַ֣יִל הָאֶחָ֑ד אֽוֹ־לַשֶּׂ֥ה בַכְּבָשִׂ֖ים א֥וֹ בָעִזִּֽים׃
Translated: Thus shall be done with each ox, with each ram, and with any sheep or goat,
Transliteration: khakhah eiasheh lashvor haechad vo laayiil haechad vo-lasheh vakhevashiym vo vaiziym

Hebrew: כַּמִּסְפָּ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ כָּ֛כָה תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לָאֶחָ֖ד כְּמִסְפָּרָֽם׃
Translated: as many as you offer; you shall do thus with each one, as many as there are.
Transliteration: khamisefar asher taashu khakhah taashu laechad khemisefaram

Hebrew: כׇּל־הָאֶזְרָ֥ח יַעֲשֶׂה־כָּ֖כָה אֶת־אֵ֑לֶּה לְהַקְרִ֛יב אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Every citizen, when presenting an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה, shall do so with them.
Transliteration: khׇl-haezerach yaasheh-khakhah et-eleh lehakeriyv isheh reycha-niychocha layhovah

Hebrew: וְכִֽי־יָגוּר֩ אִתְּכֶ֨ם גֵּ֜ר א֤וֹ אֲשֶׁר־בְּתֽוֹכְכֶם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וְעָשָׂ֛ה אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּעֲשׂ֖וּ כֵּ֥ן יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: And when, throughout the ages, a stranger who has taken up residence with you, or one who lives among you, would present an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה —as you do, so shall it be done by
Transliteration: vekhiy-yagur itekhem ger vo asher-vetvokhekhem ledoroteykhem veashah isheh reycha-niychocha layhovah khaasher taashu khen yaasheh

Hebrew: הַקָּהָ֕ל חֻקָּ֥ה אַחַ֛ת לָכֶ֖ם וְלַגֵּ֣ר הַגָּ֑ר חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם כָּכֶ֛ם כַּגֵּ֥ר יִהְיֶ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: the rest of the congregation. There shall be one law for you and for the resident stranger; it shall be a law for all time throughout the ages. You and the stranger shall be alike before יהוה;
Transliteration: hakahal chukah achat lakhem velager hagar chukat volam ledoroteykhem khakhem khager yiheyeh lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: תּוֹרָ֥ה אַחַ֛ת וּמִשְׁפָּ֥ט אֶחָ֖ד יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֥ר אִתְּכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: the same ritual and the same rule shall apply to you and to the stranger who resides among you.
Transliteration: tvorah achat umishefat echad yiheyeh lakhem velager hagar itekhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם בְּבֹֽאֲכֶם֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֛י מֵבִ֥יא אֶתְכֶ֖ם שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land to which I am taking you
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem vevoakhem el-haarets asher aniy meviy etekhem shamah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֕ה בַּאֲכׇלְכֶ֖ם מִלֶּ֣חֶם הָאָ֑רֶץ תָּרִ֥ימוּ תְרוּמָ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and you eat of the bread of the land, you shall set some aside as a gift to יהוה:
Transliteration: vehayah vaakhׇlekhem milechem haarets tariymu terumah layhovah

Hebrew: רֵאשִׁית֙ עֲרִסֹ֣תֵכֶ֔ם חַלָּ֖ה תָּרִ֣ימוּ תְרוּמָ֑ה כִּתְרוּמַ֣ת גֹּ֔רֶן כֵּ֖ן תָּרִ֥ימוּ אֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: as the first yield of your baking, you shall set aside a loaf as a gift; you shall set it aside as a gift like the gift from the threshing floor.
Transliteration: reshiyt arisotekhem chalah tariymu terumah khiterumat goren khen tariymu otah

Hebrew: מֵרֵאשִׁית֙ עֲרִסֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תִּתְּנ֥וּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה תְּרוּמָ֑ה לְדֹרֹ֖תֵיכֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall make a gift to יהוה from the first yield of your baking, throughout the ages.
Transliteration: mereshiyt arisoteykhem titenu layhovah terumah ledoroteykhem {s}

Hebrew: וְכִ֣י תִשְׁגּ֔וּ וְלֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֔וּ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַמִּצְוֺ֖ת הָאֵ֑לֶּה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: If you unwittingly fail to observe any one of the commandments that יהוה has declared to Moses—
Transliteration: vekhiy tishegu velo taashu et khׇl-hamitsevot haeleh asher-diver yehovah el-mosheh

Hebrew: אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֑ה מִן־הַיּ֞וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה וָהָ֖לְאָה לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: anything that יהוה has enjoined upon you through Moses—from the day that יהוה gave the commandment and on through the ages:
Transliteration: et khׇl-asher tsivah yehovah aleykhem veyad-mosheh min-hayyvom asher tsivah yehovah vahaleah ledoroteykhem

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִ֣ם מֵעֵינֵ֣י הָעֵדָה֮ נֶעֶשְׂתָ֣ה לִשְׁגָגָה֒ וְעָשׂ֣וּ כׇל־הָעֵדָ֡ה פַּ֣ר בֶּן־בָּקָר֩ אֶחָ֨ד לְעֹלָ֜ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וּמִנְחָת֥וֹ וְנִסְכּ֖וֹ כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד לְחַטָּֽת׃
Translated: If this was done unwittingly, through the inadvertence of the community, the community leaders shall present one bull of the herd as a burnt offering of pleasing odor to יהוה, with its proper meal offering and libation, and one he-goat as a sin offering.
Transliteration: vehayah im meeyney haedah neeshetah lishegagah veashu khׇl-haedah far ven-vakar echad leolah lereycha niychocha layhovah uminechatvo venisekhvo khamishefat usheiyr-iziym echad lechatat

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֗ן עַֽל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְנִסְלַ֣ח לָהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־שְׁגָגָ֣ה הִ֔וא וְהֵם֩ הֵבִ֨יאוּ אֶת־קׇרְבָּנָ֜ם אִשֶּׁ֣ה לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה וְחַטָּאתָ֛ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־שִׁגְגָתָֽם׃
Translated: The priest shall make expiation for the whole Israelite community and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and for their error they have brought their offering, an offering by fire to יהוה and their sin offering before יהוה.
Transliteration: vekhifer hakhohen al-khׇl-adat veney yisherael veniselach lahem khiy-shegagah hiv vehem heviyu et-kׇrevanam isheh layhovah vechatatam lifeney yehovah al-shigegatam

Hebrew: וְנִסְלַ֗ח לְכׇל־עֲדַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֑ם כִּ֥י לְכׇל־הָעָ֖ם בִּשְׁגָגָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The whole Israelite community and the stranger residing among them shall be forgiven, for it happened to the entire people through error.
Transliteration: veniselach lekhׇl-adat veney yisherael velager hagar vetvokham khiy lekhׇl-haam vishegagah {s}

Hebrew: וְאִם־נֶ֥פֶשׁ אַחַ֖ת תֶּחֱטָ֣א בִשְׁגָגָ֑ה וְהִקְרִ֛יבָה עֵ֥ז בַּת־שְׁנָתָ֖הּ לְחַטָּֽאת׃
Translated: In case it is an individual who has sinned unwittingly, that person shall offer a she-goat in its first year as a sin offering.
Transliteration: veim-nefesh achat techeta vishegagah vehikeriyvah ez vat-shenatah lechatat

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֗ן עַל־הַנֶּ֧פֶשׁ הַשֹּׁגֶ֛גֶת בְּחֶטְאָ֥הֿ בִשְׁגָגָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה לְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָ֖יו וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃
Translated: The priest shall make expiation before יהוה on behalf of the person who erred, for having sinned unwittingly, making such expiation that the person may be forgiven.
Transliteration: vekhifer hakhohen al-hanefesh hashogeget vecheteahֿ vishegagah lifeney yehovah lekhafer alayv veniselach lvo

Hebrew: הָֽאֶזְרָח֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלַגֵּ֖ר הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֑ם תּוֹרָ֤ה אַחַת֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם לָעֹשֶׂ֖ה בִּשְׁגָגָֽה׃
Translated: For the citizen among the Israelites and for the stranger who resides among them—you shall have one ritual for anyone who acts in error.
Transliteration: haezerach viveney yisherael velager hagar vetvokham tvorah achat yiheyeh lakhem laosheh vishegagah

Hebrew: וְהַנֶּ֜פֶשׁ אֲשֶֽׁר־תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה ׀ בְּיָ֣ד רָמָ֗ה מִן־הָֽאֶזְרָח֙ וּמִן־הַגֵּ֔ר אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֣וּא מְגַדֵּ֑ף וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִקֶּ֥רֶב עַמָּֽהּ׃
Translated: But the person, whether citizen or stranger, who acts defiantly reviles יהוה; that person shall be cut off from among the people.
Transliteration: vehanefesh asher-taasheh veyad ramah min-haezerach umin-hager et-yehovah hu megadef venikheretah hanefesh hahiv mikerev amah

Hebrew: כִּ֤י דְבַר־יְהֹוָה֙ בָּזָ֔ה וְאֶת־מִצְוָת֖וֹ הֵפַ֑ר הִכָּרֵ֧ת ׀ תִּכָּרֵ֛ת הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא עֲוֺנָ֥הֿ בָֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Because it was the word of יהוה that was spurned and [God’s] commandment that was violated, that person shall be cut off—and bears the guilt.
Transliteration: khiy devar-yehovah vazah veet-mitsevatvo hefar hikharet tikharet hanefesh hahiv avonahֿ vah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַֽיִּמְצְא֗וּ אִ֛ישׁ מְקֹשֵׁ֥שׁ עֵצִ֖ים בְּי֥וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃
Translated: Once, when the Israelites were in the wilderness, they came upon a man gathering wood on the sabbath day.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-yisherael vamidevar vayimetseu iysh mekoshesh etsiym veyvom hashavat

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרִ֣יבוּ אֹת֔וֹ הַמֹּצְאִ֥ים אֹת֖וֹ מְקֹשֵׁ֣שׁ עֵצִ֑ים אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְאֶ֖ל כׇּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: Those who found him as he was gathering wood brought him before Moses, Aaron, and the community leadership.
Transliteration: vayakeriyvu otvo hamotseiym otvo mekoshesh etsiym el-mosheh veel-aharon veel khׇl-haedah

Hebrew: וַיַּנִּ֥יחוּ אֹת֖וֹ בַּמִּשְׁמָ֑ר כִּ֚י לֹ֣א פֹרַ֔שׁ מַה־יֵּעָשֶׂ֖ה לֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: He was placed in custody, for it had not been specified what should be done to him.
Transliteration: vayaniychu otvo vamishemar khiy lo forash mah-yeasheh lvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה מ֥וֹת יוּמַ֖ת הָאִ֑ישׁ רָג֨וֹם אֹת֤וֹ בָֽאֲבָנִים֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “The party in question shall be put to death: the community leadership shall pelt him with stones outside the camp.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh mvot yumat haiysh ragvom otvo vaavaniym khׇl-haedah michuts lamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיֹּצִ֨יאוּ אֹת֜וֹ כׇּל־הָעֵדָ֗ה אֶל־מִחוּץ֙ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיִּרְגְּמ֥וּ אֹת֛וֹ בָּאֲבָנִ֖ים וַיָּמֹ֑ת כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: So the community leadership took him outside the camp and stoned him to death—as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayotsiyu otvo khׇl-haedah el-michuts lamachaneh vayiregemu otvo vaavaniym vayamot khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses as follows:
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם וְעָשׂ֨וּ לָהֶ֥ם צִיצִ֛ת עַל־כַּנְפֵ֥י בִגְדֵיהֶ֖ם לְדֹרֹתָ֑ם וְנָ֥תְנ֛וּ עַל־צִיצִ֥ת הַכָּנָ֖ף פְּתִ֥יל תְּכֵֽלֶת׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and instruct them to make for themselves fringes on the corners of their garments throughout the ages; let them attach a cord of blue to the fringe at each corner.
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem veashu lahem tsiytsit al-khanefey vigedeyhem ledorotam venatenu al-tsiytsit hakhanaf fetiyl tekhelet

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה לָכֶם֮ לְצִיצִת֒ וּרְאִיתֶ֣ם אֹת֗וֹ וּזְכַרְתֶּם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֹתָ֑ם וְלֹֽא־תָת֜וּרוּ אַחֲרֵ֤י לְבַבְכֶם֙ וְאַחֲרֵ֣י עֵֽינֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־אַתֶּ֥ם זֹנִ֖ים אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: That shall be your fringe; look at it and recall all the commandments of יהוה and observe them, so that you do not follow your heart and eyes in your lustful urge.
Transliteration: vehayah lakhem letsiytsit ureiytem otvo uzekharetem et-khׇl-mitsevot yehovah vaashiytem otam velo-taturu acharey levavekhem veacharey eyneykhem asher-atem zoniym achareyhem

Hebrew: לְמַ֣עַן תִּזְכְּר֔וּ וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם אֶת־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתָ֑י וִהְיִיתֶ֥ם קְדֹשִׁ֖ים לֵאלֹֽהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Thus you shall be reminded to observe all My commandments and to be holy to your God.
Transliteration: lemaan tizekheru vaashiytem et-khׇl-mitsevotay viheyiytem kedoshiym leloheykhem

Hebrew: אֲנִ֞י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר הוֹצֵ֤אתִי אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם לִהְי֥וֹת לָכֶ֖ם לֵאלֹהִ֑ים אֲנִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: I יהוה am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God: I, your God יהוה.
Transliteration: aniy yehovah eloheykhem asher hvotsetiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim liheyvot lakhem lelohiym aniy yehovah eloheykhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח קֹ֔רַח בֶּן־יִצְהָ֥ר בֶּן־קְהָ֖ת בֶּן־לֵוִ֑י וְדָתָ֨ן וַאֲבִירָ֜ם בְּנֵ֧י אֱלִיאָ֛ב וְא֥וֹן בֶּן־פֶּ֖לֶת בְּנֵ֥י רְאוּבֵֽן׃
Translated: Now Korah, son of Izhar son of Kohath son of Levi, betook himself, along with Dathan and Abiram sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth—descendants of Reuben —
Transliteration: vayikach korach ven-yitsehar ven-kehat ven-leviy vedatan vaaviyram veney eliyav vevon ven-felet veney reuven

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֙מוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַאֲנָשִׁ֥ים מִבְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל חֲמִשִּׁ֣ים וּמָאתָ֑יִם נְשִׂיאֵ֥י עֵדָ֛ה קְרִאֵ֥י מוֹעֵ֖ד אַנְשֵׁי־שֵֽׁם׃
Translated: to rise up against Moses, together with two hundred and fifty Israelites, chieftains of the community, chosen in the assembly, men of repute.
Transliteration: vayakumu lifeney mosheh vaanashiym miveney-yisherael chamishiym umatayiim neshiyey edah keriey mvoed aneshey-shem

Hebrew: וַיִּֽקָּהֲל֞וּ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֲלֵהֶם֮ רַב־לָכֶם֒ כִּ֤י כׇל־הָֽעֵדָה֙ כֻּלָּ֣ם קְדֹשִׁ֔ים וּבְתוֹכָ֖ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמַדּ֥וּעַ תִּֽתְנַשְּׂא֖וּ עַל־קְהַ֥ל יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They combined against Moses and Aaron and said to them, “You have gone too far! For all the community are holy, all of them, and יהוה is in their midst. Why then do you raise yourselves above יהוה’s congregation?”
Transliteration: vayikahalu al-mosheh veal-aharon vayomeru alehem rav-lakhem khiy khׇl-haedah khulam kedoshiym uvetvokham yehovah umadua titenasheu al-kehal yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיִּפֹּ֖ל עַל־פָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: When Moses heard this, he fell on his face.
Transliteration: vayishema mosheh vayifol al-fanayv

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֶל־קֹ֜רַח וְאֶֽל־כׇּל־עֲדָתוֹ֮ לֵאמֹר֒ בֹּ֠קֶר וְיֹדַ֨ע יְהֹוָ֧ה אֶת־אֲשֶׁר־ל֛וֹ וְאֶת־הַקָּד֖וֹשׁ וְהִקְרִ֣יב אֵלָ֑יו וְאֵ֛ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחַר־בּ֖וֹ יַקְרִ֥יב אֵלָֽיו׃
Translated: Then he spoke to Korah and all his company, saying, “Come morning, יהוה will make known who is [God’s] and who is holy by granting direct access; the one whom [God] has chosen will be granted access.
Transliteration: vayedaver el-korach veel-khׇl-adatvo lemor voker veyoda yehovah et-asher-lvo veet-hakadvosh vehikeriyv elayv veet asher yivechar-vvo yakeriyv elayv

Hebrew: זֹ֖את עֲשׂ֑וּ קְחוּ־לָכֶ֣ם מַחְתּ֔וֹת קֹ֖רַח וְכׇל־עֲדָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Do this: You, Korah and all your band, take fire pans,
Transliteration: zot ashu kechu-lakhem machetvot korach vekhׇl-adatvo

Hebrew: וּתְנ֣וּ בָהֵ֣ן <small>׀</small> אֵ֡שׁ וְשִׂ֩ימוּ֩ עֲלֵיהֶ֨ן <small>׀</small> קְטֹ֜רֶת לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ מָחָ֔ר וְהָיָ֗ה הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִבְחַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֣וּא הַקָּד֑וֹשׁ רַב־לָכֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
Translated: and tomorrow put fire in them and lay incense on them before יהוה. Then the candidate whom יהוה chooses, he shall be the holy one. You have gone too far, sons of Levi!”
Transliteration: utenu vahen <small></small> esh veshiymu aleyhen <small></small> ketoret lifeney yehovah machar vehayah haiysh asher-yivechar yehovah hu hakadvosh rav-lakhem veney leviy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־קֹ֑רַח שִׁמְעוּ־נָ֖א בְּנֵ֥י לֵוִֽי׃
Translated: Moses said further to Korah, “Hear me, sons of Levi.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-korach shimeu-na veney leviy

Hebrew: הַמְעַ֣ט מִכֶּ֗ם כִּֽי־הִבְדִּיל֩ אֱלֹהֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֤ל אֶתְכֶם֙ מֵעֲדַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לְהַקְרִ֥יב אֶתְכֶ֖ם אֵלָ֑יו לַעֲבֹ֗ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַת֙ מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֔ה וְלַעֲמֹ֛ד לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה לְשָׁרְתָֽם׃
Translated: Is it not enough for you that the God of Israel has set you apart from the community of Israel and given you direct access, to perform the duties of יהוה’s Tabernacle and to minister to the community and serve them?
Transliteration: hameat mikhem khiy-hivediyl elohey yisherael etekhem meadat yisherael lehakeriyv etekhem elayv laavod et-avodat mishekhan yehovah velaamod lifeney haedah lesharetam

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֙ אֹֽתְךָ֔ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אַחֶ֥יךָ בְנֵי־לֵוִ֖י אִתָּ֑ךְ וּבִקַּשְׁתֶּ֖ם גַּם־כְּהֻנָּֽה׃
Translated: Now that [God] has advanced you and all your fellow Levites with you, do you seek the priesthood too?
Transliteration: vayakerev otekha veet-khׇl-acheykha veney-leviy itakhe uvikashetem gam-khehunah

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן אַתָּה֙ וְכׇל־עֲדָ֣תְךָ֔ הַנֹּעָדִ֖ים עַל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן מַה־ה֔וּא כִּ֥י (תלונו) [תַלִּ֖ינוּ] עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: Truly, it is against יהוה that you and all your company have banded together. For who is Aaron that you should rail against him?”
Transliteration: lakhen atah vekhׇl-adatekha hanoadiym al-yehovah veaharon mah-hu khiy (tlvnv) [taliynu] alayv

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח מֹשֶׁ֔ה לִקְרֹ֛א לְדָתָ֥ן וְלַאֲבִירָ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י אֱלִיאָ֑ב וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ לֹ֥א נַעֲלֶֽה׃
Translated: Moses sent for Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab; but they said, “We will not come!
Transliteration: vayishelach mosheh likero ledatan velaaviyram veney eliyav vayomeru lo naaleh

Hebrew: הַמְעַ֗ט כִּ֤י הֶֽעֱלִיתָ֙נוּ֙ מֵאֶ֨רֶץ זָבַ֤ת חָלָב֙ וּדְבַ֔שׁ לַהֲמִיתֵ֖נוּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר כִּֽי־תִשְׂתָּרֵ֥ר עָלֵ֖ינוּ גַּם־הִשְׂתָּרֵֽר׃
Translated: Is it not enough that you brought us from a land flowing with milk and honey to have us die in the wilderness, that you would also lord it over us?
Transliteration: hameat khiy heeliytanu meerets zavat chalav udevash lahamiytenu vamidevar khiy-tishetarer aleynu gam-hishetarer

Hebrew: אַ֡ף לֹ֣א אֶל־אֶ֩רֶץ֩ זָבַ֨ת חָלָ֤ב וּדְבַשׁ֙ הֲבִ֣יאֹתָ֔נוּ וַתִּ֨תֶּן־לָ֔נוּ נַחֲלַ֖ת שָׂדֶ֣ה וָכָ֑רֶם הַעֵינֵ֞י הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים הָהֵ֛ם תְּנַקֵּ֖ר לֹ֥א נַעֲלֶֽה׃
Translated: Even if you had brought us to a land flowing with milk and honey, and given us possession of fields and vineyards, should you gouge out the eyes of those involved? We will not come!”
Transliteration: af lo el-erets zavat chalav udevash haviyotanu vatiten-lanu nachalat shadeh vakharem haeyney haanashiym hahem tenaker lo naaleh

Hebrew: וַיִּ֤חַר לְמֹשֶׁה֙ מְאֹ֔ד וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה אַל־תֵּ֖פֶן אֶל־מִנְחָתָ֑ם לֹ֠א חֲמ֨וֹר אֶחָ֤ד מֵהֶם֙ נָשָׂ֔אתִי וְלֹ֥א הֲרֵעֹ֖תִי אֶת־אַחַ֥ד מֵהֶֽם׃
Translated: Moses was much aggrieved and he said to יהוה, “Pay no regard to their oblation. I have not taken the ass of any one of them, nor have I wronged any one of them.”
Transliteration: vayichar lemosheh meod vayomer el-yehovah al-tefen el-minechatam lo chamvor echad mehem nashatiy velo hareotiy et-achad mehem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־קֹ֔רַח אַתָּה֙ וְכׇל־עֲדָ֣תְךָ֔ הֱי֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אַתָּ֥ה וָהֵ֛ם וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן מָחָֽר׃
Translated: And Moses said to Korah, “Tomorrow, you and all your company appear before יהוה, you and they and Aaron.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-korach atah vekhׇl-adatekha heyu lifeney yehovah atah vahem veaharon machar

Hebrew: וּקְח֣וּ ׀ אִ֣ישׁ מַחְתָּת֗וֹ וּנְתַתֶּ֤ם עֲלֵיהֶם֙ קְטֹ֔רֶת וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֞ם לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ אִ֣ישׁ מַחְתָּת֔וֹ חֲמִשִּׁ֥ים וּמָאתַ֖יִם מַחְתֹּ֑ת וְאַתָּ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן אִ֥ישׁ מַחְתָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: Each of you take your fire pan and lay incense on it, and each of you bring that fire pan before יהוה, two hundred and fifty fire pans; you and Aaron also [bring] your fire pans.”
Transliteration: ukechu iysh machetatvo unetatem aleyhem ketoret vehikeravetem lifeney yehovah iysh machetatvo chamishiym umatayiim machetot veatah veaharon iysh machetatvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֞וּ אִ֣ישׁ מַחְתָּת֗וֹ וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ עֲלֵיהֶם֙ אֵ֔שׁ וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם קְטֹ֑רֶת וַֽיַּעַמְד֗וּ פֶּ֛תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד וּמֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated: They each took their fire pan, put fire in it, laid incense on it, and took a place at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, as did Moses and Aaron.
Transliteration: vayikechu iysh machetatvo vayitenu aleyhem esh vayashiymu aleyhem ketoret vayaamedu fetach ohel mvoed umosheh veaharon

Hebrew: וַיַּקְהֵ֨ל עֲלֵיהֶ֥ם קֹ֙רַח֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיֵּרָ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־כׇּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Korah gathered the whole community against them at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting. Then the Presence of יהוה appeared to the whole community,
Transliteration: vayakehel aleyhem korach et-khׇl-haedah el-fetach ohel mvoed vayera khevvod-yehovah el-khׇl-haedah {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: and יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: הִבָּ֣דְל֔וּ מִתּ֖וֹךְ הָעֵדָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את וַאֲכַלֶּ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם כְּרָֽגַע׃
Translated: “Stand back from this community that I may annihilate them in an instant!”
Transliteration: hivadelu mitvokhe haedah hazot vaakhaleh otam kheraga

Hebrew: וַיִּפְּל֤וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶם֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ אֵ֕ל אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָרוּחֹ֖ת לְכׇל־בָּשָׂ֑ר הָאִ֤ישׁ אֶחָד֙ יֶחֱטָ֔א וְעַ֥ל כׇּל־הָעֵדָ֖ה תִּקְצֹֽף׃ {ס}
Translated: But they fell on their faces and said, “O God, Source of the breath of all flesh! When one member sins, will You be wrathful with the whole community?”
Transliteration: vayifelu al-feneyhem vayomeru el elohey haruchot lekhׇl-vashar haiysh echad yecheta veal khׇl-haedah tiketsof {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֥ר אֶל־הָעֵדָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵֽעָלוּ֙ מִסָּבִ֔יב לְמִשְׁכַּן־קֹ֖רַח דָּתָ֥ן וַאֲבִירָֽם׃
Translated: “Speak to the community and say: Withdraw from about the abodes of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.”
Transliteration: daver el-haedah lemor healu misaviyv lemishekhan-korach datan vaaviyram

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם מֹשֶׁ֔ה וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ אֶל־דָּתָ֣ן וַאֲבִירָ֑ם וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ אַחֲרָ֖יו זִקְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Moses rose and went to Dathan and Abiram, the elders of Israel following him.
Transliteration: vayakׇm mosheh vayelekhe el-datan vaaviyram vayelekhu acharayv zikeney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר אֶל־הָעֵדָ֜ה לֵאמֹ֗ר ס֣וּרוּ נָ֡א מֵעַל֩ אׇהֳלֵ֨י הָאֲנָשִׁ֤ים הָֽרְשָׁעִים֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה וְאַֽל־תִּגְּע֖וּ בְּכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם פֶּן־תִּסָּפ֖וּ בְּכׇל־חַטֹּאתָֽם׃
Translated: He addressed the community, saying, “Move away from the tents of these wicked men and touch nothing that belongs to them, lest you be wiped out for all their sins.”
Transliteration: vayedaver el-haedah lemor suru na meal ׇholey haanashiym hareshaiym haeleh veal-tigeu vekhׇl-asher lahem fen-tisafu vekhׇl-chatotam

Hebrew: וַיֵּעָל֗וּ מֵעַ֧ל מִשְׁכַּן־קֹ֛רַח דָּתָ֥ן וַאֲבִירָ֖ם מִסָּבִ֑יב וְדָתָ֨ן וַאֲבִירָ֜ם יָצְא֣וּ נִצָּבִ֗ים פֶּ֚תַח אׇֽהֳלֵיהֶ֔ם וּנְשֵׁיהֶ֥ם וּבְנֵיהֶ֖ם וְטַפָּֽם׃
Translated: So they withdrew from about the abodes of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram. Now Dathan and Abiram had come out and they stood at the entrance of their tents, with their wives, their adult children, and their little ones.
Transliteration: vayealu meal mishekhan-korach datan vaaviyram misaviyv vedatan vaaviyram yatseu nitsaviym fetach ׇholeyhem unesheyhem uveneyhem vetafam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֘אמֶר֮ מֹשֶׁה֒ בְּזֹאת֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּן כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֣ה שְׁלָחַ֔נִי לַעֲשׂ֕וֹת אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַֽמַּעֲשִׂ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה כִּי־לֹ֖א מִלִּבִּֽי׃
Translated: And Moses said, “By this you shall know that it was יהוה who sent me to do all these things; that they are not of my own devising:
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh vezot tedeun khiy-yehovah shelachaniy laashvot et khׇl-hamaashiym haeleh khiy-lo miliviy

Hebrew: אִם־כְּמ֤וֹת כׇּל־הָֽאָדָם֙ יְמֻת֣וּן אֵ֔לֶּה וּפְקֻדַּת֙ כׇּל־הָ֣אָדָ֔ם יִפָּקֵ֖ד עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם לֹ֥א יְהֹוָ֖ה שְׁלָחָֽנִי׃
Translated: if these people’s death is that of all humankind, if their lot is humankind’s common fate, it was not יהוה who sent me.
Transliteration: im-khemvot khׇl-haadam yemutun eleh ufekudat khׇl-haadam yifaked aleyhem lo yehovah shelachaniy

Hebrew: וְאִם־בְּרִיאָ֞ה יִבְרָ֣א יְהֹוָ֗ה וּפָצְתָ֨ה הָאֲדָמָ֤ה אֶת־פִּ֙יהָ֙ וּבָלְעָ֤ה אֹתָם֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָהֶ֔ם וְיָרְד֥וּ חַיִּ֖ים שְׁאֹ֑לָה וִֽידַעְתֶּ֕ם כִּ֧י נִֽאֲצ֛וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But if יהוה brings about something unheard-of, so that the ground opens its mouth and swallows them up with all that belongs to them, and they go down alive into Sheol, you shall know that those involved have spurned יהוה.”
Transliteration: veim-veriyah yivera yehovah ufatsetah haadamah et-fiyha uvaleah otam veet-khׇl-asher lahem veyaredu chayiym sheolah viydaetem khiy niatsu haanashiym haeleh et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ כְּכַלֹּת֔וֹ לְדַבֵּ֕ר אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַדְּבָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַתִּבָּקַ֥ע הָאֲדָמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּחְתֵּיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Scarcely had he finished speaking all these words when the ground under them burst asunder,
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalotvo ledaver et khׇl-hadevariym haeleh vativaka haadamah asher tacheteyhem

Hebrew: וַתִּפְתַּ֤ח הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶת־פִּ֔יהָ וַתִּבְלַ֥ע אֹתָ֖ם וְאֶת־בָּתֵּיהֶ֑ם וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־הָאָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לְקֹ֔רַח וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הָרְכֽוּשׁ׃
Translated: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up with their households, all Korah’s people and all their possessions.
Transliteration: vatifetach haarets et-fiyha vativela otam veet-vateyhem veet khׇl-haadam asher lekorach veet khׇl-harekhush

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨רְד֜וּ הֵ֣ם וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָהֶ֛ם חַיִּ֖ים שְׁאֹ֑לָה וַתְּכַ֤ס עֲלֵיהֶם֙ הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיֹּאבְד֖וּ מִתּ֥וֹךְ הַקָּהָֽל׃
Translated: They went down alive into Sheol, with all that belonged to them; the earth closed over them and they vanished from the midst of the congregation.
Transliteration: vayeredu hem vekhׇl-asher lahem chayiym sheolah vatekhas aleyhem haarets vayovedu mitvokhe hakahal

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֛ר סְבִיבֹתֵיהֶ֖ם נָ֣סוּ לְקֹלָ֑ם כִּ֣י אָֽמְר֔וּ פֶּן־תִּבְלָעֵ֖נוּ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: All Israel around them fled at their shrieks, for they said, “The earth might swallow us!”
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael asher seviyvoteyhem nasu lekolam khiy ameru fen-tivelaenu haarets

Hebrew: וְאֵ֥שׁ יָצְאָ֖ה מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וַתֹּ֗אכַל אֵ֣ת הַחֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וּמָאתַ֙יִם֙ אִ֔ישׁ מַקְרִיבֵ֖י הַקְּטֹֽרֶת׃ {ס}
Translated: And a fire went forth from יהוה and consumed the two hundred and fifty contestants offering the incense.
Transliteration: veesh yatseah meet yehovah vatokhal et hachamishiym umatayiim iysh makeriyvey haketoret {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: אֱמֹ֨ר אֶל־אֶלְעָזָ֜ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְיָרֵ֤ם אֶת־הַמַּחְתֹּת֙ מִבֵּ֣ין הַשְּׂרֵפָ֔ה וְאֶת־הָאֵ֖שׁ זְרֵה־הָ֑לְאָה כִּ֖י קָדֵֽשׁוּ׃
Translated: Order Eleazar son of Aaron the priest to remove the fire pans—for they have become sacred—from among the charred remains; and scatter the coals abroad.
Transliteration: emor el-eleazar ven-aharon hakhohen veyarem et-hamachetot miveyn hasherefah veet-haesh zereh-haleah khiy kadeshu

Hebrew: אֵ֡ת מַחְתּוֹת֩ הַֽחַטָּאִ֨ים הָאֵ֜לֶּה בְּנַפְשֹׁתָ֗ם וְעָשׂ֨וּ אֹתָ֜ם רִקֻּעֵ֤י פַחִים֙ צִפּ֣וּי לַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ כִּֽי־הִקְרִיבֻ֥ם לִפְנֵֽי־יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיִּקְדָּ֑שׁוּ וְיִֽהְי֥וּ לְא֖וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: [Remove] the fire pans of those who have sinned at the cost of their lives, and let them be made into hammered sheets as plating for the altar—for once they have been used for offering to יהוה, they have become sacred—and let them serve as a warning to the people of Israel.
Transliteration: et machetvot hachataiym haeleh venafeshotam veashu otam rikuey fachiym tsifuy lamizevecha khiy-hikeriyvum lifeney-yehovah vayikedashu veyiheyu levot liveney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֞ח אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֗ן אֵ֚ת מַחְתּ֣וֹת הַנְּחֹ֔שֶׁת אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִקְרִ֖יבוּ הַשְּׂרֻפִ֑ים וַֽיְרַקְּע֖וּם צִפּ֥וּי לַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Eleazar the priest took the copper fire pans which had been used for offering by those who died in the fire; and they were hammered into plating for the altar,
Transliteration: vayikach eleazar hakhohen et machetvot hanechoshet asher hikeriyvu hasherufiym vayerakeum tsifuy lamizevecha

Hebrew: זִכָּר֞וֹן לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לְ֠מַ֠עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־יִקְרַ֜ב אִ֣ישׁ זָ֗ר אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר לֹ֣א מִזֶּ֤רַע אַהֲרֹן֙ ה֔וּא לְהַקְטִ֥יר קְטֹ֖רֶת לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֤ה כְקֹ֙רַח֙ וְכַ֣עֲדָת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֖ה לֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: as יהוה had ordered him through Moses. It was to be a reminder to the Israelites, so that no outsider—one not of Aaron’s offspring—should presume to offer incense before יהוה and suffer the fate of Korah and his band.
Transliteration: zikharvon liveney yisherael lemaan asher lo-yikerav iysh zar asher lo mizera aharon hu lehaketiyr ketoret lifeney yehovah velo-yiheyeh khekorach vekhaadatvo khaasher diver yehovah veyad-mosheh lvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּלֹּ֜נוּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֔ת עַל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר אַתֶּ֥ם הֲמִתֶּ֖ם אֶת־עַ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Next day the whole Israelite community railed against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You two have brought death upon יהוה’s people!”
Transliteration: vayilonu khׇl-adat veney-yisherael mimׇchorat al-mosheh veal-aharon lemor atem hamitem et-am yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בְּהִקָּהֵ֤ל הָֽעֵדָה֙ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וַיִּפְנוּ֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְהִנֵּ֥ה כִסָּ֖הוּ הֶעָנָ֑ן וַיֵּרָ֖א כְּב֥וֹד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But as the community gathered against them, Moses and Aaron turned toward the Tent of Meeting; the cloud had covered it and the Presence of יהוה appeared.
Transliteration: vayehiy vehikahel haedah al-mosheh veal-aharon vayifenu el-ohel mvoed vehineh khisahu heanan vayera khevvod yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶל־פְּנֵ֖י אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃ {ס}
Translated: When Moses and Aaron reached the Tent of Meeting,
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh veaharon el-feney ohel mvoed {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: הֵרֹ֗מּוּ מִתּוֹךְ֙ הָעֵדָ֣ה הַזֹּ֔את וַאֲכַלֶּ֥ה אֹתָ֖ם כְּרָ֑גַע וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: “Remove yourselves from this community, that I may annihilate them in an instant.” They fell on their faces.
Transliteration: heromu mitvokhe haedah hazot vaakhaleh otam kheraga vayifelu al-feneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן קַ֣ח אֶת־הַ֠מַּחְתָּ֠ה וְתֶן־עָלֶ֨יהָ אֵ֜שׁ מֵעַ֤ל הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ וְשִׂ֣ים קְטֹ֔רֶת וְהוֹלֵ֧ךְ מְהֵרָ֛ה אֶל־הָעֵדָ֖ה וְכַפֵּ֣ר עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם כִּֽי־יָצָ֥א הַקֶּ֛צֶף מִלִּפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה הֵחֵ֥ל הַנָּֽגֶף׃
Translated: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Take the fire pan, and put on it fire from the altar. Add incense and take it quickly to the community and make expiation for them. For wrath has gone forth from יהוה: the plague has begun!”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-aharon kach et-hamachetah veten-aleyha esh meal hamizevecha veshiym ketoret vehvolekhe meherah el-haedah vekhafer aleyhem khiy-yatsa haketsef milifeney yehovah hechel hanagef

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח אַהֲרֹ֜ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ דִּבֶּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֗ה וַיָּ֙רׇץ֙ אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ הַקָּהָ֔ל וְהִנֵּ֛ה הֵחֵ֥ל הַנֶּ֖גֶף בָּעָ֑ם וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶֽת־הַקְּטֹ֔רֶת וַיְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Aaron took it, as Moses had ordered, and ran to the midst of the congregation, where the plague had begun among the people. He put on the incense and made expiation for the people;
Transliteration: vayikach aharon khaasher diver mosheh vayarׇts el-tvokhe hakahal vehineh hechel hanegef vaam vayiten et-haketoret vayekhafer al-haam

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֥ד בֵּֽין־הַמֵּתִ֖ים וּבֵ֣ין הַֽחַיִּ֑ים וַתֵּעָצַ֖ר הַמַּגֵּפָֽה׃
Translated: he stood between the dead and the living until the plague was checked.
Transliteration: vayaamod veyn-hametiym uveyn hachayiym vateatsar hamagefah

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֗וּ הַמֵּתִים֙ בַּמַּגֵּפָ֔ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁבַ֣ע מֵא֑וֹת מִלְּבַ֥ד הַמֵּתִ֖ים עַל־דְּבַר־קֹֽרַח׃
Translated: Those who died of the plague came to fourteen thousand and seven hundred, aside from those who died on account of Korah.
Transliteration: vayiheyu hametiym vamagefah arevaah ashar elef usheva mevot milevad hametiym al-devar-korach

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שׇׁב אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה נֶעֱצָֽרָה׃ {פ}
Translated: Aaron then returned to Moses at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, since the plague was checked.
Transliteration: vayashׇv aharon el-mosheh el-fetach ohel mvoed vehamagefah neetsarah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֣ר ׀ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְקַ֣ח מֵֽאִתָּ֡ם מַטֶּ֣ה מַטֶּה֩ לְבֵ֨ית אָ֜ב מֵאֵ֤ת כׇּל־נְשִֽׂיאֵהֶם֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֔ם שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר מַטּ֑וֹת אִ֣ישׁ אֶת־שְׁמ֔וֹ תִּכְתֹּ֖ב עַל־מַטֵּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and take from them—from the chieftains of their ancestral houses —one staff for each chieftain of an ancestral house: twelve staffs in all. Inscribe each one’s name on his staff,
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael vekach meitam mateh mateh leveyt av meet khׇl-neshiyehem leveyt avotam sheneym ashar matvot iysh et-shemvo tikhetov al-matehu

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ שֵׁ֣ם אַהֲרֹ֔ן תִּכְתֹּ֖ב עַל־מַטֵּ֣ה לֵוִ֑י כִּ֚י מַטֶּ֣ה אֶחָ֔ד לְרֹ֖אשׁ בֵּ֥ית אֲבוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: there being one staff for each head of an ancestral house; also inscribe Aaron’s name on the staff of Levi.
Transliteration: veet shem aharon tikhetov al-mateh leviy khiy mateh echad lerosh veyt avvotam

Hebrew: וְהִנַּחְתָּ֖ם בְּאֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד לִפְנֵי֙ הָֽעֵד֔וּת אֲשֶׁ֛ר אִוָּעֵ֥ד לָכֶ֖ם שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: Deposit them in the Tent of Meeting before the Pact, where I meet with you.
Transliteration: vehinachetam veohel mvoed lifeney haedut asher ivaed lakhem shamah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה הָאִ֛ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֶבְחַר־בּ֖וֹ מַטֵּ֣הוּ יִפְרָ֑ח וַהֲשִׁכֹּתִ֣י מֵֽעָלַ֗י אֶת־תְּלֻנּוֹת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥ם מַלִּינִ֖ם עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: The staff of the candidate whom I choose shall sprout, and I will rid Myself of the incessant mutterings of the Israelites against you.
Transliteration: vehayah haiysh asher evechar-vvo matehu yiferach vahashikhotiy mealay et-telunvot veney yisherael asher hem maliynim aleykhem

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיִּתְּנ֣וּ אֵלָ֣יו <small>׀</small> כׇּֽל־נְשִׂיאֵיהֶ֡ם מַטֶּה֩ לְנָשִׂ֨יא אֶחָ֜ד מַטֶּ֨ה לְנָשִׂ֤יא אֶחָד֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֔ם שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר מַטּ֑וֹת וּמַטֵּ֥ה אַהֲרֹ֖ן בְּת֥וֹךְ מַטּוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Moses spoke thus to the Israelites. Their chieftains gave him a staff for each chieftain of an ancestral house, twelve staffs in all; among these staffs was that of Aaron.
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh el-veney yisherael vayitenu elayv <small></small> khׇl-neshiyeyhem mateh lenashiy echad mateh lenashiy echad leveyt avotam sheneym ashar matvot umateh aharon vetvokhe matvotam

Hebrew: וַיַּנַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־הַמַּטֹּ֖ת לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּאֹ֖הֶל הָעֵדֻֽת׃
Translated: Moses deposited the staffs before יהוה, in the Tent of the Pact.
Transliteration: vayanach mosheh et-hamatot lifeney yehovah veohel haedut

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֗ת וַיָּבֹ֤א מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל הָעֵד֔וּת וְהִנֵּ֛ה פָּרַ֥ח מַטֵּֽה־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לְבֵ֣ית לֵוִ֑י וַיֹּ֤צֵֽא פֶ֙רַח֙ וַיָּ֣צֵֽץ צִ֔יץ וַיִּגְמֹ֖ל שְׁקֵדִֽים׃
Translated: The next day Moses entered the Tent of the Pact, and there the staff of Aaron of the house of Levi had sprouted: it had brought forth sprouts, produced blossoms, and borne almonds.
Transliteration: vayehiy mimׇchorat vayavo mosheh el-ohel haedut vehineh farach mateh-aharon leveyt leviy vayotse ferach vayatsets tsiyts vayigemol shekediym

Hebrew: וַיֹּצֵ֨א מֹשֶׁ֤ה אֶת־כׇּל־הַמַּטֹּת֙ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶֽל־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּרְא֥וּ וַיִּקְח֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ מַטֵּֽהוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: Moses then brought out all the staffs from before יהוה to all the Israelites; each identified and recovered his staff.
Transliteration: vayotse mosheh et-khׇl-hamatot milifeney yehovah el-khׇl-veney yisherael vayireu vayikechu iysh matehu {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה הָשֵׁ֞ב אֶת־מַטֵּ֤ה אַהֲרֹן֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָעֵד֔וּת לְמִשְׁמֶ֥רֶת לְא֖וֹת לִבְנֵי־מֶ֑רִי וּתְכַ֧ל תְּלוּנֹּתָ֛ם מֵעָלַ֖י וְלֹ֥א יָמֻֽתוּ׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Put Aaron’s staff back before the Pact, to be kept as a lesson to rebels, so that their mutterings against Me may cease, lest they die.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh hashev et-mateh aharon lifeney haedut lemishemeret levot liveney-meriy utekhal telunotam mealay velo yamutu

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה אֹת֖וֹ כֵּ֥ן עָשָֽׂה׃ {פ}
Translated: This Moses did; just as יהוה had commanded him, so he did.
Transliteration: vayaash mosheh khaasher tsivah yehovah otvo khen ashah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר הֵ֥ן גָּוַ֛עְנוּ אָבַ֖דְנוּ כֻּלָּ֥נוּ אָבָֽדְנוּ׃
Translated: But the Israelites said to Moses, “Lo, we perish! We are lost, all of us lost!
Transliteration: vayomeru veney yisherael el-mosheh lemor hen gavaenu avadenu khulanu avadenu

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ל הַקָּרֵ֧ב ׀ הַקָּרֵ֛ב אֶל־מִשְׁכַּ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה יָמ֑וּת הַאִ֥ם תַּ֖מְנוּ לִגְוֺֽעַ׃ {ס}
Translated: Everyone who so much as ventures near יהוה’s Tabernacle must die. Alas, we are doomed to perish!”
Transliteration: khol hakarev hakarev el-mishekhan yehovah yamut haim tamenu ligevoa {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֔ן אַתָּ֗ה וּבָנֶ֤יךָ וּבֵית־אָבִ֙יךָ֙ אִתָּ֔ךְ תִּשְׂא֖וּ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן הַמִּקְדָּ֑שׁ וְאַתָּה֙ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ אִתָּ֔ךְ תִּשְׂא֖וּ אֶת־עֲוֺ֥ן כְּהֻנַּתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: יהוה said to Aaron: You and your sons and the ancestral house under your charge shall bear any guilt connected with the sanctuary; you and your sons alone shall bear any guilt connected with your priesthood.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-aharon atah uvaneykha uveyt-aviykha itakhe tisheu et-avon hamikedash veatah uvaneykha itakhe tisheu et-avon khehunatekhem

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אֶת־אַחֶ֩יךָ֩ מַטֵּ֨ה לֵוִ֜י שֵׁ֤בֶט אָבִ֙יךָ֙ הַקְרֵ֣ב אִתָּ֔ךְ וְיִלָּו֥וּ עָלֶ֖יךָ וִישָֽׁרְת֑וּךָ וְאַתָּה֙ וּבָנֶ֣יךָ אִתָּ֔ךְ לִפְנֵ֖י אֹ֥הֶל הָעֵדֻֽת׃
Translated: You shall also associate with yourself your kinsmen the tribe of Levi, your ancestral tribe, to be attached to you and to minister to you, while you and your sons under your charge are before the Tent of the Pact.
Transliteration: vegam et-acheykha mateh leviy shevet aviykha hakerev itakhe veyilavu aleykha viysharetukha veatah uvaneykha itakhe lifeney ohel haedut

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁמְרוּ֙ מִֽשְׁמַרְתְּךָ֔ וּמִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת כׇּל־הָאֹ֑הֶל אַךְ֩ אֶל־כְּלֵ֨י הַקֹּ֤דֶשׁ וְאֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ לֹ֣א יִקְרָ֔בוּ וְלֹֽא־יָמֻ֥תוּ גַם־הֵ֖ם גַּם־אַתֶּֽם׃
Translated: They shall discharge their duties to you and to the Tent as a whole, but they must not have any contact with the furnishings of the Shrine or with the altar, lest both they and you die.
Transliteration: veshameru mishemaretekha umishemeret khׇl-haohel akhe el-kheley hakodesh veel-hamizevecha lo yikeravu velo-yamutu gam-hem gam-atem

Hebrew: וְנִלְו֣וּ עָלֶ֔יךָ וְשָֽׁמְר֗וּ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֙רֶת֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד לְכֹ֖ל עֲבֹדַ֣ת הָאֹ֑הֶל וְזָ֖ר לֹא־יִקְרַ֥ב אֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: They shall be attached to you and discharge the duties of the Tent of Meeting, all the service of the Tent; but no outsider shall intrude upon you
Transliteration: venilevu aleykha veshameru et-mishemeret ohel mvoed lekhol avodat haohel vezar lo-yikerav aleykhem

Hebrew: וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֗ם אֵ֚ת מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַקֹּ֔דֶשׁ וְאֵ֖ת מִשְׁמֶ֣רֶת הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְלֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֥ה ע֛וֹד קֶ֖צֶף עַל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: as you discharge the duties connected with the Shrine and the altar, that wrath may not again strike the Israelites.
Transliteration: ushemaretem et mishemeret hakodesh veet mishemeret hamizevecha velo-yiheyeh vod ketsef al-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י הִנֵּ֤ה לָקַ֙חְתִּי֙ אֶת־אֲחֵיכֶ֣ם הַלְוִיִּ֔ם מִתּ֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לָכֶ֞ם מַתָּנָ֤ה נְתֻנִים֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲבֹ֕ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: I hereby take your fellow Levites from among the Israelites; they are assigned to you in dedication to יהוה, to do the work of the Tent of Meeting;
Transliteration: vaaniy hineh lakachetiy et-acheykhem haleviyim mitvokhe veney yisherael lakhem matanah netuniym layhovah laavod et-avodat ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה וּבָנֶ֣יךָ אִ֠תְּךָ֠ תִּשְׁמְר֨וּ אֶת־כְּהֻנַּתְכֶ֜ם לְכׇל־דְּבַ֧ר הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ וּלְמִבֵּ֥ית לַפָּרֹ֖כֶת וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֑ם עֲבֹדַ֣ת מַתָּנָ֗ה אֶתֵּן֙ אֶת־כְּהֻנַּתְכֶ֔ם וְהַזָּ֥ר הַקָּרֵ֖ב יוּמָֽת׃ {פ}
Translated: while you and your sons shall be careful to perform your priestly duties in everything pertaining to the altar and to what is behind the curtain. I make your priesthood a service of dedication; any outsider who encroaches shall be put to death.
Transliteration: veatah uvaneykha itekha tishemeru et-khehunatekhem lekhׇl-devar hamizevecha ulemiveyt lafarokhet vaavadetem avodat matanah eten et-khehunatekhem vehazar hakarev yumat {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֒ וַאֲנִי֙ הִנֵּ֣ה נָתַ֣תִּֽי לְךָ֔ אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת תְּרוּמֹתָ֑י לְכׇל־קׇדְשֵׁ֣י בְנֵֽי־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל לְךָ֨ נְתַתִּ֧ים לְמׇשְׁחָ֛ה וּלְבָנֶ֖יךָ לְחׇק־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: יהוה spoke further to Aaron: I hereby give you charge of My gifts, all the sacred donations of the Israelites; I grant them to you and to your sons as a perquisite, a due for all time.
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-aharon vaaniy hineh natatiy lekha et-mishemeret terumotay lekhׇl-kׇdeshey veney-yisherael lekha netatiym lemׇshechah ulevaneykha lechׇk-volam

Hebrew: זֶֽה־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֛ מִקֹּ֥דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים מִן־הָאֵ֑שׁ כׇּל־קׇ֠רְבָּנָ֠ם לְֽכׇל־מִנְחָתָ֞ם וּלְכׇל־חַטָּאתָ֗ם וּלְכׇל־אֲשָׁמָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָשִׁ֣יבוּ לִ֔י קֹ֣דֶשׁ קׇֽדָשִׁ֥ים לְךָ֛ ה֖וּא וּלְבָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: This shall be yours from the most holy sacrifices, the offerings by fire: every such offering that they render to Me as most holy sacrifices, namely, every meal offering, sin offering, and guilt offering of theirs, shall belong to you and your sons.
Transliteration: zeh-yiheyeh lekha mikodesh hakodashiym min-haesh khׇl-kׇrevanam lekhׇl-minechatam ulekhׇl-chatatam ulekhׇl-ashamam asher yashiyvu liy kodesh kׇdashiym lekha hu ulevaneykha

Hebrew: בְּקֹ֥דֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁ֖ים תֹּאכְלֶ֑נּוּ כׇּל־זָכָר֙ יֹאכַ֣ל אֹת֔וֹ קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִֽהְיֶה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: You shall partake of them as most sacred donations: only males may eat them; you shall treat them as consecrated.
Transliteration: vekodesh hakodashiym tokhelenu khׇl-zakhar yokhal otvo kodesh yiheyeh-lakhe

Hebrew: וְזֶה־לְּךָ֞ תְּרוּמַ֣ת מַתָּנָ֗ם לְכׇל־תְּנוּפֹת֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ לְךָ֣ נְתַתִּ֗ים וּלְבָנֶ֧יךָ וְלִבְנֹתֶ֛יךָ אִתְּךָ֖ לְחׇק־עוֹלָ֑ם כׇּל־טָה֥וֹר בְּבֵיתְךָ֖ יֹאכַ֥ל אֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: This, too, shall be yours: the gift offerings of their contributions, all the elevation offerings of the Israelites, I give to you [and your wives], to your sons, and to the daughters that are with you, as a due for all time; everyone of your household who is pure may eat it.
Transliteration: vezeh-lekha terumat matanam lekhׇl-tenufot veney yisherael lekha netatiym ulevaneykha velivenoteykha itekha lechׇk-volam khׇl-tahvor veveytekha yokhal otvo

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ל חֵ֣לֶב יִצְהָ֔ר וְכׇל־חֵ֖לֶב תִּיר֣וֹשׁ וְדָגָ֑ן רֵאשִׁיתָ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־יִתְּנ֥וּ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה לְךָ֥ נְתַתִּֽים׃
Translated: All the best of the new oil, wine, and grain—the choice parts that they present to יהוה —I give to you.
Transliteration: khol chelev yitsehar vekhׇl-chelev tiyrvosh vedagan reshiytam asher-yitenu layhovah lekha netatiym

Hebrew: בִּכּוּרֵ֞י כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּאַרְצָ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־יָבִ֥יאוּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה לְךָ֣ יִהְיֶ֑ה כׇּל־טָה֥וֹר בְּבֵיתְךָ֖ יֹאכְלֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: The first fruits of everything in their land, that they bring to יהוה, shall be yours; everyone of your household who is pure may eat them.
Transliteration: vikhurey khׇl-asher vearetsam asher-yaviyu layhovah lekha yiheyeh khׇl-tahvor veveytekha yokhelenu

Hebrew: כׇּל־חֵ֥רֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְךָ֥ יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: Everything that has been proscribed in Israel shall be yours.
Transliteration: khׇl-cherem veyisherael lekha yiheyeh

Hebrew: כׇּל־פֶּ֣טֶר רֶ֠חֶם לְֽכׇל־בָּשָׂ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־יַקְרִ֧יבוּ לַֽיהֹוָ֛ה בָּאָדָ֥ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֖ה יִֽהְיֶה־לָּ֑ךְ אַ֣ךְ ׀ פָּדֹ֣ה תִפְדֶּ֗ה אֵ֚ת בְּכ֣וֹר הָֽאָדָ֔ם וְאֵ֛ת בְּכֽוֹר־הַבְּהֵמָ֥ה הַטְּמֵאָ֖ה תִּפְדֶּֽה׃
Translated: The first [male] issue of the womb of every being, human or beast, that is offered to יהוה, shall be yours; but you shall have the male first-born of human beings redeemed, and you shall also have the firstling of impure animals redeemed.
Transliteration: khׇl-feter rechem lekhׇl-vashar asher-yakeriyvu layhovah vaadam uvavehemah yiheyeh-lakhe akhe fadoh tifedeh et vekhvor haadam veet vekhvor-havehemah hatemeah tifedeh

Hebrew: וּפְדוּיָו֙ מִבֶּן־חֹ֣דֶשׁ תִּפְדֶּ֔ה בְּעֶ֨רְכְּךָ֔ כֶּ֛סֶף חֲמֵ֥שֶׁת שְׁקָלִ֖ים בְּשֶׁ֣קֶל הַקֹּ֑דֶשׁ עֶשְׂרִ֥ים גֵּרָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: Take as their redemption price, from the age of one month up, the money equivalent of five shekels by the sanctuary weight, which is twenty gerahs.
Transliteration: ufeduyav miven-chodesh tifedeh veerekhekha khesef chameshet shekaliym veshekel hakodesh esheriym gerah hu

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ בְּֽכוֹר־שׁ֡וֹר אֽוֹ־בְכ֨וֹר כֶּ֜שֶׂב אֽוֹ־בְכ֥וֹר עֵ֛ז לֹ֥א תִפְדֶּ֖ה קֹ֣דֶשׁ הֵ֑ם אֶת־דָּמָ֞ם תִּזְרֹ֤ק עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ וְאֶת־חֶלְבָּ֣ם תַּקְטִ֔יר אִשֶּׁ֛ה לְרֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: But the firstlings of cattle, sheep, or goats may not be redeemed; they are consecrated. You shall dash their blood against the altar, and turn their fat into smoke as an offering by fire for a pleasing odor to יהוה.
Transliteration: akhe vekhvor-shvor vo-vekhvor kheshev vo-vekhvor ez lo tifedeh kodesh hem et-damam tizerok al-hamizevecha veet-chelevam taketiyr isheh lereycha niychocha layhovah

Hebrew: וּבְשָׂרָ֖ם יִהְיֶה־לָּ֑ךְ כַּחֲזֵ֧ה הַתְּנוּפָ֛ה וּכְשׁ֥וֹק הַיָּמִ֖ין לְךָ֥ יִהְיֶֽה׃
Translated: But their meat shall be yours: it shall be yours like the breast of elevation offering and like the right thigh.
Transliteration: uvesharam yiheyeh-lakhe khachazeh hatenufah ukheshvok hayamiyn lekha yiheyeh

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ל ׀ תְּרוּמֹ֣ת הַקֳּדָשִׁ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֥ימוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לַֽיהֹוָה֒ נָתַ֣תִּֽי לְךָ֗ וּלְבָנֶ֧יךָ וְלִבְנֹתֶ֛יךָ אִתְּךָ֖ לְחׇק־עוֹלָ֑ם בְּרִית֩ מֶ֨לַח עוֹלָ֥ם הִוא֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לְךָ֖ וּֽלְזַרְעֲךָ֥ אִתָּֽךְ׃
Translated: All the sacred gifts that the Israelites set aside for יהוה I give to you, to your sons, and to the daughters that are with you, as a due for all time. It shall be an everlasting covenant of salt before יהוה for you and for your offspring as well.
Transliteration: khol terumot hakodashiym asher yariymu veney-yisherael layhovah natatiy lekha ulevaneykha velivenoteykha itekha lechׇk-volam veriyt melach volam hiv lifeney yehovah lekha ulezareakha itakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֗ן בְּאַרְצָם֙ לֹ֣א תִנְחָ֔ל וְחֵ֕לֶק לֹא־יִהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ בְּתוֹכָ֑ם אֲנִ֤י חֶלְקְךָ֙ וְנַחֲלָ֣תְךָ֔ בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: And יהוה said to Aaron: You shall, however, have no territorial share among them or own any portion in their midst; I am your portion and your share among the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-aharon vearetsam lo tinechal vechelek lo-yiheyeh lekha vetvokham aniy chelekekha venachalatekha vetvokhe veney yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֣י לֵוִ֔י הִנֵּ֥ה נָתַ֛תִּי כׇּל־מַֽעֲשֵׂ֥ר בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְנַחֲלָ֑ה חֵ֤לֶף עֲבֹֽדָתָם֙ אֲשֶׁר־הֵ֣ם עֹֽבְדִ֔ים אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֖ת אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: And to the Levites I hereby give all the tithes in Israel as their share in return for the services that they perform, the services of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: veliveney leviy hineh natatiy khׇl-maasher veyisherael lenachalah chelef avodatam asher-hem ovediym et-avodat ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יִקְרְב֥וּ ע֛וֹד בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד לָשֵׂ֥את חֵ֖טְא לָמֽוּת׃
Translated: Henceforth, Israelites shall not trespass on the Tent of Meeting, and thus incur guilt and die:
Transliteration: velo-yikerevu vod veney yisherael el-ohel mvoed lashet chete lamut

Hebrew: וְעָבַ֨ד הַלֵּוִ֜י ה֗וּא אֶת־עֲבֹדַת֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וְהֵ֖ם יִשְׂא֣וּ עֲוֺנָ֑ם חֻקַּ֤ת עוֹלָם֙ לְדֹרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וּבְתוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א יִנְחֲל֖וּ נַחֲלָֽה׃
Translated: only Levites shall perform the services of the Tent of Meeting; others would incur guilt. It is the law for all time throughout the ages. But they shall have no territorial share among the Israelites;
Transliteration: veavad haleviy hu et-avodat ohel mvoed vehem yisheu avonam chukat volam ledoroteykhem uvetvokhe veney yisherael lo yinechalu nachalah

Hebrew: כִּ֞י אֶת־מַעְשַׂ֣ר בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָרִ֤ימוּ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ תְּרוּמָ֔ה נָתַ֥תִּי לַלְוִיִּ֖ם לְנַחֲלָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֙ אָמַ֣רְתִּי לָהֶ֔ם בְּתוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֥א יִנְחֲל֖וּ נַחֲלָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: for it is the tithes set aside by the Israelites as a gift to יהוה that I give to the Levites as their share. Therefore I have said concerning them: They shall have no territorial share among the Israelites.
Transliteration: khiy et-maeshar veney-yisherael asher yariymu layhovah terumah natatiy laleviyim lenachalah al-khen amaretiy lahem vetvokhe veney yisherael lo yinechalu nachalah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: וְאֶל־הַלְוִיִּ֣ם תְּדַבֵּר֮ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶם֒ כִּֽי־תִ֠קְח֠וּ מֵאֵ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶת־הַֽמַּעֲשֵׂ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֧תִּי לָכֶ֛ם מֵאִתָּ֖ם בְּנַחֲלַתְכֶ֑ם וַהֲרֵמֹתֶ֤ם מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה מַעֲשֵׂ֖ר מִן־הַֽמַּעֲשֵֽׂר׃
Translated: Speak to the Levites and say to them: When you receive from the Israelites their tithes, which I have assigned to you as your share, you shall set aside from them one-tenth of the tithe as a gift to יהוה.
Transliteration: veel-haleviyim tedaver veamareta alehem khiy-tikechu meet veney-yisherael et-hamaasher asher natatiy lakhem meitam venachalatekhem vaharemotem mimenu terumat yehovah maasher min-hamaasher

Hebrew: וְנֶחְשַׁ֥ב לָכֶ֖ם תְּרוּמַתְכֶ֑ם כַּדָּגָן֙ מִן־הַגֹּ֔רֶן וְכַֽמְלֵאָ֖ה מִן־הַיָּֽקֶב׃
Translated: This shall be accounted to you as your gift. As with the new grain from the threshing floor or the flow from the vat,
Transliteration: venecheshav lakhem terumatekhem khadagan min-hagoren vekhameleah min-hayakev

Hebrew: כֵּ֣ן תָּרִ֤ימוּ גַם־אַתֶּם֙ תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה מִכֹּל֙ מַעְשְׂרֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּקְח֔וּ מֵאֵ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וּנְתַתֶּ֤ם מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ אֶת־תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: so shall you on your part set aside a gift for יהוה from all the tithes that you receive from the Israelites; and from them you shall bring the gift for יהוה to Aaron the priest.
Transliteration: khen tariymu gam-atem terumat yehovah mikhol maesheroteykhem asher tikechu meet veney yisherael unetatem mimenu et-terumat yehovah leaharon hakhohen

Hebrew: מִכֹּל֙ מַתְּנֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תָּרִ֕ימוּ אֵ֖ת כׇּל־תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה מִכׇּ֨ל־חֶלְבּ֔וֹ אֶֽת־מִקְדְּשׁ֖וֹ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
Translated: You shall set aside all gifts due to יהוה from everything that is donated to you, from each thing its best portion, the part thereof that is to be consecrated.
Transliteration: mikhol matenoteykhem tariymu et khׇl-terumat yehovah mikhׇl-chelevvo et-mikedeshvo mimenu

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם בַּהֲרִֽימְכֶ֤ם אֶת־חֶלְבּוֹ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ וְנֶחְשַׁב֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם כִּתְבוּאַ֥ת גֹּ֖רֶן וְכִתְבוּאַ֥ת יָֽקֶב׃
Translated: Say to them further: When you have removed the best part from it, you Levites may consider it the same as the yield of threshing floor or vat.
Transliteration: veamareta alehem vahariymekhem et-chelevvo mimenu venecheshav laleviyim khitevuat goren vekhitevuat yakev

Hebrew: וַאֲכַלְתֶּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ בְּכׇל־מָק֔וֹם אַתֶּ֖ם וּבֵֽיתְכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־שָׂכָ֥ר הוּא֙ לָכֶ֔ם חֵ֥לֶף עֲבֹֽדַתְכֶ֖ם בְּאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: You and your households may eat it anywhere, for it is your recompense for your services in the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: vaakhaletem otvo vekhׇl-makvom atem uveytekhem khiy-shakhar hu lakhem chelef avodatekhem veohel mvoed

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִשְׂא֤וּ עָלָיו֙ חֵ֔טְא בַּהֲרִֽימְכֶ֥ם אֶת־חֶלְבּ֖וֹ מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְאֶת־קׇדְשֵׁ֧י בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לֹ֥א תְחַלְּל֖וּ וְלֹ֥א תָמֽוּתוּ׃ {פ}
