Translated: You will incur no guilt through it, once you have removed the best part from it; but you must not profane the sacred donations of the Israelites, lest you die.
Transliteration: velo-tisheu alayv chete vahariymekhem et-chelevvo mimenu veet-kׇdeshey veney-yisherael lo techalelu velo tamutu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon lemor

Hebrew: זֹ֚את חֻקַּ֣ת הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר דַּבֵּ֣ר ׀ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְיִקְח֣וּ אֵלֶ֩יךָ֩ פָרָ֨ה אֲדֻמָּ֜ה תְּמִימָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵֽין־בָּהּ֙ מ֔וּם אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־עָלָ֥ה עָלֶ֖יהָ עֹֽל׃
Translated: This is the ritual law that יהוה has commanded: Instruct the Israelite people to bring you a red cow without blemish, in which there is no defect and on which no yoke has been laid.
Transliteration: zot chukat hatvorah asher-tsivah yehovah lemor daver el-veney yisherael veyikechu eleykha farah adumah temiymah asher eyn-vah mum asher lo-alah aleyha ol

Hebrew: וּנְתַתֶּ֣ם אֹתָ֔הּ אֶל־אֶלְעָזָ֖ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְהוֹצִ֤יא אֹתָהּ֙ אֶל־מִח֣וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וְשָׁחַ֥ט אֹתָ֖הּ לְפָנָֽיו׃
Translated: You shall give it to Eleazar the priest. It shall be taken outside the camp and slaughtered in his presence.
Transliteration: unetatem otah el-eleazar hakhohen vehvotsiy otah el-michuts lamachaneh veshachat otah lefanayv

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֞ח אֶלְעָזָ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן מִדָּמָ֖הּ בְּאֶצְבָּע֑וֹ וְהִזָּ֞ה אֶל־נֹ֨כַח פְּנֵ֧י אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֛ד מִדָּמָ֖הּ שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִֽים׃
Translated: Eleazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger and sprinkle it seven times toward the front of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: velakach eleazar hakhohen midamah veetsevavo vehizah el-nokhach feney ohel-mvoed midamah sheva feamiym

Hebrew: וְשָׂרַ֥ף אֶת־הַפָּרָ֖ה לְעֵינָ֑יו אֶת־עֹרָ֤הּ וְאֶת־בְּשָׂרָהּ֙ וְאֶת־דָּמָ֔הּ עַל־פִּרְשָׁ֖הּ יִשְׂרֹֽף׃
Translated: The cow shall be burned in his sight—its hide, flesh, and blood shall be burned, its dung included—
Transliteration: vesharaf et-hafarah leeynayv et-orah veet-vesharah veet-damah al-fireshah yisherof

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֣ח הַכֹּהֵ֗ן עֵ֥ץ אֶ֛רֶז וְאֵז֖וֹב וּשְׁנִ֣י תוֹלָ֑עַת וְהִשְׁלִ֕יךְ אֶל־תּ֖וֹךְ שְׂרֵפַ֥ת הַפָּרָֽה׃
Translated: and the priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson stuff, and throw them into the fire consuming the cow.
Transliteration: velakach hakhohen ets erez veezvov usheniy tvolaat vehisheliykhe el-tvokhe sherefat hafarah

Hebrew: וְכִבֶּ֨ס בְּגָדָ֜יו הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וְרָחַ֤ץ בְּשָׂרוֹ֙ בַּמַּ֔יִם וְאַחַ֖ר יָבֹ֣א אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה וְטָמֵ֥א הַכֹּהֵ֖ן עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: The priest shall wash his garments and bathe his body in water; after that the priest may reenter the camp, but he shall be impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhives vegadayv hakhohen verachats vesharvo vamayiim veachar yavo el-hamachaneh vetame hakhohen ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְהַשֹּׂרֵ֣ף אֹתָ֔הּ יְכַבֵּ֤ס בְּגָדָיו֙ בַּמַּ֔יִם וְרָחַ֥ץ בְּשָׂר֖וֹ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְטָמֵ֖א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: The one who performed the burning shall also wash those garments in water, bathe in water, and be impure until evening.
Transliteration: vehashoref otah yekhaves vegadayv vamayiim verachats vesharvo vamayiim vetame ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְאָסַ֣ף ׀ אִ֣ישׁ טָה֗וֹר אֵ֚ת אֵ֣פֶר הַפָּרָ֔ה וְהִנִּ֛יחַ מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה בְּמָק֣וֹם טָה֑וֹר וְ֠הָיְתָ֠ה לַעֲדַ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל לְמִשְׁמֶ֛רֶת לְמֵ֥י נִדָּ֖ה חַטָּ֥את הִֽוא׃
Translated: Another party who is pure shall gather up the ashes of the cow and deposit them outside the camp in a pure place, to be kept for water of lustration for the Israelite community. It is for purgation.
Transliteration: veasaf iysh tahvor et efer hafarah vehiniycha michuts lamachaneh vemakvom tahvor vehayetah laadat veney-yisherael lemishemeret lemey nidah chatat hiv

Hebrew: וְ֠כִבֶּ֠ס הָאֹסֵ֨ף אֶת־אֵ֤פֶר הַפָּרָה֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְטָמֵ֖א עַד־הָעָ֑רֶב וְֽהָיְתָ֞ה לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְלַגֵּ֛ר הַגָּ֥ר בְּתוֹכָ֖ם לְחֻקַּ֥ת עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: The one who gathers up the ashes of the cow shall also wash those clothes and be impure until evening. This shall be a permanent law for the Israelites and for the strangers who reside among them.
Transliteration: vekhives haosef et-efer hafarah et-vegadayv vetame ad-haarev vehayetah liveney yisherael velager hagar vetvokham lechukat volam

Hebrew: הַנֹּגֵ֥עַ בְּמֵ֖ת לְכׇל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֑ם וְטָמֵ֖א שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: Those who touch the corpse of any human being shall be impure for seven days.
Transliteration: hanogea vemet lekhׇl-nefesh adam vetame shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: ה֣וּא יִתְחַטָּא־ב֞וֹ בַּיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֛י וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י יִטְהָ֑ר וְאִם־לֹ֨א יִתְחַטָּ֜א בַּיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֛י וּבַיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י לֹ֥א יִטְהָֽר׃
Translated: They shall purify themselves with [the ashes] on the third day and on the seventh day, and then be pure; if they fail to purify themselves on the third and seventh days, they shall not be pure.
Transliteration: hu yitechata-vvo vayyvom hasheliyshiy uvayyvom hasheviyiy yitehar veim-lo yitechata vayyvom hasheliyshiy uvayyvom hasheviyiy lo yitehar

Hebrew: כׇּֽל־הַנֹּגֵ֡עַ בְּמֵ֣ת בְּנֶ֩פֶשׁ֩ הָאָדָ֨ם אֲשֶׁר־יָמ֜וּת וְלֹ֣א יִתְחַטָּ֗א אֶת־מִשְׁכַּ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ טִמֵּ֔א וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּי֩ מֵ֨י נִדָּ֜ה לֹא־זֹרַ֤ק עָלָיו֙ טָמֵ֣א יִהְיֶ֔ה ע֖וֹד טֻמְאָת֥וֹ בֽוֹ׃
Translated: Those who touch a corpse, the body of a person who has died, and do not purify themselves, defile יהוה’s Tabernacle; those persons shall be cut off from Israel. Since the water of lustration was not dashed on them, they remain impure; their impurity is still upon them.
Transliteration: khׇl-hanogea vemet venefesh haadam asher-yamut velo yitechata et-mishekhan yehovah time venikheretah hanefesh hahiv miyisherael khiy mey nidah lo-zorak alayv tame yiheyeh vod tumeatvo vvo

Hebrew: זֹ֚את הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אָדָ֖ם כִּֽי־יָמ֣וּת בְּאֹ֑הֶל כׇּל־הַבָּ֤א אֶל־הָאֹ֙הֶל֙ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּאֹ֔הֶל יִטְמָ֖א שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: This is the ritual: When a person dies in a tent, whoever enters the tent and whoever is in the tent shall be impure seven days;
Transliteration: zot hatvorah adam khiy-yamut veohel khׇl-hava el-haohel vekhׇl-asher vaohel yitema shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ כְּלִ֣י פָת֔וּחַ אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֵין־צָמִ֥יד פָּתִ֖יל עָלָ֑יו טָמֵ֖א הֽוּא׃
Translated: and every open vessel, with no lid fastened down, shall be impure.
Transliteration: vekhol kheliy fatucha asher eyn-tsamiyd fatiyl alayv tame hu

Hebrew: וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּ֜ע עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה בַּֽחֲלַל־חֶ֙רֶב֙ א֣וֹ בְמֵ֔ת אֽוֹ־בְעֶ֥צֶם אָדָ֖ם א֣וֹ בְקָ֑בֶר יִטְמָ֖א שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: And in the open, anyone who touches a person who was killed or who died naturally, or human bone, or a grave, shall be impure seven days.
Transliteration: vekhol asher-yiga al-feney hashadeh vachalal-cherev vo vemet vo-veetsem adam vo vekaver yitema shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְלָֽקְחוּ֙ לַטָּמֵ֔א מֵעֲפַ֖ר שְׂרֵפַ֣ת הַֽחַטָּ֑את וְנָתַ֥ן עָלָ֛יו מַ֥יִם חַיִּ֖ים אֶל־כֶּֽלִי׃
Translated: Some of the ashes from the fire of purgation shall be taken for the impure person, and fresh water shall be added to them in a vessel.
Transliteration: velakechu latame meafar sherefat hachatat venatan alayv mayiim chayiym el-kheliy

Hebrew: וְלָקַ֨ח אֵז֜וֹב וְטָבַ֣ל בַּמַּ֘יִם֮ אִ֣ישׁ טָהוֹר֒ וְהִזָּ֤ה עַל־הָאֹ֙הֶל֙ וְעַל־כׇּל־הַכֵּלִ֔ים וְעַל־הַנְּפָשׁ֖וֹת אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָֽיוּ־שָׁ֑ם וְעַל־הַנֹּגֵ֗עַ בַּעֶ֙צֶם֙ א֣וֹ בֶֽחָלָ֔ל א֥וֹ בַמֵּ֖ת א֥וֹ בַקָּֽבֶר׃
Translated: Another party who is pure shall take hyssop, dip it in the water, and sprinkle on the tent and on all the vessels and people who were there, or on the one who touched the bones or the person who was killed or died naturally or the grave.
Transliteration: velakach ezvov vetaval vamayiim iysh tahvor vehizah al-haohel veal-khׇl-hakheliym veal-hanefashvot asher hayu-sham veal-hanogea vaetsem vo vechalal vo vamet vo vakaver

Hebrew: וְהִזָּ֤ה הַטָּהֹר֙ עַל־הַטָּמֵ֔א בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֖י וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֑י וְחִטְּאוֹ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י וְכִבֶּ֧ס בְּגָדָ֛יו וְרָחַ֥ץ בַּמַּ֖יִם וְטָהֵ֥ר בָּעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: The pure person shall sprinkle it upon the impure person on the third day and on the seventh day, thus purifying that person by the seventh day. [The one being purified] shall then wash those clothes and bathe in water—and at nightfall shall be pure.
Transliteration: vehizah hatahor al-hatame vayyvom hasheliyshiy uvayyvom hasheviyiy vechitevo vayyvom hasheviyiy vekhives vegadayv verachats vamayiim vetaher vaarev

Hebrew: וְאִ֤ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יִטְמָא֙ וְלֹ֣א יִתְחַטָּ֔א וְנִכְרְתָ֛ה הַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַהִ֖וא מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַקָּהָ֑ל כִּי֩ אֶת־מִקְדַּ֨שׁ יְהֹוָ֜ה טִמֵּ֗א מֵ֥י נִדָּ֛ה לֹא־זֹרַ֥ק עָלָ֖יו טָמֵ֥א הֽוּא׃
Translated: If any party who has become impure fails to undergo purification, that person shall be cut off from the congregation for having defiled יהוה’s sanctuary. The water of lustration was not dashed on that person, who is impure.
Transliteration: veiysh asher-yitema velo yitechata venikheretah hanefesh hahiv mitvokhe hakahal khiy et-mikedash yehovah time mey nidah lo-zorak alayv tame hu

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם לְחֻקַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם וּמַזֵּ֤ה מֵֽי־הַנִּדָּה֙ יְכַבֵּ֣ס בְּגָדָ֔יו וְהַנֹּגֵ֙עַ֙ בְּמֵ֣י הַנִּדָּ֔ה יִטְמָ֖א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: That shall be for them a law for all time. Further, the one who sprinkled the water of lustration shall wash those clothes; and whoever touches the water of lustration shall be impure until evening.
Transliteration: vehayetah lahem lechukat volam umazeh mey-hanidah yekhaves vegadayv vehanogea vemey hanidah yitema ad-haarev

Hebrew: וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יִגַּע־בּ֥וֹ הַטָּמֵ֖א יִטְמָ֑א וְהַנֶּ֥פֶשׁ הַנֹּגַ֖עַת תִּטְמָ֥א עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃ {פ}
Translated: Whatever that impure person touches shall be impure; and the person who touches the impure one shall be impure until evening.
Transliteration: vekhol asher-yiga-vvo hatame yitema vehanefesh hanogaat titema ad-haarev {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל כׇּל־הָ֨עֵדָ֤ה מִדְבַּר־צִן֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב הָעָ֖ם בְּקָדֵ֑שׁ וַתָּ֤מׇת שָׁם֙ מִרְיָ֔ם וַתִּקָּבֵ֖ר שָֽׁם׃
Translated: The Israelites arrived in a body at the wilderness of Zin on the first new moon, and the people stayed at Kadesh. Miriam died there and was buried there.
Transliteration: vayavou veney-yisherael khׇl-haedah midevar-tsin vachodesh harishvon vayeshev haam vekadesh vatamׇt sham mireyam vatikaver sham

Hebrew: וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה מַ֖יִם לָעֵדָ֑ה וַיִּקָּ֣הֲל֔וּ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated: The community was without water, and they joined against Moses and Aaron.
Transliteration: velo-hayah mayiim laedah vayikahalu al-mosheh veal-aharon

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥רֶב הָעָ֖ם עִם־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לֵאמֹ֔ר וְל֥וּ גָוַ֛עְנוּ בִּגְוַ֥ע אַחֵ֖ינוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The people quarreled with Moses, saying, “If only we had perished when our brothers perished at the instance of יהוה !
Transliteration: vayarev haam im-mosheh vayomeru lemor velu gavaenu vigeva acheynu lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְלָמָ֤ה הֲבֵאתֶם֙ אֶת־קְהַ֣ל יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר הַזֶּ֑ה לָמ֣וּת שָׁ֔ם אֲנַ֖חְנוּ וּבְעִירֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: Why have you brought יהוה’s congregation into this wilderness for us and our beasts to die there?
Transliteration: velamah havetem et-kehal yehovah el-hamidevar hazeh lamut sham anachenu uveiyrenu

Hebrew: וְלָמָ֤ה הֶֽעֱלִיתֻ֙נוּ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לְהָבִ֣יא אֹתָ֔נוּ אֶל־הַמָּק֥וֹם הָרָ֖ע הַזֶּ֑ה לֹ֣א ׀ מְק֣וֹם זֶ֗רַע וּתְאֵנָ֤ה וְגֶ֙פֶן֙ וְרִמּ֔וֹן וּמַ֥יִם אַ֖יִן לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃
Translated: Why did you make us leave Egypt to bring us to this wretched place, a place with no grain or figs or vines or pomegranates? There is not even water to drink!”
Transliteration: velamah heeliytunu mimitserayiim lehaviy otanu el-hamakvom hara hazeh lo mekvom zera uteenah vegefen verimvon umayiim ayiin lishetvot

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה וְאַהֲרֹ֜ן מִפְּנֵ֣י הַקָּהָ֗ל אֶל־פֶּ֙תַח֙ אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ עַל־פְּנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיֵּרָ֥א כְבוֹד־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֲלֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Moses and Aaron came away from the congregation to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and fell on their faces. The Presence of יהוה appeared to them,
Transliteration: vayavo mosheh veaharon mifeney hakahal el-fetach ohel mvoed vayifelu al-feneyhem vayera khevvod-yehovah aleyhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: and יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: קַ֣ח אֶת־הַמַּטֶּ֗ה וְהַקְהֵ֤ל אֶת־הָעֵדָה֙ אַתָּה֙ וְאַהֲרֹ֣ן אָחִ֔יךָ וְדִבַּרְתֶּ֧ם אֶל־הַסֶּ֛לַע לְעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם וְנָתַ֣ן מֵימָ֑יו וְהוֹצֵאתָ֨ לָהֶ֥ם מַ֙יִם֙ מִן־הַסֶּ֔לַע וְהִשְׁקִיתָ֥ אֶת־הָעֵדָ֖ה וְאֶת־בְּעִירָֽם׃
Translated: “You and your brother Aaron take the rod and assemble the community, and before their very eyes order the rock to yield its water. Thus you shall produce water for them from the rock and provide drink for the congregation and their beasts.”
Transliteration: kach et-hamateh vehakehel et-haedah atah veaharon achiykha vedivaretem el-hasela leeyneyhem venatan meymayv vehvotseta lahem mayiim min-hasela vehishekiyta et-haedah veet-veiyram

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־הַמַּטֶּ֖ה מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּֽהוּ׃
Translated: Moses took the rod from before יהוה, as he had been commanded.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh et-hamateh milifeney yehovah khaasher tsivahu

Hebrew: וַיַּקְהִ֜לוּ מֹשֶׁ֧ה וְאַהֲרֹ֛ן אֶת־הַקָּהָ֖ל אֶל־פְּנֵ֣י הַסָּ֑לַע וַיֹּ֣אמֶר לָהֶ֗ם שִׁמְעוּ־נָא֙ הַמֹּרִ֔ים הֲמִן־הַסֶּ֣לַע הַזֶּ֔ה נוֹצִ֥יא לָכֶ֖ם מָֽיִם׃
Translated: Moses and Aaron assembled the congregation in front of the rock; and he said to them, “Listen, you rebels, shall we get water for you out of this rock?”
Transliteration: vayakehilu mosheh veaharon et-hakahal el-feney hasala vayomer lahem shimeu-na hamoriym hamin-hasela hazeh nvotsiy lakhem mayiim

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨רֶם מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־יָד֗וֹ וַיַּ֧ךְ אֶת־הַסֶּ֛לַע בְּמַטֵּ֖הוּ פַּעֲמָ֑יִם וַיֵּצְאוּ֙ מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֔ים וַתֵּ֥שְׁתְּ הָעֵדָ֖ה וּבְעִירָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: And Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his rod. Out came copious water, and the community and their beasts drank.
Transliteration: vayarem mosheh et-yadvo vayakhe et-hasela vematehu faamayiim vayetseu mayiim raviym vateshete haedah uveiyram {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹן֒ יַ֚עַן לֹא־הֶאֱמַנְתֶּ֣ם בִּ֔י לְהַ֨קְדִּישֵׁ֔נִי לְעֵינֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לָכֵ֗ן לֹ֤א תָבִ֙יאוּ֙ אֶת־הַקָּהָ֣ל הַזֶּ֔ה אֶל־הָאָ֖רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥תִּי לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: But יהוה said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not trust Me enough to affirm My sanctity in the sight of the Israelite people, therefore you shall not lead this congregation into the land that I have given them.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon yaan lo-heemanetem viy lehakediysheniy leeyney veney yisherael lakhen lo taviyu et-hakahal hazeh el-haarets asher-natatiy lahem

Hebrew: הֵ֚מָּה מֵ֣י מְרִיבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־רָב֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיִּקָּדֵ֖שׁ בָּֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the Waters of Meribah —meaning that the Israelites quarrelled with יהוה —whose sanctity was affirmed through them.
Transliteration: hemah mey meriyvah asher-ravu veney-yisherael et-yehovah vayikadesh vam {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֧ה מַלְאָכִ֛ים מִקָּדֵ֖שׁ אֶל־מֶ֣לֶךְ אֱד֑וֹם כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אָחִ֣יךָ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֔עְתָּ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַתְּלָאָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר מְצָאָֽתְנוּ׃
Translated: From Kadesh, Moses sent messengers to the king of Edom: “Thus says your brother Israel: You know all the hardships that have befallen us;
Transliteration: vayishelach mosheh maleakhiym mikadesh el-melekhe edvom khoh amar achiykha yisherael atah yadaeta et khׇl-hatelaah asher metsaatenu

Hebrew: וַיֵּרְד֤וּ אֲבֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ מִצְרַ֔יְמָה וַנֵּ֥שֶׁב בְּמִצְרַ֖יִם יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים וַיָּרֵ֥עוּ לָ֛נוּ מִצְרַ֖יִם וְלַאֲבֹתֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: that our ancestors went down to Egypt, that we dwelt in Egypt a long time, and that the Egyptians dealt harshly with us and our ancestors.
Transliteration: vayeredu avoteynu mitserayemah vaneshev vemitserayiim yamiym raviym vayareu lanu mitserayiim velaavoteynu

Hebrew: וַנִּצְעַ֤ק אֶל־יְהֹוָה֙ וַיִּשְׁמַ֣ע קֹלֵ֔נוּ וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח מַלְאָ֔ךְ וַיֹּצִאֵ֖נוּ מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וְהִנֵּה֙ אֲנַ֣חְנוּ בְקָדֵ֔שׁ עִ֖יר קְצֵ֥ה גְבוּלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: We cried to יהוה who heard our plea, sending a messenger who freed us from Egypt. Now we are in Kadesh, the town on the border of your territory.
Transliteration: vanitseak el-yehovah vayishema kolenu vayishelach maleakhe vayotsienu mimitserayiim vehineh anachenu vekadesh iyr ketseh gevulekha

Hebrew: נַעְבְּרָה־נָּ֣א בְאַרְצֶ֗ךָ לֹ֤א נַעֲבֹר֙ בְּשָׂדֶ֣ה וּבְכֶ֔רֶם וְלֹ֥א נִשְׁתֶּ֖ה מֵ֣י בְאֵ֑ר דֶּ֧רֶךְ הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ נֵלֵ֗ךְ לֹ֤א נִטֶּה֙ יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֔אול עַ֥ד אֲשֶֽׁר־נַעֲבֹ֖ר גְּבֻלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Allow us, then, to cross your country. We will not pass through fields or vineyards, and we will not drink water from wells. We will follow the king’s highway, turning off neither to the right nor to the left until we have crossed your territory.”
Transliteration: naeverah-na vearetsekha lo naavor veshadeh uvekherem velo nisheteh mey veer derekhe hamelekhe nelekhe lo niteh yamiyn ushemovl ad asher-naavor gevulekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ אֱד֔וֹם לֹ֥א תַעֲבֹ֖ר בִּ֑י פֶּן־בַּחֶ֖רֶב אֵצֵ֥א לִקְרָאתֶֽךָ׃
Translated: But Edom answered him, “You shall not pass through us, else we will go out against you with the sword.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv edvom lo taavor viy fen-vacherev etse likeratekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֵלָ֥יו בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ בַּֽמְסִלָּ֣ה נַעֲלֶה֒ וְאִם־מֵימֶ֤יךָ נִשְׁתֶּה֙ אֲנִ֣י וּמִקְנַ֔י וְנָתַתִּ֖י מִכְרָ֑ם רַ֥ק אֵין־דָּבָ֖ר בְּרַגְלַ֥י אֶֽעֱבֹֽרָה׃
Translated: “We will keep to the beaten track,” the Israelites said to them, “and if we or our cattle drink your water, we will pay for it. We ask only for passage on foot—it is but a small matter.”
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv veney-yisherael vamesilah naaleh veim-meymeykha nisheteh aniy umikenay venatatiy mikheram rak eyn-davar veragelay eevorah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֹ֣א תַעֲבֹ֑ר וַיֵּצֵ֤א אֱדוֹם֙ לִקְרָאת֔וֹ בְּעַ֥ם כָּבֵ֖ד וּבְיָ֥ד חֲזָקָֽה׃
Translated: But they replied, “You shall not pass through!” And Edom went out against them in heavy force, strongly armed.
Transliteration: vayomer lo taavor vayetse edvom likeratvo veam khaved uveyad chazakah

Hebrew: וַיְמָאֵ֣ן ׀ אֱד֗וֹם נְתֹן֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עֲבֹ֖ר בִּגְבֻל֑וֹ וַיֵּ֥ט יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵעָלָֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: So Edom would not let Israel cross their territory, and Israel turned away from them.
Transliteration: vayemaen edvom neton et-yisherael avor vigevulvo vayet yisherael mealayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִקָּדֵ֑שׁ וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל כׇּל־הָעֵדָ֖ה הֹ֥ר הָהָֽר׃
Translated: Setting out from Kadesh, the Israelites arrived in a body at Mount Hor.
Transliteration: vayiseu mikadesh vayavou veney-yisherael khׇl-haedah hor hahar

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאֶֽל־אַהֲרֹ֖ן בְּהֹ֣ר הָהָ֑ר עַל־גְּב֥וּל אֶֽרֶץ־אֱד֖וֹם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: At Mount Hor, on the boundary of the land of Edom, יהוה said to Moses and Aaron,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh veel-aharon vehor hahar al-gevul erets-edvom lemor

Hebrew: יֵאָסֵ֤ף אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶל־עַמָּ֔יו כִּ֣י לֹ֤א יָבֹא֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־מְרִיתֶ֥ם אֶת־פִּ֖י לְמֵ֥י מְרִיבָֽה׃
Translated: “Let Aaron be gathered to his kin: he is not to enter the land that I have assigned to the Israelite people, because you disobeyed My command about the Waters of Meribah.
Transliteration: eiasef aharon el-amayv khiy lo yavo el-haarets asher natatiy liveney yisherael al asher-meriytem et-fiy lemey meriyvah

Hebrew: קַ֚ח אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֔ן וְאֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֖ר בְּנ֑וֹ וְהַ֥עַל אֹתָ֖ם הֹ֥ר הָהָֽר׃
Translated: Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up on Mount Hor.
Transliteration: kach et-aharon veet-eleazar venvo vehaal otam hor hahar

Hebrew: וְהַפְשֵׁ֤ט אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ אֶת־בְּגָדָ֔יו וְהִלְבַּשְׁתָּ֖ם אֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֣ר בְּנ֑וֹ וְאַהֲרֹ֥ן יֵאָסֵ֖ף וּמֵ֥ת שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Strip Aaron of his vestments and put them on his son Eleazar. There Aaron shall be gathered unto the dead.”
Transliteration: vehafeshet et-aharon et-vegadayv vehilevashetam et-eleazar venvo veaharon eiasef umet sham

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה וַֽיַּעֲלוּ֙ אֶל־הֹ֣ר הָהָ֔ר לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: Moses did as יהוה had commanded. They ascended Mount Hor in the sight of the whole community.
Transliteration: vayaash mosheh khaasher tsivah yehovah vayaalu el-hor hahar leeyney khׇl-haedah

Hebrew: וַיַּפְשֵׁט֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹ֜ן אֶת־בְּגָדָ֗יו וַיַּלְבֵּ֤שׁ אֹתָם֙ אֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֣ר בְּנ֔וֹ וַיָּ֧מׇת אַהֲרֹ֛ן שָׁ֖ם בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֑ר וַיֵּ֧רֶד מֹשֶׁ֛ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֖ר מִן־הָהָֽר׃
Translated: Moses stripped Aaron of his vestments and put them on his son Eleazar, and Aaron died there on the summit of the mountain. When Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain,
Transliteration: vayafeshet mosheh et-aharon et-vegadayv vayalevesh otam et-eleazar venvo vayamׇt aharon sham verosh hahar vayered mosheh veeleazar min-hahar

Hebrew: וַיִּרְאוּ֙ כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה כִּ֥י גָוַ֖ע אַהֲרֹ֑ן וַיִּבְכּ֤וּ אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ שְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים י֔וֹם כֹּ֖ל בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: the whole community knew that Aaron had breathed his last. All the house of Israel bewailed Aaron thirty days.
Transliteration: vayireu khׇl-haedah khiy gava aharon vayivekhu et-aharon sheloshiym yvom khol veyt yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֞ע הַכְּנַעֲנִ֤י מֶֽלֶךְ־עֲרָד֙ יֹשֵׁ֣ב הַנֶּ֔גֶב כִּ֚י בָּ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל דֶּ֖רֶךְ הָאֲתָרִ֑ים וַיִּלָּ֙חֶם֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּ֥שְׁבְּ <small>׀</small> מִמֶּ֖נּוּ שֶֽׁבִי׃
Translated: When the Canaanite, king of Arad, who dwelt in the Negeb, learned that Israel was coming by the way of Atharim, he engaged Israel in battle and took some of them captive.
Transliteration: vayishema hakhenaaniy melekhe-arad yoshev hanegev khiy va yisherael derekhe haatariym vayilachem veyisherael vayisheve <small></small> mimenu sheviy

Hebrew: וַיִּדַּ֨ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל נֶ֛דֶר לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אִם־נָתֹ֨ן תִּתֵּ֜ן אֶת־הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ בְּיָדִ֔י וְהַֽחֲרַמְתִּ֖י אֶת־עָרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Then Israel made a vow to יהוה and said, “If You deliver this people into our hand, we will proscribe their towns.”
Transliteration: vayidar yisherael neder layhovah vayomar im-naton titen et-haam hazeh veyadiy vehacharametiy et-areyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֨ע יְהֹוָ֜ה בְּק֣וֹל יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיִּתֵּן֙ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י וַיַּחֲרֵ֥ם אֶתְהֶ֖ם וְאֶת־עָרֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֥א שֵׁם־הַמָּק֖וֹם חׇרְמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: יהוה heeded Israel’s plea and delivered up the Canaanites; and they and their cities were proscribed. So that place was named Hormah.
Transliteration: vayishema yehovah vekvol yisherael vayiten et-hakhenaaniy vayacharem etehem veet-areyhem vayikera shem-hamakvom chׇremah {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֞וּ מֵהֹ֤ר הָהָר֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ יַם־ס֔וּף לִסְבֹ֖ב אֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ אֱד֑וֹם וַתִּקְצַ֥ר נֶֽפֶשׁ־הָעָ֖ם בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: They set out from Mount Hor by way of the Sea of Reeds to skirt the land of Edom. But the people grew restive on the journey,
Transliteration: vayiseu mehor hahar derekhe yam-suf lisevov et-erets edvom vatiketsar nefesh-haam vadarekhe

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר הָעָ֗ם בֵּֽאלֹהִים֮ וּבְמֹשֶׁה֒ לָמָ֤ה הֶֽעֱלִיתֻ֙נוּ֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם לָמ֖וּת בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין לֶ֙חֶם֙ וְאֵ֣ין מַ֔יִם וְנַפְשֵׁ֣נוּ קָ֔צָה בַּלֶּ֖חֶם הַקְּלֹקֵֽל׃
Translated: and the people spoke against God and against Moses, “Why did you make us leave Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no bread and no water, and we have come to loathe this miserable food.”
Transliteration: vayedaver haam velohiym uvemosheh lamah heeliytunu mimitserayiim lamut vamidevar khiy eyn lechem veeyn mayiim venafeshenu katsah valechem hakelokel

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֨ח יְהֹוָ֜ה בָּעָ֗ם אֵ֚ת הַנְּחָשִׁ֣ים הַשְּׂרָפִ֔ים וַֽיְנַשְּׁכ֖וּ אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיָּ֥מׇת עַם־רָ֖ב מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: יהוה sent seraph serpents against the people. They bit the people and many of the Israelites died.
Transliteration: vayeshalach yehovah vaam et hanechashiym hasherafiym vayenashekhu et-haam vayamׇt am-rav miyisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹא֩ הָעָ֨ם אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֜ה וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ חָטָ֗אנוּ כִּֽי־דִבַּ֤רְנוּ בַֽיהֹוָה֙ וָבָ֔ךְ הִתְפַּלֵּל֙ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְיָסֵ֥ר מֵעָלֵ֖ינוּ אֶת־הַנָּחָ֑שׁ וַיִּתְפַּלֵּ֥ל מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּעַ֥ד הָעָֽם׃
Translated: The people came to Moses and said, “We sinned by speaking against יהוה and against you. Intercede with יהוה to take away the serpents from us!” And Moses interceded for the people.
Transliteration: vayavo haam el-mosheh vayomeru chatanu khiy-divarenu vayhovah vavakhe hitefalel el-yehovah veyaser mealeynu et-hanachash vayitefalel mosheh vead haam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה עֲשֵׂ֤ה לְךָ֙ שָׂרָ֔ף וְשִׂ֥ים אֹת֖וֹ עַל־נֵ֑ס וְהָיָה֙ כׇּל־הַנָּשׁ֔וּךְ וְרָאָ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ וָחָֽי׃
Translated: Then יהוה said to Moses, “Make a seraph figure and mount it on a standard. And anyone who was bitten who then looks at it shall recover.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh asheh lekha sharaf veshiym otvo al-nes vehayah khׇl-hanashukhe veraah otvo vachay

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ מֹשֶׁה֙ נְחַ֣שׁ נְחֹ֔שֶׁת וַיְשִׂמֵ֖הוּ עַל־הַנֵּ֑ס וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־נָשַׁ֤ךְ הַנָּחָשׁ֙ אֶת־אִ֔ישׁ וְהִבִּ֛יט אֶל־נְחַ֥שׁ הַנְּחֹ֖שֶׁת וָחָֽי׃
Translated: Moses made a copper serpent and mounted it on a standard; and when bitten by a serpent, anyone who looked at the copper serpent would recover.
Transliteration: vayaash mosheh nechash nechoshet vayeshimehu al-hanes vehayah im-nashakhe hanachash et-iysh vehiviyt el-nechash hanechoshet vachay

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּאֹבֹֽת׃
Translated: The Israelites marched on and encamped at Oboth.
Transliteration: vayiseu veney yisherael vayachanu veovot

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵאֹבֹ֑ת וַֽיַּחֲנ֞וּ בְּעִיֵּ֣י הָֽעֲבָרִ֗ים בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב מִמִּזְרַ֖ח הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: They set out from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim, in the wilderness bordering on Moab to the east.
Transliteration: vayiseu meovot vayachanu veiyey haavariym vamidevar asher al-feney mvoav mimizerach hashamesh

Hebrew: מִשָּׁ֖ם נָסָ֑עוּ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּנַ֥חַל זָֽרֶד׃
Translated: From there they set out and encamped at the wadi Zered.
Transliteration: misham nasau vayachanu venachal zared

Hebrew: מִשָּׁם֮ נָסָ֒עוּ֒ וַֽיַּחֲנ֗וּ מֵעֵ֤בֶר אַרְנוֹן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר הַיֹּצֵ֖א מִגְּבֻ֣ל הָֽאֱמֹרִ֑י כִּ֤י אַרְנוֹן֙ גְּב֣וּל מוֹאָ֔ב בֵּ֥ין מוֹאָ֖ב וּבֵ֥ין הָאֱמֹרִֽי׃
Translated: From there they set out and encamped beyond the Arnon, that is, in the wilderness that extends from the territory of the Amorites. For the Arnon is the boundary of Moab, between Moab and the Amorites.
Transliteration: misham nasau vayachanu meever arenvon asher vamidevar hayotse migevul haemoriy khiy arenvon gevul mvoav veyn mvoav uveyn haemoriy

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּן֙ יֵֽאָמַ֔ר בְּסֵ֖פֶר מִלְחֲמֹ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶת־וָהֵ֣ב בְּסוּפָ֔ה וְאֶת־הַנְּחָלִ֖ים אַרְנֽוֹן׃
Translated: Therefore the Book of the Wars of יהוה speaks of “…Waheb in Suphah, and the wadis: the Arnon
Transliteration: al-khen eiamar vesefer milechamot yehovah et-vahev vesufah veet-hanechaliym arenvon

Hebrew: וְאֶ֙שֶׁד֙ הַנְּחָלִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָטָ֖ה לְשֶׁ֣בֶת עָ֑ר וְנִשְׁעַ֖ן לִגְב֥וּל מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: with its tributary wadis, stretched along the settled country of Ar, hugging the territory of Moab…”
Transliteration: veeshed hanechaliym asher natah leshevet ar venishean ligevul mvoav

Hebrew: וּמִשָּׁ֖ם בְּאֵ֑רָה הִ֣וא הַבְּאֵ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ לְמֹשֶׁ֔ה אֱסֹף֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וְאֶתְּנָ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם מָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: And from there to Beer, which is the well where יהוה said to Moses, “Assemble the people that I may give them water.”
Transliteration: umisham veerah hiv haveer asher amar yehovah lemosheh esof et-haam veetenah lahem mayiim {s}

Hebrew: אָ֚ז יָשִׁ֣יר יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־הַשִּׁירָ֖ה הַזֹּ֑את עֲלִ֥י בְאֵ֖ר עֱנוּ־לָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Then Israel sang this song:
Spring up, O well—sing to it—
Transliteration: az yashiyr yisherael et-hashiyrah hazot aliy veer enu-lah

Hebrew: בְּאֵ֞ר חֲפָר֣וּהָ שָׂרִ֗ים כָּר֙וּהָ֙ נְדִיבֵ֣י הָעָ֔ם בִּמְחֹקֵ֖ק בְּמִשְׁעֲנֹתָ֑ם וּמִמִּדְבָּ֖ר מַתָּנָֽה׃
Translated:
The well which the chieftains dug,
Which the nobles of the people started
With maces, with their own staffs. And from Midbar to Mattanah,
Transliteration: veer chafaruha shariym kharuha nediyvey haam vimechokek vemisheanotam umimidevar matanah

Hebrew: וּמִמַּתָּנָ֖ה נַחֲלִיאֵ֑ל וּמִנַּחֲלִיאֵ֖ל בָּמֽוֹת׃
Translated: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
Transliteration: umimatanah nachaliyel uminachaliyel vamvot

Hebrew: וּמִבָּמ֗וֹת הַגַּיְא֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ בִּשְׂדֵ֣ה מוֹאָ֔ב רֹ֖אשׁ הַפִּסְגָּ֑ה וְנִשְׁקָ֖פָה עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַיְשִׁימֹֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: and from Bamoth to the valley that is in the country of Moab, at the peak of Pisgah, overlooking the wasteland.
Transliteration: umivamvot hagaye asher vishedeh mvoav rosh hafisegah venishekafah al-feney hayeshiymon {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים אֶל־סִיחֹ֥ן מֶֽלֶךְ־הָאֱמֹרִ֖י לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Israel now sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
Transliteration: vayishelach yisherael maleakhiym el-siychon melekhe-haemoriy lemor

Hebrew: אֶעְבְּרָ֣ה בְאַרְצֶ֗ךָ לֹ֤א נִטֶּה֙ בְּשָׂדֶ֣ה וּבְכֶ֔רֶם לֹ֥א נִשְׁתֶּ֖ה מֵ֣י בְאֵ֑ר בְּדֶ֤רֶךְ הַמֶּ֙לֶךְ֙ נֵלֵ֔ךְ עַ֥ד אֲשֶֽׁר־נַעֲבֹ֖ר גְּבֻלֶֽךָ׃
Translated: “Let me pass through your country. We will not turn off into fields or vineyards, and we will not drink water from wells. We will follow the king’s highway until we have crossed your territory.”
Transliteration: eeverah vearetsekha lo niteh veshadeh uvekherem lo nisheteh mey veer vederekhe hamelekhe nelekhe ad asher-naavor gevulekha

Hebrew: וְלֹא־נָתַ֨ן סִיחֹ֣ן אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ עֲבֹ֣ר בִּגְבֻלוֹ֒ וַיֶּאֱסֹ֨ף סִיחֹ֜ן אֶת־כׇּל־עַמּ֗וֹ וַיֵּצֵ֞א לִקְרַ֤את יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הַמִּדְבָּ֔רָה וַיָּבֹ֖א יָ֑הְצָה וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But Sihon would not let Israel pass through his territory. Sihon gathered all his troops and went out against Israel in the wilderness. He came to Jahaz and engaged Israel in battle.
Transliteration: velo-natan siychon et-yisherael avor vigevulvo vayeesof siychon et-khׇl-amvo vayetse likerat yisherael hamidevarah vayavo yahetsah vayilachem veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֥הוּ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְפִי־חָ֑רֶב וַיִּירַ֨שׁ אֶת־אַרְצ֜וֹ מֵֽאַרְנֹ֗ן עַד־יַבֹּק֙ עַד־בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֔וֹן כִּ֣י עַ֔ז גְּב֖וּל בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: But Israel put them to the sword, and took possession of their land, from the Arnon to the Jabbok, as far as [Az] of the Ammonites, for Az marked the boundary of the Ammonites.
Transliteration: vayakhehu yisherael lefiy-charev vayiyrash et-aretsvo mearenon ad-yavok ad-veney amvon khiy az gevul veney amvon

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּח֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הֶעָרִ֖ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיֵּ֤שֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּכׇל־עָרֵ֣י הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י בְּחֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן וּבְכׇל־בְּנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Israel took all those towns. And Israel settled in all the towns of the Amorites, in Heshbon and all its dependencies.
Transliteration: vayikach yisherael et khׇl-heariym haeleh vayeshev yisherael vekhׇl-arey haemoriy vecheshevvon uvekhׇl-venoteyha

Hebrew: כִּ֣י חֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן עִ֗יר סִיחֹ֛ן מֶ֥לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֖י הִ֑וא וְה֣וּא נִלְחַ֗ם בְּמֶ֤לֶךְ מוֹאָב֙ הָֽרִאשׁ֔וֹן וַיִּקַּ֧ח אֶת־כׇּל־אַרְצ֛וֹ מִיָּד֖וֹ עַד־אַרְנֹֽן׃
Translated: Now Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against a former king of Moab and taken all his land from him as far as the Arnon.
Transliteration: khiy cheshevvon iyr siychon melekhe haemoriy hiv vehu nilecham vemelekhe mvoav harishvon vayikach et-khׇl-aretsvo miyadvo ad-arenon

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֛ן יֹאמְר֥וּ הַמֹּשְׁלִ֖ים בֹּ֣אוּ חֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן תִּבָּנֶ֥ה וְתִכּוֹנֵ֖ן עִ֥יר סִיחֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Therefore the bards would recite:
“Come to Heshbon; firmly built
And well founded is Sihon’s city.
Transliteration: al-khen yomeru hamosheliym vou cheshevvon tivaneh vetikhvonen iyr siychvon

Hebrew: כִּי־אֵשׁ֙ יָֽצְאָ֣ה מֵֽחֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן לֶהָבָ֖ה מִקִּרְיַ֣ת סִיחֹ֑ן אָֽכְלָה֙ עָ֣ר מוֹאָ֔ב בַּעֲלֵ֖י בָּמ֥וֹת אַרְנֹֽן׃
Translated:
For fire went forth from Heshbon,
Flame from Sihon’s city,
Consuming Ar of Moab,
The lords of Bamoth by the Arnon.
Transliteration: khiy-esh yatseah mecheshevvon lehavah mikireyat siychon akhelah ar mvoav vaaley vamvot arenon

Hebrew: אוֹי־לְךָ֣ מוֹאָ֔ב אָבַ֖דְתָּ עַם־כְּמ֑וֹשׁ נָתַ֨ן בָּנָ֤יו פְּלֵיטִם֙ וּבְנֹתָ֣יו בַּשְּׁבִ֔ית לְמֶ֥לֶךְ אֱמֹרִ֖י סִיחֽוֹן׃
Translated:
Woe to you, O Moab!
You are undone, O people of Chemosh!
His sons are rendered fugitive
And his daughters captive
By an Amorite king, Sihon.”
Transliteration: voy-lekha mvoav avadeta am-khemvosh natan vanayv feleytim uvenotayv vasheviyt lemelekhe emoriy siychvon

Hebrew: וַנִּירָ֛ם אָבַ֥ד חֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן עַד־דִּיבֹ֑ן וַנַּשִּׁ֣ים עַד־נֹ֔פַח אֲשֶׁ֖רׄ עַד־מֵֽידְבָֽא׃
Translated:
Yet we have cast them down utterly,
Heshbon along with Dibon;
We have wrought desolation at Nophah,
Which is hard by Medeba.
Transliteration: vaniyram avad cheshevvon ad-diyvon vanashiym ad-nofach asher ad-meydeva

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּאֶ֖רֶץ הָאֱמֹרִֽי׃
Translated: So Israel occupied the land of the Amorites.
Transliteration: vayeshev yisherael veerets haemoriy

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח מֹשֶׁה֙ לְרַגֵּ֣ל אֶת־יַעְזֵ֔ר וַֽיִּלְכְּד֖וּ בְּנֹתֶ֑יהָ (ויירש) [וַיּ֖וֹרֶשׁ] אֶת־הָאֱמֹרִ֥י אֲשֶׁר־שָֽׁם׃
Translated: Then Moses sent to spy out Jazer, and they captured its dependencies and dispossessed the Amorites who were there.
Transliteration: vayishelach mosheh leragel et-yaezer vayilekhedu venoteyha (vyyrsh) [vayyvoresh] et-haemoriy asher-sham

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנוּ֙ וַֽיַּעֲל֔וּ דֶּ֖רֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן וַיֵּצֵ֣א עוֹג֩ מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֨ן לִקְרָאתָ֜ם ה֧וּא וְכׇל־עַמּ֛וֹ לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אֶדְרֶֽעִי׃
Translated: They marched on and went up the road to Bashan, and King Og of Bashan, with all his troops, came out to Edrei to engage them in battle.
Transliteration: vayifenu vayaalu derekhe havashan vayetse vog melekhe-havashan likeratam hu vekhׇl-amvo lamilechamah edereiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ אַל־תִּירָ֣א אֹת֔וֹ כִּ֣י בְיָדְךָ֞ נָתַ֧תִּי אֹת֛וֹ וְאֶת־כׇּל־עַמּ֖וֹ וְאֶת־אַרְצ֑וֹ וְעָשִׂ֣יתָ לּ֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשִׂ֗יתָ לְסִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּֽוֹן׃
Translated: But יהוה said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I give him and all his troops and his land into your hand. You shall do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites who dwelt in Heshbon.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh al-tiyra otvo khiy veyadekha natatiy otvo veet-khׇl-amvo veet-aretsvo veashiyta lvo khaasher ashiyta lesiychon melekhe haemoriy asher yvoshev vecheshevvon

Hebrew: וַיַּכּ֨וּ אֹת֤וֹ וְאֶת־בָּנָיו֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־עַמּ֔וֹ עַד־בִּלְתִּ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ שָׂרִ֑יד וַיִּֽירְשׁ֖וּ אֶת־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: They defeated him and his sons and all his troops, until no remnant was left him; and they took possession of his country.
Transliteration: vayakhu otvo veet-vanayv veet-khׇl-amvo ad-viletiy hisheiyr-lvo shariyd vayiyreshu et-aretsvo

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בְּעַֽרְב֣וֹת מוֹאָ֔ב מֵעֵ֖בֶר לְיַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: The Israelites then marched on and encamped in the steppes of Moab, across the Jordan from Jericho.
Transliteration: vayiseu veney yisherael vayachanu vearevvot mvoav meever leyareden yerechvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥רְא בָּלָ֖ק בֶּן־צִפּ֑וֹר אֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לָֽאֱמֹרִֽי׃
Translated: Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites.
Transliteration: vayare valak ven-tsifvor et khׇl-asher-ashah yisherael laemoriy

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨גׇר מוֹאָ֜ב מִפְּנֵ֥י הָעָ֛ם מְאֹ֖ד כִּ֣י רַב־ה֑וּא וַיָּ֣קׇץ מוֹאָ֔ב מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Moab was alarmed because that people was so numerous. Moab dreaded the Israelites,
Transliteration: vayagׇr mvoav mifeney haam meod khiy rav-hu vayakׇts mvoav mifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מוֹאָ֜ב אֶל־זִקְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן עַתָּ֞ה יְלַחֲכ֤וּ הַקָּהָל֙ אֶת־כׇּל־סְבִ֣יבֹתֵ֔ינוּ כִּלְחֹ֣ךְ הַשּׁ֔וֹר אֵ֖ת יֶ֣רֶק הַשָּׂדֶ֑ה וּבָלָ֧ק בֶּן־צִפּ֛וֹר מֶ֥לֶךְ לְמוֹאָ֖ב בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִֽוא׃
Translated: and Moab said to the elders of Midian, “Now this horde will lick clean all that is about us as an ox licks up the grass of the field.” Balak son of Zippor, who was king of Moab at that time,
Transliteration: vayomer mvoav el-zikeney mideyan atah yelachakhu hakahal et-khׇl-seviyvoteynu khilechokhe hashvor et yerek hashadeh uvalak ven-tsifvor melekhe lemvoav vaet hahiv

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח מַלְאָכִ֜ים אֶל־בִּלְעָ֣ם בֶּן־בְּעֹ֗ר פְּ֠ת֠וֹרָה אֲשֶׁ֧ר עַל־הַנָּהָ֛ר אֶ֥רֶץ בְּנֵי־עַמּ֖וֹ לִקְרֹא־ל֑וֹ לֵאמֹ֗ר הִ֠נֵּ֠ה עַ֣ם יָצָ֤א מִמִּצְרַ֙יִם֙ הִנֵּ֤ה כִסָּה֙ אֶת־עֵ֣ין הָאָ֔רֶץ וְה֥וּא יֹשֵׁ֖ב מִמֻּלִֽי׃
Translated: sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor in Pethor, which is by the Euphrates, in the land of his kinsfolk, to invite him, saying, “There is a people that came out of Egypt; it hides the earth from view, and it is settled next to me.
Transliteration: vayishelach maleakhiym el-vileam ven-veor fetvorah asher al-hanahar erets veney-amvo likero-lvo lemor hineh am yatsa mimitserayiim hineh khisah et-eyn haarets vehu yoshev mimuliy

Hebrew: וְעַתָּה֩ לְכָה־נָּ֨א אָֽרָה־לִּ֜י אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֗ה כִּֽי־עָצ֥וּם הוּא֙ מִמֶּ֔נִּי אוּלַ֤י אוּכַל֙ נַכֶּה־בּ֔וֹ וַאֲגָרְשֶׁ֖נּוּ מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּ֣י יָדַ֗עְתִּי אֵ֤ת אֲשֶׁר־תְּבָרֵךְ֙ מְבֹרָ֔ךְ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר תָּאֹ֖ר יוּאָֽר׃
Translated: Come then, put a curse upon this people for me, since they are too numerous for me; perhaps I can thus defeat them and drive them out of the land. For I know that whomever you bless is blessed indeed, and whomever you curse is cursed.”
Transliteration: veatah lekhah-na arah-liy et-haam hazeh khiy-atsum hu mimeniy ulay ukhal nakheh-vvo vaagareshenu min-haarets khiy yadaetiy et asher-tevarekhe mevorakhe vaasher taor yuar

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ זִקְנֵ֤י מוֹאָב֙ וְזִקְנֵ֣י מִדְיָ֔ן וּקְסָמִ֖ים בְּיָדָ֑ם וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ אֵלָ֖יו דִּבְרֵ֥י בָלָֽק׃
Translated: The elders of Moab and the elders of Midian, versed in divination, set out. They came to Balaam and gave him Balak’s message.
Transliteration: vayelekhu zikeney mvoav vezikeney mideyan ukesamiym veyadam vayavou el-vileam vayedaveru elayv diverey valak

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֗ם לִ֤ינוּ פֹה֙ הַלַּ֔יְלָה וַהֲשִׁבֹתִ֤י אֶתְכֶם֙ דָּבָ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֵלָ֑י וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ שָׂרֵֽי־מוֹאָ֖ב עִם־בִּלְעָֽם׃
Translated: He said to them, “Spend the night here, and I shall reply to you as יהוה may instruct me.” So the Moabite dignitaries stayed with Balaam.
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem liynu foh halayelah vahashivotiy etekhem davar khaasher yedaver yehovah elay vayeshevu sharey-mvoav im-vileam

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥א אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֕אמֶר מִ֛י הָאֲנָשִׁ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: God came to Balaam and said, “What do these men want of you?”
Transliteration: vayavo Elohim el-vileam vayomer miy haanashiym haeleh imakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר בִּלְעָ֖ם אֶל־הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים בָּלָ֧ק בֶּן־צִפֹּ֛ר מֶ֥לֶךְ מוֹאָ֖ב שָׁלַ֥ח אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: Balaam said to God, “Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:
Transliteration: vayomer vileam el-haElohim valak ven-tsifor melekhe mvoav shalach elay

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה הָעָם֙ הַיֹּצֵ֣א מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וַיְכַ֖ס אֶת־עֵ֣ין הָאָ֑רֶץ עַתָּ֗ה לְכָ֤ה קָֽבָה־לִּי֙ אֹת֔וֹ אוּלַ֥י אוּכַ֛ל לְהִלָּ֥חֶם בּ֖וֹ וְגֵרַשְׁתִּֽיו׃
Translated: Here is a people that came out from Egypt and hides the earth from view. Come now and curse them for me; perhaps I can engage them in battle and drive them off.”
Transliteration: hineh haam hayotse mimitserayiim vayekhas et-eyn haarets atah lekhah kavah-liy otvo ulay ukhal lehilachem vvo vegerashetiyv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם לֹ֥א תֵלֵ֖ךְ עִמָּהֶ֑ם לֹ֤א תָאֹר֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י בָר֖וּךְ הֽוּא׃
Translated: But God said to Balaam, “Do not go with them. You must not curse that people, for they are blessed.”
Transliteration: vayomer Elohim el-vileam lo telekhe imahem lo taor et-haam khiy varukhe hu

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤קׇם בִּלְעָם֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־שָׂרֵ֣י בָלָ֔ק לְכ֖וּ אֶֽל־אַרְצְכֶ֑ם כִּ֚י מֵאֵ֣ן יְהֹוָ֔ה לְתִתִּ֖י לַהֲלֹ֥ךְ עִמָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: Balaam arose in the morning and said to Balak’s dignitaries, “Go back to your own country, for יהוה will not let me go with you.”
Transliteration: vayakׇm vileam vavoker vayomer el-sharey valak lekhu el-aretsekhem khiy meen yehovah letitiy lahalokhe imakhem

Hebrew: וַיָּק֙וּמוּ֙ שָׂרֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־בָּלָ֑ק וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ מֵאֵ֥ן בִּלְעָ֖ם הֲלֹ֥ךְ עִמָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: The Moabite dignitaries left, and they came to Balak and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”
Transliteration: vayakumu sharey mvoav vayavou el-valak vayomeru meen vileam halokhe imanu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥סֶף ע֖וֹד בָּלָ֑ק שְׁלֹ֣חַ שָׂרִ֔ים רַבִּ֥ים וְנִכְבָּדִ֖ים מֵאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Then Balak sent other dignitaries, more numerous and distinguished than the first.
Transliteration: vayosef vod valak shelocha shariym raviym venikhevadiym meeleh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמְרוּ ל֗וֹ כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ בָּלָ֣ק בֶּן־צִפּ֔וֹר אַל־נָ֥א תִמָּנַ֖ע מֵהֲלֹ֥ךְ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: They came to Balaam and said to him, “Thus says Balak son of Zippor: Please do not refuse to come to me.
Transliteration: vayavou el-vileam vayomeru lvo khoh amar valak ven-tsifvor al-na timana mehalokhe elay

Hebrew: כִּֽי־כַבֵּ֤ד אֲכַבֶּדְךָ֙ מְאֹ֔ד וְכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־תֹּאמַ֥ר אֵלַ֖י אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֑ה וּלְכָה־נָּא֙ קָֽבָה־לִּ֔י אֵ֖ת הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: I will reward you richly and I will do anything you ask of me. Only come and damn this people for me.”
Transliteration: khiy-khaved akhavedekha meod vekhol asher-tomar elay eesheh ulekhah-na kavah-liy et haam hazeh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן בִּלְעָ֗ם וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־עַבְדֵ֣י בָלָ֔ק אִם־יִתֶּן־לִ֥י בָלָ֛ק מְלֹ֥א בֵית֖וֹ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֑ב לֹ֣א אוּכַ֗ל לַעֲבֹר֙ אֶת־פִּי֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֔י לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת קְטַנָּ֖ה א֥וֹ גְדוֹלָֽה׃
Translated: Balaam replied to Balak’s officials, “Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything, big or little, contrary to the command of my God יהוה.
Transliteration: vayaan vileam vayomer el-avedey valak im-yiten-liy valak melo veytvo khesef vezahav lo ukhal laavor et-fiy yehovah elohay laashvot ketanah vo gedvolah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה שְׁב֨וּ נָ֥א בָזֶ֛ה גַּם־אַתֶּ֖ם הַלָּ֑יְלָה וְאֵ֣דְעָ֔ה מַה־יֹּסֵ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה דַּבֵּ֥ר עִמִּֽי׃
Translated: So you, too, stay here overnight, and let me find out what else יהוה may say to me.”
Transliteration: veatah shevu na vazeh gam-atem halayelah veedeah mah-yosef yehovah daver imiy

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א אֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֶל־בִּלְעָם֮ לַ֒יְלָה֒ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֗וֹ אִם־לִקְרֹ֤א לְךָ֙ בָּ֣אוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים ק֖וּם לֵ֣ךְ אִתָּ֑ם וְאַ֗ךְ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אֲדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ אֹת֥וֹ תַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: That night God came to Balaam and said to him, “If the agents have come to invite you, you may go with them. But whatever I command you, that you shall do.”
Transliteration: vayavo Elohim <small></small> el-vileam layelah vayomer lvo im-likero lekha vau haanashiym kum lekhe itam veakhe et-hadavar asher-adaver eleykha otvo taasheh

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤קׇם בִּלְעָם֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַֽיַּחֲבֹ֖שׁ אֶת־אֲתֹנ֑וֹ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ עִם־שָׂרֵ֥י מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: When he arose in the morning, Balaam saddled his ass and departed with the Moabite dignitaries.
Transliteration: vayakׇm vileam vavoker vayachavosh et-atonvo vayelekhe im-sharey mvoav

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֣ף אֱלֹהִים֮ כִּֽי־הוֹלֵ֣ךְ הוּא֒ וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֞ב מַלְאַ֧ךְ יְהֹוָ֛ה בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ לְשָׂטָ֣ן ל֑וֹ וְהוּא֙ רֹכֵ֣ב עַל־אֲתֹנ֔וֹ וּשְׁנֵ֥י נְעָרָ֖יו עִמּֽוֹ׃
Translated: But God was incensed at his going; so a messenger of יהוה took a position in his way as an adversary. He was riding on his she-ass, with his two servants alongside,
Transliteration: vayichar-af Elohim khiy-hvolekhe hu vayiteyatsev maleakhe yehovah vaderekhe leshatan lvo vehu rokhev al-atonvo usheney nearayv imvo

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֣רֶא הָאָתוֹן֩ אֶת־מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֜ה נִצָּ֣ב בַּדֶּ֗רֶךְ וְחַרְבּ֤וֹ שְׁלוּפָה֙ בְּיָד֔וֹ וַתֵּ֤ט הָֽאָתוֹן֙ מִן־הַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וַתֵּ֖לֶךְ בַּשָּׂדֶ֑ה וַיַּ֤ךְ בִּלְעָם֙ אֶת־הָ֣אָת֔וֹן לְהַטֹּתָ֖הּ הַדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: when the ass caught sight of the messenger of יהוה standing in the way, with his drawn sword in his hand. The ass swerved from the road and went into the fields; and Balaam beat the ass to turn her back onto the road.
Transliteration: vatere haatvon et-maleakhe yehovah nitsav vaderekhe vecharevvo shelufah veyadvo vatet haatvon min-haderekhe vatelekhe vashadeh vayakhe vileam et-haatvon lehatotah hadarekhe

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּמִשְׁע֖וֹל הַכְּרָמִ֑ים גָּדֵ֥ר מִזֶּ֖ה וְגָדֵ֥ר מִזֶּֽה׃
Translated: The messenger of יהוה then stationed himself in a lane between the vineyards, with a fence on either side.
Transliteration: vayaamod maleakhe yehovah vemishevol hakheramiym gader mizeh vegader mizeh

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֨רֶא הָאָת֜וֹן אֶת־מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֗ה וַתִּלָּחֵץ֙ אֶל־הַקִּ֔יר וַתִּלְחַ֛ץ אֶת־רֶ֥גֶל בִּלְעָ֖ם אֶל־הַקִּ֑יר וַיֹּ֖סֶף לְהַכֹּתָֽהּ׃
Translated: The ass, seeing the messenger of יהוה, pressed herself against the wall and squeezed Balaam’s foot against the wall; so he beat her again.
Transliteration: vatere haatvon et-maleakhe yehovah vatilachets el-hakiyr vatilechats et-regel vileam el-hakiyr vayosef lehakhotah

Hebrew: וַיּ֥וֹסֶף מַלְאַךְ־יְהֹוָ֖ה עֲב֑וֹר וַֽיַּעֲמֹד֙ בְּמָק֣וֹם צָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֛ר אֵֽין־דֶּ֥רֶךְ לִנְט֖וֹת יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאול׃
Translated: Once more the messenger of יהוה moved forward and stationed himself on a spot so narrow that there was no room to swerve right or left.
Transliteration: vayyvosef maleakhe-yehovah avvor vayaamod vemakvom tsar asher eyn-derekhe linetvot yamiyn ushemovl

Hebrew: וַתֵּ֤רֶא הָֽאָתוֹן֙ אֶת־מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה וַתִּרְבַּ֖ץ תַּ֣חַת בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֣ף בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיַּ֥ךְ אֶת־הָאָת֖וֹן בַּמַּקֵּֽל׃
Translated: When the ass now saw the messenger of יהוה, she lay down under Balaam; and Balaam was furious and beat the ass with his stick.
Transliteration: vatere haatvon et-maleakhe yehovah vatirevats tachat vileam vayichar-af vileam vayakhe et-haatvon vamakel

Hebrew: וַיִּפְתַּ֥ח יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־פִּ֣י הָאָת֑וֹן וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לְבִלְעָם֙ מֶה־עָשִׂ֣יתִֽי לְךָ֔ כִּ֣י הִכִּיתַ֔נִי זֶ֖ה שָׁלֹ֥שׁ רְגָלִֽים׃
Translated: Then יהוה opened the ass’s mouth, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you that you have beaten me these three times?”
Transliteration: vayifetach yehovah et-fiy haatvon vatomer levileam meh-ashiytiy lekha khiy hikhiytaniy zeh shalosh regaliym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בִּלְעָם֙ לָֽאָת֔וֹן כִּ֥י הִתְעַלַּ֖לְתְּ בִּ֑י ל֤וּ יֶשׁ־חֶ֙רֶב֙ בְּיָדִ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֖ה הֲרַגְתִּֽיךְ׃
Translated: Balaam said to the ass, “You have made a mockery of me! If I had a sword with me, I’d kill you.”
Transliteration: vayomer vileam laatvon khiy hitealalete viy lu yesh-cherev veyadiy khiy atah haragetiykhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֨אמֶר הָאָת֜וֹן אֶל־בִּלְעָ֗ם הֲלוֹא֩ אָנֹכִ֨י אֲתֹֽנְךָ֜ אֲשֶׁר־רָכַ֣בְתָּ עָלַ֗י מֵעֽוֹדְךָ֙ עַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה הַֽהַסְכֵּ֣ן הִסְכַּ֔נְתִּי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לְךָ֖ כֹּ֑ה וַיֹּ֖אמֶר לֹֽא׃
Translated: The ass said to Balaam, “Look, I am the ass that you have been riding all along until this day! Have I been in the habit of doing thus to you?” And he answered, “No.”
Transliteration: vatomer haatvon el-vileam halvo anokhiy atonekha asher-rakhaveta alay mevodekha ad-hayyvom hazeh hahasekhen hisekhanetiy laashvot lekha khoh vayomer lo

Hebrew: וַיְגַ֣ל יְהֹוָה֮ אֶת־עֵינֵ֣י בִלְעָם֒ וַיַּ֞רְא אֶת־מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ נִצָּ֣ב בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ וְחַרְבּ֥וֹ שְׁלֻפָ֖ה בְּיָד֑וֹ וַיִּקֹּ֥ד וַיִּשְׁתַּ֖חוּ לְאַפָּֽיו׃
Translated: Then יהוה uncovered Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the messenger of יהוה standing in the way, his drawn sword in his hand; thereupon he bowed right down to the ground.
Transliteration: vayegal yehovah et-eyney vileam vayare et-maleakhe yehovah nitsav vaderekhe vecharevvo shelufah veyadvo vayikod vayishetachu leafayv

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלָיו֙ מַלְאַ֣ךְ יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־מָ֗ה הִכִּ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־אֲתֹ֣נְךָ֔ זֶ֖ה שָׁל֣וֹשׁ רְגָלִ֑ים הִנֵּ֤ה אָנֹכִי֙ יָצָ֣אתִי לְשָׂטָ֔ן כִּֽי־יָרַ֥ט הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ לְנֶגְדִּֽי׃
Translated: The messenger of יהוה said to him, “Why have you beaten your ass these three times? It is I who came out as an adversary, for the errand is obnoxious to me.
Transliteration: vayomer elayv maleakhe yehovah al-mah hikhiyta et-atonekha zeh shalvosh regaliym hineh anokhiy yatsatiy leshatan khiy-yarat haderekhe lenegediy

Hebrew: וַתִּרְאַ֙נִי֙ הָֽאָת֔וֹן וַתֵּ֣ט לְפָנַ֔י זֶ֖ה שָׁלֹ֣שׁ רְגָלִ֑ים אוּלַי֙ נָטְתָ֣ה מִפָּנַ֔י כִּ֥י עַתָּ֛ה גַּם־אֹתְכָ֥ה הָרַ֖גְתִּי וְאוֹתָ֥הּ הֶחֱיֵֽיתִי׃
Translated: And when the ass saw me, she shied away because of me those three times. If she had not shied away from me, you are the one I should have killed, while sparing her.”
Transliteration: vatireaniy haatvon vatet lefanay zeh shalosh regaliym ulay natetah mifanay khiy atah gam-otekhah haragetiy vevotah hecheeiytiy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בִּלְעָ֜ם אֶל־מַלְאַ֤ךְ יְהֹוָה֙ חָטָ֔אתִי כִּ֚י לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי כִּ֥י אַתָּ֛ה נִצָּ֥ב לִקְרָאתִ֖י בַּדָּ֑רֶךְ וְעַתָּ֛ה אִם־רַ֥ע בְּעֵינֶ֖יךָ אָשׁ֥וּבָה לִּֽי׃
Translated: Balaam said to the messenger of יהוה, “I erred because I did not know that you were standing in my way. If you still disapprove, I will turn back.”
Transliteration: vayomer vileam el-maleakhe yehovah chatatiy khiy lo yadaetiy khiy atah nitsav likeratiy vadarekhe veatah im-ra veeyneykha ashuvah liy

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ מַלְאַ֨ךְ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־בִּלְעָ֗ם לֵ֚ךְ עִם־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְאֶ֗פֶס אֶת־הַדָּבָ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אֲדַבֵּ֥ר אֵלֶ֖יךָ אֹת֣וֹ תְדַבֵּ֑ר וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בִּלְעָ֖ם עִם־שָׂרֵ֥י בָלָֽק׃
Translated: But the messenger of יהוה said to Balaam, “Go with the men. But you must say nothing except what I tell you.” So Balaam went on with Balak’s dignitaries.
Transliteration: vayomer maleakhe yehovah el-vileam lekhe im-haanashiym veefes et-hadavar asher-adaver eleykha otvo tedaver vayelekhe vileam im-sharey valak

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע בָּלָ֖ק כִּ֣י בָ֣א בִלְעָ֑ם וַיֵּצֵ֨א לִקְרָאת֜וֹ אֶל־עִ֣יר מוֹאָ֗ב אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־גְּב֣וּל אַרְנֹ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּקְצֵ֥ה הַגְּבֽוּל׃
Translated: When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at Ir-moab, which is on the Arnon border, at its farthest point.
Transliteration: vayishema valak khiy va vileam vayetse likeratvo el-iyr mvoav asher al-gevul arenon asher viketseh hagevul

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בָּלָ֜ק אֶל־בִּלְעָ֗ם הֲלֹא֩ שָׁלֹ֨חַ שָׁלַ֤חְתִּי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ לִקְרֹא־לָ֔ךְ לָ֥מָּה לֹא־הָלַ֖כְתָּ אֵלָ֑י הַֽאֻמְנָ֔ם לֹ֥א אוּכַ֖ל כַּבְּדֶֽךָ׃
Translated: Balak said to Balaam, “When I first sent to invite you, why didn’t you come to me? Am I really unable to reward you?”
Transliteration: vayomer valak el-vileam halo shalocha shalachetiy eleykha likero-lakhe lamah lo-halakheta elay haumenam lo ukhal khavedekha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בִּלְעָ֜ם אֶל־בָּלָ֗ק הִֽנֵּה־בָ֙אתִי֙ אֵלֶ֔יךָ עַתָּ֕ה הֲיָכֹ֥ל אוּכַ֖ל דַּבֵּ֣ר מְא֑וּמָה הַדָּבָ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָשִׂ֧ים אֱלֹהִ֛ים בְּפִ֖י אֹת֥וֹ אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated: But Balaam said to Balak, “And now that I have come to you, have I the power to speak freely? I can utter only the word that God puts into my mouth.”
Transliteration: vayomer vileam el-valak hineh-vatiy eleykha atah hayakhol ukhal daver meumah hadavar asher yashiym Elohim vefiy otvo adaver

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥לֶךְ בִּלְעָ֖ם עִם־בָּלָ֑ק וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ קִרְיַ֥ת חֻצֽוֹת׃
Translated: Balaam went with Balak and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.
Transliteration: vayelekhe vileam im-valak vayavou kireyat chutsvot

Hebrew: וַיִּזְבַּ֥ח בָּלָ֖ק בָּקָ֣ר וָצֹ֑אן וַיְשַׁלַּ֣ח לְבִלְעָ֔ם וְלַשָּׂרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: Balak sacrificed oxen and sheep, and had them served to Balaam and the dignitaries with him.
Transliteration: vayizevach valak vakar vatson vayeshalach levileam velashariym asher itvo

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בַבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּקַּ֤ח בָּלָק֙ אֶת־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַֽיַּעֲלֵ֖הוּ בָּמ֣וֹת בָּ֑עַל וַיַּ֥רְא מִשָּׁ֖ם קְצֵ֥ה הָעָֽם׃
Translated: In the morning Balak took Balaam up to Bamoth-baal. From there he could see a portion of the people.
Transliteration: vayehiy vavoker vayikach valak et-vileam vayaalehu vamvot vaal vayare misham ketseh haam

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בִּלְעָם֙ אֶל־בָּלָ֔ק בְּנֵה־לִ֥י בָזֶ֖ה שִׁבְעָ֣ה מִזְבְּחֹ֑ת וְהָכֵ֥ן לִי֙ בָּזֶ֔ה שִׁבְעָ֥ה פָרִ֖ים וְשִׁבְעָ֥ה אֵילִֽים׃
Translated: Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here and have seven bulls and seven rams ready here for me.”
Transliteration: vayomer vileam el-valak veneh-liy vazeh shiveah mizevechot vehakhen liy vazeh shiveah fariym veshiveah eyliym

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ בָּלָ֔ק כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֣ר בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיַּ֨עַל בָּלָ֧ק וּבִלְעָ֛ם פָּ֥ר וָאַ֖יִל בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Balak did as Balaam directed; and Balak and Balaam offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.
Transliteration: vayaash valak khaasher diver vileam vayaal valak uvileam far vaayiil vamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בִּלְעָ֜ם לְבָלָ֗ק הִתְיַצֵּב֮ עַל־עֹלָתֶ֒ךָ֒ וְאֵֽלְכָ֗ה אוּלַ֞י יִקָּרֵ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לִקְרָאתִ֔י וּדְבַ֥ר מַה־יַּרְאֵ֖נִי וְהִגַּ֣דְתִּי לָ֑ךְ וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ שֶֽׁפִי׃
Translated: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offerings while I am gone. Perhaps יהוה will grant me a manifestation, and whatever is revealed to me I will tell you.” And he went off alone.
Transliteration: vayomer vileam levalak hiteyatsev al-olatekha veelekhah ulay yikareh yehovah likeratiy udevar mah-yareeniy vehigadetiy lakhe vayelekhe shefiy

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּ֥ר אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֶל־בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֗יו אֶת־שִׁבְעַ֤ת הַֽמִּזְבְּחֹת֙ עָרַ֔כְתִּי וָאַ֛עַל פָּ֥ר וָאַ֖יִל בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: God became manifest to Balaam, who stated, “I have set up the seven altars and offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.”
Transliteration: vayikar Elohim el-vileam vayomer elayv et-shiveat hamizevechot arakhetiy vaaal far vaayiil vamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שֶׂם יְהֹוָ֛ה דָּבָ֖ר בְּפִ֣י בִלְעָ֑ם וַיֹּ֛אמֶר שׁ֥וּב אֶל־בָּלָ֖ק וְכֹ֥ה תְדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה put a word in Balaam’s mouth and said, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”
Transliteration: vayashem yehovah davar vefiy vileam vayomer shuv el-valak vekhoh tedaver

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שׇׁב אֵלָ֔יו וְהִנֵּ֥ה נִצָּ֖ב עַל־עֹלָת֑וֹ ה֖וּא וְכׇל־שָׂרֵ֥י מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: So he returned to him and found him standing beside his offerings, and all the Moabite dignitaries with him.
Transliteration: vayashׇv elayv vehineh nitsav al-olatvo hu vekhׇl-sharey mvoav

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר מִן־אֲ֠רָ֠ם יַנְחֵ֨נִי בָלָ֤ק מֶֽלֶךְ־מוֹאָב֙ מֵֽהַרְרֵי־קֶ֔דֶם לְכָה֙ אָֽרָה־לִּ֣י יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּלְכָ֖ה זֹעֲמָ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
He took up his theme, and said:
From Aram has Balak brought me,
Moab’s king from the hills of the East:
Come, curse me Jacob,
Come, tell Israel’s doom!
Transliteration: vayisha meshalvo vayomar min-aram yanecheniy valak melekhe-mvoav meharerey-kedem lekhah arah-liy yaakov ulekhah zoamah yisherael

Hebrew: מָ֣ה אֶקֹּ֔ב לֹ֥א קַבֹּ֖ה אֵ֑ל וּמָ֣ה אֶזְעֹ֔ם לֹ֥א זָעַ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
How can I damn whom God has not damned,
How doom when יהוה has not doomed?
Transliteration: mah ekov lo kavoh el umah ezeom lo zaam yehovah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מֵרֹ֤אשׁ צֻרִים֙ אֶרְאֶ֔נּוּ וּמִגְּבָע֖וֹת אֲשׁוּרֶ֑נּוּ הֶן־עָם֙ לְבָדָ֣ד יִשְׁכֹּ֔ן וּבַגּוֹיִ֖ם לֹ֥א יִתְחַשָּֽׁב׃
Translated:
As I see them from the mountain tops,
Gaze on them from the heights,
There is a people that dwells apart,
Not reckoned among the nations,
Transliteration: khiy-merosh tsuriym ereenu umigevavot ashurenu hen-am levadad yishekhon uvagvoyim lo yitechashav

Hebrew: מִ֤י מָנָה֙ עֲפַ֣ר יַעֲקֹ֔ב וּמִסְפָּ֖ר אֶת־רֹ֣בַע יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל תָּמֹ֤ת נַפְשִׁי֙ מ֣וֹת יְשָׁרִ֔ים וּתְהִ֥י אַחֲרִיתִ֖י כָּמֹֽהוּ׃
Translated:
Who can count the dust of Jacob,
Number the dust-cloud of Israel?
May I die the death of the upright,
May my fate be like theirs!
Transliteration: miy manah afar yaakov umisefar et-rova yisherael tamot nafeshiy mvot yeshariym utehiy achariytiy khamohu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בָּלָק֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם מֶ֥ה עָשִׂ֖יתָ לִ֑י לָקֹ֤ב אֹיְבַי֙ לְקַחְתִּ֔יךָ וְהִנֵּ֖ה בֵּרַ֥כְתָּ בָרֵֽךְ׃
Translated: Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? Here I brought you to damn my enemies, and instead you have blessed them!”
Transliteration: vayomer valak el-vileam meh ashiyta liy lakov oyevay lekachetiykha vehineh verakheta varekhe

Hebrew: וַיַּ֖עַן וַיֹּאמַ֑ר הֲלֹ֗א אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָשִׂ֤ים יְהֹוָה֙ בְּפִ֔י אֹת֥וֹ אֶשְׁמֹ֖ר לְדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated: He replied, “I can only repeat faithfully what יהוה puts in my mouth.”
Transliteration: vayaan vayomar halo et asher yashiym yehovah vefiy otvo eshemor ledaver

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֵלָ֜יו בָּלָ֗ק (לך) [לְכָה־]נָּ֨א אִתִּ֜י אֶל־מָק֤וֹם אַחֵר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּרְאֶ֣נּוּ מִשָּׁ֔ם אֶ֚פֶס קָצֵ֣הוּ תִרְאֶ֔ה וְכֻלּ֖וֹ לֹ֣א תִרְאֶ֑ה וְקׇבְנוֹ־לִ֖י מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: Then Balak said to him, “Come with me to another place from which you can see them—you will see only a portion of them; you will not see all of them—and damn them for me from there.”
Transliteration: vayomer elayv valak (lkh) [lekhah-]na itiy el-makvom acher asher tireenu misham efes katsehu tireeh vekhulvo lo tireeh vekׇvenvo-liy misham

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּחֵ֙הוּ֙ שְׂדֵ֣ה צֹפִ֔ים אֶל־רֹ֖אשׁ הַפִּסְגָּ֑ה וַיִּ֙בֶן֙ שִׁבְעָ֣ה מִזְבְּחֹ֔ת וַיַּ֛עַל פָּ֥ר וָאַ֖יִל בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: With that, he took him to Sedehzophim, on the summit of Pisgah. He built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
Transliteration: vayikachehu shedeh tsofiym el-rosh hafisegah vayiven shiveah mizevechot vayaal far vaayiil vamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־בָּלָ֔ק הִתְיַצֵּ֥ב כֹּ֖ה עַל־עֹלָתֶ֑ךָ וְאָנֹכִ֖י אִקָּ֥רֶה כֹּֽה׃
Translated: And [Balaam] said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offerings, while I seek a manifestation yonder.”
Transliteration: vayomer el-valak hiteyatsev khoh al-olatekha veanokhiy ikareh khoh

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיָּ֥שֶׂם דָּבָ֖ר בְּפִ֑יו וַיֹּ֛אמֶר שׁ֥וּב אֶל־בָּלָ֖ק וְכֹ֥ה תְדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated: יהוה became manifest to Balaam and put a word in his mouth, saying, “Return to Balak and speak thus.”
Transliteration: vayikar yehovah el-vileam vayashem davar vefiyv vayomer shuv el-valak vekhoh tedaver

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א אֵלָ֗יו וְהִנּ֤וֹ נִצָּב֙ עַל־עֹ֣לָת֔וֹ וְשָׂרֵ֥י מוֹאָ֖ב אִתּ֑וֹ וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לוֹ֙ בָּלָ֔ק מַה־דִּבֶּ֖ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: He went to him and found him standing beside his offerings, and the Moabite dignitaries with him. Balak asked him, “What did יהוה say?”
Transliteration: vayavo elayv vehinvo nitsav al-olatvo vesharey mvoav itvo vayomer lvo valak mah-diver yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר ק֤וּם בָּלָק֙ וּֽשְׁמָ֔ע הַאֲזִ֥ינָה עָדַ֖י בְּנ֥וֹ צִפֹּֽר׃
Translated:
And he took up his theme, and said:
Up, Balak, attend,
Give ear unto me, son of Zippor!
Transliteration: vayisha meshalvo vayomar kum valak ushema haaziynah aday venvo tsifor

Hebrew: לֹ֣א אִ֥ישׁ אֵל֙ וִֽיכַזֵּ֔ב וּבֶן־אָדָ֖ם וְיִתְנֶחָ֑ם הַה֤וּא אָמַר֙ וְלֹ֣א יַעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְדִבֶּ֖ר וְלֹ֥א יְקִימֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
God is not human to be capricious,
Or mortal to have a change of heart.
Would [God] speak and not act,
Promise and not fulfill?
Transliteration: lo iysh el viykhazev uven-adam veyitenecham hahu amar velo yaasheh vediver velo yekiymenah

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה בָרֵ֖ךְ לָקָ֑חְתִּי וּבֵרֵ֖ךְ וְלֹ֥א אֲשִׁיבֶֽנָּה׃
Translated:
My message was to bless:
When [God] blesses, I cannot reverse it.
Transliteration: hineh varekhe lakachetiy uverekhe velo ashiyvenah

Hebrew: לֹֽא־הִבִּ֥יט אָ֙וֶן֙ בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב וְלֹא־רָאָ֥ה עָמָ֖ל בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהָיו֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וּתְרוּעַ֥ת מֶ֖לֶךְ בּֽוֹ׃
Translated:
No harm is in sight for Jacob,
No woe in view for Israel.
Their God יהוה is with them,
And their King’s acclaim in their midst.
Transliteration: lo-hiviyt aven veyaakov velo-raah amal veyisherael yehovah elohayv imvo uteruat melekhe vvo

Hebrew: אֵ֖ל מוֹצִיאָ֣ם מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם כְּתוֹעֲפֹ֥ת רְאֵ֖ם לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
God who freed them from Egypt
Is for them like the horns of the wild ox.
Transliteration: el mvotsiyam mimitserayiim khetvoafot reem lvo

Hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹא־נַ֙חַשׁ֙ בְּיַעֲקֹ֔ב וְלֹא־קֶ֖סֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כָּעֵ֗ת יֵאָמֵ֤ר לְיַעֲקֹב֙ וּלְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מַה־פָּ֖עַל אֵֽל׃
Translated:
Lo, there is no augury in Jacob,
No divining in Israel:
Jacob is told at once,
Yea Israel, what God has planned.
Transliteration: khiy lo-nachash veyaakov velo-kesem veyisherael khaet eiamer leyaakov uleyisherael mah-faal el

Hebrew: הֶן־עָם֙ כְּלָבִ֣יא יָק֔וּם וְכַאֲרִ֖י יִתְנַשָּׂ֑א לֹ֤א יִשְׁכַּב֙ עַד־יֹ֣אכַל טֶ֔רֶף וְדַם־חֲלָלִ֖ים יִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Lo, a people that rises like a lioness,
Leaps up like a lion,
Rests not till it has feasted on prey
And drunk the blood of the slain.
Transliteration: hen-am khelaviy yakum vekhaariy yitenasha lo yishekhav ad-yokhal teref vedam-chalaliym yisheteh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בָּלָק֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם גַּם־קֹ֖ב לֹ֣א תִקֳּבֶ֑נּוּ גַּם־בָּרֵ֖ךְ לֹ֥א תְבָרְכֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: Thereupon Balak said to Balaam, “Don’t curse them and don’t bless them!”
Transliteration: vayomer valak el-vileam gam-kov lo tikovenu gam-varekhe lo tevarekhenu

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַן בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיֹּ֖אמֶר אֶל־בָּלָ֑ק הֲלֹ֗א דִּבַּ֤רְתִּי אֵלֶ֙יךָ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֹת֥וֹ אֶֽעֱשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: In reply, Balaam said to Balak, “But I told you: Whatever יהוה says, that I must do.”
Transliteration: vayaan vileam vayomer el-valak halo divaretiy eleykha lemor khol asher-yedaver yehovah otvo eesheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בָּלָק֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם לְכָה־נָּא֙ אֶקָּ֣חֲךָ֔ אֶל־מָק֖וֹם אַחֵ֑ר אוּלַ֤י יִישַׁר֙ בְּעֵינֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֔ים וְקַבֹּ֥תוֹ לִ֖י מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: Then Balak said to Balaam, “Come now, I will take you to another place. Perhaps God will deem it right that you damn them for me there.”
Transliteration: vayomer valak el-vileam lekhah-na ekachakha el-makvom acher ulay yiyshar veeyney haElohim vekavotvo liy misham

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֥ח בָּלָ֖ק אֶת־בִּלְעָ֑ם רֹ֣אשׁ הַפְּע֔וֹר הַנִּשְׁקָ֖ף עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הַיְשִׁימֹֽן׃
Translated: Balak took Balaam to the peak of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.
Transliteration: vayikach valak et-vileam rosh hafevor hanishekaf al-feney hayeshiymon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בִּלְעָם֙ אֶל־בָּלָ֔ק בְּנֵה־לִ֥י בָזֶ֖ה שִׁבְעָ֣ה מִזְבְּחֹ֑ת וְהָכֵ֥ן לִי֙ בָּזֶ֔ה שִׁבְעָ֥ה פָרִ֖ים וְשִׁבְעָ֥ה אֵילִֽם׃
Translated: Balaam said to Balak, “Build me here seven altars, and have seven bulls and seven rams ready for me here.”
Transliteration: vayomer vileam el-valak veneh-liy vazeh shiveah mizevechot vehakhen liy vazeh shiveah fariym veshiveah eylim

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ בָּלָ֔ק כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר אָמַ֣ר בִּלְעָ֑ם וַיַּ֛עַל פָּ֥ר וָאַ֖יִל בַּמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translated: Balak did as Balaam said: he offered up a bull and a ram on each altar.
Transliteration: vayaash valak khaasher amar vileam vayaal far vaayiil vamizevecha

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣רְא בִּלְעָ֗ם כִּ֣י ט֞וֹב בְּעֵינֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ לְבָרֵ֣ךְ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלֹא־הָלַ֥ךְ כְּפַֽעַם־בְּפַ֖עַם לִקְרַ֣את נְחָשִׁ֑ים וַיָּ֥שֶׁת אֶל־הַמִּדְבָּ֖ר פָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: Now Balaam, seeing that it pleased יהוה to bless Israel, did not, as on previous occasions, go in search of omens, but turned his face toward the wilderness.
Transliteration: vayare vileam khiy tvov veeyney yehovah levarekhe et-yisherael velo-halakhe khefaam-vefaam likerat nechashiym vayashet el-hamidevar fanayv

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֨א בִלְעָ֜ם אֶת־עֵינָ֗יו וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שֹׁכֵ֖ן לִשְׁבָטָ֑יו וַתְּהִ֥י עָלָ֖יו ר֥וּחַ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: As Balaam looked up and saw Israel encamped tribe by tribe, the spirit of God came upon him.
Transliteration: vayisha vileam et-eynayv vayare et-yisherael shokhen lishevatayv vatehiy alayv rucha Elohim

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר נְאֻ֤ם בִּלְעָם֙ בְּנ֣וֹ בְעֹ֔ר וּנְאֻ֥ם הַגֶּ֖בֶר שְׁתֻ֥ם הָעָֽיִן׃
Translated:
Taking up his theme, he said:
Word of Balaam son of Beor,
Word of the man whose eye is true,
Transliteration: vayisha meshalvo vayomar neum vileam venvo veor uneum hagever shetum haayiin

Hebrew: נְאֻ֕ם שֹׁמֵ֖עַ אִמְרֵי־אֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר מַחֲזֵ֤ה שַׁדַּי֙ יֶֽחֱזֶ֔ה נֹפֵ֖ל וּגְל֥וּי עֵינָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Word of one who hears God’s speech,
Who beholds visions from the Almighty,
Prostrate, but with eyes unveiled:
Transliteration: neum shomea imerey-el asher machazeh shaday yechezeh nofel ugeluy eynayiim

Hebrew: מַה־טֹּ֥בוּ אֹהָלֶ֖יךָ יַעֲקֹ֑ב מִשְׁכְּנֹתֶ֖יךָ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
How fair are your tents, O Jacob,
Your dwellings, O Israel!
Transliteration: mah-tovu ohaleykha yaakov mishekhenoteykha yisherael

Hebrew: כִּנְחָלִ֣ים נִטָּ֔יוּ כְּגַנֹּ֖ת עֲלֵ֣י נָהָ֑ר כַּאֲהָלִים֙ נָטַ֣ע יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲרָזִ֖ים עֲלֵי־מָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Like palm-groves that stretch out,
Like gardens beside a river,
Like aloes planted by יהוה,
Like cedars beside the water;
Transliteration: khinechaliym nitayu kheganot aley nahar khaahaliym nata yehovah khaaraziym aley-mayiim

Hebrew: יִֽזַּל־מַ֙יִם֙ מִדָּ֣לְיָ֔ו וְזַרְע֖וֹ בְּמַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים וְיָרֹ֤ם מֵֽאֲגַג֙ מַלְכּ֔וֹ וְתִנַּשֵּׂ֖א מַלְכֻתֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Their boughs drip with moisture,
Their roots have abundant water.
Their ruler shall rise above Agag,
Their sovereignty shall be exalted.
Transliteration: yizal-mayiim midaleyav vezarevo vemayiim raviym veyarom meagag malekhvo vetinashe malekhutvo

Hebrew: אֵ֚ל מוֹצִיא֣וֹ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם כְּתוֹעֲפֹ֥ת רְאֵ֖ם ל֑וֹ יֹאכַ֞ל גּוֹיִ֣ם צָרָ֗יו וְעַצְמֹתֵיהֶ֛ם יְגָרֵ֖ם וְחִצָּ֥יו יִמְחָֽץ׃
Translated:
God who freed them from Egypt
Is for them like the horns of the wild ox.
They shall devour enemy nations,
Crush their bones,
And smash their arrows.
Transliteration: el mvotsiyvo mimitserayiim khetvoafot reem lvo yokhal gvoyim tsarayv veatsemoteyhem yegarem vechitsayv yimechats

Hebrew: כָּרַ֨ע שָׁכַ֧ב כַּאֲרִ֛י וּכְלָבִ֖יא מִ֣י יְקִימֶ֑נּוּ מְבָרְכֶ֣יךָ בָר֔וּךְ וְאֹרְרֶ֖יךָ אָרֽוּר׃
Translated:
They crouch, they lie down like a lion,
Like a lioness; who dares rouse them?
Blessed are they who bless you,
Accursed they who curse you!
Transliteration: khara shakhav khaariy ukhelaviy miy yekiymenu mevarekheykha varukhe veorereykha arur

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף בָּלָק֙ אֶל־בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיִּסְפֹּ֖ק אֶת־כַּפָּ֑יו וַיֹּ֨אמֶר בָּלָ֜ק אֶל־בִּלְעָ֗ם לָקֹ֤ב אֹֽיְבַי֙ קְרָאתִ֔יךָ וְהִנֵּה֙ בֵּרַ֣כְתָּ בָרֵ֔ךְ זֶ֖ה שָׁלֹ֥שׁ פְּעָמִֽים׃
Translated: Enraged at Balaam, Balak struck his hands together. “I called you,” Balak said to Balaam, “to damn my enemies, and instead you have blessed them these three times!
Transliteration: vayichar-af valak el-vileam vayisefok et-khafayv vayomer valak el-vileam lakov oyevay keratiykha vehineh verakheta varekhe zeh shalosh feamiym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה בְּרַח־לְךָ֣ אֶל־מְקוֹמֶ֑ךָ אָמַ֙רְתִּי֙ כַּבֵּ֣ד אֲכַבֶּדְךָ֔ וְהִנֵּ֛ה מְנָעֲךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה מִכָּבֽוֹד׃
Translated: Back with you at once to your own place! I was going to reward you richly, but יהוה has denied you the reward.”
Transliteration: veatah verach-lekha el-mekvomekha amaretiy khaved akhavedekha vehineh menaakha yehovah mikhavvod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר בִּלְעָ֖ם אֶל־בָּלָ֑ק הֲלֹ֗א גַּ֧ם אֶל־מַלְאָכֶ֛יךָ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥חְתָּ אֵלַ֖י דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Balaam replied to Balak, “But I even told the messengers you sent to me,
Transliteration: vayomer vileam el-valak halo gam el-maleakheykha asher-shalacheta elay divaretiy lemor

Hebrew: אִם־יִתֶּן־לִ֨י בָלָ֜ק מְלֹ֣א בֵיתוֹ֮ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָב֒ לֹ֣א אוּכַ֗ל לַעֲבֹר֙ אֶת־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת טוֹבָ֛ה א֥וֹ רָעָ֖ה מִלִּבִּ֑י אֲשֶׁר־יְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֹת֥וֹ אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
Translated: ‘Though Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not of my own accord do anything good or bad contrary to יהוה’s command. What יהוה says, that I must say.’
Transliteration: im-yiten-liy valak melo veytvo khesef vezahav lo ukhal laavor et-fiy yehovah laashvot tvovah vo raah miliviy asher-yedaver yehovah otvo adaver

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הִנְנִ֥י הוֹלֵ֖ךְ לְעַמִּ֑י לְכָה֙ אִיעָ֣צְךָ֔ אֲשֶׁ֨ר יַעֲשֶׂ֜ה הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּ֛ה לְעַמְּךָ֖ בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית הַיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: And now, as I go back to my people, let me inform you of what this people will do to your people in days to come.”
Transliteration: veatah hineniy hvolekhe leamiy lekhah iyatsekha asher yaasheh haam hazeh leamekha veachariyt hayamiym

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר נְאֻ֤ם בִּלְעָם֙ בְּנ֣וֹ בְעֹ֔ר וּנְאֻ֥ם הַגֶּ֖בֶר שְׁתֻ֥ם הָעָֽיִן׃
Translated:
He took up his theme, and said:
Word of Balaam son of Beor,
Word of the man whose eye is true,
Transliteration: vayisha meshalvo vayomar neum vileam venvo veor uneum hagever shetum haayiin

Hebrew: נְאֻ֗ם שֹׁמֵ֙עַ֙ אִמְרֵי־אֵ֔ל וְיֹדֵ֖עַ דַּ֣עַת עֶלְי֑וֹן מַחֲזֵ֤ה שַׁדַּי֙ יֶֽחֱזֶ֔ה נֹפֵ֖ל וּגְל֥וּי עֵינָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Word of one who hears God’s speech,
Who obtains knowledge from the Most High,
And beholds visions from the Almighty,
Prostrate, but with eyes unveiled:
Transliteration: neum shomea imerey-el veyodea daat eleyvon machazeh shaday yechezeh nofel ugeluy eynayiim

Hebrew: אֶרְאֶ֙נּוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א עַתָּ֔ה אֲשׁוּרֶ֖נּוּ וְלֹ֣א קָר֑וֹב דָּרַ֨ךְ כּוֹכָ֜ב מִֽיַּעֲקֹ֗ב וְקָ֥ם שֵׁ֙בֶט֙ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וּמָחַץ֙ פַּאֲתֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב וְקַרְקַ֖ר כׇּל־בְּנֵי־שֵֽׁת׃
Translated:
What I see for them is not yet,
What I behold will not be soon:
A star rises from Jacob,
A scepter comes forth from Israel;
It smashes the brow of Moab,
The foundation of all children of Seth.
Transliteration: ereenu velo atah ashurenu velo karvov darakhe khvokhav miyaakov vekam shevet miyisherael umachats faatey mvoav vekarekar khׇl-veney-shet

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה אֱד֜וֹם יְרֵשָׁ֗ה וְהָיָ֧ה יְרֵשָׁ֛ה שֵׂעִ֖יר אֹיְבָ֑יו וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עֹ֥שֶׂה חָֽיִל׃
Translated:
Edom becomes a possession,
Yea, Seir a possession of its enemies;
But Israel is triumphant.
Transliteration: vehayah edvom yereshah vehayah yereshah sheiyr oyevayv veyisherael osheh chayiil

Hebrew: וְיֵ֖רְדְּ מִֽיַּעֲקֹ֑ב וְהֶֽאֱבִ֥יד שָׂרִ֖יד מֵעִֽיר׃
Translated:
A victor issues from Jacob
To wipe out what is left of Ir.
Transliteration: veeirede miyaakov veheeviyd shariyd meiyr

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־עֲמָלֵ֔ק וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר רֵאשִׁ֤ית גּוֹיִם֙ עֲמָלֵ֔ק וְאַחֲרִית֖וֹ עֲדֵ֥י אֹבֵֽד׃
Translated:
He saw Amalek and, taking up his theme, he said:
A leading nation is Amalek;
But its fate is to perish forever.
Transliteration: vayare et-amalek vayisha meshalvo vayomar reshiyt gvoyim amalek veachariytvo adey oved

Hebrew: וַיַּרְא֙ אֶת־הַקֵּינִ֔י וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אֵיתָן֙ מֽוֹשָׁבֶ֔ךָ וְשִׂ֥ים בַּסֶּ֖לַע קִנֶּֽךָ׃
Translated:
He saw the Kenites and, taking up his theme, he said:
Though your abode be secure,
And your nest be set among cliffs,
Transliteration: vayare et-hakeyniy vayisha meshalvo vayomar eytan mvoshavekha veshiym vasela kinekha

Hebrew: כִּ֥י אִם־יִהְיֶ֖ה לְבָ֣עֵֽר קָ֑יִן עַד־מָ֖ה אַשּׁ֥וּר תִּשְׁבֶּֽךָּ׃
Translated:
Yet shall Kain be consumed,
When Asshur takes you captive.
Transliteration: khiy im-yiheyeh levaer kayiin ad-mah ashur tishevekha

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֥א מְשָׁל֖וֹ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר א֕וֹי מִ֥י יִחְיֶ֖ה מִשֻּׂמ֥וֹ אֵֽל׃
Translated:
He took up his theme and said:
Alas, who can survive except God has willed it!
Transliteration: vayisha meshalvo vayomar voy miy yicheyeh mishumvo el

Hebrew: וְצִים֙ מִיַּ֣ד כִּתִּ֔ים וְעִנּ֥וּ אַשּׁ֖וּר וְעִנּוּ־עֵ֑בֶר וְגַם־ה֖וּא עֲדֵ֥י אֹבֵֽד׃
Translated:
Ships come from the quarter of Kittim;
They subject Asshur, subject Eber.
They, too, shall perish forever.
Transliteration: vetsiym miyad khitiym veinu ashur veinu-ever vegam-hu adey oved

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣קׇם בִּלְעָ֔ם וַיֵּ֖לֶךְ וַיָּ֣שׇׁב לִמְקֹמ֑וֹ וְגַם־בָּלָ֖ק הָלַ֥ךְ לְדַרְכּֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Balaam set out on his journey back home; and Balak also went his way.
Transliteration: vayakׇm vileam vayelekhe vayashׇv limekomvo vegam-valak halakhe ledarekhvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּשִּׁטִּ֑ים וַיָּ֣חֶל הָעָ֔ם לִזְנ֖וֹת אֶל־בְּנ֥וֹת מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: While Israel was staying at Shittim, the menfolk profaned themselves by whoring with the Moabite women,
Transliteration: vayeshev yisherael vashitiym vayachel haam lizenvot el-venvot mvoav

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרֶ֣אןָ לָעָ֔ם לְזִבְחֵ֖י אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֑ן וַיֹּ֣אכַל הָעָ֔ם וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ לֵאלֹֽהֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: who invited the menfolk to the sacrifices for their god. The menfolk partook of them and worshiped that god.
Transliteration: vatikerena laam lezivechey eloheyhen vayokhal haam vayishetachavu leloheyhen

Hebrew: וַיִּצָּ֥מֶד יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לְבַ֣עַל פְּע֑וֹר וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thus Israel attached itself to Baal-peor, and יהוה was incensed with Israel.
Transliteration: vayitsamed yisherael levaal fevor vayichar-af yehovah veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה קַ֚ח אֶת־כׇּל־רָאשֵׁ֣י הָעָ֔ם וְהוֹקַ֥ע אוֹתָ֛ם לַיהֹוָ֖ה נֶ֣גֶד הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וְיָשֹׁ֛ב חֲר֥וֹן אַף־יְהֹוָ֖ה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Take all the ringleaders and have them publicly impaled before יהוה, so that יהוה’s wrath may turn away from Israel.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh kach et-khׇl-rashey haam vehvoka votam layhovah neged hashamesh veyashov charvon af-yehovah miyisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־שֹׁפְטֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הִרְגוּ֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֲנָשָׁ֔יו הַנִּצְמָדִ֖ים לְבַ֥עַל פְּעֽוֹר׃
Translated: So Moses said to Israel’s officials, “Each of you slay those of his men who attached themselves to Baal-peor.”
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-shofetey yisherael hiregu iysh anashayv hanitsemadiym levaal fevor

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֡ה אִישׁ֩ מִבְּנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בָּ֗א וַיַּקְרֵ֤ב אֶל־אֶחָיו֙ אֶת־הַמִּדְיָנִ֔ית לְעֵינֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה וּלְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְהֵ֣מָּה בֹכִ֔ים פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translated: Just then a certain Israelite man came and brought a Midianite woman over to his companions, in the sight of Moses and of the whole Israelite community who were weeping at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
Transliteration: vehineh iysh miveney yisherael va vayakerev el-echayv et-hamideyaniyt leeyney mosheh uleeyney khׇl-adat veney-yisherael vehemah vokhiym fetach ohel mvoed

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗רְא פִּֽינְחָס֙ בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֔ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וַיָּ֙קׇם֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה וַיִּקַּ֥ח רֹ֖מַח בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: When Phinehas, son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, saw this, he left the assembly and, taking a spear in his hand,
Transliteration: vayare fiynechas ven-eleazar ven-aharon hakhohen vayakׇm mitvokhe haedah vayikach romach veyadvo

Hebrew: וַ֠יָּבֹ֠א אַחַ֨ר אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־הַקֻּבָּ֗ה וַיִּדְקֹר֙ אֶת־שְׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֚ת אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאֶת־הָאִשָּׁ֖ה אֶל־קֳבָתָ֑הּ וַתֵּֽעָצַר֙ הַמַּגֵּפָ֔ה מֵעַ֖ל בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: he followed the Israelite man into the chamber and stabbed both of them, the Israelite man and the woman, through the belly. Then the plague against the Israelites was checked.
Transliteration: vayavo achar iysh-yisherael el-hakuvah vayidekor et-sheneyhem et iysh yisherael veet-haishah el-kovatah vateatsar hamagefah meal veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֕וּ הַמֵּתִ֖ים בַּמַּגֵּפָ֑ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה וְעֶשְׂרִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃ {פ}
Translated: Those who died of the plague numbered twenty-four thousand.
Transliteration: vayiheyu hametiym vamagefah arevaah veesheriym alef {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: פִּֽינְחָ֨ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֜ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֗ן הֵשִׁ֤יב אֶת־חֲמָתִי֙ מֵעַ֣ל בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בְּקַנְא֥וֹ אֶת־קִנְאָתִ֖י בְּתוֹכָ֑ם וְלֹא־כִלִּ֥יתִי אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּקִנְאָתִֽי׃
Translated: “Phinehas, son of Eleazar son of Aaron the priest, has turned back My wrath from the Israelites by displaying among them his passion for Me, so that I did not wipe out the Israelite people in My passion.
Transliteration: fiynechas ven-eleazar ven-aharon hakhohen heshiyv et-chamatiy meal veney-yisherael vekanevo et-kineatiy vetvokham velo-khiliytiy et-veney-yisherael vekineatiy

Hebrew: לָכֵ֖ן אֱמֹ֑ר הִנְנִ֨י נֹתֵ֥ן ל֛וֹ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֖י שָׁלֽוֹם׃
Translated: Say, therefore, ‘I grant him My pact of friendship.
Transliteration: lakhen emor hineniy noten lvo et-veriytiy shalvom

Hebrew: וְהָ֤יְתָה לּוֹ֙ וּלְזַרְע֣וֹ אַחֲרָ֔יו בְּרִ֖ית כְּהֻנַּ֣ת עוֹלָ֑ם תַּ֗חַת אֲשֶׁ֤ר קִנֵּא֙ לֵֽאלֹהָ֔יו וַיְכַפֵּ֖ר עַל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: It shall be for him and his descendants after him a pact of priesthood for all time, because he took impassioned action for his God, thus making expiation for the Israelites.’”
Transliteration: vehayetah lvo ulezarevo acharayv veriyt khehunat volam tachat asher kine lelohayv vayekhafer al-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְשֵׁם֩ אִ֨ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל הַמֻּכֶּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֻכָּה֙ אֶת־הַמִּדְיָנִ֔ית זִמְרִ֖י בֶּן־סָל֑וּא נְשִׂ֥יא בֵֽית־אָ֖ב לַשִּׁמְעֹנִֽי׃
Translated: The name of the Israelite man who was killed, the one who was killed with the Midianite woman, was Zimri son of Salu, chieftain of a Simeonite ancestral house.
Transliteration: veshem iysh yisherael hamukheh asher hukhah et-hamideyaniyt zimeriy ven-salu neshiy veyt-av lashimeoniy

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֨ם הָֽאִשָּׁ֧ה הַמֻּכָּ֛ה הַמִּדְיָנִ֖ית כׇּזְבִּ֣י בַת־צ֑וּר רֹ֣אשׁ אֻמּ֥וֹת בֵּֽית־אָ֛ב בְּמִדְיָ֖ן הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated: The name of the Midianite woman who was killed was Cozbi daughter of Zur; he was the tribal head of an ancestral house in Midian.
Transliteration: veshem haishah hamukhah hamideyaniyt khׇzeviy vat-tsur rosh umvot veyt-av vemideyan hu {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: צָר֖וֹר אֶת־הַמִּדְיָנִ֑ים וְהִכִּיתֶ֖ם אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: “Assail the Midianites and defeat them—
Transliteration: tsarvor et-hamideyaniym vehikhiytem votam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י צֹרְרִ֥ים הֵם֙ לָכֶ֔ם בְּנִכְלֵיהֶ֛ם אֲשֶׁר־נִכְּל֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם עַל־דְּבַר־פְּע֑וֹר וְעַל־דְּבַ֞ר כׇּזְבִּ֨י בַת־נְשִׂ֤יא מִדְיָן֙ אֲחֹתָ֔ם הַמֻּכָּ֥ה בְיוֹם־הַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה עַל־דְּבַר־פְּעֽוֹר׃
Translated: for they assailed you by the trickery they practiced against you—because of the affair of Peor and because of the affair of their kinswoman Cozbi, daughter of the Midianite chieftain, who was killed at the time of the plague on account of Peor.”
Transliteration: khiy tsoreriym hem lakhem venikheleyhem asher-nikhelu lakhem al-devar-fevor veal-devar khׇzeviy vat-neshiy mideyan achotam hamukhah veyvom-hamagefah al-devar-fevor

Hebrew:
וַיְהִ֖י אַחֲרֵ֣י הַמַּגֵּפָ֑ה {פ}
וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאֶ֧ל אֶלְעָזָ֛ר בֶּן־אַהֲרֹ֥ן הַכֹּהֵ֖ן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: When the plague was over, יהוה said to Moses and to Eleazar son of Aaron the priest,
Transliteration:
vayehiy acharey hamagefah {f}
vayomer yehovah el-mosheh veel eleazar ven-aharon hakhohen lemor

Hebrew: שְׂא֞וּ אֶת־רֹ֣אשׁ ׀ כׇּל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֛ה וָמַ֖עְלָה לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם כׇּל־יֹצֵ֥א צָבָ֖א בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “Take a census of the whole Israelite company [of fighters] from the age of twenty years up, by their ancestral houses, all Israelite males able to bear arms.”
Transliteration: sheu et-rosh khׇl-adat veney-yisherael miven esheriym shanah vamaelah leveyt avotam khׇl-yotse tsava veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֨ר מֹשֶׁ֜ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֹתָ֖ם בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֑ב עַל־יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵח֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: So Moses and Eleazar the priest, on the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho, gave instructions about them, namely,
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh veeleazar hakhohen otam vearevot mvoav al-yareden yerechvo lemor

Hebrew: מִבֶּ֛ן עֶשְׂרִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה וָמָ֑עְלָה כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ צִוָּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁה֙ וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: those from twenty years up, as יהוה had commanded Moses. The [eligible male] descendants of the Israelites who came out of the land of Egypt were:
Transliteration: miven esheriym shanah vamaelah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh uveney yisherael hayotseiym meerets mitserayiim

Hebrew: רְאוּבֵ֖ן בְּכ֣וֹר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֗ן חֲנוֹךְ֙ מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַחֲנֹכִ֔י לְפַלּ֕וּא מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַפַּלֻּאִֽי׃
Translated: Reuben, Israel’s first-born. Descendants of Reuben: [Of] Enoch, the clan of the Enochites; of Pallu, the clan of the Palluites;
