Transliteration: reuven vekhvor yisherael veney reuven chanvokhe mishefachat hachanokhiy lefalu mishefachat hafaluiy

Hebrew: לְחֶצְרֹ֕ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶצְרוֹנִ֑י לְכַרְמִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַכַּרְמִֽי׃
Translated: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Carmi, the clan of the Carmites.
Transliteration: lechetseron mishefachat hachetservoniy lekharemiy mishefachat hakharemiy

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הָראוּבֵנִ֑י וַיִּהְי֣וּ פְקֻדֵיהֶ֗ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה וְאַרְבָּעִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Those are the clans of the Reubenites. The men enrolled came to 43,730.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot haruveniy vayiheyu fekudeyhem sheloshah vearevaiym elef usheva mevot usheloshiym

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֥י פַלּ֖וּא אֱלִיאָֽב׃
Translated: Born to Pallu: Eliab.
Transliteration: uveney falu eliyav

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֣י אֱלִיאָ֔ב נְמוּאֵ֖ל וְדָתָ֣ן וַאֲבִירָ֑ם הֽוּא־דָתָ֨ן וַאֲבִירָ֜ם (קרואי) [קְרִיאֵ֣י] הָעֵדָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִצּ֜וּ עַל־מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְעַֽל־אַהֲרֹן֙ בַּעֲדַת־קֹ֔רַח בְּהַצֹּתָ֖ם עַל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The sons of Eliab were Nemuel, and Dathan and Abiram. These are the same Dathan and Abiram, chosen in the assembly, who agitated against Moses and Aaron as part of Korah’s band when they agitated against יהוה.
Transliteration: uveney eliyav nemuel vedatan vaaviyram hu-datan vaaviyram (krvy) [keriyey] haedah asher hitsu al-mosheh veal-aharon vaadat-korach vehatsotam al-yehovah

Hebrew: וַתִּפְתַּ֨ח הָאָ֜רֶץ אֶת־פִּ֗יהָ וַתִּבְלַ֥ע אֹתָ֛ם וְאֶת־קֹ֖רַח בְּמ֣וֹת הָעֵדָ֑ה בַּאֲכֹ֣ל הָאֵ֗שׁ אֵ֣ת חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים וּמָאתַ֙יִם֙ אִ֔ישׁ וַיִּהְי֖וּ לְנֵֽס׃
Translated: Whereupon the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up with Korah—when that band died, when the fire consumed the two hundred and fifty men—and they became an example.
Transliteration: vatifetach haarets et-fiyha vativela otam veet-korach vemvot haedah vaakhol haesh et chamishiym umatayiim iysh vayiheyu lenes

Hebrew: וּבְנֵי־קֹ֖רַח לֹא־מֵֽתוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: The sons of Korah, however, did not die.
Transliteration: uveney-korach lo-metu {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְעוֹן֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לִנְמוּאֵ֗ל מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַנְּמ֣וּאֵלִ֔י לְיָמִ֕ין מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיָּמִינִ֑י לְיָכִ֕ין מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיָּכִינִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Simeon by their clans: Of Nemuel, the clan of the Nemuelites; of Jamin, the clan of the Jaminites; of Jachin, the clan of the Jachinites;
Transliteration: veney shimevon lemishefechotam linemuel mishefachat hanemueliy leyamiyn mishefachat hayamiyniy leyakhiyn mishefachat hayakhiyniy

Hebrew: לְזֶ֕רַח מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַזַּרְחִ֑י לְשָׁא֕וּל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשָּׁאוּלִֽי׃
Translated: of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites; of Saul, the clan of the Saulites.
Transliteration: lezerach mishefachat hazarechiy leshaul mishefachat hashauliy

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַשִּׁמְעֹנִ֑י שְׁנַ֧יִם וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּמָאתָֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the clans of the Simeonites; [men enrolled: ] 22,200.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot hashimeoniy shenayiim veesheriym elef umatayiim {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י גָד֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לִצְפ֗וֹן מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַצְּפוֹנִ֔י לְחַגִּ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחַגִּ֑י לְשׁוּנִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשּׁוּנִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Gad by their clans: Of Zephon, the clan of the Zephonites; of Haggi, the clan of the Haggites; of Shuni, the clan of the Shunites;
Transliteration: veney gad lemishefechotam litsefvon mishefachat hatsefvoniy lechagiy mishefachat hachagiy leshuniy mishefachat hashuniy

Hebrew: לְאׇזְנִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאׇזְנִ֑י לְעֵרִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָעֵרִֽי׃
Translated: of Ozni, the clan of the Oznites; of Eri, the clan of the Erites;
Transliteration: leׇzeniy mishefachat haׇzeniy leeriy mishefachat haeriy

Hebrew: לַאֲר֕וֹד מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאֲרוֹדִ֑י לְאַ֨רְאֵלִ֔י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאַרְאֵלִֽי׃
Translated: of Arod, the clan of the Arodites; of Areli, the clan of the Arelites.
Transliteration: laarvod mishefachat haarvodiy leareeliy mishefachat haareeliy

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־גָ֖ד לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the clans of Gad’s descendants; men enrolled: 40,500.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot veney-gad lifekudeyhem arevaiym elef vachamesh mevot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה עֵ֣ר וְאוֹנָ֑ן וַיָּ֥מׇת עֵ֛ר וְאוֹנָ֖ן בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: Born to Judah: Er and Onan. Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: veney yehudah er vevonan vayamׇt er vevonan veerets khenaan

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ בְנֵי־יְהוּדָה֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְשֵׁלָ֗ה מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַשֵּׁ֣לָנִ֔י לְפֶ֕רֶץ מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַפַּרְצִ֑י לְזֶ֕רַח מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַזַּרְחִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Judah by their clans: Of Shelah, the clan of the Shelanites; of Perez, the clan of the Perezites; of Zerah, the clan of the Zerahites.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-yehudah lemishefechotam leshelah mishefachat hashelaniy leferets mishefachat hafaretsiy lezerach mishefachat hazarechiy

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ בְנֵי־פֶ֔רֶץ לְחֶצְרֹ֕ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶצְרֹנִ֑י לְחָמ֕וּל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הֶחָמוּלִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Perez: of Hezron, the clan of the Hezronites; of Hamul, the clan of the Hamulites.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-ferets lechetseron mishefachat hachetseroniy lechamul mishefachat hechamuliy

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת יְהוּדָ֖ה לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שִׁשָּׁ֧ה וְשִׁבְעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the clans of Judah; men enrolled: 76,500.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot yehudah lifekudeyhem shishah veshiveiym elef vachamesh mevot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י יִשָּׂשכָר֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם תּוֹלָ֕ע מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַתּוֹלָעִ֑י לְפֻוָ֕ה מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַפּוּנִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Issachar by their clans: [Of] Tola, the clan of the Tolaites; of Puvah, the clan of the Punites;
Transliteration: veney yishashkhar lemishefechotam tvola mishefachat hatvolaiy lefuvah mishefachat hafuniy

Hebrew: לְיָשׁ֕וּב מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיָּשֻׁבִ֑י לְשִׁמְרֹ֕ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשִּׁמְרֹנִֽי׃
Translated: of Jashub, the clan of the Jashubites; of Shimron, the clan of the Shimronites.
Transliteration: leyashuv mishefachat hayashuviy leshimeron mishefachat hashimeroniy

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁלֹ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the clans of Issachar; men enrolled: 64,300.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot yishashkhar lifekudeyhem arevaah veshishiym elef ushelosh mevot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י זְבוּלֻן֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְסֶ֗רֶד מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַסַּרְדִּ֔י לְאֵל֕וֹן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאֵלֹנִ֑י לְיַ֨חְלְאֵ֔ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיַּחְלְאֵלִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Zebulun by their clans: Of Sered, the clan of the Seredites; of Elon, the clan of the Elonites; of Jahleel, the clan of the Jahleelites.
Transliteration: veney zevulun lemishefechotam lesered mishefachat hasarediy leelvon mishefachat haeloniy leyacheleel mishefachat hayacheleeliy

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַזְּבוּלֹנִ֖י לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שִׁשִּׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the clans of the Zebulunites; men enrolled: 60,500.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot hazevuloniy lifekudeyhem shishiym elef vachamesh mevot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י יוֹסֵ֖ף לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה וְאֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: The sons of Joseph were Manasseh and Ephraim—by their clans.
Transliteration: veney yvosef lemishefechotam menasheh veeferayiim

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה לְמָכִיר֙ מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַמָּכִירִ֔י וּמָכִ֖יר הוֹלִ֣יד אֶת־גִּלְעָ֑ד לְגִלְעָ֕ד מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַגִּלְעָדִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Manasseh: Of Machir, the clan of the Machirites.—Machir begot Gilead.—Of Gilead, the clan of the Gileadites.
Transliteration: veney menasheh lemakhiyr mishefachat hamakhiyriy umakhiyr hvoliyd et-gilead legilead mishefachat hagileadiy

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י גִלְעָ֔ד אִיעֶ֕זֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאִֽיעֶזְרִ֑י לְחֵ֕לֶק מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶלְקִֽי׃
Translated: These were the descendants of Gilead: [Of] Iezer, the clan of the Iezerites; of Helek, the clan of the Helekites;
Transliteration: eleh veney gilead iyezer mishefachat haiyezeriy lechelek mishefachat hachelekiy

Hebrew: וְאַ֨שְׂרִיאֵ֔ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאַשְׂרִֽאֵלִ֑י וְשֶׁ֕כֶם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשִּׁכְמִֽי׃
Translated: [of] Asriel, the clan of the Asrielites; [of] Shechem, the clan of the Shechemites;
Transliteration: veasheriyel mishefachat haasherieliy veshekhem mishefachat hashikhemiy

Hebrew: וּשְׁמִידָ֕ע מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשְּׁמִידָעִ֑י וְחֵ֕פֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶפְרִֽי׃
Translated: [of] Shemida, the clan of the Shemidaites; [of] Hepher, the clan of the Hepherites.—
Transliteration: ushemiyda mishefachat hashemiydaiy vechefer mishefachat hacheferiy

Hebrew: וּצְלׇפְחָ֣ד בֶּן־חֵ֗פֶר לֹא־הָ֥יוּ ל֛וֹ בָּנִ֖ים כִּ֣י אִם־בָּנ֑וֹת וְשֵׁם֙ בְּנ֣וֹת צְלׇפְחָ֔ד מַחְלָ֣ה וְנֹעָ֔ה חׇגְלָ֥ה מִלְכָּ֖ה וְתִרְצָֽה׃
Translated: Now Zelophehad son of Hepher had no sons, only daughters. The names of Zelophehad’s daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.—
Transliteration: utselׇfechad ven-chefer lo-hayu lvo vaniym khiy im-vanvot veshem venvot tselׇfechad machelah venoah chׇgelah milekhah vetiretsah

Hebrew: אֵ֖לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וּפְקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁנַ֧יִם וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וּשְׁבַ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the clans of Manasseh; men enrolled: 52,700.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot menasheh ufekudeyhem shenayiim vachamishiym elef usheva mevot {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בְנֵי־אֶפְרַ֘יִם֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְשׁוּתֶ֗לַח מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַשֻּׁ֣תַלְחִ֔י לְבֶ֕כֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַבַּכְרִ֑י לְתַ֕חַן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽתַּחֲנִֽי׃
Translated: These are the descendants of Ephraim by their clans: Of Shuthelah, the clan of the Shuthelahites; of Becher, the clan of the Becherites; of Tahan, the clan of the Tahanites.
Transliteration: eleh veney-eferayiim lemishefechotam leshutelach mishefachat hashutalechiy levekher mishefachat havakheriy letachan mishefachat hatachaniy

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה בְּנֵ֣י שׁוּתָ֑לַח לְעֵרָ֕ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָעֵרָנִֽי׃
Translated: These are the descendants of Shuthelah: Of Eran, the clan of the Eranites.
Transliteration: veeleh veney shutalach leeran mishefachat haeraniy

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֤ת בְּנֵי־אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ לִפְקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם שְׁנַ֧יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵי־יוֹסֵ֖ף לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the clans of Ephraim’s descendants; men enrolled: 32,500. Those are the descendants of Joseph by their clans.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot veney-eferayiim lifekudeyhem shenayiim usheloshiym elef vachamesh mevot eleh veney-yvosef lemishefechotam {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י בִנְיָמִן֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְבֶ֗לַע מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַבַּלְעִ֔י לְאַשְׁבֵּ֕ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָֽאַשְׁבֵּלִ֑י לַאֲחִירָ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הָאֲחִירָמִֽי׃
Translated: The descendants of Benjamin by their clans: Of Bela, the clan of the Belaites; of Ashbel, the clan of the Ashbelites; of Ahiram, the clan of the Ahiramites;
Transliteration: veney vineyamin lemishefechotam levela mishefachat havaleiy leashevel mishefachat haasheveliy laachiyram mishefachat haachiyramiy

Hebrew: לִשְׁפוּפָ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשּׁוּפָמִ֑י לְחוּפָ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַחוּפָמִֽי׃
Translated: of Shephupham, the clan of the Shuphamites; of Hupham, the clan of the Huphamites.
Transliteration: lishefufam mishefachat hashufamiy lechufam mishefachat hachufamiy

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֥וּ בְנֵי־בֶ֖לַע אַ֣רְדְּ וְנַעֲמָ֑ן מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הָֽאַרְדִּ֔י לְנַֽעֲמָ֔ן מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽנַּעֲמִֽי׃
Translated: The sons of Bela were Ard and Naaman: [Of Ard,] the clan of the Ardites; of Naaman, the clan of the Naamanites.
Transliteration: vayiheyu veney-vela arede venaaman mishefachat haarediy lenaaman mishefachat hanaamiy

Hebrew: אֵ֥לֶּה בְנֵי־בִנְיָמִ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם וּפְקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְשֵׁ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: Those are the descendants of Benjamin by their clans; men enrolled: 45,600.
Transliteration: eleh veney-vineyamin lemishefechotam ufekudeyhem chamishah vearevaiym elef veshesh mevot {s}

Hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה בְנֵי־דָן֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם לְשׁוּחָ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשּׁוּחָמִ֑י אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת דָּ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: These are the descendants of Dan by their clans: Of Shuham, the clan of the Shuhamites. Those are the clans of Dan, by their clans.
Transliteration: eleh veney-dan lemishefechotam leshucham mishefachat hashuchamiy eleh mishefechot dan lemishefechotam

Hebrew: כׇּל־מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת הַשּׁוּחָמִ֖י לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם אַרְבָּעָ֧ה וְשִׁשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: All the clans of the Shuhamites; men enrolled: 64,400.
Transliteration: khׇl-mishefechot hashuchamiy lifekudeyhem arevaah veshishiym elef veareva mevot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֣י אָשֵׁר֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְיִמְנָ֗ה מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַיִּמְנָ֔ה לְיִשְׁוִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיִּשְׁוִ֑י לִבְרִיעָ֕ה מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַבְּרִיעִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Asher by their clans: Of Imnah, the clan of the Imnites; of Ishvi, the clan of the Ishvites; of Beriah, the clan of the Beriites.
Transliteration: veney asher lemishefechotam leyimenah mishefachat hayimenah leyisheviy mishefachat hayisheviy liveriyah mishefachat haveriyiy

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י בְרִיעָ֔ה לְחֶ֕בֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַֽחֶבְרִ֑י לְמַ֨לְכִּיאֵ֔ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַמַּלְכִּיאֵלִֽי׃
Translated: Of the descendants of Beriah: Of Heber, the clan of the Heberites; of Malchiel, the clan of the Malchielites.—
Transliteration: liveney veriyah lechever mishefachat hacheveriy lemalekhiyel mishefachat hamalekhiyeliy

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֥ם בַּת־אָשֵׁ֖ר שָֽׂרַח׃
Translated: The name of Asher’s daughter was Serah.—
Transliteration: veshem vat-asher sharach

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת בְּנֵי־אָשֵׁ֖ר לִפְקֻדֵיהֶ֑ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֧ה וַחֲמִשִּׁ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃ {ס}
Translated: These are the clans of Asher’s descendants; men enrolled: 53,400.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot veney-asher lifekudeyhem sheloshah vachamishiym elef veareva mevot {s}

Hebrew: בְּנֵ֤י נַפְתָּלִי֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם לְיַ֨חְצְאֵ֔ל מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיַּחְצְאֵלִ֑י לְגוּנִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַגּוּנִֽי׃
Translated: Descendants of Naphtali by their clans: Of Jahzeel, the clan of the Jahzeelites; of Guni, the clan of the Gunites;
Transliteration: veney nafetaliy lemishefechotam leyachetseel mishefachat hayachetseeliy leguniy mishefachat haguniy

Hebrew: לְיֵ֕צֶר מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַיִּצְרִ֑י לְשִׁלֵּ֕ם מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַשִּׁלֵּמִֽי׃
Translated: of Jezer, the clan of the Jezerites; of Shillem, the clan of the Shillemites.
Transliteration: leeitser mishefachat hayitseriy leshilem mishefachat hashilemiy

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה מִשְׁפְּחֹ֥ת נַפְתָּלִ֖י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם וּפְקֻ֣דֵיהֶ֔ם חֲמִשָּׁ֧ה וְאַרְבָּעִ֛ים אֶ֖לֶף וְאַרְבַּ֥ע מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: Those are the clans of the Naphtalites, clan by clan; men enrolled: 45,400.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot nafetaliy lemishefechotam ufekudeyhem chamishah vearevaiym elef veareva mevot

Hebrew: אֵ֗לֶּה פְּקוּדֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֖לֶף וָאָ֑לֶף שְׁבַ֥ע מֵא֖וֹת וּשְׁלֹשִֽׁים׃ {פ}
Translated: This is the enrollment of the Israelite men: 601,730.
Transliteration: eleh fekudey veney yisherael shesh-mevot elef vaalef sheva mevot usheloshiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: לָאֵ֗לֶּה תֵּחָלֵ֥ק הָאָ֛רֶץ בְּנַחֲלָ֖ה בְּמִסְפַּ֥ר שֵׁמֽוֹת׃
Translated: “Among these shall the land be apportioned as shares, according to the listed names:
Transliteration: laeleh techalek haarets venachalah vemisefar shemvot

Hebrew: לָרַ֗ב תַּרְבֶּה֙ נַחֲלָת֔וֹ וְלַמְעַ֕ט תַּמְעִ֖יט נַחֲלָת֑וֹ אִ֚ישׁ לְפִ֣י פְקֻדָ֔יו יֻתַּ֖ן נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: with larger groups increase the share, with smaller groups reduce the share. Each is to be assigned its share according to its enrollment.
Transliteration: larav tareveh nachalatvo velameat tameiyt nachalatvo iysh lefiy fekudayv yutan nachalatvo

Hebrew: אַךְ־בְּגוֹרָ֕ל יֵחָלֵ֖ק אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ לִשְׁמ֥וֹת מַטּוֹת־אֲבֹתָ֖ם יִנְחָֽלוּ׃
Translated: The land, moreover, is to be apportioned by lot; and the allotment shall be made according to the listings of their ancestral tribes.
Transliteration: akhe-vegvoral eichalek et-haarets lishemvot matvot-avotam yinechalu

Hebrew: עַל־פִּי֙ הַגּוֹרָ֔ל תֵּחָלֵ֖ק נַחֲלָת֑וֹ בֵּ֥ין רַ֖ב לִמְעָֽט׃ {ס}
Translated: Each portion shall be assigned by lot, whether for larger or smaller groups.”
Transliteration: al-fiy hagvoral techalek nachalatvo veyn rav limeat {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה פְקוּדֵ֣י הַלֵּוִי֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לְגֵרְשׁ֗וֹן מִשְׁפַּ֙חַת֙ הַגֵּ֣רְשֻׁנִּ֔י לִקְהָ֕ת מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַקְּהָתִ֑י לִמְרָרִ֕י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַמְּרָרִֽי׃
Translated: This is the enrollment of the Levites by their clans: Of Gershon, the clan of the Gershonites; of Kohath, the clan of the Kohathites; of Merari, the clan of the Merarites.
Transliteration: veeleh fekudey haleviy lemishefechotam legereshvon mishefachat hagereshuniy likehat mishefachat hakehatiy limerariy mishefachat hamerariy

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה ׀ מִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת לֵוִ֗י מִשְׁפַּ֨חַת הַלִּבְנִ֜י מִשְׁפַּ֤חַת הַֽחֶבְרֹנִי֙ מִשְׁפַּ֤חַת הַמַּחְלִי֙ מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַמּוּשִׁ֔י מִשְׁפַּ֖חַת הַקׇּרְחִ֑י וּקְהָ֖ת הוֹלִ֥ד אֶת־עַמְרָֽם׃
Translated: These are the clans of Levi: The clan of the Libnites, the clan of the Hebronites, the clan of the Mahlites, the clan of the Mushites, the clan of the Korahites.—Kohath begot Amram.
Transliteration: eleh mishefechot leviy mishefachat haliveniy mishefachat hacheveroniy mishefachat hamacheliy mishefachat hamushiy mishefachat hakׇrechiy ukehat hvolid et-ameram

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֣ם ׀ אֵ֣שֶׁת עַמְרָ֗ם יוֹכֶ֙בֶד֙ בַּת־לֵוִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֨ר יָלְדָ֥ה אֹתָ֛הּ לְלֵוִ֖י בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וַתֵּ֣לֶד לְעַמְרָ֗ם אֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וְאֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאֵ֖ת מִרְיָ֥ם אֲחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The name of Amram’s wife was Jochebed daughter of Levi, who was born to Levi in Egypt; she bore to Amram Aaron and Moses and their sister Miriam.
Transliteration: veshem eshet ameram yvokheved vat-leviy asher yaledah otah leleviy vemitserayiim vateled leameram et-aharon veet-mosheh veet mireyam achotam

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּלֵ֣ד לְאַהֲרֹ֔ן אֶת־נָדָ֖ב וְאֶת־אֲבִיה֑וּא אֶת־אֶלְעָזָ֖ר וְאֶת־אִיתָמָֽר׃
Translated: To Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
Transliteration: vayivaled leaharon et-nadav veet-aviyhu et-eleazar veet-iytamar

Hebrew: וַיָּ֥מׇת נָדָ֖ב וַאֲבִיה֑וּא בְּהַקְרִיבָ֥ם אֵשׁ־זָרָ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Nadab and Abihu died when they offered alien fire before יהוה.—
Transliteration: vayamׇt nadav vaaviyhu vehakeriyvam esh-zarah lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּהְי֣וּ פְקֻדֵיהֶ֗ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה וְעֶשְׂרִים֙ אֶ֔לֶף כׇּל־זָכָ֖ר מִבֶּן־חֹ֣דֶשׁ וָמָ֑עְלָה כִּ֣י ׀ לֹ֣א הׇתְפָּקְד֗וּ בְּתוֹךְ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּ֠י לֹא־נִתַּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ נַחֲלָ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Their enrollment of 23,000 comprised all males from a month up. They were not part of the regular enrollment of the Israelites, since no share was assigned to them among the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayiheyu fekudeyhem sheloshah veesheriym elef khׇl-zakhar miven-chodesh vamaelah khiy lo hׇtefakedu vetvokhe veney yisherael khiy lo-nitan lahem nachalah vetvokhe veney yisherael

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה פְּקוּדֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֖ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן אֲשֶׁ֨ר פָּֽקְד֜וּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב עַ֖ל יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃
Translated: These are the males enrolled by Moses and Eleazar the priest who registered the Israelites on the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho.
Transliteration: eleh fekudey mosheh veeleazar hakhohen asher fakedu et-veney yisherael vearevot mvoav al yareden yerechvo

Hebrew: וּבְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ לֹא־הָ֣יָה אִ֔ישׁ מִפְּקוּדֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֵ֑ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר פָּקְד֛וּ אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translated: Among these there was not one of those enrolled by Moses and Aaron the priest when they recorded the Israelites in the wilderness of Sinai.
Transliteration: uveeleh lo-hayah iysh mifekudey mosheh veaharon hakhohen asher fakedu et-veney yisherael vemidevar siynay

Hebrew: כִּֽי־אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ לָהֶ֔ם מ֥וֹת יָמֻ֖תוּ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְלֹא־נוֹתַ֤ר מֵהֶם֙ אִ֔ישׁ כִּ֚י אִם־כָּלֵ֣ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֔ה וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃ {ס}
Translated: For יהוה had said of them, “They shall die in the wilderness.” Not one of them survived, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
Transliteration: khiy-amar yehovah lahem mvot yamutu vamidevar velo-nvotar mehem iysh khiy im-khalev ven-yefuneh viyhvoshua vin-nun {s}

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרַ֜בְנָה בְּנ֣וֹת צְלׇפְחָ֗ד בֶּן־חֵ֤פֶר בֶּן־גִּלְעָד֙ בֶּן־מָכִ֣יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה בֶן־יוֹסֵ֑ף וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ שְׁמ֣וֹת בְּנֹתָ֔יו מַחְלָ֣ה נֹעָ֔ה וְחׇגְלָ֥ה וּמִלְכָּ֖ה וְתִרְצָֽה׃
Translated: The daughters of Zelophehad, of Manassite family—son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh son of Joseph—came forward. The names of the daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
Transliteration: vatikeravenah venvot tselׇfechad ven-chefer ven-gilead ven-makhiyr ven-menasheh lemishefechot menasheh ven-yvosef veeleh shemvot venotayv machelah noah vechׇgelah umilekhah vetiretsah

Hebrew: וַֽתַּעֲמֹ֜דְנָה לִפְנֵ֣י מֹשֶׁ֗ה וְלִפְנֵי֙ אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְלִפְנֵ֥י הַנְּשִׂיאִ֖ם וְכׇל־הָעֵדָ֑ה פֶּ֥תַח אֹֽהֶל־מוֹעֵ֖ד לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: They stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the chieftains, and the whole assembly, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and they said,
Transliteration: vataamodenah lifeney mosheh velifeney eleazar hakhohen velifeney haneshiyim vekhׇl-haedah fetach ohel-mvoed lemor

Hebrew: אָבִ֘ינוּ֮ מֵ֣ת בַּמִּדְבָּר֒ וְה֨וּא לֹא־הָיָ֜ה בְּת֣וֹךְ הָעֵדָ֗ה הַנּוֹעָדִ֛ים עַל־יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּעֲדַת־קֹ֑רַח כִּֽי־בְחֶטְא֣וֹ מֵ֔ת וּבָנִ֖ים לֹא־הָ֥יוּ לֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Our father died in the wilderness. He was not one of the faction, Korah’s faction, which banded together against יהוה, but died for his own sin; and he has left no sons.
Transliteration: aviynu met vamidevar vehu lo-hayah vetvokhe haedah hanvoadiym al-yehovah vaadat-korach khiy-vechetevo met uvaniym lo-hayu lvo

Hebrew: לָ֣מָּה יִגָּרַ֤ע שֵׁם־אָבִ֙ינוּ֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ מִשְׁפַּחְתּ֔וֹ כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ בֵּ֑ן תְּנָה־לָּ֣נוּ אֲחֻזָּ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ אֲחֵ֥י אָבִֽינוּ׃
Translated: Let not our father’s name be lost to his clan just because he had no son! Give us a holding among our father’s kinsmen!”
Transliteration: lamah yigara shem-aviynu mitvokhe mishefachetvo khiy eyn lvo ven tenah-lanu achuzah vetvokhe achey aviynu

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֥ב מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶת־מִשְׁפָּטָ֖ן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Moses brought their case before יהוה.
Transliteration: vayakerev mosheh et-mishefatan lifeney yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: And יהוה said to Moses,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: כֵּ֗ן בְּנ֣וֹת צְלׇפְחָד֮ דֹּבְרֹת֒ נָתֹ֨ן תִּתֵּ֤ן לָהֶם֙ אֲחֻזַּ֣ת נַחֲלָ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ אֲחֵ֣י אֲבִיהֶ֑ם וְהַֽעֲבַרְתָּ֛ אֶת־נַחֲלַ֥ת אֲבִיהֶ֖ן לָהֶֽן׃
Translated: “The plea of Zelophehad’s daughters is just: you should give them a hereditary holding among their father’s kinsmen; transfer their father’s share to them.
Transliteration: khen venvot tselׇfechad doverot naton titen lahem achuzat nachalah vetvokhe achey aviyhem vehaavareta et-nachalat aviyhen lahen

Hebrew: וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל תְּדַבֵּ֣ר לֵאמֹ֑ר אִ֣ישׁ כִּֽי־יָמ֗וּת וּבֵן֙ אֵ֣ין ל֔וֹ וְהַֽעֲבַרְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־נַחֲלָת֖וֹ לְבִתּֽוֹ׃
Translated: “Further, speak to the Israelite people as follows: ‘If a householder dies without leaving a son, you shall transfer his property to his daughter.
Transliteration: veel-veney yisherael tedaver lemor iysh khiy-yamut uven eyn lvo vehaavaretem et-nachalatvo levitvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ בַּ֑ת וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם אֶת־נַחֲלָת֖וֹ לְאֶחָֽיו׃
Translated: If he has no daughter, you shall assign his property to his brothers.
Transliteration: veim-eyn lvo vat unetatem et-nachalatvo leechayv

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ אַחִ֑ים וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם אֶת־נַחֲלָת֖וֹ לַאֲחֵ֥י אָבִֽיו׃
Translated: If he has no brothers, you shall assign his property to his father’s brothers.
Transliteration: veim-eyn lvo achiym unetatem et-nachalatvo laachey aviyv

Hebrew: וְאִם־אֵ֣ין אַחִים֮ לְאָבִיו֒ וּנְתַתֶּ֣ם אֶת־נַחֲלָת֗וֹ לִשְׁאֵר֞וֹ הַקָּרֹ֥ב אֵלָ֛יו מִמִּשְׁפַּחְתּ֖וֹ וְיָרַ֣שׁ אֹתָ֑הּ וְֽהָ֨יְתָ֜ה לִבְנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְחֻקַּ֣ת מִשְׁפָּ֔ט כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: If his father had no brothers, you shall assign his property to his nearest relative in his own clan, who shall inherit it.’ This shall be the law of procedure for the Israelites, in accordance with יהוה’s command to Moses.”
Transliteration: veim-eyn achiym leaviyv unetatem et-nachalatvo lisheervo hakarov elayv mimishefachetvo veyarash otah vehayetah liveney yisherael lechukat mishefat khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עֲלֵ֛ה אֶל־הַ֥ר הָעֲבָרִ֖ים הַזֶּ֑ה וּרְאֵה֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָתַ֖תִּי לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses, “Ascend these heights of Abarim and view the land that I have given to the Israelite people.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh aleh el-har haavariym hazeh ureeh et-haarets asher natatiy liveney yisherael

Hebrew: וְרָאִ֣יתָה אֹתָ֔הּ וְנֶאֱסַפְתָּ֥ אֶל־עַמֶּ֖יךָ גַּם־אָ֑תָּה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נֶאֱסַ֖ף אַהֲרֹ֥ן אָחִֽיךָ׃
Translated: When you have seen it, you too shall be gathered to your kin, just as your brother Aaron was.
Transliteration: veraiytah otah veneesafeta el-ameykha gam-atah khaasher neesaf aharon achiykha

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ מְרִיתֶ֨ם פִּ֜י בְּמִדְבַּר־צִ֗ן בִּמְרִיבַת֙ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה לְהַקְדִּישֵׁ֥נִי בַמַּ֖יִם לְעֵינֵיהֶ֑ם הֵ֛ם מֵֽי־מְרִיבַ֥ת קָדֵ֖שׁ מִדְבַּר־צִֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: For, in the wilderness of Zin, when the community was contentious, you disobeyed My command to uphold My sanctity in their sight by means of the water.” Those are the Waters of Meribath-kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin.
Transliteration: khaasher meriytem fiy vemidevar-tsin vimeriyvat haedah lehakediysheniy vamayiim leeyneyhem hem mey-meriyvat kadesh midevar-tsin {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Moses spoke to יהוה, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh el-yehovah lemor

Hebrew: יִפְקֹ֣ד יְהֹוָ֔ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י הָרוּחֹ֖ת לְכׇל־בָּשָׂ֑ר אִ֖ישׁ עַל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: “Let יהוה, Source of the breath of all flesh, appoint someone over the community
Transliteration: yifekod yehovah elohey haruchot lekhׇl-vashar iysh al-haedah

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־יֵצֵ֣א לִפְנֵיהֶ֗ם וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר יָבֹא֙ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר יוֹצִיאֵ֖ם וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר יְבִיאֵ֑ם וְלֹ֤א תִהְיֶה֙ עֲדַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּצֹּ֕אן אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֵין־לָהֶ֖ם רֹעֶֽה׃
Translated: who shall go out before them and come in before them, and who shall take them out and bring them in, so that יהוה’s community may not be like sheep that have no shepherd.”
Transliteration: asher-eitse lifeneyhem vaasher yavo lifeneyhem vaasher yvotsiyem vaasher yeviyem velo tiheyeh adat yehovah khatson asher eyn-lahem roeh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֗ה קַח־לְךָ֙ אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֔וּן אִ֖ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־ר֣וּחַ בּ֑וֹ וְסָמַכְתָּ֥ אֶת־יָדְךָ֖ עָלָֽיו׃
Translated: And יהוה answered Moses, “Single out Joshua son of Nun, an inspired man, and lay your hand upon him.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh kach-lekha et-yehvoshua vin-nun iysh asher-rucha vvo vesamakheta et-yadekha alayv

Hebrew: וְהַֽעֲמַדְתָּ֣ אֹת֗וֹ לִפְנֵי֙ אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְלִפְנֵ֖י כׇּל־הָעֵדָ֑ה וְצִוִּיתָ֥ה אֹת֖וֹ לְעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community, and commission him in their sight.
Transliteration: vehaamadeta otvo lifeney eleazar hakhohen velifeney khׇl-haedah vetsiviytah otvo leeyneyhem

Hebrew: וְנָתַתָּ֥ה מֵהֽוֹדְךָ֖ עָלָ֑יו לְמַ֣עַן יִשְׁמְע֔וּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֖ת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Invest him with some of your authority, so that the whole Israelite community may obey.
Transliteration: venatatah mehvodekha alayv lemaan yishemeu khׇl-adat veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְלִפְנֵ֨י אֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ יַעֲמֹ֔ד וְשָׁ֥אַל ל֛וֹ בְּמִשְׁפַּ֥ט הָאוּרִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה עַל־פִּ֨יו יֵצְא֜וּ וְעַל־פִּ֣יו יָבֹ֗אוּ ה֛וּא וְכׇל־בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אִתּ֖וֹ וְכׇל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: But he shall present himself to Eleazar the priest, who shall on his behalf seek the decision of the Urim before יהוה. By such instruction they shall go out and by such instruction they shall come in, he and all the Israelite [militia], and the whole community.”
Transliteration: velifeney eleazar hakhohen yaamod veshaal lvo vemishefat hauriym lifeney yehovah al-fiyv eitseu veal-fiyv yavou hu vekhׇl-veney-yisherael itvo vekhׇl-haedah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֹת֑וֹ וַיִּקַּ֣ח אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ וַיַּֽעֲמִדֵ֙הוּ֙ לִפְנֵי֙ אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְלִפְנֵ֖י כׇּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: Moses did as יהוה commanded him. He took Joshua and had him stand before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community.
Transliteration: vayaash mosheh khaasher tsivah yehovah otvo vayikach et-yehvoshua vayaamidehu lifeney eleazar hakhohen velifeney khׇl-haedah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְמֹ֧ךְ אֶת־יָדָ֛יו עָלָ֖יו וַיְצַוֵּ֑הוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: He laid his hands upon him and commissioned him—as יהוה had spoken through Moses.
Transliteration: vayisemokhe et-yadayv alayv vayetsavehu khaasher diver yehovah veyad-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: צַ֚ו אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם אֶת־קׇרְבָּנִ֨י לַחְמִ֜י לְאִשַּׁ֗י רֵ֚יחַ נִֽיחֹחִ֔י תִּשְׁמְר֕וּ לְהַקְרִ֥יב לִ֖י בְּמוֹעֲדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Command the Israelite people and say to them: Be punctilious in presenting to Me at stated times the offerings of food due Me, as offerings by fire of pleasing odor to Me.
Transliteration: tsav et-veney yisherael veamareta alehem et-kׇrevaniy lachemiy leishay reycha niychochiy tishemeru lehakeriyv liy vemvoadvo

Hebrew: וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ לָהֶ֔ם זֶ֚ה הָֽאִשֶּׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תַּקְרִ֖יבוּ לַיהֹוָ֑ה כְּבָשִׂ֨ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֧ה תְמִימִ֛ם שְׁנַ֥יִם לַיּ֖וֹם עֹלָ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃
Translated: Say to them: These are the offerings by fire that you are to present to יהוה: As a regular burnt offering every day, two yearling lambs without blemish.
Transliteration: veamareta lahem zeh haisheh asher takeriyvu layhovah khevashiym veney-shanah temiymim shenayiim layyvom olah tamiyd

Hebrew: אֶת־הַכֶּ֥בֶשׂ אֶחָ֖ד תַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה בַבֹּ֑קֶר וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֥ין הָֽעַרְבָּֽיִם׃
Translated: You shall offer one lamb in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer at twilight.
Transliteration: et-hakhevesh echad taasheh vavoker veet hakhevesh hasheniy taasheh veyn haarevayiim

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂירִ֧ית הָאֵיפָ֛ה סֹ֖לֶת לְמִנְחָ֑ה בְּלוּלָ֛ה בְּשֶׁ֥מֶן כָּתִ֖ית רְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִֽין׃
Translated: And as a meal offering, there shall be a tenth of an ephah of choice flour with a quarter of a hin of beaten oil mixed in—
Transliteration: vaashiyriyt haeyfah solet leminechah velulah veshemen khatiyt reviyit hahiyn

Hebrew: עֹלַ֖ת תָּמִ֑יד הָעֲשֻׂיָה֙ בְּהַ֣ר סִינַ֔י לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: the regular burnt offering instituted at Mount Sinai —an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה.
Transliteration: olat tamiyd haashuyah vehar siynay lereycha niychocha isheh layhovah

Hebrew: וְנִסְכּוֹ֙ רְבִיעִ֣ת הַהִ֔ין לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד בַּקֹּ֗דֶשׁ הַסֵּ֛ךְ נֶ֥סֶךְ שֵׁכָ֖ר לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The libation with it shall be a quarter of a hin for each lamb, to be poured in the sacred precinct as an offering of fermented drink to יהוה.
Transliteration: venisekhvo reviyit hahiyn lakhevesh haechad vakodesh hasekhe nesekhe shekhar layhovah

Hebrew: וְאֵת֙ הַכֶּ֣בֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִ֔י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בֵּ֣ין הָֽעַרְבָּ֑יִם כְּמִנְחַ֨ת הַבֹּ֤קֶר וּכְנִסְכּוֹ֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: The other lamb you shall offer at twilight, preparing the same meal offering and libation as in the morning—an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה.
Transliteration: veet hakhevesh hasheniy taasheh veyn haarevayiim kheminechat havoker ukhenisekhvo taasheh isheh reycha niychocha layhovah {f}

Hebrew: וּבְיוֹם֙ הַשַּׁבָּ֔ת שְׁנֵֽי־כְבָשִׂ֥ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֖ה תְּמִימִ֑ם וּשְׁנֵ֣י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֗ים סֹ֧לֶת מִנְחָ֛ה בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן וְנִסְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated: On the sabbath day: two yearling lambs without blemish, together with two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in as a meal offering, and with the proper libation—
Transliteration: uveyvom hashavat sheney-khevashiym veney-shanah temiymim usheney esheroniym solet minechah velulah vashemen venisekhvo

Hebrew: עֹלַ֥ת שַׁבַּ֖ת בְּשַׁבַּתּ֑וֹ עַל־עֹלַ֥ת הַתָּמִ֖יד וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: a burnt offering for every sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its libation.
Transliteration: olat shavat veshavatvo al-olat hatamiyd venisekhah {f}

Hebrew: וּבְרָאשֵׁי֙ חׇדְשֵׁיכֶ֔ם תַּקְרִ֥יבוּ עֹלָ֖ה לַיהֹוָ֑ה פָּרִ֨ים בְּנֵֽי־בָקָ֤ר שְׁנַ֙יִם֙ וְאַ֣יִל אֶחָ֔ד כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: On your new moons you shall present a burnt offering to יהוה: two bulls of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs, without blemish.
Transliteration: uverashey chׇdesheykhem takeriyvu olah layhovah fariym veney-vakar shenayiim veayiil echad khevashiym veney-shanah shiveah temiymim

Hebrew: וּשְׁלֹשָׁ֣ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֗ים סֹ֤לֶת מִנְחָה֙ בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשֶּׁ֔מֶן לַפָּ֖ר הָאֶחָ֑ד וּשְׁנֵ֣י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֗ים סֹ֤לֶת מִנְחָה֙ בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשֶּׁ֔מֶן לָאַ֖יִל הָֽאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: As meal offering for each bull: three-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in. As meal offering for each ram: two-tenths of a measure of choice flour with oil mixed in.
Transliteration: usheloshah esheroniym solet minechah velulah vashemen lafar haechad usheney esheroniym solet minechah velulah vashemen laayiil haechad

Hebrew: וְעִשָּׂרֹ֣ן עִשָּׂר֗וֹן סֹ֤לֶת מִנְחָה֙ בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשֶּׁ֔מֶן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד עֹלָה֙ רֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: As meal offering for each lamb: a tenth of a measure of fine flour with oil mixed in. Such shall be the burnt offering of pleasing odor, an offering by fire to יהוה.
Transliteration: veisharon isharvon solet minechah velulah vashemen lakhevesh haechad olah reycha niychocha isheh layhovah

Hebrew: וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֗ם חֲצִ֣י הַהִין֩ יִהְיֶ֨ה לַפָּ֜ר וּשְׁלִישִׁ֧ת הַהִ֣ין לָאַ֗יִל וּרְבִיעִ֥ת הַהִ֛ין לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ יָ֑יִן זֹ֣את עֹלַ֥ת חֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ בְּחׇדְשׁ֔וֹ לְחׇדְשֵׁ֖י הַשָּׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Their libations shall be: half a hin of wine for a bull, a third of a hin for a ram, and a quarter of a hin for a lamb. That shall be the monthly burnt offering for each new moon of the year.
Transliteration: venisekheyhem chatsiy hahiyn yiheyeh lafar usheliyshit hahiyn laayiil ureviyit hahiyn lakhevesh yayiin zot olat chodesh vechׇdeshvo lechׇdeshey hashanah

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֨יר עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֛ד לְחַטָּ֖את לַיהֹוָ֑ה עַל־עֹלַ֧ת הַתָּמִ֛יד יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה וְנִסְכּֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: And there shall be one goat as a sin offering to יהוה, to be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering and its libation.
Transliteration: usheiyr iziym echad lechatat layhovah al-olat hatamiyd eiasheh venisekhvo {s}

Hebrew: וּבַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֗וֹן בְּאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֑דֶשׁ פֶּ֖סַח לַיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, there shall be a passover sacrifice to יהוה,
Transliteration: uvachodesh harishvon vearevaah ashar yvom lachodesh fesach layhovah

Hebrew: וּבַחֲמִשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר י֛וֹם לַחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַזֶּ֖ה חָ֑ג שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים מַצּ֖וֹת יֵאָכֵֽל׃
Translated: and on the fifteenth day of that month a festival. Unleavened bread shall be eaten for seven days.
Transliteration: uvachamishah ashar yvom lachodesh hazeh chag shiveat yamiym matsvot eiakhel

Hebrew: בַּיּ֥וֹם הָרִאשׁ֖וֹן מִקְרָא־קֹ֑דֶשׁ כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: The first day shall be a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.
Transliteration: vayyvom harishvon mikera-kodesh khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם אִשֶּׁ֤ה עֹלָה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה פָּרִ֧ים בְּנֵי־בָקָ֛ר שְׁנַ֖יִם וְאַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד וְשִׁבְעָ֤ה כְבָשִׂים֙ בְּנֵ֣י שָׁנָ֔ה תְּמִימִ֖ם יִהְי֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall present an offering by fire, a burnt offering, to יהוה: two bulls of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs—see that they are without blemish.
Transliteration: vehikeravetem isheh olah layhovah fariym veney-vakar shenayiim veayiil echad veshiveah khevashiym veney shanah temiymim yiheyu lakhem

Hebrew: וּמִ֨נְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֨ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֜ים לַפָּ֗ר וּשְׁנֵ֧י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֛ים לָאַ֖יִל תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: The meal offering with them shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in: prepare three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram;
Transliteration: uminechatam solet velulah vashamen sheloshah esheroniym lafar usheney esheroniym laayiil taashu

Hebrew: עִשָּׂר֤וֹן עִשָּׂרוֹן֙ תַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְשִׁבְעַ֖ת הַכְּבָשִֽׂים׃
Translated: and for each of the seven lambs prepare one-tenth of a measure.
Transliteration: isharvon isharvon taasheh lakhevesh haechad leshiveat hakhevashiym

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד לְכַפֵּ֖ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And there shall be one goat for a sin offering, to make expiation in your behalf.
Transliteration: usheiyr chatat echad lekhafer aleykhem

Hebrew: מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַבֹּ֔קֶר אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְעֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֑יד תַּעֲשׂ֖וּ אֶת־אֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: You shall present these in addition to the morning portion of the regular burnt offering.
Transliteration: milevad olat havoker asher leolat hatamiyd taashu et-eleh

Hebrew: כָּאֵ֜לֶּה תַּעֲשׂ֤וּ לַיּוֹם֙ שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֔ים לֶ֛חֶם אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהֹוָ֑ה עַל־עוֹלַ֧ת הַתָּמִ֛יד יֵעָשֶׂ֖ה וְנִסְכּֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall offer the like daily for seven days as food, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה; they shall be offered, with their libations, in addition to the regular burnt offering.
Transliteration: khaeleh taashu layyvom shiveat yamiym lechem isheh reycha-niychocha layhovah al-volat hatamiyd eiasheh venisekhvo

Hebrew: וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י מִקְרָא־קֹ֖דֶשׁ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And the seventh day shall be a sacred occasion for you: you shall not work at your occupations.
Transliteration: uvayyvom hasheviyiy mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu {s}

Hebrew: וּבְי֣וֹם הַבִּכּוּרִ֗ים בְּהַקְרִ֨יבְכֶ֜ם מִנְחָ֤ה חֲדָשָׁה֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה בְּשָׁבֻעֹ֖תֵיכֶ֑ם מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: On the day of the first fruits, your Feast of Weeks, when you bring an offering of new grain to יהוה, you shall observe a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.
Transliteration: uveyvom havikhuriym vehakeriyvekhem minechah chadashah layhovah veshavuoteykhem mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם עוֹלָ֜ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה פָּרִ֧ים בְּנֵי־בָקָ֛ר שְׁנַ֖יִם אַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד שִׁבְעָ֥ה כְבָשִׂ֖ים בְּנֵ֥י שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: You shall present a burnt offering of pleasing odor to יהוה: two bulls of the herd, one ram, seven yearling lambs.
Transliteration: vehikeravetem volah lereycha niychocha layhovah fariym veney-vakar shenayiim ayiil echad shiveah khevashiym veney shanah

Hebrew: וּמִ֨נְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶשְׂרֹנִים֙ לַפָּ֣ר הָֽאֶחָ֔ד שְׁנֵי֙ עֶשְׂרֹנִ֔ים לָאַ֖יִל הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: The meal offering with them shall be of choice flour with oil mixed in, three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram,
Transliteration: uminechatam solet velulah vashamen sheloshah esheroniym lafar haechad sheney esheroniym laayiil haechad

Hebrew: עִשָּׂרוֹן֙ עִשָּׂר֔וֹן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְשִׁבְעַ֖ת הַכְּבָשִֽׂים׃
Translated: and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs.
Transliteration: isharvon isharvon lakhevesh haechad leshiveat hakhevashiym

Hebrew: שְׂעִ֥יר עִזִּ֖ים אֶחָ֑ד לְכַפֵּ֖ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And there shall be one goat for expiation in your behalf.
Transliteration: sheiyr iziym echad lekhafer aleykhem

Hebrew: מִלְּבַ֞ד עֹלַ֧ת הַתָּמִ֛יד וּמִנְחָת֖וֹ תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ תְּמִימִ֥ם יִהְיוּ־לָכֶ֖ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall present them—see that they are without blemish—with their libations, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its meal offering.
Transliteration: milevad olat hatamiyd uminechatvo taashu temiymim yiheyu-lakhem venisekheyhem {f}

Hebrew: וּבַחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜י בְּאֶחָ֣ד לַחֹ֗דֶשׁ מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ י֥וֹם תְּרוּעָ֖ה יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, you shall observe a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations. You shall observe it as a day when the horn is sounded.
Transliteration: uvachodesh hasheviyiy veechad lachodesh mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu yvom teruah yiheyeh lakhem

Hebrew: וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֨ם עֹלָ֜ה לְרֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה פַּ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר אֶחָ֖ד אַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: You shall present a burnt offering of pleasing odor to יהוה: one bull of the herd, one ram, and seven yearling lambs, without blemish.
Transliteration: vaashiytem olah lereycha niychocha layhovah far ven-vakar echad ayiil echad khevashiym veney-shanah shiveah temiymim

Hebrew: וּמִ֨נְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶשְׂרֹנִים֙ לַפָּ֔ר שְׁנֵ֥י עֶשְׂרֹנִ֖ים לָאָֽיִל׃
Translated: The meal offering with them—choice flour with oil mixed in—shall be: three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for a ram,
Transliteration: uminechatam solet velulah vashamen sheloshah esheroniym lafar sheney esheroniym laayiil

Hebrew: וְעִשָּׂר֣וֹן אֶחָ֔ד לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְשִׁבְעַ֖ת הַכְּבָשִֽׂים׃
Translated: and one-tenth for each of the seven lambs.
Transliteration: veisharvon echad lakhevesh haechad leshiveat hakhevashiym

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את לְכַפֵּ֖ר עֲלֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And there shall be one goat for a sin offering, to make expiation in your behalf—
Transliteration: usheiyr-iziym echad chatat lekhafer aleykhem

Hebrew: מִלְּבַד֩ עֹלַ֨ת הַחֹ֜דֶשׁ וּמִנְחָתָ֗הּ וְעֹלַ֤ת הַתָּמִיד֙ וּמִנְחָתָ֔הּ וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֖ם כְּמִשְׁפָּטָ֑ם לְרֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: in addition to the burnt offering of the new moon with its meal offering and the regular burnt offering with its meal offering, each with its libation as prescribed, offerings by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה.
Transliteration: milevad olat hachodesh uminechatah veolat hatamiyd uminechatah venisekheyhem khemishefatam lereycha niychocha isheh layhovah {s}

Hebrew: וּבֶעָשׂוֹר֩ לַחֹ֨דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֜י הַזֶּ֗ה מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם וְעִנִּיתֶ֖ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵיכֶ֑ם כׇּל־מְלָאכָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: On the tenth day of the same seventh month you shall observe a sacred occasion when you shall practice self-denial. You shall do no work.
Transliteration: uveashvor lachodesh hasheviyiy hazeh mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem veiniytem et-nafeshoteykhem khׇl-melakhah lo taashu

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם עֹלָ֤ה לַֽיהֹוָה֙ רֵ֣יחַ נִיחֹ֔חַ פַּ֧ר בֶּן־בָּקָ֛ר אֶחָ֖ד אַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד כְּבָשִׂ֤ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָה֙ שִׁבְעָ֔ה תְּמִימִ֖ם יִהְי֥וּ לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: You shall present to יהוה a burnt offering of pleasing odor: one bull of the herd, one ram, seven yearling lambs; see that they are without blemish.
Transliteration: vehikeravetem olah layhovah reycha niychocha far ven-vakar echad ayiil echad khevashiym veney-shanah shiveah temiymim yiheyu lakhem

Hebrew: וּמִ֨נְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עֶשְׂרֹנִים֙ לַפָּ֔ר שְׁנֵי֙ עֶשְׂרֹנִ֔ים לָאַ֖יִל הָאֶחָֽד׃
Translated: The meal offering with them—of choice flour with oil mixed in—shall be: three-tenths of a measure for a bull, two-tenths for the one ram,
Transliteration: uminechatam solet velulah vashamen sheloshah esheroniym lafar sheney esheroniym laayiil haechad

Hebrew: עִשָּׂרוֹן֙ עִשָּׂר֔וֹן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְשִׁבְעַ֖ת הַכְּבָשִֽׂים׃
Translated: one-tenth for each of the seven lambs.
Transliteration: isharvon isharvon lakhevesh haechad leshiveat hakhevashiym

Hebrew: שְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את מִלְּבַ֞ד חַטַּ֤את הַכִּפֻּרִים֙ וְעֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: And there shall be one goat for a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering of expiation and the regular burnt offering with its meal offering, each with its libation.
Transliteration: sheiyr-iziym echad chatat milevad chatat hakhifuriym veolat hatamiyd uminechatah venisekheyhem {s}

Hebrew: וּבַחֲמִשָּׁה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֜וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י מִֽקְרָא־קֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ יִהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֔ם כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֣א תַעֲשׂ֑וּ וְחַגֹּתֶ֥ם חַ֛ג לַיהֹוָ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֥ת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, you shall observe a sacred occasion: you shall not work at your occupations.—Seven days you shall observe a festival of יהוה.—
Transliteration: uvachamishah ashar yvom lachodesh hasheviyiy mikera-kodesh yiheyeh lakhem khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu vechagotem chag layhovah shiveat yamiym

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם עֹלָ֜ה אִשֵּׁ֨ה רֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה פָּרִ֧ים בְּנֵי־בָקָ֛ר שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִ֥ם יִהְיֽוּ׃
Translated: You shall present a burnt offering, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה: Thirteen bulls of the herd, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs; they shall be without blemish.
Transliteration: vehikeravetem olah isheh reycha niychocha layhovah fariym veney-vakar sheloshah ashar eylim shenayiim khevashiym veney-shanah arevaah ashar temiymim yiheyu

Hebrew: וּמִ֨נְחָתָ֔ם סֹ֖לֶת בְּלוּלָ֣ה בַשָּׁ֑מֶן שְׁלֹשָׁ֨ה עֶשְׂרֹנִ֜ים לַפָּ֣ר הָֽאֶחָ֗ד לִשְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה עָשָׂר֙ פָּרִ֔ים שְׁנֵ֤י עֶשְׂרֹנִים֙ לָאַ֣יִל הָֽאֶחָ֔ד לִשְׁנֵ֖י הָאֵילִֽם׃
Translated: The meal offerings with them—of choice flour with oil mixed in—shall be: three-tenths of a measure for each of the thirteen bulls, two-tenths for each of the two rams,
Transliteration: uminechatam solet velulah vashamen sheloshah esheroniym lafar haechad lisheloshah ashar fariym sheney esheroniym laayiil haechad lisheney haeylim

Hebrew: וְעִשָּׂרוֹׄן֙ עִשָּׂר֔וֹן לַכֶּ֖בֶשׂ הָאֶחָ֑ד לְאַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר כְּבָשִֽׂים׃
Translated: and one-tenth for each of the fourteen lambs.
Transliteration: veisharvon isharvon lakhevesh haechad learevaah ashar khevashiym

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד מִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: And there shall be one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.
Transliteration: usheiyr-iziym echad chatat milevad olat hatamiyd minechatah venisekhah {s}

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשֵּׁנִ֗י פָּרִ֧ים בְּנֵי־בָקָ֛ר שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: Second day: Twelve bulls of the herd, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;
Transliteration: uvayyvom hasheniy fariym veney-vakar sheneym ashar eylim shenayiim khevashiym veney-shanah arevaah ashar temiymim

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִ֠ים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;
Transliteration: uminechatam venisekheyhem lafariym laeylim velakhevashiym vemisefaram khamishefat

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכֵּיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libations.
Transliteration: usheiyr-iziym echad chatat milevad olat hatamiyd uminechatah venisekheyhem {s}

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֛י פָּרִ֥ים עַשְׁתֵּי־עָשָׂ֖ר אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: Third day: Eleven bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;
Transliteration: uvayyvom hasheliyshiy fariym ashetey-ashar eylim shenayiim khevashiym veney-shanah arevaah ashar temiymim

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִ֠ים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;
Transliteration: uminechatam venisekheyhem lafariym laeylim velakhevashiym vemisefaram khamishefat

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.
Transliteration: usheiyr chatat echad milevad olat hatamiyd uminechatah venisekhah {s}

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הָרְבִיעִ֛י פָּרִ֥ים עֲשָׂרָ֖ה אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: Fourth day: Ten bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;
Transliteration: uvayyvom hareviyiy fariym asharah eylim shenayiim khevashiym veney-shanah arevaah ashar temiymim

Hebrew: מִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִ֠ים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;
Transliteration: minechatam venisekheyhem lafariym laeylim velakhevashiym vemisefaram khamishefat

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִיר־עִזִּ֥ים אֶחָ֖ד חַטָּ֑את מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד מִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.
Transliteration: usheiyr-iziym echad chatat milevad olat hatamiyd minechatah venisekhah {s}

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַחֲמִישִׁ֛י פָּרִ֥ים תִּשְׁעָ֖ה אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵֽי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: Fifth day: Nine bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;
Transliteration: uvayyvom hachamiyshiy fariym tisheah eylim shenayiim khevashiym veney-shanah arevaah ashar temiymim

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִ֠ים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;
Transliteration: uminechatam venisekheyhem lafariym laeylim velakhevashiym vemisefaram khamishefat

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.
Transliteration: usheiyr chatat echad milevad olat hatamiyd uminechatah venisekhah {s}

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשִּׁשִּׁ֛י פָּרִ֥ים שְׁמֹנָ֖ה אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: Sixth day: Eight bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;
Transliteration: uvayyvom hashishiy fariym shemonah eylim shenayiim khevashiym veney-shanah arevaah ashar temiymim

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִ֠ים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;
Transliteration: uminechatam venisekheyhem lafariym laeylim velakhevashiym vemisefaram khamishefat

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד מִנְחָתָ֖הּ וּנְסָכֶֽיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libations.
Transliteration: usheiyr chatat echad milevad olat hatamiyd minechatah unesakheyha {s}

Hebrew: וּבַיּ֧וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֛י פָּרִ֥ים שִׁבְעָ֖ה אֵילִ֣ם שְׁנָ֑יִם כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה אַרְבָּעָ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: Seventh day: Seven bulls, two rams, fourteen yearling lambs, without blemish;
Transliteration: uvayyvom hasheviyiy fariym shiveah eylim shenayiim khevashiym veney-shanah arevaah ashar temiymim

Hebrew: וּמִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּהֶ֡ם לַ֠פָּרִ֠ים לָאֵילִ֧ם וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כְּמִשְׁפָּטָֽם׃
Translated: the meal offerings and libations for the bulls, rams, and lambs, in the quantities prescribed;
Transliteration: uminechatam venisekhehem lafariym laeylim velakhevashiym vemisefaram khemishefatam

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד מִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.
Transliteration: usheiyr chatat echad milevad olat hatamiyd minechatah venisekhah {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁמִינִ֔י עֲצֶ֖רֶת תִּהְיֶ֣ה לָכֶ֑ם כׇּל־מְלֶ֥אכֶת עֲבֹדָ֖ה לֹ֥א תַעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: On the eighth day you shall hold a solemn gathering; you shall not work at your occupations.
Transliteration: vayyvom hashemiyniy atseret tiheyeh lakhem khׇl-melekhet avodah lo taashu

Hebrew: וְהִקְרַבְתֶּ֨ם עֹלָ֜ה אִשֵּׁ֨ה רֵ֤יחַ נִיחֹ֙חַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה פַּ֥ר אֶחָ֖ד אַ֣יִל אֶחָ֑ד כְּבָשִׂ֧ים בְּנֵי־שָׁנָ֛ה שִׁבְעָ֖ה תְּמִימִֽם׃
Translated: You shall present a burnt offering, an offering by fire of pleasing odor to יהוה; one bull, one ram, seven yearling lambs, without blemish;
Transliteration: vehikeravetem olah isheh reycha niychocha layhovah far echad ayiil echad khevashiym veney-shanah shiveah temiymim

Hebrew: מִנְחָתָ֣ם וְנִסְכֵּיהֶ֗ם לַפָּ֨ר לָאַ֧יִל וְלַכְּבָשִׂ֛ים בְּמִסְפָּרָ֖ם כַּמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: the meal offerings and libations for the bull, the ram, and the lambs, in the quantities prescribed;
Transliteration: minechatam venisekheyhem lafar laayiil velakhevashiym vemisefaram khamishefat

Hebrew: וּשְׂעִ֥יר חַטָּ֖את אֶחָ֑ד מִלְּבַד֙ עֹלַ֣ת הַתָּמִ֔יד וּמִנְחָתָ֖הּ וְנִסְכָּֽהּ׃
Translated: and one goat for a sin offering—in addition to the regular burnt offering, its meal offering and libation.
Transliteration: usheiyr chatat echad milevad olat hatamiyd uminechatah venisekhah

Hebrew: אֵ֛לֶּה תַּעֲשׂ֥וּ לַיהֹוָ֖ה בְּמוֹעֲדֵיכֶ֑ם לְבַ֨ד מִנִּדְרֵיכֶ֜ם וְנִדְבֹתֵיכֶ֗ם לְעֹלֹֽתֵיכֶם֙ וּלְמִנְחֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם וּלְנִסְכֵּיכֶ֖ם וּלְשַׁלְמֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: All these you shall offer to יהוה at the stated times, in addition to your votive and freewill offerings, be they burnt offerings, meal offerings, libations, or offerings of well-being.
Transliteration: eleh taashu layhovah vemvoadeykhem levad minidereykhem venidevoteykhem leoloteykhem uleminechoteykhem ulenisekheykhem uleshalemeykhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {פ}
Translated: So Moses spoke to the Israelites just as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh el-veney yisherael khekhol asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־רָאשֵׁ֣י הַמַּטּ֔וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Moses spoke to the heads of the Israelite tribes, saying: This is what יהוה has commanded:
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh el-rashey hamatvot liveney yisherael lemor zeh hadavar asher tsivah yehovah

Hebrew: אִישׁ֩ כִּֽי־יִדֹּ֨ר נֶ֜דֶר לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה אֽוֹ־הִשָּׁ֤בַע שְׁבֻעָה֙ לֶאְסֹ֤ר אִסָּר֙ עַל־נַפְשׁ֔וֹ לֹ֥א יַחֵ֖ל דְּבָר֑וֹ כְּכׇל־הַיֹּצֵ֥א מִפִּ֖יו יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: If a householder makes a vow to יהוה or takes an oath imposing an obligation on himself, he shall not break his pledge; he must carry out all that has crossed his lips.
Transliteration: iysh khiy-yidor neder layhovah vo-hishava shevuah leesor isar al-nafeshvo lo yachel devarvo khekhׇl-hayotse mifiyv yaasheh

Hebrew: וְאִשָּׁ֕ה כִּֽי־תִדֹּ֥ר נֶ֖דֶר לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְאָסְרָ֥ה אִסָּ֛ר בְּבֵ֥ית אָבִ֖יהָ בִּנְעֻרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: If a woman makes a vow to יהוה or assumes an obligation while still in her father’s household by reason of her youth,
Transliteration: veishah khiy-tidor neder layhovah veaserah isar veveyt aviyha vineureyha

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַ֨ע אָבִ֜יהָ אֶת־נִדְרָ֗הּ וֶֽאֱסָרָהּ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָֽסְרָ֣ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֔הּ וְהֶחֱרִ֥ישׁ לָ֖הּ אָבִ֑יהָ וְקָ֙מוּ֙ כׇּל־נְדָרֶ֔יהָ וְכׇל־אִסָּ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ יָקֽוּם׃
Translated: and her father learns of her vow or her self-imposed obligation and offers no objection, all her vows shall stand and every self-imposed obligation shall stand.
Transliteration: veshama aviyha et-niderah veesarah asher aserah al-nafeshah vehecheriysh lah aviyha vekamu khׇl-nedareyha vekhׇl-isar asher-aserah al-nafeshah yakum

Hebrew: וְאִם־הֵנִ֨יא אָבִ֣יהָ אֹתָהּ֮ בְּי֣וֹם שׇׁמְעוֹ֒ כׇּל־נְדָרֶ֗יהָ וֶֽאֱסָרֶ֛יהָ אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ לֹ֣א יָק֑וּם וַֽיהֹוָה֙ יִֽסְלַח־לָ֔הּ כִּי־הֵנִ֥יא אָבִ֖יהָ אֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: But if her father restrains her on the day he finds out, none of her vows or self-imposed obligations shall stand; and יהוה will forgive her, since her father restrained her.
Transliteration: veim-heniy aviyha otah veyvom shׇmevo khׇl-nedareyha veesareyha asher-aserah al-nafeshah lo yakum vayhovah yiselach-lah khiy-heniy aviyha otah

Hebrew: וְאִם־הָי֤וֹ תִֽהְיֶה֙ לְאִ֔ישׁ וּנְדָרֶ֖יהָ עָלֶ֑יהָ א֚וֹ מִבְטָ֣א שְׂפָתֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָסְרָ֖ה עַל־נַפְשָֽׁהּ׃
Translated: If she should become someone’s [wife] while her vow or the commitment to which she bound herself is still in force,
Transliteration: veim-hayvo tiheyeh leiysh unedareyha aleyha vo miveta shefateyha asher aserah al-nafeshah

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַ֥ע אִישָׁ֛הּ בְּי֥וֹם שׇׁמְע֖וֹ וְהֶחֱרִ֣ישׁ לָ֑הּ וְקָ֣מוּ נְדָרֶ֗יהָ וֶֽאֱסָרֶ֛הָ אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ יָקֻֽמוּ׃
Translated: and her husband learns of it and offers no objection on the day he finds out, her vows shall stand and her self-imposed obligations shall stand.
Transliteration: veshama iyshah veyvom shׇmevo vehecheriysh lah vekamu nedareyha veesareha asher-aserah al-nafeshah yakumu

Hebrew: וְ֠אִ֠ם בְּי֨וֹם שְׁמֹ֣עַ אִישָׁהּ֮ יָנִ֣יא אוֹתָהּ֒ וְהֵפֵ֗ר אֶת־נִדְרָהּ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלֶ֔יהָ וְאֵת֙ מִבְטָ֣א שְׂפָתֶ֔יהָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָסְרָ֖ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֑הּ וַיהֹוָ֖ה יִֽסְלַֽח־לָֽהּ׃
Translated: But if her husband restrains her on the day that he learns of it, he thereby annuls her vow which was in force or the commitment to which she bound herself; and יהוה will forgive her.—
Transliteration: veim veyvom shemoa iyshah yaniy votah vehefer et-niderah asher aleyha veet miveta shefateyha asher aserah al-nafeshah vayhovah yiselach-lah

Hebrew: וְנֵ֥דֶר אַלְמָנָ֖ה וּגְרוּשָׁ֑ה כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ יָק֥וּם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: The vow of a widow or of a divorced woman, however, whatever she has imposed on herself, shall be binding upon her.—
Transliteration: veneder alemanah ugerushah khol asher-aserah al-nafeshah yakum aleyha

Hebrew: וְאִם־בֵּ֥ית אִישָׁ֖הּ נָדָ֑רָה אֽוֹ־אָסְרָ֥ה אִסָּ֛ר עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ בִּשְׁבֻעָֽה׃
Translated: So, too, if, while in her husband’s household, she makes a vow or imposes an obligation on herself by oath,
Transliteration: veim-veyt iyshah nadarah vo-aserah isar al-nafeshah vishevuah

Hebrew: וְשָׁמַ֤ע אִישָׁהּ֙ וְהֶחֱרִ֣שׁ לָ֔הּ לֹ֥א הֵנִ֖יא אֹתָ֑הּ וְקָ֙מוּ֙ כׇּל־נְדָרֶ֔יהָ וְכׇל־אִסָּ֛ר אֲשֶׁר־אָסְרָ֥ה עַל־נַפְשָׁ֖הּ יָקֽוּם׃
Translated: and her husband learns of it, yet offers no objection—thus failing to restrain her—all her vows shall stand and all her self-imposed obligations shall stand.
Transliteration: veshama iyshah vehecherish lah lo heniy otah vekamu khׇl-nedareyha vekhׇl-isar asher-aserah al-nafeshah yakum

Hebrew: וְאִם־הָפֵר֩ יָפֵ֨ר אֹתָ֥ם <small>׀</small> אִישָׁהּ֮ בְּי֣וֹם שׇׁמְעוֹ֒ כׇּל־מוֹצָ֨א שְׂפָתֶ֧יהָ לִנְדָרֶ֛יהָ וּלְאִסַּ֥ר נַפְשָׁ֖הּ לֹ֣א יָק֑וּם אִישָׁ֣הּ הֲפֵרָ֔ם וַיהֹוָ֖ה יִֽסְלַֽח־לָֽהּ׃
Translated: But if her husband does annul them on the day he finds out, then nothing that has crossed her lips shall stand, whether vows or self-imposed obligations. Her husband has annulled them, and יהוה will forgive her.
Transliteration: veim-hafer yafer otam <small></small> iyshah veyvom shׇmevo khׇl-mvotsa shefateyha linedareyha uleisar nafeshah lo yakum iyshah haferam vayhovah yiselach-lah

Hebrew: כׇּל־נֵ֛דֶר וְכׇל־שְׁבֻעַ֥ת אִסָּ֖ר לְעַנֹּ֣ת נָ֑פֶשׁ אִישָׁ֥הּ יְקִימֶ֖נּוּ וְאִישָׁ֥הּ יְפֵרֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: Every vow and every sworn obligation of self-denial may be upheld by her husband or annulled by her husband.
Transliteration: khׇl-neder vekhׇl-shevuat isar leanot nafesh iyshah yekiymenu veiyshah yeferenu

Hebrew: וְאִם־הַחֲרֵשׁ֩ יַחֲרִ֨ישׁ לָ֥הּ אִישָׁהּ֮ מִיּ֣וֹם אֶל־יוֹם֒ וְהֵקִים֙ אֶת־כׇּל־נְדָרֶ֔יהָ א֥וֹ אֶת־כׇּל־אֱסָרֶ֖יהָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָלֶ֑יהָ הֵקִ֣ים אֹתָ֔ם כִּי־הֶחֱרִ֥שׁ לָ֖הּ בְּי֥וֹם שׇׁמְעֽוֹ׃
Translated: If her husband offers no objection from that day to the next, he has upheld all the vows or obligations she has assumed: he has upheld them by offering no objection on the day he found out.
Transliteration: veim-hacharesh yachariysh lah iyshah miyyvom el-yvom vehekiym et-khׇl-nedareyha vo et-khׇl-esareyha asher aleyha hekiym otam khiy-hecherish lah veyvom shׇmevo

Hebrew: וְאִם־הָפֵ֥ר יָפֵ֛ר אֹתָ֖ם אַחֲרֵ֣י שׇׁמְע֑וֹ וְנָשָׂ֖א אֶת־עֲוֺנָֽהּ׃
Translated: But if he annuls them after [the day] he finds out, he shall bear her guilt.
Transliteration: veim-hafer yafer otam acharey shׇmevo venasha et-avonah

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַֽחֻקִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה בֵּ֥ין אִ֖ישׁ לְאִשְׁתּ֑וֹ בֵּֽין־אָ֣ב לְבִתּ֔וֹ בִּנְעֻרֶ֖יהָ בֵּ֥ית אָבִֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated: Those are the laws that יהוה enjoined upon Moses between a husband and his wife, and as between a father and his daughter while in her father’s household by reason of her youth.
Transliteration: eleh hachukiym asher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh veyn iysh leishetvo veyn-av levitvo vineureyha veyt aviyha {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying,
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: נְקֹ֗ם נִקְמַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵאֵ֖ת הַמִּדְיָנִ֑ים אַחַ֖ר תֵּאָסֵ֥ף אֶל־עַמֶּֽיךָ׃
Translated: “Avenge the Israelite people on the Midianites; then you shall be gathered to your kin.”
Transliteration: nekom nikemat veney yisherael meet hamideyaniym achar teasef el-ameykha

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶל־הָעָ֣ם לֵאמֹ֔ר הֵחָלְצ֧וּ מֵאִתְּכֶ֛ם אֲנָשִׁ֖ים לַצָּבָ֑א וְיִהְיוּ֙ עַל־מִדְיָ֔ן לָתֵ֥ת נִקְמַת־יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּמִדְיָֽן׃
Translated: Moses spoke to the militia, saying, “Let troops be picked out from among you for a campaign, and let them fall upon Midian to wreak יהוה’s vengeance on Midian.
Transliteration: vayedaver mosheh el-haam lemor hechaletsu meitekhem anashiym latsava veyiheyu al-mideyan latet nikemat-yehovah vemideyan

Hebrew: אֶ֚לֶף לַמַּטֶּ֔ה אֶ֖לֶף לַמַּטֶּ֑ה לְכֹל֙ מַטּ֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל תִּשְׁלְח֖וּ לַצָּבָֽא׃
Translated: You shall dispatch on the campaign a thousand from every one of the tribes of Israel.”
Transliteration: elef lamateh elef lamateh lekhol matvot yisherael tishelechu latsava

Hebrew: וַיִּמָּֽסְרוּ֙ מֵאַלְפֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶ֖לֶף לַמַּטֶּ֑ה שְׁנֵים־עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֖לֶף חֲלוּצֵ֥י צָבָֽא׃
Translated: So a thousand from each tribe were furnished from the divisions of Israel, twelve thousand picked for the campaign.
Transliteration: vayimaseru mealefey yisherael elef lamateh sheneym-ashar elef chalutsey tsava

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח אֹתָ֥ם מֹשֶׁ֛ה אֶ֥לֶף לַמַּטֶּ֖ה לַצָּבָ֑א אֹ֠תָ֠ם וְאֶת־פִּ֨ינְחָ֜ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ לַצָּבָ֔א וּכְלֵ֥י הַקֹּ֛דֶשׁ וַחֲצֹצְר֥וֹת הַתְּרוּעָ֖ה בְּיָדֽוֹ׃
Translated: Moses dispatched them on the campaign, a thousand from each tribe, with Phinehas son of Eleazar serving as a priest on the campaign, equipped with the sacred utensils and the trumpets for sounding the blasts.
Transliteration: vayishelach otam mosheh elef lamateh latsava otam veet-fiynechas ven-eleazar hakhohen latsava ukheley hakodesh vachatsotservot hateruah veyadvo

Hebrew: וַֽיִּצְבְּאוּ֙ עַל־מִדְיָ֔ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיַּֽהַרְג֖וּ כׇּל־זָכָֽר׃
Translated: They took the field against Midian, as יהוה had commanded Moses, and slew every male.
Transliteration: vayitseveu al-mideyan khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh vayaharegu khׇl-zakhar

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מַלְכֵ֨י מִדְיָ֜ן הָרְג֣וּ עַל־חַלְלֵיהֶ֗ם אֶת־אֱוִ֤י וְאֶת־רֶ֙קֶם֙ וְאֶת־צ֤וּר וְאֶת־חוּר֙ וְאֶת־רֶ֔בַע חֲמֵ֖שֶׁת מַלְכֵ֣י מִדְיָ֑ן וְאֵת֙ בִּלְעָ֣ם בֶּן־בְּע֔וֹר הָרְג֖וּ בֶּחָֽרֶב׃
Translated: Along with their other victims, they slew the kings of Midian: Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the five kings of Midian. They also put Balaam son of Beor to the sword.
Transliteration: veet-malekhey mideyan haregu al-chaleleyhem et-eviy veet-rekem veet-tsur veet-chur veet-reva chameshet malekhey mideyan veet vileam ven-vevor haregu vecharev

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבּ֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל אֶת־נְשֵׁ֥י מִדְיָ֖ן וְאֶת־טַפָּ֑ם וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־בְּהֶמְתָּ֧ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־מִקְנֵהֶ֛ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־חֵילָ֖ם בָּזָֽזוּ׃
Translated: The Israelites took the women and other noncombatants of the Midianites captive, and seized as booty all their beasts, all their herds, and all their wealth.
Transliteration: vayishevu veney-yisherael et-neshey mideyan veet-tafam veet khׇl-vehemetam veet-khׇl-mikenehem veet-khׇl-cheylam vazazu

Hebrew: וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־עָרֵיהֶם֙ בְּמ֣וֹשְׁבֹתָ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־טִֽירֹתָ֑ם שָׂרְפ֖וּ בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: And they destroyed by fire all the towns in which they were settled, and their encampments.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-areyhem vemvoshevotam veet khׇl-tiyrotam sharefu vaesh

Hebrew: וַיִּקְחוּ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הַשָּׁלָ֔ל וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הַמַּלְק֑וֹחַ בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָֽה׃
Translated: They gathered all the spoil and all the booty, human and beast,
Transliteration: vayikechu et-khׇl-hashalal veet khׇl-hamalekvocha vaadam uvavehemah

Hebrew: וַיָּבִ֡אוּ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֩ וְאֶל־אֶלְעָזָ֨ר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וְאֶל־עֲדַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶת־הַשְּׁבִ֧י וְאֶת־הַמַּלְק֛וֹחַ וְאֶת־הַשָּׁלָ֖ל אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה אֶל־עַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: and they brought the captives, the booty, and the spoil to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the Israelite community leadership, at the camp in the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho.
Transliteration: vayaviu el-mosheh veel-eleazar hakhohen veel-adat veney-yisherael et-hasheviy veet-hamalekvocha veet-hashalal el-hamachaneh el-arevot mvoav asher al-yareden yerechvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨צְא֜וּ מֹשֶׁ֨ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן וְכׇל־נְשִׂיאֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה לִקְרָאתָ֑ם אֶל־מִח֖וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the chieftains of the community came out to meet them outside the camp.
Transliteration: vayetseu mosheh veeleazar hakhohen vekhׇl-neshiyey haedah likeratam el-michuts lamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיִּקְצֹ֣ף מֹשֶׁ֔ה עַ֖ל פְּקוּדֵ֣י הֶחָ֑יִל שָׂרֵ֤י הָאֲלָפִים֙ וְשָׂרֵ֣י הַמֵּא֔וֹת הַבָּאִ֖ים מִצְּבָ֥א הַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Moses became angry with the commanders of the army, the officers of thousands and the officers of hundreds, who had come back from the military campaign.
Transliteration: vayiketsof mosheh al fekudey hechayiil sharey haalafiym vesharey hamevot havaiym mitseva hamilechamah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֹשֶׁ֑ה הַֽחִיִּיתֶ֖ם כׇּל־נְקֵבָֽה׃
Translated: Moses said to them, “You have spared every female!
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem mosheh hachiyiytem khׇl-nekevah

Hebrew: הֵ֣ן הֵ֜נָּה הָי֨וּ לִבְנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בִּדְבַ֣ר בִּלְעָ֔ם לִמְסׇר־מַ֥עַל בַּיהֹוָ֖ה עַל־דְּבַר־פְּע֑וֹר וַתְּהִ֥י הַמַּגֵּפָ֖ה בַּעֲדַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Yet they are the very ones who, at the bidding of Balaam, induced the Israelites to trespass against יהוה in the matter of Peor, so that יהוה’s community was struck by the plague.
Transliteration: hen henah hayu liveney yisherael videvar vileam limesׇr-maal vayhovah al-devar-fevor vatehiy hamagefah vaadat yehovah

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הִרְג֥וּ כׇל־זָכָ֖ר בַּטָּ֑ף וְכׇל־אִשָּׁ֗ה יֹדַ֥עַת אִ֛ישׁ לְמִשְׁכַּ֥ב זָכָ֖ר הֲרֹֽגוּ׃
Translated: Now, therefore, slay every male among the noncombatants, and slay also every woman who has known a man carnally;
Transliteration: veatah hiregu khׇl-zakhar vataf vekhׇl-ishah yodaat iysh lemishekhav zakhar harogu

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ הַטַּ֣ף בַּנָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָדְע֖וּ מִשְׁכַּ֣ב זָכָ֑ר הַחֲי֖וּ לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: but spare every female noncombatant who has not had carnal relations with a man.
Transliteration: vekhol hataf vanashiym asher lo-yadeu mishekhav zakhar hachayu lakhem

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֗ם חֲנ֛וּ מִח֥וּץ לַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה שִׁבְעַ֣ת יָמִ֑ים כֹּל֩ הֹרֵ֨ג נֶ֜פֶשׁ וְכֹ֣ל ׀ נֹגֵ֣עַ בֶּֽחָלָ֗ל תִּֽתְחַטְּא֞וּ בַּיּ֤וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי֙ וּבַיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י אַתֶּ֖ם וּשְׁבִיכֶֽם׃
Translated: “You shall then stay outside the camp seven days; every one among you or among your captives who has slain a person or touched a corpse shall purify himself on the third and seventh days.
Transliteration: veatem chanu michuts lamachaneh shiveat yamiym khol horeg nefesh vekhol nogea vechalal titechateu vayyvom hasheliyshiy uvayyvom hasheviyiy atem usheviykhem

Hebrew: וְכׇל־בֶּ֧גֶד וְכׇל־כְּלִי־ע֛וֹר וְכׇל־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה עִזִּ֖ים וְכׇל־כְּלִי־עֵ֑ץ תִּתְחַטָּֽאוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: You shall also purify every cloth, every article of skin, everything made of goats’ hair, and every object of wood.”
Transliteration: vekhׇl-veged vekhׇl-kheliy-vor vekhׇl-maasheh iziym vekhׇl-kheliy-ets titechatau {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶל־אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַצָּבָ֔א הַבָּאִ֖ים לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה זֹ֚את חֻקַּ֣ת הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Eleazar the priest said to the troops who had taken part in the fighting, “This is the ritual law that יהוה has enjoined upon Moses:
Transliteration: vayomer eleazar hakhohen el-aneshey hatsava havaiym lamilechamah zot chukat hatvorah asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: אַ֥ךְ אֶת־הַזָּהָ֖ב וְאֶת־הַכָּ֑סֶף אֶֽת־הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ אֶת־הַבַּרְזֶ֔ל אֶֽת־הַבְּדִ֖יל וְאֶת־הָעֹפָֽרֶת׃
Translated: Gold and silver, copper, iron, tin, and lead—
Transliteration: akhe et-hazahav veet-hakhasef et-hanechoshet et-havarezel et-havediyl veet-haofaret

Hebrew: כׇּל־דָּבָ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־יָבֹ֣א בָאֵ֗שׁ תַּעֲבִ֤ירוּ בָאֵשׁ֙ וְטָהֵ֔ר אַ֕ךְ בְּמֵ֥י נִדָּ֖ה יִתְחַטָּ֑א וְכֹ֨ל אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־יָבֹ֛א בָּאֵ֖שׁ תַּעֲבִ֥ירוּ בַמָּֽיִם׃
Translated: any article that can withstand fire—these you shall pass through fire and they shall be pure, except that they must be purified with water of lustration; and anything that cannot withstand fire you must pass through water.
Transliteration: khׇl-davar asher-yavo vaesh taaviyru vaesh vetaher akhe vemey nidah yitechata vekhol asher lo-yavo vaesh taaviyru vamayiim

Hebrew: וְכִבַּסְתֶּ֧ם בִּגְדֵיכֶ֛ם בַּיּ֥וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֖י וּטְהַרְתֶּ֑ם וְאַחַ֖ר תָּבֹ֥אוּ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: On the seventh day you shall wash your clothes and be pure, and after that you may enter the camp.”
Transliteration: vekhivasetem vigedeykhem vayyvom hasheviyiy uteharetem veachar tavou el-hamachaneh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה said to Moses:
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: שָׂ֗א אֵ֣ת רֹ֤אשׁ מַלְק֙וֹחַ֙ הַשְּׁבִ֔י בָּאָדָ֖ם וּבַבְּהֵמָ֑ה אַתָּה֙ וְאֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְרָאשֵׁ֖י אֲב֥וֹת הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: “You and Eleazar the priest and the family heads of the community take an inventory of the booty that was captured, human and beast,
Transliteration: sha et rosh malekvocha hasheviy vaadam uvavehemah atah veeleazar hakhohen verashey avvot haedah

Hebrew: וְחָצִ֙יתָ֙ אֶת־הַמַּלְק֔וֹחַ בֵּ֚ין תֹּפְשֵׂ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים לַצָּבָ֑א וּבֵ֖ין כׇּל־הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: and divide the booty equally between the combatants who engaged in the campaign and the rest of the community.
Transliteration: vechatsiyta et-hamalekvocha veyn tofeshey hamilechamah hayotseiym latsava uveyn khׇl-haedah

Hebrew: וַהֲרֵמֹתָ֨ מֶ֜כֶס לַֽיהֹוָ֗ה מֵאֵ֞ת אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ הַיֹּצְאִ֣ים לַצָּבָ֔א אֶחָ֣ד נֶ֔פֶשׁ מֵחֲמֵ֖שׁ הַמֵּא֑וֹת מִן־הָאָדָם֙ וּמִן־הַבָּקָ֔ר וּמִן־הַחֲמֹרִ֖ים וּמִן־הַצֹּֽאן׃
Translated: You shall exact a levy for יהוה: in the case of the warriors who engaged in the campaign, one item in five hundred, of persons, oxen, asses, and sheep,
Transliteration: vaharemota mekhes layhovah meet aneshey hamilechamah hayotseiym latsava echad nefesh mechamesh hamevot min-haadam umin-havakar umin-hachamoriym umin-hatson

Hebrew: מִמַּֽחֲצִיתָ֖ם תִּקָּ֑חוּ וְנָתַתָּ֛ה לְאֶלְעָזָ֥ר הַכֹּהֵ֖ן תְּרוּמַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: shall be taken from their half-share and given to Eleazar the priest as a contribution to יהוה;
Transliteration: mimachatsiytam tikachu venatatah leeleazar hakhohen terumat yehovah

Hebrew: וּמִמַּחֲצִ֨ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל תִּקַּ֣ח ׀ אֶחָ֣ד ׀ אָחֻ֣ז מִן־הַחֲמִשִּׁ֗ים מִן־הָאָדָ֧ם מִן־הַבָּקָ֛ר מִן־הַחֲמֹרִ֥ים וּמִן־הַצֹּ֖אן מִכׇּל־הַבְּהֵמָ֑ה וְנָתַתָּ֤ה אֹתָם֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם שֹׁמְרֵ֕י מִשְׁמֶ֖רֶת מִשְׁכַּ֥ן יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and from the half-share of the other Israelites you shall withhold one in every fifty human beings as well as cattle, asses, and sheep—all the animals—and give them to the Levites, who attend to the duties of יהוה’s Tabernacle.”
Transliteration: umimachatsit veney-yisherael tikach echad achuz min-hachamishiym min-haadam min-havakar min-hachamoriym umin-hatson mikhׇl-havehemah venatatah otam laleviyim shomerey mishemeret mishekhan yehovah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַשׂ מֹשֶׁ֔ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֖ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Moses and Eleazar the priest did as יהוה commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayaash mosheh veeleazar hakhohen khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ הַמַּלְק֔וֹחַ יֶ֣תֶר הַבָּ֔ז אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּזְז֖וּ עַ֣ם הַצָּבָ֑א צֹ֗אן שֵׁשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֛לֶף וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִֽים׃
Translated: The amount of booty, other than the spoil that the troops had plundered, came to 675,000 sheep,
Transliteration: vayehiy hamalekvocha yeter havaz asher vazezu am hatsava tson shesh-mevot elef veshiveiym elef vachameshet alafiym

Hebrew: וּבָקָ֕ר שְׁנַ֥יִם וְשִׁבְעִ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: 72,000 head of cattle,
Transliteration: uvakar shenayiim veshiveiym alef

Hebrew: וַחֲמֹרִ֕ים אֶחָ֥ד וְשִׁשִּׁ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: 61,000 asses,
Transliteration: vachamoriym echad veshishiym alef

Hebrew: וְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֔ם מִ֨ן־הַנָּשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָדְע֖וּ מִשְׁכַּ֣ב זָכָ֑ר כׇּל־נֶ֕פֶשׁ שְׁנַ֥יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: and a total of 32,000 human beings, namely, the females who had not had carnal relations.
Transliteration: venefesh adam min-hanashiym asher lo-yadeu mishekhav zakhar khׇl-nefesh shenayiim usheloshiym alef

Hebrew: וַתְּהִי֙ הַֽמֶּחֱצָ֔ה חֵ֕לֶק הַיֹּצְאִ֖ים בַּצָּבָ֑א מִסְפַּ֣ר הַצֹּ֗אן שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים אֶ֔לֶף וְשִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: Thus, the half-share of those who had engaged in the campaign [was as follows]: The number of sheep was 337,500,
Transliteration: vatehiy hamechetsah chelek hayotseiym vatsava misefar hatson shelosh-mevot elef usheloshiym elef veshiveat alafiym vachamesh mevot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י הַמֶּ֥כֶס לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה מִן־הַצֹּ֑אן שֵׁ֥שׁ מֵא֖וֹת חָמֵ֥שׁ וְשִׁבְעִֽים׃
Translated: and יהוה’s levy from the sheep was 675;
Transliteration: vayehiy hamekhes layhovah min-hatson shesh mevot chamesh veshiveiym

Hebrew: וְהַ֨בָּקָ֔ר שִׁשָּׁ֥ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים אָ֑לֶף וּמִכְסָ֥ם לַיהֹוָ֖ה שְׁנַ֥יִם וְשִׁבְעִֽים׃
Translated: the cattle came to 36,000, from which יהוה’s levy was 72;
Transliteration: vehavakar shishah usheloshiym alef umikhesam layhovah shenayiim veshiveiym

Hebrew: וַחֲמֹרִ֕ים שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֣שׁ מֵא֑וֹת וּמִכְסָ֥ם לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אֶחָ֥ד וְשִׁשִּֽׁים׃
Translated: the asses came to 30,500, from which יהוה’s levy was 61.
Transliteration: vachamoriym sheloshiym elef vachamesh mevot umikhesam layhovah echad veshishiym

Hebrew: וְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֔ם שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אָ֑לֶף וּמִכְסָם֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה שְׁנַ֥יִם וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים נָֽפֶשׁ׃
Translated: And the number of human beings was 16,000, from which יהוה’s levy was 32.
Transliteration: venefesh adam shishah ashar alef umikhesam layhovah shenayiim usheloshiym nafesh

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֗ה אֶת־מֶ֙כֶס֙ תְּרוּמַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֔ה לְאֶלְעָזָ֖ר הַכֹּהֵ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Moses gave the contributions levied for יהוה to Eleazar the priest, as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayiten mosheh et-mekhes terumat yehovah leeleazar hakhohen khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וּמִֽמַּחֲצִ֖ית בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁר֙ חָצָ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִן־הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים הַצֹּבְאִֽים׃
Translated: As for the half-share of the other Israelites, which Moses withdrew from those who had taken the field,
Transliteration: umimachatsiyt veney yisherael asher chatsah mosheh min-haanashiym hatsoveiym

Hebrew: וַתְּהִ֛י מֶחֱצַ֥ת הָעֵדָ֖ה מִן־הַצֹּ֑אן שְׁלֹשׁ־מֵא֥וֹת אֶ֙לֶף֙ וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֣ים אֶ֔לֶף שִׁבְעַ֥ת אֲלָפִ֖ים וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: that half-share of the community consisted of 337,500 sheep,
Transliteration: vatehiy mechetsat haedah min-hatson shelosh-mevot elef usheloshiym elef shiveat alafiym vachamesh mevot

Hebrew: וּבָקָ֕ר שִׁשָּׁ֥ה וּשְׁלֹשִׁ֖ים אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: 36,000 head of cattle,
Transliteration: uvakar shishah usheloshiym alef

Hebrew: וַחֲמֹרִ֕ים שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף וַחֲמֵ֥שׁ מֵאֽוֹת׃
Translated: 30,500 asses,
Transliteration: vachamoriym sheloshiym elef vachamesh mevot

Hebrew: וְנֶ֣פֶשׁ אָדָ֔ם שִׁשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֖ר אָֽלֶף׃
Translated: and 16,000 human beings.
Transliteration: venefesh adam shishah ashar alef

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה מִמַּחֲצִ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶת־הָֽאָחֻז֙ אֶחָ֣ד מִן־הַחֲמִשִּׁ֔ים מִן־הָאָדָ֖ם וּמִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֑ה וַיִּתֵּ֨ן אֹתָ֜ם לַלְוִיִּ֗ם שֹֽׁמְרֵי֙ מִשְׁמֶ֙רֶת֙ מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: From this half-share of the Israelites, Moses withheld one in every fifty humans and animals; and he gave them to the Levites, who attended to the duties of יהוה’s Tabernacle, as יהוה had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh mimachatsit veney-yisherael et-haachuz echad min-hachamishiym min-haadam umin-havehemah vayiten otam laleviyim shomerey mishemeret mishekhan yehovah khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְבוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה הַפְּקֻדִ֕ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר לְאַלְפֵ֣י הַצָּבָ֑א שָׂרֵ֥י הָאֲלָפִ֖ים וְשָׂרֵ֥י הַמֵּאֽוֹת׃
Translated: The commanders of the troop divisions, the officers of thousands and the officers of hundreds, approached Moses.
Transliteration: vayikerevu el-mosheh hafekudiym asher lealefey hatsava sharey haalafiym vesharey hamevot

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ נָֽשְׂא֗וּ אֶת־רֹ֛אשׁ אַנְשֵׁ֥י הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּיָדֵ֑נוּ וְלֹא־נִפְקַ֥ד מִמֶּ֖נּוּ אִֽישׁ׃
Translated: They said to Moses, “Your servants have made a check of the warriors in our charge, and not one of us is missing.
Transliteration: vayomeru el-mosheh avadeykha nasheu et-rosh aneshey hamilechamah asher veyadenu velo-nifekad mimenu iysh

Hebrew: וַנַּקְרֵ֞ב אֶת־קׇרְבַּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֗ה אִישׁ֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר מָצָ֤א כְלִֽי־זָהָב֙ אֶצְעָדָ֣ה וְצָמִ֔יד טַבַּ֖עַת עָגִ֣יל וְכוּמָ֑ז לְכַפֵּ֥ר עַל־נַפְשֹׁתֵ֖ינוּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So we have brought as an offering to יהוה such articles of gold as each of us came upon: armlets, bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and pendants, that expiation may be made for our persons before יהוה.”
Transliteration: vanakerev et-kׇrevan yehovah iysh asher matsa kheliy-zahav etseadah vetsamiyd tavaat agiyl vekhumaz lekhafer al-nafeshoteynu lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֧ר הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֶת־הַזָּהָ֖ב מֵֽאִתָּ֑ם כֹּ֖ל כְּלִ֥י מַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from them, all kinds of wrought articles.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh veeleazar hakhohen et-hazahav meitam khol kheliy maasheh

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ כׇּל־זְהַ֣ב הַתְּרוּמָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר הֵרִ֙ימוּ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה שִׁשָּׁ֨ה עָשָׂ֥ר אֶ֛לֶף שְׁבַע־מֵא֥וֹת וַחֲמִשִּׁ֖ים שָׁ֑קֶל מֵאֵת֙ שָׂרֵ֣י הָֽאֲלָפִ֔ים וּמֵאֵ֖ת שָׂרֵ֥י הַמֵּאֽוֹת׃
Translated: All the gold that was offered by the officers of thousands and the officers of hundreds as a contribution to יהוה came to 16,750 shekels.—
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-zehav haterumah asher heriymu layhovah shishah ashar elef sheva-mevot vachamishiym shakel meet sharey haalafiym umeet sharey hamevot

Hebrew: אַנְשֵׁי֙ הַצָּבָ֔א בָּזְז֖וּ אִ֥ישׁ לֽוֹ׃
Translated: But in the ranks, everyone kept his booty for himself.—
Transliteration: aneshey hatsava vazezu iysh lvo
