Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח מֹשֶׁ֜ה וְאֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶת־הַזָּהָ֔ב מֵאֵ֛ת שָׂרֵ֥י הָאֲלָפִ֖ים וְהַמֵּא֑וֹת וַיָּבִ֤אוּ אֹתוֹ֙ אֶל־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֔ד זִכָּר֥וֹן לִבְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: So Moses and Eleazar the priest accepted the gold from the officers of thousands and the officers of hundreds and brought it to the Tent of Meeting, as a reminder in behalf of the Israelites before יהוה.
Transliteration: vayikach mosheh veeleazar hakhohen et-hazahav meet sharey haalafiym vehamevot vayaviu otvo el-ohel mvoed zikharvon liveney-yisherael lifeney yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וּמִקְנֶ֣ה ׀ רַ֗ב הָיָ֞ה לִבְנֵ֧י רְאוּבֵ֛ן וְלִבְנֵי־גָ֖ד עָצ֣וּם מְאֹ֑ד וַיִּרְא֞וּ אֶת־אֶ֤רֶץ יַעְזֵר֙ וְאֶת־אֶ֣רֶץ גִּלְעָ֔ד וְהִנֵּ֥ה הַמָּק֖וֹם מְק֥וֹם מִקְנֶֽה׃
Translated: The Reubenites and the Gadites owned cattle in very great numbers. Noting that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were a region suitable for cattle,
Transliteration: umikeneh rav hayah liveney reuven veliveney-gad atsum meod vayireu et-erets yaezer veet-erets gilead vehineh hamakvom mekvom mikeneh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ בְנֵֽי־גָ֖ד וּבְנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֑ן וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֙ וְאֶל־אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶל־נְשִׂיאֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: the Gadite and Reubenite [leaders] came to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the chieftains of the community, and said,
Transliteration: vayavou veney-gad uveney reuven vayomeru el-mosheh veel-eleazar hakhohen veel-neshiyey haedah lemor

Hebrew: עֲטָר֤וֹת וְדִיבֹן֙ וְיַעְזֵ֣ר וְנִמְרָ֔ה וְחֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן וְאֶלְעָלֵ֑ה וּשְׂבָ֥ם וּנְב֖וֹ וּבְעֹֽן׃
Translated: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon—
Transliteration: atarvot vediyvon veyaezer venimerah vecheshevvon veelealeh ushevam unevvo uveon

Hebrew: הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לִפְנֵי֙ עֲדַ֣ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶ֥רֶץ מִקְנֶ֖ה הִ֑וא וְלַֽעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ מִקְנֶֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: the land that יהוה has conquered for the community of Israel—is cattle country, and your servants have cattle.
Transliteration: haarets asher hikhah yehovah lifeney adat yisherael erets mikeneh hiv velaavadeykha mikeneh {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אִם־מָצָ֤אנוּ חֵן֙ בְּעֵינֶ֔יךָ יֻתַּ֞ן אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את לַעֲבָדֶ֖יךָ לַאֲחֻזָּ֑ה אַל־תַּעֲבִרֵ֖נוּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: It would be a favor to us,” they continued, “if this land were given to your servants as a holding; do not move us across the Jordan.”
Transliteration: vayomeru im-matsanu chen veeyneykha yutan et-haarets hazot laavadeykha laachuzah al-taavirenu et-hayareden

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֔ה לִבְנֵי־גָ֖ד וְלִבְנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֑ן הַאַֽחֵיכֶ֗ם יָבֹ֙אוּ֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְאַתֶּ֖ם תֵּ֥שְׁבוּ פֹֽה׃
Translated: Moses replied to the Gadites and the Reubenites, “Are your brothers to go to war while you stay here?
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh liveney-gad veliveney reuven haacheykhem yavou lamilechamah veatem teshevu foh

Hebrew: וְלָ֣מָּה (תנואון) [תְנִיא֔וּן] אֶת־לֵ֖ב בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מֵֽעֲבֹר֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Why will you turn the minds of the Israelites from crossing into the land that יהוה has given them?
Transliteration: velamah (tnvvn) [teniyun] et-lev veney yisherael meavor el-haarets asher-natan lahem yehovah

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה עָשׂ֖וּ אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּשׇׁלְחִ֥י אֹתָ֛ם מִקָּדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵ֖עַ לִרְא֥וֹת אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: That is what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to survey the land.
Transliteration: khoh ashu avoteykhem veshׇlechiy otam mikadesh varenea lirevot et-haarets

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲל֞וּ עַד־נַ֣חַל אֶשְׁכּ֗וֹל וַיִּרְאוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וַיָּנִ֕יאוּ אֶת־לֵ֖ב בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְבִלְתִּי־בֹא֙ אֶל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נָתַ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: After going up to the wadi Eshcol and surveying the land, they turned the minds of the Israelites from invading the land that יהוה had given them.
Transliteration: vayaalu ad-nachal eshekhvol vayireu et-haarets vayaniyu et-lev veney yisherael leviletiy-vo el-haarets asher-natan lahem yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיִּשָּׁבַ֖ע לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Thereupon יהוה was incensed and swore,
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah vayyvom hahu vayishava lemor

Hebrew: אִם־יִרְא֨וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים הָעֹלִ֣ים מִמִּצְרַ֗יִם מִבֶּ֨ן עֶשְׂרִ֤ים שָׁנָה֙ וָמַ֔עְלָה אֵ֚ת הָאֲדָמָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֛עְתִּי לְאַבְרָהָ֥ם לְיִצְחָ֖ק וּֽלְיַעֲקֹ֑ב כִּ֥י לֹא־מִלְא֖וּ אַחֲרָֽי׃
Translated: ‘None of the men from twenty years up who came out of Egypt shall see the land that I promised on oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, for they did not remain loyal to Me—
Transliteration: im-yireu haanashiym haoliym mimitserayiim miven esheriym shanah vamaelah et haadamah asher nishevaetiy leaveraham leyitsechak uleyaakov khiy lo-mileu acharay

Hebrew: בִּלְתִּ֞י כָּלֵ֤ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּה֙ הַקְּנִזִּ֔י וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נ֑וּן כִּ֥י מִלְא֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: none except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun, for they remained loyal to יהוה.’
Transliteration: viletiy khalev ven-yefuneh hakeniziy viyhvoshua vin-nun khiy mileu acharey yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֤ף יְהֹוָה֙ בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְנִעֵם֙ בַּמִּדְבָּ֔ר אַרְבָּעִ֖ים שָׁנָ֑ה עַד־תֹּם֙ כׇּל־הַדּ֔וֹר הָעֹשֶׂ֥ה הָרַ֖ע בְּעֵינֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: יהוה, incensed at Israel, made them wander in the wilderness for forty years, until the whole generation that had provoked יהוה’s displeasure was gone.
Transliteration: vayichar-af yehovah veyisherael vayeniem vamidevar arevaiym shanah ad-tom khׇl-hadvor haosheh hara veeyney yehovah

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֣ה קַמְתֶּ֗ם תַּ֚חַת אֲבֹ֣תֵיכֶ֔ם תַּרְבּ֖וּת אֲנָשִׁ֣ים חַטָּאִ֑ים לִסְפּ֣וֹת ע֗וֹד עַ֛ל חֲר֥וֹן אַף־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And now you, a breed of sinful fellows, have replaced your fathers, to add still further to יהוה’s wrath against Israel.
Transliteration: vehineh kametem tachat avoteykhem tarevut anashiym chataiym lisefvot vod al charvon af-yehovah el-yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תְשׁוּבֻן֙ מֵֽאַחֲרָ֔יו וְיָסַ֣ף ע֔וֹד לְהַנִּיח֖וֹ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְשִֽׁחַתֶּ֖ם לְכׇל־הָעָ֥ם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: If you turn away from [God], who then abandons them once more in the wilderness, you will bring calamity upon all this people.”
Transliteration: khiy teshuvun meacharayv veyasaf vod lehaniychvo vamidevar veshichatem lekhׇl-haam hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּגְּשׁ֤וּ אֵלָיו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמְר֔וּ גִּדְרֹ֥ת צֹ֛אן נִבְנֶ֥ה לְמִקְנֵ֖נוּ פֹּ֑ה וְעָרִ֖ים לְטַפֵּֽנוּ׃
Translated: Then they stepped up to him and said, “We will build here sheepfolds for our flocks and towns for our children.
Transliteration: vayigeshu elayv vayomeru giderot tson niveneh lemikenenu foh veariym letafenu

Hebrew: וַאֲנַ֜חְנוּ נֵחָלֵ֣ץ חֻשִׁ֗ים לִפְנֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֛ד אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִם־הֲבִֽיאֹנֻ֖ם אֶל־מְקוֹמָ֑ם וְיָשַׁ֤ב טַפֵּ֙נוּ֙ בְּעָרֵ֣י הַמִּבְצָ֔ר מִפְּנֵ֖י יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And we will hasten as shock-troops in the van of the Israelites until we have established them in their home, while our children stay in the fortified towns because of the inhabitants of the land.
Transliteration: vaanachenu nechalets chushiym lifeney veney yisherael ad asher im-haviyonum el-mekvomam veyashav tafenu vearey hamivetsar mifeney yoshevey haarets

Hebrew: לֹ֥א נָשׁ֖וּב אֶל־בָּתֵּ֑ינוּ עַ֗ד הִתְנַחֵל֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִ֖ישׁ נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: We will not return to our homes until the Israelites—every one of them—are in possession of their portion.
Transliteration: lo nashuv el-vateynu ad hitenachel veney yisherael iysh nachalatvo

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֤א נִנְחַל֙ אִתָּ֔ם מֵעֵ֥בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן וָהָ֑לְאָה כִּ֣י בָ֤אָה נַחֲלָתֵ֙נוּ֙ אֵלֵ֔ינוּ מֵעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן מִזְרָֽחָה׃ {פ}
Translated: But we will not have a share with them in the territory beyond the Jordan, for we have received our share on the east side of the Jordan.”
Transliteration: khiy lo ninechal itam meever layareden vahaleah khiy vaah nachalatenu eleynu meever hayareden mizerachah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה אִֽם־תַּעֲשׂ֖וּן אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֑ה אִם־תֵּחָ֥לְצ֛וּ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Moses said to them, “If you do this, if you go to battle as shock-troops, at the instance of יהוה,
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem mosheh im-taashun et-hadavar hazeh im-techaletsu lifeney yehovah lamilechamah

Hebrew: וְעָבַ֨ר לָכֶ֧ם כׇּל־חָל֛וּץ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה עַ֧ד הוֹרִישׁ֛וֹ אֶת־אֹיְבָ֖יו מִפָּנָֽיו׃
Translated: and every shock-fighter among you crosses the Jordan, at the instance of יהוה, until [God] has personally dispossessed the enemies,
Transliteration: veavar lakhem khׇl-chaluts et-hayareden lifeney yehovah ad hvoriyshvo et-oyevayv mifanayv

Hebrew: וְנִכְבְּשָׁ֨ה הָאָ֜רֶץ לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ וְאַחַ֣ר תָּשֻׁ֔בוּ וִהְיִיתֶ֧ם נְקִיִּ֛ם מֵיְהֹוָ֖ה וּמִיִּשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְ֠הָיְתָ֠ה הָאָ֨רֶץ הַזֹּ֥את לָכֶ֛ם לַאֲחֻזָּ֖ה לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: and the land has been subdued, at the instance of יהוה, and then you return—you shall be clear before יהוה and before Israel; and this land shall be your holding under יהוה.
Transliteration: venikheveshah haarets lifeney yehovah veachar tashuvu viheyiytem nekiyim meyehovah umiyisherael vehayetah haarets hazot lakhem laachuzah lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א תַעֲשׂוּן֙ כֵּ֔ן הִנֵּ֥ה חֲטָאתֶ֖ם לַיהֹוָ֑ה וּדְעוּ֙ חַטַּאתְכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּמְצָ֖א אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: But if you do not do so, you will have sinned against יהוה; and know that your sin will overtake you.
Transliteration: veim-lo taashun khen hineh chatatem layhovah udeu chatatekhem asher timetsa etekhem

Hebrew: בְּנֽוּ־לָכֶ֤ם עָרִים֙ לְטַפְּכֶ֔ם וּגְדֵרֹ֖ת לְצֹנַאֲכֶ֑ם וְהַיֹּצֵ֥א מִפִּיכֶ֖ם תַּעֲשֽׂוּ׃
Translated: Build towns for your children and sheepfolds for your flocks, but do what you have promised.”
Transliteration: venu-lakhem ariym letafekhem ugederot letsonaakhem vehayotse mifiykhem taashu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר בְּנֵי־גָד֙ וּבְנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֔ן אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ יַעֲשׂ֔וּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲדֹנִ֖י מְצַוֶּֽה׃
Translated: The Gadites and the Reubenites answered Moses, “Your servants will do as my lord commands.
Transliteration: vayomer veney-gad uveney reuven el-mosheh lemor avadeykha yaashu khaasher adoniy metsaveh

Hebrew: טַפֵּ֣נוּ נָשֵׁ֔ינוּ מִקְנֵ֖נוּ וְכׇל־בְּהֶמְתֵּ֑נוּ יִֽהְיוּ־שָׁ֖ם בְּעָרֵ֥י הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated: Our children, our wives, our flocks, and all our other livestock will stay behind in the towns of Gilead;
Transliteration: tafenu nasheynu mikenenu vekhׇl-vehemetenu yiheyu-sham vearey hagilead

Hebrew: וַעֲבָדֶ֨יךָ יַֽעַבְר֜וּ כׇּל־חֲל֥וּץ צָבָ֛א לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲדֹנִ֖י דֹּבֵֽר׃
Translated: while your servants, all those recruited for war, cross over, at the instance of יהוה, to engage in battle—as my lord orders.”
Transliteration: vaavadeykha yaaveru khׇl-chaluts tsava lifeney yehovah lamilechamah khaasher adoniy dover

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו לָהֶם֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֵ֚ת אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֵ֖ת יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֑וּן וְאֶת־רָאשֵׁ֛י אֲב֥וֹת הַמַּטּ֖וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then Moses gave instructions concerning them to Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the family heads of the Israelite tribes.
Transliteration: vayetsav lahem mosheh et eleazar hakhohen veet yehvoshua vin-nun veet-rashey avvot hamatvot liveney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֲלֵהֶ֗ם אִם־יַעַבְר֣וּ בְנֵי־גָ֣ד וּבְנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֣ן <small>׀</small> אִ֠תְּכֶ֠ם אֶֽת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֞ן כׇּל־חָל֤וּץ לַמִּלְחָמָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנִכְבְּשָׁ֥ה הָאָ֖רֶץ לִפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם לָהֶ֛ם אֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ הַגִּלְעָ֖ד לַאֲחֻזָּֽה׃
Translated: Moses said to them, “If every shock-fighter among the Gadites and the Reubenites crosses the Jordan with you to do battle, at the instance of יהוה, and the land is subdued before you, you shall give them the land of Gilead as a holding.
Transliteration: vayomer mosheh alehem im-yaaveru veney-gad uveney-reuven <small></small> itekhem et-hayareden khׇl-chaluts lamilechamah lifeney yehovah venikheveshah haarets lifeneykhem unetatem lahem et-erets hagilead laachuzah

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֧א יַֽעַבְר֛וּ חֲלוּצִ֖ים אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְנֹֽאחֲז֥וּ בְתֹכְכֶ֖ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: But if they do not cross over with you as shock-troops, they shall receive holdings among you in the land of Canaan.”
Transliteration: veim-lo yaaveru chalutsiym itekhem venochazu vetokhekhem veerets khenaan

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲנ֧וּ בְנֵי־גָ֛ד וּבְנֵ֥י רְאוּבֵ֖ן לֵאמֹ֑ר אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֖יךָ כֵּ֥ן נַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
Translated: The Gadites and the Reubenites said in reply, “Whatever יהוה has spoken concerning your servants, that we will do.
Transliteration: vayaanu veney-gad uveney reuven lemor et asher diver yehovah el-avadeykha khen naasheh

Hebrew: נַ֣חְנוּ נַעֲבֹ֧ר חֲלוּצִ֛ים לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וְאִתָּ֙נוּ֙ אֲחֻזַּ֣ת נַחֲלָתֵ֔נוּ מֵעֵ֖בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: We ourselves will cross over as shock-troops, at the instance of יהוה, into the land of Canaan; and we shall keep our hereditary holding across the Jordan.”
Transliteration: nachenu naavor chalutsiym lifeney yehovah erets khenaan veitanu achuzat nachalatenu meever layareden

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָהֶ֣ם ׀ מֹשֶׁ֡ה לִבְנֵי־גָד֩ וְלִבְנֵ֨י רְאוּבֵ֜ן וְלַחֲצִ֣י ׀ שֵׁ֣בֶט ׀ מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה בֶן־יוֹסֵ֗ף אֶת־מַמְלֶ֙כֶת֙ סִיחֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָֽאֱמֹרִ֔י וְאֶ֨ת־מַמְלֶ֔כֶת ע֖וֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן הָאָ֗רֶץ לְעָרֶ֙יהָ֙ בִּגְבֻלֹ֔ת עָרֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: So Moses assigned to them—to the Gadites, the Reubenites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph—the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of King Og of Bashan, the land with its various cities and the territories of their surrounding towns.
Transliteration: vayiten lahem mosheh liveney-gad veliveney reuven velachatsiy shevet menasheh ven-yvosef et-mamelekhet siychon melekhe haemoriy veet-mamelekhet vog melekhe havashan haarets leareyha vigevulot arey haarets saviyv

Hebrew: וַיִּבְנ֣וּ בְנֵי־גָ֔ד אֶת־דִּיבֹ֖ן וְאֶת־עֲטָרֹ֑ת וְאֵ֖ת עֲרֹעֵֽר׃
Translated: The Gadites rebuilt Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
Transliteration: vayivenu veney-gad et-diyvon veet-atarot veet aroer

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַטְרֹ֥ת שׁוֹפָ֛ן וְאֶת־יַעְזֵ֖ר וְיׇגְבְּהָֽה׃
Translated: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
Transliteration: veet-aterot shvofan veet-yaezer veyׇgevehah

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית נִמְרָ֖ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֣ית הָרָ֑ן עָרֵ֥י מִבְצָ֖ר וְגִדְרֹ֥ת צֹֽאן׃
Translated: Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran as fortified towns or as enclosures for flocks.
Transliteration: veet-veyt nimerah veet-veyt haran arey mivetsar vegiderot tson

Hebrew: וּבְנֵ֤י רְאוּבֵן֙ בָּנ֔וּ אֶת־חֶשְׁבּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־אֶלְעָלֵ֑א וְאֵ֖ת קִרְיָתָֽיִם׃
Translated: The Reubenites rebuilt Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
Transliteration: uveney reuven vanu et-cheshevvon veet-eleale veet kireyatayiim

Hebrew: וְאֶת־נְב֞וֹ וְאֶת־בַּ֧עַל מְע֛וֹן מֽוּסַבֹּ֥ת שֵׁ֖ם וְאֶת־שִׂבְמָ֑ה וַיִּקְרְא֣וּ בְשֵׁמֹ֔ת אֶת־שְׁמ֥וֹת הֶעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר בָּנֽוּ׃
Translated: Nebo, Baal-meon—some names being changed—and Sibmah; they gave [their own] names to towns that they rebuilt.
Transliteration: veet-nevvo veet-vaal mevon musavot shem veet-shivemah vayikereu veshemot et-shemvot heariym asher vanu

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ בְּנֵ֨י מָכִ֧יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֛ה גִּלְעָ֖דָה וַֽיִּלְכְּדֻ֑הָ וַיּ֖וֹרֶשׁ אֶת־הָאֱמֹרִ֥י אֲשֶׁר־בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: The descendants of Machir son of Manasseh went to Gilead and captured it, dispossessing the Amorites who were there;
Transliteration: vayelekhu veney makhiyr ven-menasheh gileadah vayilekheduha vayyvoresh et-haemoriy asher-vah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־הַגִּלְעָ֔ד לְמָכִ֖יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַיֵּ֖שֶׁב בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: so Moses gave Gilead to Machir son of Manasseh, and he settled there.
Transliteration: vayiten mosheh et-hagilead lemakhiyr ven-menasheh vayeshev vah

Hebrew: וְיָאִ֤יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁה֙ הָלַ֔ךְ וַיִּלְכֹּ֖ד אֶת־חַוֺּתֵיהֶ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֥א אֶתְהֶ֖ן חַוֺּ֥ת יָאִֽיר׃
Translated: Jair son of Manasseh went and captured their villages, which he renamed Havvoth-jair.
Transliteration: veyaiyr ven-menasheh halakhe vayilekhod et-chavoteyhem vayikera etehen chavot yaiyr

Hebrew: וְנֹ֣בַח הָלַ֔ךְ וַיִּלְכֹּ֥ד אֶת־קְנָ֖ת וְאֶת־בְּנֹתֶ֑יהָ וַיִּקְרָ֧א לָ֦הֿ נֹ֖בַח בִּשְׁמֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: And Nobah went and captured Kenath and its dependencies, renaming it Nobah after himself.
Transliteration: venovach halakhe vayilekhod et-kenat veet-venoteyha vayikera lahֿ novach vishemvo {f}

Hebrew: אֵ֜לֶּה מַסְעֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָצְא֛וּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לְצִבְאֹתָ֑ם בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֖ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
Translated: These were the marches of the Israelites who started out from the land of Egypt, troop by troop, in the charge of Moses and Aaron.
Transliteration: eleh maseey veney-yisherael asher yatseu meerets mitserayiim letsiveotam veyad-mosheh veaharon

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֨ב מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֶת־מוֹצָאֵיהֶ֛ם לְמַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֵ֥לֶּה מַסְעֵיהֶ֖ם לְמוֹצָאֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Moses recorded the starting points of their various marches as directed by יהוה. Their marches, by starting points, were as follows:
Transliteration: vayikhetov mosheh et-mvotsaeyhem lemaseeyhem al-fiy yehovah veeleh maseeyhem lemvotsaeyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֤וּ מֵֽרַעְמְסֵס֙ בַּחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֔וֹן בַּחֲמִשָּׁ֥ה עָשָׂ֛ר י֖וֹם לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֑וֹן מִֽמׇּחֳרַ֣ת הַפֶּ֗סַח יָצְא֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּיָ֣ד רָמָ֔ה לְעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: They set out from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month. It was on the morrow of the passover offering that the Israelites started out defiantly, in plain view of all the Egyptians.
Transliteration: vayiseu meraemeses vachodesh harishvon vachamishah ashar yvom lachodesh harishvon mimׇchorat hafesach yatseu veney-yisherael veyad ramah leeyney khׇl-mitserayiim

Hebrew: וּמִצְרַ֣יִם מְקַבְּרִ֗ים אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה בָּהֶ֖ם כׇּל־בְּכ֑וֹר וּבֵאלֹ֣הֵיהֶ֔ם עָשָׂ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה שְׁפָטִֽים׃
Translated: The Egyptians meanwhile were burying those among them whom יהוה had struck down, every [male] first-born—whereby יהוה executed judgment on their gods.
Transliteration: umitserayiim mekaveriym et asher hikhah yehovah vahem khׇl-vekhvor uveloheyhem ashah yehovah shefatiym

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מֵרַעְמְסֵ֑ס וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּסֻכֹּֽת׃
Translated: The Israelites set out from Rameses and encamped at Succoth.
Transliteration: vayiseu veney-yisherael meraemeses vayachanu vesukhot

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִסֻּכֹּ֑ת וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ בְאֵתָ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר בִּקְצֵ֥ה הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: They set out from Succoth and encamped at Etham, which is on the edge of the wilderness.
Transliteration: vayiseu misukhot vayachanu veetam asher viketseh hamidevar

Hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מֵֽאֵתָ֔ם וַיָּ֙שׇׁב֙ עַל־פִּ֣י הַחִירֹ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־פְּנֵ֖י בַּ֣עַל צְפ֑וֹן וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י מִגְדֹּֽל׃
Translated: They set out from Etham and turned about toward Pi-hahiroth, which faces Baal-zephon, and they encamped before Migdol.
Transliteration: vayiseu meetam vayashׇv al-fiy hachiyrot asher al-feney vaal tsefvon vayachanu lifeney migedol

Hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הַֽחִירֹ֔ת וַיַּֽעַבְר֥וּ בְתוֹךְ־הַיָּ֖ם הַמִּדְבָּ֑רָה וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ דֶּ֣רֶךְ שְׁלֹ֤שֶׁת יָמִים֙ בְּמִדְבַּ֣ר אֵתָ֔ם וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמָרָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Pene -hahiroth and passed through the sea into the wilderness; and they made a three-days’ journey in the wilderness of Etham and encamped at Marah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mifeney hachiyrot vayaaveru vetvokhe-hayam hamidevarah vayelekhu derekhe sheloshet yamiym vemidevar etam vayachanu vemarah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְעוּ֙ מִמָּרָ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֵילִ֑מָה וּ֠בְאֵילִ֠ם שְׁתֵּ֣ים עֶשְׂרֵ֞ה עֵינֹ֥ת מַ֛יִם וְשִׁבְעִ֥ים תְּמָרִ֖ים וַיַּחֲנוּ־שָֽׁם׃
Translated: They set out from Marah and came to Elim. There were twelve springs in Elim and seventy palm trees, so they encamped there.
Transliteration: vayiseu mimarah vayavou eylimah uveeylim sheteym eshereh eynot mayiim veshiveiym temariym vayachanu-sham

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵאֵילִ֑ם וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ עַל־יַם־סֽוּף׃
Translated: They set out from Elim and encamped by the Sea of Reeds.
Transliteration: vayiseu meeylim vayachanu al-yam-suf

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִיַּם־ס֑וּף וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמִדְבַּר־סִֽין׃
Translated: They set out from the Sea of Reeds and encamped in the wilderness of Sin.
Transliteration: vayiseu miyam-suf vayachanu vemidevar-siyn

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמִּדְבַּר־סִ֑ין וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּדׇפְקָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from the wilderness of Sin and encamped at Dophkah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mimidevar-siyn vayachanu vedׇfekah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִדׇּפְקָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּאָלֽוּשׁ׃
Translated: They set out from Dophkah and encamped at Alush.
Transliteration: vayiseu midׇfekah vayachanu vealush

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵאָל֑וּשׁ וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בִּרְפִידִ֔ם וְלֹא־הָ֨יָה שָׁ֥ם מַ֛יִם לָעָ֖ם לִשְׁתּֽוֹת׃
Translated: They set out from Alush and encamped at Rephidim; it was there that the people had no water to drink.
Transliteration: vayiseu mealush vayachanu virefiydim velo-hayah sham mayiim laam lishetvot

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵרְפִידִ֑ם וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר סִינָֽי׃
Translated: They set out from Rephidim and encamped in the wilderness of Sinai.
Transliteration: vayiseu merefiydim vayachanu vemidevar siynay

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמִּדְבַּ֣ר סִינָ֑י וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּקִבְרֹ֥ת הַֽתַּאֲוָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from the wilderness of Sinai and encamped at Kibroth-hattaavah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mimidevar siynay vayachanu vekiverot hataavah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִקִּבְרֹ֣ת הַֽתַּאֲוָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּחֲצֵרֹֽת׃
Translated: They set out from Kibroth-hattaavah and encamped at Hazeroth.
Transliteration: vayiseu mikiverot hataavah vayachanu vachatserot

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵחֲצֵרֹ֑ת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּרִתְמָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Hazeroth and encamped at Rithmah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mechatserot vayachanu veritemah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵרִתְמָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּרִמֹּ֥ן פָּֽרֶץ׃
Translated: They set out from Rithmah and encamped at Rimmon-perez.
Transliteration: vayiseu meritemah vayachanu verimon farets

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵרִמֹּ֣ן פָּ֑רֶץ וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּלִבְנָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Rimmon-perez and encamped at Libnah.
Transliteration: vayiseu merimon farets vayachanu velivenah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִלִּבְנָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּרִסָּֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Libnah and encamped at Rissah.
Transliteration: vayiseu milivenah vayachanu verisah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵרִסָּ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בִּקְהֵלָֽתָה׃
Translated: They set out from Rissah and encamped at Kehelath.
Transliteration: vayiseu merisah vayachanu vikehelatah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִקְּהֵלָ֑תָה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּהַר־שָֽׁפֶר׃
Translated: They set out from Kehelath and encamped at Mount Shepher.
Transliteration: vayiseu mikehelatah vayachanu vehar-shafer

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵֽהַר־שָׁ֑פֶר וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בַּחֲרָדָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Mount Shepher and encamped at Haradah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mehar-shafer vayachanu vacharadah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵחֲרָדָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמַקְהֵלֹֽת׃
Translated: They set out from Haradah and encamped at Makheloth.
Transliteration: vayiseu mecharadah vayachanu vemakehelot

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמַּקְהֵלֹ֑ת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּתָֽחַת׃
Translated: They set out from Makheloth and encamped at Tahath.
Transliteration: vayiseu mimakehelot vayachanu vetachat

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִתָּ֑חַת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּתָֽרַח׃
Translated: They set out from Tahath and encamped at Terah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mitachat vayachanu vetarach

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִתָּ֑רַח וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמִתְקָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Terah and encamped at Mithkah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mitarach vayachanu vemitekah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמִּתְקָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּחַשְׁמֹנָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Mithkah and encamped at Hashmonah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mimitekah vayachanu vechashemonah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵֽחַשְׁמֹנָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּמֹסֵרֽוֹת׃
Translated: They set out from Hashmonah and encamped at Moseroth.
Transliteration: vayiseu mechashemonah vayachanu vemoservot

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִמֹּסֵר֑וֹת וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בִּבְנֵ֥י יַעֲקָֽן׃
Translated: They set out from Moseroth and encamped at Bene-jaakan.
Transliteration: vayiseu mimoservot vayachanu viveney yaakan

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִבְּנֵ֣י יַעֲקָ֑ן וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּחֹ֥ר הַגִּדְגָּֽד׃
Translated: They set out from Bene-jaakan and encamped at Hor-haggidgad.
Transliteration: vayiseu miveney yaakan vayachanu vechor hagidegad

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵחֹ֣ר הַגִּדְגָּ֑ד וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּיׇטְבָֽתָה׃
Translated: They set out from Hor-haggidgad and encamped at Jotbath.
Transliteration: vayiseu mechor hagidegad vayachanu veyׇtevatah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִיׇּטְבָ֑תָה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּעַבְרֹנָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Jotbath and encamped at Abronah.
Transliteration: vayiseu miyׇtevatah vayachanu veaveronah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵֽעַבְרֹנָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּעֶצְיֹ֥ן גָּֽבֶר׃
Translated: They set out from Abronah and encamped at Ezion-geber.
Transliteration: vayiseu meaveronah vayachanu veetseyon gaver

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵעֶצְיֹ֣ן גָּ֑בֶר וַיַּחֲנ֥וּ בְמִדְבַּר־צִ֖ן הִ֥וא קָדֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: They set out from Ezion-geber and encamped in the wilderness of Zin, that is, Kadesh.
Transliteration: vayiseu meetseyon gaver vayachanu vemidevar-tsin hiv kadesh

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִקָּדֵ֑שׁ וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בְּהֹ֣ר הָהָ֔ר בִּקְצֵ֖ה אֶ֥רֶץ אֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated: They set out from Kadesh and encamped at Mount Hor, on the edge of the land of Edom.
Transliteration: vayiseu mikadesh vayachanu vehor hahar viketseh erets edvom

Hebrew: וַיַּ֩עַל֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶל־הֹ֥ר הָהָ֛ר עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה וַיָּ֣מׇת שָׁ֑ם בִּשְׁנַ֣ת הָֽאַרְבָּעִ֗ים לְצֵ֤את בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם בַּחֹ֥דֶשׁ הַחֲמִישִׁ֖י בְּאֶחָ֥ד לַחֹֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: Aaron the priest ascended Mount Hor at the command of יהוה and died there, in the fortieth year after the Israelites had left the land of Egypt, on the first day of the fifth month.
Transliteration: vayaal aharon hakhohen el-hor hahar al-fiy yehovah vayamׇt sham vishenat haarevaiym letset veney-yisherael meerets mitserayiim vachodesh hachamiyshiy veechad lachodesh

Hebrew: וְאַהֲרֹ֔ן בֶּן־שָׁלֹ֧שׁ וְעֶשְׂרִ֛ים וּמְאַ֖ת שָׁנָ֑ה בְּמֹת֖וֹ בְּהֹ֥ר הָהָֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Aaron was a hundred and twenty-three years old when he died on Mount Hor.
Transliteration: veaharon ven-shalosh veesheriym umeat shanah vemotvo vehor hahar {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֗ע הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ עֲרָ֔ד וְהֽוּא־יֹשֵׁ֥ב בַּנֶּ֖גֶב בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן בְּבֹ֖א בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And the Canaanite, king of Arad, who dwelt in the Negeb, in the land of Canaan, learned of the coming of the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayishema hakhenaaniy melekhe arad vehu-yoshev vanegev veerets khenaan vevo veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵהֹ֣ר הָהָ֑ר וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּצַלְמֹנָֽה׃
Translated: They set out from Mount Hor and encamped at Zalmonah.
Transliteration: vayiseu mehor hahar vayachanu vetsalemonah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִצַּלְמֹנָ֑ה וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּפוּנֹֽן׃
Translated: They set out from Zalmonah and encamped at Punon.
Transliteration: vayiseu mitsalemonah vayachanu vefunon

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִפּוּנֹ֑ן וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּאֹבֹֽת׃
Translated: They set out from Punon and encamped at Oboth.
Transliteration: vayiseu mifunon vayachanu veovot

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵאֹבֹ֑ת וַֽיַּחֲנ֛וּ בְּעִיֵּ֥י הָעֲבָרִ֖ים בִּגְב֥וּל מוֹאָֽב׃
Translated: They set out from Oboth and encamped at Iye-abarim, in the territory of Moab.
Transliteration: vayiseu meovot vayachanu veiyey haavariym vigevul mvoav

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵעִיִּ֑ים וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּדִיבֹ֥ן גָּֽד׃
Translated: They set out from Iyim and encamped at Dibon-gad.
Transliteration: vayiseu meiyiym vayachanu vediyvon gad

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מִדִּיבֹ֣ן גָּ֑ד וַֽיַּחֲנ֖וּ בְּעַלְמֹ֥ן דִּבְלָתָֽיְמָה׃
Translated: They set out from Dibon-gad and encamped at Almon-diblathaim.
Transliteration: vayiseu midiyvon gad vayachanu vealemon divelatayemah

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵעַלְמֹ֣ן דִּבְלָתָ֑יְמָה וַֽיַּחֲנ֛וּ בְּהָרֵ֥י הָעֲבָרִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י נְבֽוֹ׃
Translated: They set out from Almon-diblathaim and encamped in the hills of Abarim, before Nebo.
Transliteration: vayiseu mealemon divelatayemah vayachanu veharey haavariym lifeney nevvo

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֖וּ מֵהָרֵ֣י הָעֲבָרִ֑ים וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב עַ֖ל יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃
Translated: They set out from the hills of Abarim and encamped in the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho;
Transliteration: vayiseu meharey haavariym vayachanu vearevot mvoav al yareden yerechvo

Hebrew: וַיַּחֲנ֤וּ עַל־הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ מִבֵּ֣ית הַיְשִׁמֹ֔ת עַ֖ד אָבֵ֣ל הַשִּׁטִּ֑ים בְּעַֽרְבֹ֖ת מוֹאָֽב׃ {ס}
Translated: they encamped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth as far as Abel-shittim, in the steppes of Moab.
Transliteration: vayachanu al-hayareden miveyt hayeshimot ad avel hashitiym vearevot mvoav {s}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֑ב עַל־יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵח֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: In the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho, יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh vearevot mvoav al-yareden yerechvo lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כִּ֥י אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem khiy atem overiym et-hayareden el-erets khenaan

Hebrew: וְה֨וֹרַשְׁתֶּ֜ם אֶת־כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם וְאִ֨בַּדְתֶּ֔ם אֵ֖ת כׇּל־מַשְׂכִּיֹּתָ֑ם וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־צַלְמֵ֤י מַסֵּֽכֹתָם֙ תְּאַבֵּ֔דוּ וְאֵ֥ת כׇּל־בָּמוֹתָ֖ם תַּשְׁמִֽידוּ׃
Translated: you shall dispossess all the inhabitants of the land; you shall destroy all their figured objects; you shall destroy all their molten images, and you shall demolish all their cult places.
Transliteration: vehvorashetem et-khׇl-yoshevey haarets mifeneykhem veivadetem et khׇl-mashekhiyotam veet khׇl-tsalemey masekhotam teavedu veet khׇl-vamvotam tashemiydu

Hebrew: וְהוֹרַשְׁתֶּ֥ם אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וִֽישַׁבְתֶּם־בָּ֑הּ כִּ֥י לָכֶ֛ם נָתַ֥תִּי אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ לָרֶ֥שֶׁת אֹתָֽהּ׃
Translated: And you shall take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have assigned the land to you to possess.
Transliteration: vehvorashetem et-haarets viyshavetem-vah khiy lakhem natatiy et-haarets lareshet otah

Hebrew: וְהִתְנַחַלְתֶּם֩ אֶת־הָאָ֨רֶץ בְּגוֹרָ֜ל לְמִשְׁפְּחֹֽתֵיכֶ֗ם לָרַ֞ב תַּרְבּ֤וּ אֶת־נַחֲלָתוֹ֙ וְלַמְעַט֙ תַּמְעִ֣יט אֶת־נַחֲלָת֔וֹ אֶל֩ אֲשֶׁר־יֵ֨צֵא ל֥וֹ שָׁ֛מָּה הַגּוֹרָ֖ל ל֣וֹ יִהְיֶ֑ה לְמַטּ֥וֹת אֲבֹתֵיכֶ֖ם תִּתְנֶחָֽלוּ׃
Translated: You shall apportion the land among yourselves by lot, clan by clan: with larger groups increase the share, with smaller groups reduce the share. Wherever the lot falls for it, that shall be its location. You shall have your portions according to your ancestral tribes.
Transliteration: vehitenachaletem et-haarets vegvoral lemishefechoteykhem larav tarevu et-nachalatvo velameat tameiyt et-nachalatvo el asher-eitse lvo shamah hagvoral lvo yiheyeh lematvot avoteykhem titenechalu

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֨א תוֹרִ֜ישׁוּ אֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֘רֶץ֮ מִפְּנֵיכֶם֒ וְהָיָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תּוֹתִ֣ירוּ מֵהֶ֔ם לְשִׂכִּים֙ בְּעֵ֣ינֵיכֶ֔ם וְלִצְנִינִ֖ם בְּצִדֵּיכֶ֑ם וְצָרְר֣וּ אֶתְכֶ֔ם עַל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֖ם יֹשְׁבִ֥ים בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: But if you do not dispossess the inhabitants of the land, those whom you allow to remain shall be stings in your eyes and thorns in your sides, and they shall harass you in the land in which you live;
Transliteration: veim-lo tvoriyshu et-yoshevey haarets mifeneykhem vehayah asher tvotiyru mehem leshikhiym veeyneykhem velitseniynim vetsideykhem vetsareru etekhem al-haarets asher atem yosheviym vah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּמִּ֛יתִי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לָהֶ֖ם אֶֽעֱשֶׂ֥ה לָכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: so that I will do to you what I planned to do to them.
Transliteration: vehayah khaasher dimiytiy laashvot lahem eesheh lakhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: צַ֞ו אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם כִּֽי־אַתֶּ֥ם בָּאִ֖ים אֶל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן זֹ֣את הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּפֹּ֤ל לָכֶם֙ בְּֽנַחֲלָ֔ה אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנַ֖עַן לִגְבֻלֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Instruct the Israelite people and say to them: When you enter the land of Canaan, this is the land that shall fall to you as your portion, the land of Canaan with its various boundaries:
Transliteration: tsav et-veney yisherael veamareta alehem khiy-atem vaiym el-haarets khenaan zot haarets asher tifol lakhem venachalah erets khenaan ligevuloteyha

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֨ה לָכֶ֧ם פְּאַת־נֶ֛גֶב מִמִּדְבַּר־צִ֖ן עַל־יְדֵ֣י אֱד֑וֹם וְהָיָ֤ה לָכֶם֙ גְּב֣וּל נֶ֔גֶב מִקְצֵ֥ה יָם־הַמֶּ֖לַח קֵֽדְמָה׃
Translated: Your southern sector shall extend from the wilderness of Zin alongside Edom. Your southern boundary shall start on the east from the tip of the Dead Sea.
Transliteration: vehayah lakhem feat-negev mimidevar-tsin al-yedey edvom vehayah lakhem gevul negev miketseh yam-hamelach kedemah

Hebrew: וְנָסַ֣ב לָכֶם֩ הַגְּב֨וּל מִנֶּ֜גֶב לְמַעֲלֵ֤ה עַקְרַבִּים֙ וְעָ֣בַר צִ֔נָה (והיה) [וְהָיוּ֙] תּֽוֹצְאֹתָ֔יו מִנֶּ֖גֶב לְקָדֵ֣שׁ בַּרְנֵ֑עַ וְיָצָ֥א חֲצַר־אַדָּ֖ר וְעָבַ֥ר עַצְמֹֽנָה׃
Translated: Your boundary shall then turn to pass south of the ascent of Akrabbim and continue to Zin, and its limits shall be south of Kadesh-barnea, reaching Hazar-addar and continuing to Azmon.
Transliteration: venasav lakhem hagevul minegev lemaaleh akeraviym veavar tsinah (vhyh) [vehayu] tvotseotayv minegev lekadesh varenea veyatsa chatsar-adar veavar atsemonah

Hebrew: וְנָסַ֧ב הַגְּב֛וּל מֵעַצְמ֖וֹן נַ֣חְלָה מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהָי֥וּ תוֹצְאֹתָ֖יו הַיָּֽמָּה׃
Translated: From Azmon the boundary shall turn toward the Wadi of Egypt and terminate at the Sea.
Transliteration: venasav hagevul meatsemvon nachelah mitserayiim vehayu tvotseotayv hayamah

Hebrew: וּגְב֣וּל יָ֔ם וְהָיָ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם הַיָּ֥ם הַגָּד֖וֹל וּגְב֑וּל זֶֽה־יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם גְּב֥וּל יָֽם׃
Translated: For the western boundary you shall have the coast of the Great Sea; that shall serve as your western boundary.
Transliteration: ugevul yam vehayah lakhem hayam hagadvol ugevul zeh-yiheyeh lakhem gevul yam

Hebrew: וְזֶֽה־יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם גְּב֣וּל צָפ֑וֹן מִן־הַיָּם֙ הַגָּדֹ֔ל תְּתָא֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם הֹ֥ר הָהָֽר׃
Translated: This shall be your northern boundary: Draw a line from the Great Sea to Mount Hor;
Transliteration: vezeh-yiheyeh lakhem gevul tsafvon min-hayam hagadol tetau lakhem hor hahar

Hebrew: מֵהֹ֣ר הָהָ֔ר תְּתָא֖וּ לְבֹ֣א חֲמָ֑ת וְהָי֛וּ תּוֹצְאֹ֥ת הַגְּבֻ֖ל צְדָֽדָה׃
Translated: from Mount Hor draw a line to Lebo-hamath, and let the boundary reach Zedad.
Transliteration: mehor hahar tetau levo chamat vehayu tvotseot hagevul tsedadah

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֤א הַגְּבֻל֙ זִפְרֹ֔נָה וְהָי֥וּ תוֹצְאֹתָ֖יו חֲצַ֣ר עֵינָ֑ן זֶֽה־יִהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם גְּב֥וּל צָפֽוֹן׃
Translated: The boundary shall then run to Ziphron and terminate at Hazar-enan. That shall be your northern boundary.
Transliteration: veyatsa hagevul ziferonah vehayu tvotseotayv chatsar eynan zeh-yiheyeh lakhem gevul tsafvon

Hebrew: וְהִתְאַוִּיתֶ֥ם לָכֶ֖ם לִגְב֣וּל קֵ֑דְמָה מֵחֲצַ֥ר עֵינָ֖ן שְׁפָֽמָה׃
Translated: For your eastern boundary you shall draw a line from Hazar-enan to Shepham.
Transliteration: vehiteaviytem lakhem ligevul kedemah mechatsar eynan shefamah

Hebrew: וְיָרַ֨ד הַגְּבֻ֧ל מִשְּׁפָ֛ם הָרִבְלָ֖ה מִקֶּ֣דֶם לָעָ֑יִן וְיָרַ֣ד הַגְּבֻ֔ל וּמָחָ֛ה עַל־כֶּ֥תֶף יָם־כִּנֶּ֖רֶת קֵֽדְמָה׃
Translated: From Shepham the boundary shall descend to Riblah on the east side of Ain; from there the boundary shall continue downward and abut on the eastern slopes of the Sea of Chinnereth.
Transliteration: veyarad hagevul mishefam harivelah mikedem laayiin veyarad hagevul umachah al-khetef yam-khineret kedemah

Hebrew: וְיָרַ֤ד הַגְּבוּל֙ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔נָה וְהָי֥וּ תוֹצְאֹתָ֖יו יָ֣ם הַמֶּ֑לַח זֹאת֩ תִּהְיֶ֨ה לָכֶ֥ם הָאָ֛רֶץ לִגְבֻלֹתֶ֖יהָ סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: The boundary shall then descend along the Jordan and terminate at the Dead Sea. That shall be your land as defined by its boundaries on all sides.
Transliteration: veyarad hagevul hayaredenah vehayu tvotseotayv yam hamelach zot tiheyeh lakhem haarets ligevuloteyha saviyv

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר זֹ֣את הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּתְנַחֲל֤וּ אֹתָהּ֙ בְּגוֹרָ֔ל אֲשֶׁר֙ צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה לָתֵ֛ת לְתִשְׁעַ֥ת הַמַּטּ֖וֹת וַחֲצִ֥י הַמַּטֶּֽה׃
Translated: Moses instructed the Israelites, saying: This is the land you are to receive by lot as your hereditary portion, which יהוה has commanded to be given to the nine and a half tribes.
Transliteration: vayetsav mosheh et-veney yisherael lemor zot haarets asher titenachalu otah vegvoral asher tsivah yehovah latet letisheat hamatvot vachatsiy hamateh

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לָקְח֞וּ מַטֵּ֨ה בְנֵ֤י הָראוּבֵנִי֙ לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֔ם וּמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־הַגָּדִ֖י לְבֵ֣ית אֲבֹתָ֑ם וַחֲצִי֙ מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה לָקְח֖וּ נַחֲלָתָֽם׃
Translated: For the Reubenite tribe by its ancestral houses, the Gadite tribe by its ancestral houses, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have already received their portions:
Transliteration: khiy lakechu mateh veney haruveniy leveyt avotam umateh veney-hagadiy leveyt avotam vachatsiy mateh menasheh lakechu nachalatam

Hebrew: שְׁנֵ֥י הַמַּטּ֖וֹת וַחֲצִ֣י הַמַּטֶּ֑ה לָקְח֣וּ נַחֲלָתָ֗ם מֵעֵ֛בֶר לְיַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵח֖וֹ קֵ֥דְמָה מִזְרָֽחָה׃ {פ}
Translated: those two and a half tribes have received their portions across the Jordan, opposite Jericho, on the east, the orient side.
Transliteration: sheney hamatvot vachatsiy hamateh lakechu nachalatam meever leyareden yerechvo kedemah mizerachah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: אֵ֚לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־יִנְחֲל֥וּ לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ אֶלְעָזָר֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וִיהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נֽוּן׃
Translated: These are the names of the participants through whom the land shall be apportioned for you: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.
Transliteration: eleh shemvot haanashiym asher-yinechalu lakhem et-haarets eleazar hakhohen viyhvoshua vin-nun

Hebrew: וְנָשִׂ֥יא אֶחָ֛ד נָשִׂ֥יא אֶחָ֖ד מִמַּטֶּ֑ה תִּקְח֖וּ לִנְחֹ֥ל אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: And you shall also take a chieftain from each tribe through whom the land shall be apportioned.
Transliteration: venashiy echad nashiy echad mimateh tikechu linechol et-haarets

Hebrew: וְאֵ֖לֶּה שְׁמ֣וֹת הָאֲנָשִׁ֑ים לְמַטֵּ֣ה יְהוּדָ֔ה כָּלֵ֖ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּֽה׃
Translated: These are the names of the participants: from the tribe of Judah: Caleb son of Jephunneh.
Transliteration: veeleh shemvot haanashiym lemateh yehudah khalev ven-yefuneh

Hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּה֙ בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֔וֹן שְׁמוּאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עַמִּיהֽוּד׃
Translated: From the Simeonite tribe: Samuel son of Ammihud.
Transliteration: ulemateh veney shimevon shemuel ven-amiyhud

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֣ה בִנְיָמִ֔ן אֱלִידָ֖ד בֶּן־כִּסְלֽוֹן׃
Translated: From the tribe of Benjamin: Elidad son of Chislon.
Transliteration: lemateh vineyamin eliydad ven-khiselvon

Hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־דָ֖ן נָשִׂ֑יא בֻּקִּ֖י בֶּן־יׇגְלִֽי׃
Translated: From the Danite tribe: a chieftain, Bukki son of Jogli.
Transliteration: ulemateh veney-dan nashiy vukiy ven-yׇgeliy

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף לְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה נָשִׂ֑יא חַנִּיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־אֵפֹֽד׃
Translated: For the descendants of Joseph: from the Manassite tribe: a chieftain, Hanniel son of Ephod;
Transliteration: liveney yvosef lemateh veney-menasheh nashiy chaniyel ven-efod

Hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־אֶפְרַ֖יִם נָשִׂ֑יא קְמוּאֵ֖ל בֶּן־שִׁפְטָֽן׃
Translated: and from the Ephraimite tribe: a chieftain, Kemuel son of Shiphtan.
Transliteration: ulemateh veney-eferayiim nashiy kemuel ven-shifetan

Hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־זְבוּלֻ֖ן נָשִׂ֑יא אֱלִיצָפָ֖ן בֶּן־פַּרְנָֽךְ׃
Translated: From the Zebulunite tribe: a chieftain, Elizaphan son of Parnach.
Transliteration: ulemateh veney-zevulun nashiy eliytsafan ven-farenakhe

Hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר נָשִׂ֑יא פַּלְטִיאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עַזָּֽן׃
Translated: From the Issacharite tribe: a chieftain, Paltiel son of Azzan.
Transliteration: ulemateh veney-yishashkhar nashiy faletiyel ven-azan

Hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־אָשֵׁ֖ר נָשִׂ֑יא אֲחִיה֖וּד בֶּן־שְׁלֹמִֽי׃
Translated: From the Asherite tribe: a chieftain, Ahihud son of Shelomi.
Transliteration: ulemateh veney-asher nashiy achiyhud ven-shelomiy

Hebrew: וּלְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־נַפְתָּלִ֖י נָשִׂ֑יא פְּדַהְאֵ֖ל בֶּן־עַמִּיהֽוּד׃
Translated: From the Naphtalite tribe: a chieftain, Pedahel son of Ammihud.
Transliteration: ulemateh veney-nafetaliy nashiy fedaheel ven-amiyhud

Hebrew: אֵ֕לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה לְנַחֵ֥ל אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּאֶ֥רֶץ כְּנָֽעַן׃ {פ}
Translated: It was these whom יהוה designated to allot portions to the Israelites in the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: eleh asher tsivah yehovah lenachel et-veney-yisherael veerets khenaan {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֑ב עַל־יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵח֖וֹ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke to Moses in the steppes of Moab at the Jordan near Jericho, saying:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh vearevot mvoav al-yareden yerechvo lemor

Hebrew: צַו֮ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְנָתְנ֣וּ לַלְוִיִּ֗ם מִֽנַּחֲלַ֛ת אֲחֻזָּתָ֖ם עָרִ֣ים לָשָׁ֑בֶת וּמִגְרָ֗שׁ לֶֽעָרִים֙ סְבִיבֹ֣תֵיהֶ֔ם תִּתְּנ֖וּ לַלְוִיִּֽם׃
Translated: Instruct the Israelite people to assign, out of the holdings apportioned to them, towns for the Levites to dwell in; you shall also assign to the Levites pasture land around their towns.
Transliteration: tsav et-veney yisherael venatenu laleviyim minachalat achuzatam ariym lashavet umigerash leariym seviyvoteyhem titenu laleviyim

Hebrew: וְהָי֧וּ הֶֽעָרִ֛ים לָהֶ֖ם לָשָׁ֑בֶת וּמִגְרְשֵׁיהֶ֗ם יִהְי֤וּ לִבְהֶמְתָּם֙ וְלִרְכֻשָׁ֔ם וּלְכֹ֖ל חַיָּתָֽם׃
Translated: The towns shall be theirs to dwell in, and the pasture shall be for the cattle they own and all their other beasts.
Transliteration: vehayu heariym lahem lashavet umigeresheyhem yiheyu livehemetam velirekhusham ulekhol chayatam

Hebrew: וּמִגְרְשֵׁי֙ הֶֽעָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּתְּנ֖וּ לַלְוִיִּ֑ם מִקִּ֤יר הָעִיר֙ וָח֔וּצָה אֶ֥לֶף אַמָּ֖ה סָבִֽיב׃
Translated: The town pasture that you are to assign to the Levites shall extend a thousand cubits outside the town wall all around.
Transliteration: umigereshey heariym asher titenu laleviyim mikiyr haiyr vachutsah elef amah saviyv

Hebrew: וּמַדֹּתֶ֞ם מִח֣וּץ לָעִ֗יר אֶת־פְּאַת־קֵ֣דְמָה אַלְפַּ֪יִם בָּֽאַמָּ֟ה וְאֶת־פְּאַת־נֶ֩גֶב֩ אַלְפַּ֨יִם בָּאַמָּ֜ה וְאֶת־פְּאַת־יָ֣ם ׀ אַלְפַּ֣יִם בָּֽאַמָּ֗ה וְאֵ֨ת פְּאַ֥ת צָפ֛וֹן אַלְפַּ֥יִם בָּאַמָּ֖ה וְהָעִ֣יר בַּתָּ֑וֶךְ זֶ֚ה יִהְיֶ֣ה לָהֶ֔ם מִגְרְשֵׁ֖י הֶעָרִֽים׃
Translated: You shall measure off two thousand cubits outside the town on the east side, two thousand on the south side, two thousand on the west side, and two thousand on the north side, with the town in the center. That shall be the pasture for their towns.
Transliteration: umadotem michuts laiyr et-feat-kedemah alefayiim vaamah veet-feat-negev alefayiim vaamah veet-feat-yam alefayiim vaamah veet feat tsafvon alefayiim vaamah vehaiyr vatavekhe zeh yiheyeh lahem migereshey heariym

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת הֶֽעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּתְּנוּ֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֵ֚ת שֵׁשׁ־עָרֵ֣י הַמִּקְלָ֔ט אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתְּנ֔וּ לָנֻ֥ס שָׁ֖מָּה הָרֹצֵ֑חַ וַעֲלֵיהֶ֣ם תִּתְּנ֔וּ אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֖יִם עִֽיר׃
Translated: The towns that you assign to the Levites shall comprise the six cities of refuge that you are to designate for [a man] who has killed someone to flee to, to which you shall add forty-two towns.
Transliteration: veet heariym asher titenu laleviyim et shesh-arey hamikelat asher titenu lanus shamah harotsecha vaaleyhem titenu arevaiym ushetayiim iyr

Hebrew: כׇּל־הֶעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּתְּנוּ֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֖ה עִ֑יר אֶתְהֶ֖ן וְאֶת־מִגְרְשֵׁיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Thus the total of the towns that you assign to the Levites shall be forty-eight towns, with their pasture.
Transliteration: khׇl-heariym asher titenu laleviyim arevaiym ushemoneh iyr etehen veet-migeresheyhen

Hebrew: וְהֶֽעָרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר תִּתְּנוּ֙ מֵאֲחֻזַּ֣ת בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מֵאֵ֤ת הָרַב֙ תַּרְבּ֔וּ וּמֵאֵ֥ת הַמְעַ֖ט תַּמְעִ֑יטוּ אִ֗ישׁ כְּפִ֤י נַחֲלָתוֹ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִנְחָ֔לוּ יִתֵּ֥ן מֵעָרָ֖יו לַלְוִיִּֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: In assigning towns from the holdings of the Israelites, take more from the larger groups and less from the smaller, so that each assigns towns to the Levites in proportion to the share it receives.
Transliteration: veheariym asher titenu meachuzat veney-yisherael meet harav tarevu umeet hameat tameiytu iysh khefiy nachalatvo asher yinechalu yiten mearayv laleviyim {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translated: יהוה spoke further to Moses:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-mosheh lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּר֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ אֲלֵהֶ֑ם כִּ֥י אַתֶּ֛ם עֹבְרִ֥ים אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן אַ֥רְצָה כְּנָֽעַן׃
Translated: Speak to the Israelite people and say to them: When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael veamareta alehem khiy atem overiym et-hayareden aretsah khenaan

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִיתֶ֤ם לָכֶם֙ עָרִ֔ים עָרֵ֥י מִקְלָ֖ט תִּהְיֶ֣ינָה לָכֶ֑ם וְנָ֥ס שָׁ֙מָּה֙ רֹצֵ֔חַ מַכֵּה־נֶ֖פֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָֽה׃
Translated: you shall provide yourselves with places to serve you as cities of refuge to which [a man] who has killed someone —who has slain a person unintentionally—may flee.
Transliteration: vehikeriytem lakhem ariym arey mikelat tiheyeynah lakhem venas shamah rotsecha makheh-nefesh vishegagah

Hebrew: וְהָי֨וּ לָכֶ֧ם הֶעָרִ֛ים לְמִקְלָ֖ט מִגֹּאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֤א יָמוּת֙ הָרֹצֵ֔חַ עַד־עׇמְד֛וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדָ֖ה לַמִּשְׁפָּֽט׃
Translated: The cities shall serve you as a refuge from the avenger, so that the killer may not die unless he has stood trial before the assembly.
Transliteration: vehayu lakhem heariym lemikelat migoel velo yamut harotsecha ad-ׇmedvo lifeney haedah lamishefat

Hebrew: וְהֶעָרִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר תִּתֵּ֑נוּ שֵׁשׁ־עָרֵ֥י מִקְלָ֖ט תִּהְיֶ֥ינָה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: The towns that you thus assign shall be six cities of refuge in all.
Transliteration: veheariym asher titenu shesh-arey mikelat tiheyeynah lakhem

Hebrew: אֵ֣ת ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ הֶעָרִ֗ים תִּתְּנוּ֙ מֵעֵ֣בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וְאֵת֙ שְׁלֹ֣שׁ הֶֽעָרִ֔ים תִּתְּנ֖וּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן עָרֵ֥י מִקְלָ֖ט תִּהְיֶֽינָה׃
Translated: Three cities shall be designated beyond the Jordan, and the other three shall be designated in the land of Canaan: they shall serve as cities of refuge.
Transliteration: et shelosh heariym titenu meever layareden veet shelosh heariym titenu veerets khenaan arey mikelat tiheyeynah

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְלַגֵּ֤ר וְלַתּוֹשָׁב֙ בְּתוֹכָ֔ם תִּהְיֶ֛ינָה שֵׁשׁ־הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לְמִקְלָ֑ט לָנ֣וּס שָׁ֔מָּה כׇּל־מַכֵּה־נֶ֖פֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָֽה׃
Translated: These six cities shall serve the Israelites and the resident aliens among them for refuge, so that any man who slays a person unintentionally may flee there.
Transliteration: liveney yisherael velager velatvoshav vetvokham tiheyeynah shesh-heariym haeleh lemikelat lanus shamah khׇl-makheh-nefesh vishegagah

Hebrew: וְאִם־בִּכְלִ֨י בַרְזֶ֧ל <small>׀</small> הִכָּ֛הוּ וַיָּמֹ֖ת רֹצֵ֣חַֽ ה֑וּא מ֥וֹת יוּמַ֖ת הָרֹצֵֽחַ׃
Translated: Anyone, however, who strikes another with an iron object so that death results is a murderer; the murderer must be put to death.
Transliteration: veim-vikheliy varezel <small></small> hikhahu vayamot rotsecha hu mvot yumat harotsecha

Hebrew: וְאִ֡ם בְּאֶ֣בֶן יָד֩ אֲשֶׁר־יָמ֨וּת בָּ֥הּ הִכָּ֛הוּ וַיָּמֹ֖ת רֹצֵ֣חַֽ ה֑וּא מ֥וֹת יוּמַ֖ת הָרֹצֵֽחַ׃
Translated: If one struck another with a stone tool that could cause death, and death resulted, that person is a murderer; the murderer must be put to death.
Transliteration: veim veeven yad asher-yamut vah hikhahu vayamot rotsecha hu mvot yumat harotsecha

Hebrew: א֡וֹ בִּכְלִ֣י עֵֽץ־יָד֩ אֲשֶׁר־יָמ֨וּת בּ֥וֹ הִכָּ֛הוּ וַיָּמֹ֖ת רֹצֵ֣חַֽ ה֑וּא מ֥וֹת יוּמַ֖ת הָרֹצֵֽחַ׃
Translated: Similarly, if one struck another with a wooden tool that could cause death, and death resulted, that person is a murderer; the murderer must be put to death.
Transliteration: vo vikheliy ets-yad asher-yamut vvo hikhahu vayamot rotsecha hu mvot yumat harotsecha

Hebrew: גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֔ם ה֥וּא יָמִ֖ית אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֑חַ בְּפִגְעוֹ־ב֖וֹ ה֥וּא יְמִתֶֽנּוּ׃
Translated: It is the blood-avenger who shall put the murderer to death; that is who shall put that person to death upon encounter.
Transliteration: goel hadam hu yamiyt et-harotsecha vefigevo-vvo hu yemitenu

Hebrew: וְאִם־בְּשִׂנְאָ֖ה יֶהְדֳּפֶ֑נּוּ אֽוֹ־הִשְׁלִ֥יךְ עָלָ֛יו בִּצְדִיָּ֖ה וַיָּמֹֽת׃
Translated: So, too, if one pushed another in hate or hurled something at [the victim] on purpose and death resulted,
Transliteration: veim-veshineah yehedofenu vo-hisheliykhe alayv vitsediyah vayamot

Hebrew: א֣וֹ בְאֵיבָ֞ה הִכָּ֤הוּ בְיָדוֹ֙ וַיָּמֹ֔ת מֽוֹת־יוּמַ֥ת הַמַּכֶּ֖ה רֹצֵ֣חַֽ ה֑וּא גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֗ם יָמִ֛ית אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֖חַ בְּפִגְעוֹ־בֽוֹ׃
Translated: or if one struck another with the hand in enmity and death resulted, the assailant shall be put to death; that person is a murderer. The blood-avenger shall put the murderer to death upon encounter.
Transliteration: vo veeyvah hikhahu veyadvo vayamot mvot-yumat hamakheh rotsecha hu goel hadam yamiyt et-harotsecha vefigevo-vvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־בְּפֶ֥תַע בְּלֹא־אֵיבָ֖ה הֲדָפ֑וֹ אוֹ־הִשְׁלִ֥יךְ עָלָ֛יו כׇּל־כְּלִ֖י בְּלֹ֥א צְדִיָּֽה׃
Translated: But if [a man] pushed without malice aforethought or hurled any object at [the victim] unintentionally,
Transliteration: veim-vefeta velo-eyvah hadafvo vo-hisheliykhe alayv khׇl-kheliy velo tsediyah

Hebrew: א֣וֹ בְכׇל־אֶ֜בֶן אֲשֶׁר־יָמ֥וּת בָּהּ֙ בְּלֹ֣א רְא֔וֹת וַיַּפֵּ֥ל עָלָ֖יו וַיָּמֹ֑ת וְהוּא֙ לֹא־אוֹיֵ֣ב ל֔וֹ וְלֹ֥א מְבַקֵּ֖שׁ רָעָתֽוֹ׃
Translated: or inadvertently dropped upon [the victim] any deadly object of stone, and death resulted—though not being an enemy and not seeking to harm—
Transliteration: vo vekhׇl-even asher-yamut vah velo revot vayafel alayv vayamot vehu lo-voeiv lvo velo mevakesh raatvo

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁפְטוּ֙ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה בֵּ֚ין הַמַּכֶּ֔ה וּבֵ֖ין גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֑ם עַ֥ל הַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֖ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: in such cases the assembly shall decide between the slayer and the blood-avenger.
Transliteration: veshafetu haedah veyn hamakheh uveyn goel hadam al hamishefatiym haeleh

Hebrew: וְהִצִּ֨ילוּ הָעֵדָ֜ה אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֗חַ מִיַּד֮ גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּם֒ וְהֵשִׁ֤יבוּ אֹתוֹ֙ הָֽעֵדָ֔ה אֶל־עִ֥יר מִקְלָט֖וֹ אֲשֶׁר־נָ֣ס שָׁ֑מָּה וְיָ֣שַׁב בָּ֗הּ עַד־מוֹת֙ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּדֹ֔ל אֲשֶׁר־מָשַׁ֥ח אֹת֖וֹ בְּשֶׁ֥מֶן הַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
Translated: The assembly shall protect the killer from the blood-avenger, and the assembly shall restore him to the city of refuge to which he fled, and there he shall remain until the death of the high priest who was anointed with the sacred oil.
Transliteration: vehitsiylu haedah et-harotsecha miyad goel hadam veheshiyvu otvo haedah el-iyr mikelatvo asher-nas shamah veyashav vah ad-mvot hakhohen hagadol asher-mashach otvo veshemen hakodesh

Hebrew: וְאִם־יָצֹ֥א יֵצֵ֖א הָרֹצֵ֑חַ אֶת־גְּבוּל֙ עִ֣יר מִקְלָט֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יָנ֖וּס שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: But if the killer ever goes outside the limits of the city of refuge to which he has fled,
Transliteration: veim-yatso eitse harotsecha et-gevul iyr mikelatvo asher yanus shamah

Hebrew: וּמָצָ֤א אֹתוֹ֙ גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֔ם מִח֕וּץ לִגְב֖וּל עִ֣יר מִקְלָט֑וֹ וְרָצַ֞ח גֹּאֵ֤ל הַדָּם֙ אֶת־הָ֣רֹצֵ֔חַ אֵ֥ין ל֖וֹ דָּֽם׃
Translated: and the blood-avenger comes upon him outside the limits of his city of refuge, and the blood-avenger kills the killer, there is no bloodguilt on his account.
Transliteration: umatsa otvo goel hadam michuts ligevul iyr mikelatvo veratsach goel hadam et-harotsecha eyn lvo dam

Hebrew: כִּ֣י בְעִ֤יר מִקְלָטוֹ֙ יֵשֵׁ֔ב עַד־מ֖וֹת הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּדֹ֑ל וְאַחֲרֵ֥י מוֹת֙ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּדֹ֔ל יָשׁוּב֙ הָרֹצֵ֔חַ אֶל־אֶ֖רֶץ אֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃
Translated: For he must remain inside his city of refuge until the death of the high priest; after the death of the high priest, the killer may return to his land holding.
Transliteration: khiy veiyr mikelatvo eishev ad-mvot hakhohen hagadol veacharey mvot hakhohen hagadol yashuv harotsecha el-erets achuzatvo

Hebrew: וְהָי֨וּ אֵ֧לֶּה לָכֶ֛ם לְחֻקַּ֥ת מִשְׁפָּ֖ט לְדֹרֹתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּכֹ֖ל מוֹשְׁבֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Such shall be your law of procedure throughout the ages in all your settlements.
Transliteration: vehayu eleh lakhem lechukat mishefat ledoroteykhem vekhol mvoshevoteykhem

Hebrew: כׇּ֨ל־מַכֵּה־נֶ֔פֶשׁ לְפִ֣י עֵדִ֔ים יִרְצַ֖ח אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֑חַ וְעֵ֣ד אֶחָ֔ד לֹא־יַעֲנֶ֥ה בְנֶ֖פֶשׁ לָמֽוּת׃
Translated: If anyone slays a person, the killer may be executed only on the evidence of witnesses; the testimony of a single witness against a person shall not suffice for a sentence of death.
Transliteration: khׇl-makheh-nefesh lefiy ediym yiretsach et-harotsecha veed echad lo-yaaneh venefesh lamut

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִקְח֥וּ כֹ֙פֶר֙ לְנֶ֣פֶשׁ רֹצֵ֔חַ אֲשֶׁר־ה֥וּא רָשָׁ֖ע לָמ֑וּת כִּי־מ֖וֹת יוּמָֽת׃
Translated: You may not accept a ransom for the life of a murderer who is guilty of a capital crime; [a murderer] must be put to death.
Transliteration: velo-tikechu khofer lenefesh rotsecha asher-hu rasha lamut khiy-mvot yumat

Hebrew: וְלֹא־תִקְח֣וּ כֹ֔פֶר לָנ֖וּס אֶל־עִ֣יר מִקְלָט֑וֹ לָשׁוּב֙ לָשֶׁ֣בֶת בָּאָ֔רֶץ עַד־מ֖וֹת הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: Nor may you accept ransom in lieu of flight to a city of refuge, enabling a man to return to live on his land before the death of the priest.
Transliteration: velo-tikechu khofer lanus el-iyr mikelatvo lashuv lashevet vaarets ad-mvot hakhohen

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תַחֲנִ֣יפוּ אֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתֶּם֙ בָּ֔הּ כִּ֣י הַדָּ֔ם ה֥וּא יַחֲנִ֖יף אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְלָאָ֣רֶץ לֹֽא־יְכֻפַּ֗ר לַדָּם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שֻׁפַּךְ־בָּ֔הּ כִּי־אִ֖ם בְּדַ֥ם שֹׁפְכֽוֹ׃
Translated: You shall not pollute the land in which you live; for blood pollutes the land, and the land can have no expiation for blood that is shed on it, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
Transliteration: velo-tachaniyfu et-haarets asher atem vah khiy hadam hu yachaniyf et-haarets velaarets lo-yekhufar ladam asher shufakhe-vah khiy-im vedam shofekhvo

Hebrew: וְלֹ֧א תְטַמֵּ֣א אֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֤ר אַתֶּם֙ יֹשְׁבִ֣ים בָּ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲנִ֖י שֹׁכֵ֣ן בְּתוֹכָ֑הּ כִּ֚י אֲנִ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה שֹׁכֵ֕ן בְּת֖וֹךְ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: You shall not defile the land in which you live, in which I Myself abide, for I יהוה abide among the Israelite people.
Transliteration: velo tetame et-haarets asher atem yosheviym vah asher aniy shokhen vetvokhah khiy aniy yehovah shokhen vetvokhe veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְב֞וּ רָאשֵׁ֣י הָֽאָב֗וֹת לְמִשְׁפַּ֤חַת בְּנֵֽי־גִלְעָד֙ בֶּן־מָכִ֣יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה מִֽמִּשְׁפְּחֹ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֑ף וַֽיְדַבְּר֞וּ לִפְנֵ֤י מֹשֶׁה֙ וְלִפְנֵ֣י הַנְּשִׂאִ֔ים רָאשֵׁ֥י אָב֖וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The family heads in the clan of the descendants of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh, one of the Josephite clans, came forward and appealed to Moses and the chieftains, family heads of the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayikerevu rashey haavvot lemishefachat veney-gilead ven-makhiyr ven-menasheh mimishefechot veney yvosef vayedaveru lifeney mosheh velifeney haneshiiym rashey avvot liveney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ אֶת־אֲדֹנִי֙ צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה לָתֵ֨ת אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ בְּנַחֲלָ֛ה בְּגוֹרָ֖ל לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽאדֹנִי֙ צֻוָּ֣ה בַֽיהֹוָ֔ה לָתֵ֗ת אֶֽת־נַחֲלַ֛ת צְלׇפְחָ֥ד אָחִ֖ינוּ לִבְנֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: They said, “יהוה commanded my lord to assign the land to the Israelites as shares by lot, and my lord was further commanded by יהוה to assign the share of our kinsman Zelophehad to his daughters.
Transliteration: vayomeru et-adoniy tsivah yehovah latet et-haarets venachalah vegvoral liveney yisherael vadoniy tsuvah vayhovah latet et-nachalat tselׇfechad achiynu livenotayv

Hebrew: וְ֠הָי֠וּ לְאֶחָ֞ד מִבְּנֵ֨י שִׁבְטֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ לְנָשִׁים֒ וְנִגְרְעָ֤ה נַחֲלָתָן֙ מִנַּחֲלַ֣ת אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ וְנוֹסַ֕ף עַ֚ל נַחֲלַ֣ת הַמַּטֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּהְיֶ֖ינָה לָהֶ֑ם וּמִגֹּרַ֥ל נַחֲלָתֵ֖נוּ יִגָּרֵֽעַ׃
Translated: Now, if they become the wives of persons from another Israelite tribe, their share will be cut off from our ancestral portion and be added to the portion of the tribe into which they become [wives]; thus our allotted portion will be diminished.
Transliteration: vehayu leechad miveney shivetey veney-yisherael lenashiym venigereah nachalatan minachalat avoteynu venvosaf al nachalat hamateh asher tiheyeynah lahem umigoral nachalatenu yigarea

Hebrew: וְאִם־יִהְיֶ֣ה הַיֹּבֵל֮ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וְנֽוֹסְפָה֙ נַחֲלָתָ֔ן עַ֚ל נַחֲלַ֣ת הַמַּטֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּהְיֶ֖ינָה לָהֶ֑ם וּמִֽנַּחֲלַת֙ מַטֵּ֣ה אֲבֹתֵ֔ינוּ יִגָּרַ֖ע נַחֲלָתָֽן׃
Translated: And even when the Israelites observe the jubilee, their share will be added to that of the tribe into which they become [wives], and their share will be cut off from the ancestral portion of our tribe.”
Transliteration: veim-yiheyeh hayovel liveney yisherael venvosefah nachalatan al nachalat hamateh asher tiheyeynah lahem uminachalat mateh avoteynu yigara nachalatan

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֤ו מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר כֵּ֛ן מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־יוֹסֵ֖ף דֹּבְרִֽים׃
Translated: So Moses, at יהוה’s bidding, instructed the Israelites, saying: “The plea of the Josephite tribe is just.
Transliteration: vayetsav mosheh et-veney yisherael al-fiy yehovah lemor khen mateh veney-yvosef doveriym

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה הַדָּבָ֞ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֗ה לִבְנ֤וֹת צְלׇפְחָד֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר לַטּ֥וֹב בְּעֵינֵיהֶ֖ם תִּהְיֶ֣ינָה לְנָשִׁ֑ים אַ֗ךְ לְמִשְׁפַּ֛חַת מַטֵּ֥ה אֲבִיהֶ֖ם תִּהְיֶ֥ינָה לְנָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: This is what יהוה has commanded concerning the daughters of Zelophehad: They may become the wives of anyone they wish, provided they become wives within a clan of their father’s tribe.
Transliteration: zeh hadavar asher-tsivah yehovah livenvot tselׇfechad lemor latvov veeyneyhem tiheyeynah lenashiym akhe lemishefachat mateh aviyhem tiheyeynah lenashiym

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִסֹּ֤ב נַחֲלָה֙ לִבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִמַּטֶּ֖ה אֶל־מַטֶּ֑ה כִּ֣י אִ֗ישׁ בְּנַחֲלַת֙ מַטֵּ֣ה אֲבֹתָ֔יו יִדְבְּק֖וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: No inheritance of the Israelites may pass over from one tribe to another, but the Israelite [heirs]—each of them—must remain bound to the ancestral portion of their tribe.
Transliteration: velo-tisov nachalah liveney yisherael mimateh el-mateh khiy iysh venachalat mateh avotayv yideveku veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְכׇל־בַּ֞ת יֹרֶ֣שֶׁת נַחֲלָ֗ה מִמַּטּוֹת֮ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ לְאֶחָ֗ד מִמִּשְׁפַּ֛חַת מַטֵּ֥ה אָבִ֖יהָ תִּהְיֶ֣ה לְאִשָּׁ֑ה לְמַ֗עַן יִֽירְשׁוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אִ֖ישׁ נַחֲלַ֥ת אֲבֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: Every daughter among the Israelite tribes who inherits a share must become the wife of someone from a clan of her father’s tribe, in order that every Israelite [heir] may keep an ancestral share.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-vat yoreshet nachalah mimatvot veney yisherael leechad mimishefachat mateh aviyha tiheyeh leishah lemaan yiyreshu veney yisherael iysh nachalat avotayv

Hebrew: וְלֹֽא־תִסֹּ֧ב נַחֲלָ֛ה מִמַּטֶּ֖ה לְמַטֶּ֣ה אַחֵ֑ר כִּי־אִישׁ֙ בְּנַ֣חֲלָת֔וֹ יִדְבְּק֕וּ מַטּ֖וֹת בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thus no inheritance shall pass over from one tribe to another, but the Israelite tribes shall remain bound each to its portion.”
Transliteration: velo-tisov nachalah mimateh lemateh acher khiy-iysh venachalatvo yideveku matvot veney yisherael

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֑ה כֵּ֥ן עָשׂ֖וּ בְּנ֥וֹת צְלׇפְחָֽד׃
Translated: The daughters of Zelophehad did as יהוה had commanded Moses:
Transliteration: khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh khen ashu venvot tselׇfechad

Hebrew: וַתִּהְיֶ֜ינָה מַחְלָ֣ה תִרְצָ֗ה וְחׇגְלָ֧ה וּמִלְכָּ֛ה וְנֹעָ֖ה בְּנ֣וֹת צְלׇפְחָ֑ד לִבְנֵ֥י דֹדֵיהֶ֖ן לְנָשִֽׁים׃
Translated: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, Zelophehad’s daughters, became the wives of their uncles’ sons,
Transliteration: vatiheyeynah machelah tiretsah vechׇgelah umilekhah venoah venvot tselׇfechad liveney dodeyhen lenashiym

Hebrew: מִֽמִּשְׁפְּחֹ֛ת בְּנֵֽי־מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה בֶן־יוֹסֵ֖ף הָי֣וּ לְנָשִׁ֑ים וַתְּהִי֙ נַחֲלָתָ֔ן עַל־מַטֵּ֖ה מִשְׁפַּ֥חַת אֲבִיהֶֽן׃
Translated: becoming wives within clans of descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph; and so their share remained in the tribe of their father’s clan.
Transliteration: mimishefechot veney-menasheh ven-yvosef hayu lenashiym vatehiy nachalatan al-mateh mishefachat aviyhen

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַמִּצְוֺ֞ת וְהַמִּשְׁפָּטִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּעַֽרְבֹ֣ת מוֹאָ֔ב עַ֖ל יַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרֵחֽוֹ׃
Translated: These are the commandments and regulations that יהוה enjoined upon the Israelites, through Moses, on the steppes of Moab, at the Jordan near Jericho.
Transliteration: eleh hamitsevot vehamishefatiym asher tsivah yehovah veyad-mosheh el-veney yisherael vearevot mvoav al yareden yerechvo
